title: Share from other apps to nextcloud app does not do anything
body:
### Actual behaviour
- Tell us what happens
Sharing any file from any android app to the nextcloud up does not work.
![screenshot_20181129-182558_android system](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/937861/49240840-7da8dd80-f406-11e8-85bc-0a792bd08543.jpg) ![screenshot_20181129-182616_nextcloud](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/937861/49240845-800b3780-f406-11e8-8d3b-337556ab44c6.jpg)

### Expected behaviour
- Tell us what should happen
 Image (or any other file) should be uploaded to nextcloud app.

### Steps to reproduce
1. Choose a photo from Gallery app.
2. Click on Share icon.
3. Choose Nextcloud.
4. Once it opens up, choose a folder and click on "upload".
4. Switch to nextcloud app and look at that particular folder - the file is not there.

### Environment data
Android version: 8.0.0

Device model: Samsung SGS S7

Stock or customized system: Stock, unbranded.

Nextcloud app version: 3.3.2

Nextcloud server version: 14.0.1

### Logs

#### Nextcloud log (data/nextcloud.log)
There is no recent "nextcloud.log" in the android filesystem accessible to the user. (Only some old version from 2017.) There seems to be no option in app settings to enable debug logging.

title: Theming App Settings not applied to client
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
### Actual behaviour
- The Settings in the Server/ Theming App are not applied to the Android Client. 

### Expected behaviour
- Colors, Login Image etc. should be applied to the Client (with programmatically calculated adaptions) 
 
### Steps to reproduce
1. Have the exact same enviroment as I do
2. Do a clean Installation of Nextcloud Android Client
3. Colors are probably the default Blue on White


### Environment data
Android version: 9

Device model: OnePlus 6

Stock or customized system: Stock Oxygen OS (although Beta 7)

Nextcloud app version: 3.3.2

Nextcloud server version: 14 (tried on 15rc)

title: use 90 as first stable
label: [Label(name="backport-request")]
body:
With next stable release, build version should be starting with 90 for stable.
This is not needed in a normal release cycle, but could be needed for an emergency release, like when a changelog is missing, or if a branded version needs to be rebuild and thus needs to have a new version code.

Signed-off-by: tobiasKaminsky <tobias@kaminsky.me>

title: In-app notification for shared content
label: [Label(name="enhancement"), Label(name="needs info/discussion")]
body:
Today, when sharing content, the receiver gets a dedicated email.
What about receiving an in-app notification if this user has the nexcloud app?
Then a setting on the user setting would ask what would be the notification : mail, app, both, or none.

title: App launched uppon click on link in shared content email
body:
When sharing content with a particular user, the receiver receives an email announcing that the sender has shared a particular content, with a link saying "open [content]". Clicking on that link will open a browser to the right content, required nevertheless to log in to the nextcloud server if required.

On a smartphone using nextcloud app, user experience would be much easier if when clicking on such link the nextcloud app is open instead a browser. 

I noticed that on several app, my android phone asks me which app should be used for the action, so I would like nextcloud app to be opened in the same way.

title: "Cannot upload null" with end-to-end encryption enabled
body:
### Actual behaviour
This notification is shown:
![notification: "Hochladen fehlgeschlagen – Cannot upload 'null'"](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11966684/48981482-5e444480-f0d6-11e8-918e-ca8157d25fe5.png)

And this is how it is shown in the recent uploads:
![uploadlist](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11966684/48981486-68664300-f0d6-11e8-8ef4-f759f7f55d5b.png)

### Expected behaviour
Upload file.
 
### Steps to reproduce
1. Setup e2e encryption on Android in the exact same app.
2. (Tried to) upload something in the dir in Nextcloud Desktop 2.5.0 on Fedora 29.
3. Access dir in Android app. It shows no files… :confused: 
4. Now try to upload a small <500kB file.

### Environment data
Android version: LineageOS 14.1

Stock or customized system: custom

Nextcloud app version: 3.3.2 (F-Droid)

Nextcloud server version: 14

### Logs
#### Web server error log
I checked when the error occurred, no error logged here.

#### Nextcloud log (data/nextcloud.log)
I checked when the error occurred, nothing special in there.

title: Sync: Mirror the latest version of files
body: I'm trying to make NextCloud work with [Anki](https://apps.ankiweb.net/), which needs to exactly mirror the latest version of files between PC and Android. For example, when I made changes on the PC, the latest file changes locally will replace the server version, and on Android the latest file changes on the server will replace the older local file version. Is it possible to do this?

title: Data Loss: Remotely deleting a Folder silently deletes unsynced local files
body:
1) On the Android phone, I added a new subfolder in the NextCloud folder
2) I copied images there which were synced
3) Later, I added some additional images, which, for reasons unknown to me, were not synced. :-/ (The phone was connected to WiFi all the time and it only was a handful of pictures.)
4) Even later, on my Desktop computer which uses the NextCloud Linux Client, I moved the folder with the images somewhere else, out of NextCloud's reach.

Unfortunately, only then I noticed that after moving the folder, it did not contain the images I added in step 3.

As soon as I tried to open the folder on my Android device, it disappeared, and with it apparently the unsynced local images. Ouch!

Curiously, Google Fotos (which I only use because it came preinstalled as the only Gallery app, but I do *not* use its sync/online features) still shows the missing files, but in "information" it shows the now non-existent Nextcloud folder as the file location, and I cannot copy or share them in any way any more in the Fotos app. Apparently, Google Fotos uses a local cache which still contains the image file... Does anyone know any way to get them out there quickly before the are really deleted?

title: Suggest some solution to fix laptop won't charge
Sync to server not working
body:
Android NextCloud Version: 3.3.2
Server 14.0.2

Open Nextcloud Androit Client app.
Open an excel file
Select Microsoft Excel.
Modify the file.
Exit Excel.

The file is saved locally on the phone, but the Androit Nextcloud app is never syncing the file back to the NextCloud server.

The only way to get the file sync trigger, is to open the file again from the Android phone. When doing that, it looks that it trigger the syncing to the cloud server. After that, when I'm going on my file server, the file is up to date.

I know that I can select the option in the menu "Sync", but working on the cloud means that if I open a file and save it, I want it to be automatically save on the cloud server and not stay on my phone and need a manual sync to get uploaded to the server. If someone else has access to that file, it means that the file will stay on my phone and the other user accessing that file will never get the updated file until I open it again or do a manual sync.

On the Android Account, Nextcloud Syncing file is enabled, but is not doing anything.

title: Hidden files on external storage with dotfiles crash the app
label: [Label(name="needs info/discussion")]
body:
When enabling hidden files in settings and accessing an external storage (using SFTP) containing dotfiles, the Android app crashes.

### Actual behaviour

- The app crashes

### Expected behaviour

- The app should display a list of files

### Steps to reproduce

1. Have the following list of files and folders in the directory defined as root on an SFTP external storage

```
Folders:

.apache2
.cache
.config
.local
.logs
.nano
.nginx
.script-credentials
.ssh
.subversion
.znc
------------------------------
Files:

.bash_aliases
.bash_history
.bash_logout
.bashrc
.feral_aliases
.mysql_history
.profile
.selected_editor
.wget-hsts
```

2. Enable hidden files in the Nextcloud app settings.

3. Access the external storage

### Environment data

Android version: 8.1.2 or 7.0

Device model: Xiaomi Redmi Note 4 (mido), or also stock Samsung Galaxy A5 2016

Stock or customized system: Customized LineageOS 15.1, Stock "Samsung Experience".

Nextcloud app version: 3.3.2

Nextcloud server version: 14.0.3

### Logs

#### Stacktrace

```
E/AndroidRuntime( 4641): FATAL EXCEPTION: main
E/AndroidRuntime( 4641): Process: com.nextcloud.client, PID: 4641
E/AndroidRuntime( 4641): java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Comparison method violates its general contract!

E/AndroidRuntime( 4641): 	at java.util.Arrays.sort(Arrays.java:1498)
E/AndroidRuntime( 4641): 	at java.util.ArrayList.sort(ArrayList.java:1470)
E/AndroidRuntime( 4641): 	at java.util.Collections.sort(Collections.java:201)
E/AndroidRuntime( 4641): 	at com.owncloud.android.utils.FileSortOrderByName.sortCloudFiles(FileSortOrderByName.java:52)
E/AndroidRuntime( 4641): 	at com.owncloud.android.ui.adapter.OCFileListAdapter.swapDirectory(OCFileListAdapter.java:513)
E/AndroidRuntime( 4641): 	at com.owncloud.android.ui.fragment.OCFileListFragment.listDirectory(OCFileListFragment.java:1080)
E/AndroidRuntime( 4641): 	at com.owncloud.android.ui.fragment.OCFileListFragment.onItemClicked(OCFileListFragment.java:809)
E/AndroidRuntime( 4641): 	at com.owncloud.android.ui.adapter.OCFileListAdapter.lambda$onBindViewHolder$0$OCFileListAdapter(OCFileListAdapter.java:276)
E/AndroidRuntime( 4641): 	at com.owncloud.android.ui.adapter.OCFileListAdapter$$Lambda$0.onClick(Unknown Source:4)
E/AndroidRuntime( 4641): 	at android.view.View.performClick(View.java:6294)
E/AndroidRuntime( 4641): 	at android.view.View$PerformClick.run(View.java:24770)

Release notes *Sourced from [android-gif-drawable's releases](https://github.com/koral--/android-gif-drawable/releases).* > ## v1.2.16 > * Fixed setting color drawable from Java code - [#606](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/koral--/android-gif-drawable/issues/606) > * Fixed extraneous file descriptor closing - [#600](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/koral--/android-gif-drawable/issues/600) > * Fixed missing null check for NewGlobalRef - [#594](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/koral--/android-gif-drawable/issues/594) > * Fixed missing free of info buffer - [#595](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/koral--/android-gif-drawable/issues/595) > * Android Gradle plugin updated to 3.2.1 > * Gradle wrapper regenerated with 4.10.2 > * NDK updated to r18, minimum API level increased to 17
Changelog *Sourced from [android-gif-drawable's changelog](https://github.com/koral--/android-gif-drawable/blob/dev/CHANGELOG.md).* > ### 1.2.16 > - Fixed setting color drawable from Java code - [#606](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/koral--/android-gif-drawable/issue/606) > - Fixed extraneous file descriptor closing - [#600](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/koral--/android-gif-drawable/issue/600) > - Fixed missing null check for NewGlobalRef - [#594](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/koral--/android-gif-drawable/issue/594) > - Fixed missing free of info buffer - [#595](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/koral--/android-gif-drawable/issue/595) > - Android Gradle plugin updated to 3.2.1 > - Gradle wrapper regenerated with 4.10.2 > - NDK updated to r18, minimum API level increased to 17
Commits - [`a68901c`](https://github.com/koral--/android-gif-drawable/commit/a68901cf22471b621e70d69a7ef8693a10469173) Merge pull request [#615](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/koral--/android-gif-drawable/issues/615) from koral--/dev - [`af10289`](https://github.com/koral--/android-gif-drawable/commit/af1028982f00045663b29ffe66bd12653d5e2ab7) Release 1.2.16 - [`f4e703b`](https://github.com/koral--/android-gif-drawable/commit/f4e703b73de9f7d2b5146eaf6bbb1f5e9d5d7cd7) Update changelog and readme. Fix badges. - [`3fceb10`](https://github.com/koral--/android-gif-drawable/commit/3fceb1062342141eb3efee4bfe5c84b3ba61d9b5) Update changelog. - [`da243e1`](https://github.com/koral--/android-gif-drawable/commit/da243e175ff1373726b78137465c20007689ac5d) Remove unneeded macros. - [`948b747`](https://github.com/koral--/android-gif-drawable/commit/948b74709075e6e477594c77e6bed952ea45ebfc) Change (f)stat calls to (f)stat64. - [`49f662f`](https://github.com/koral--/android-gif-drawable/commit/49f662ff147b1bda149fac72f043b37260a92116) Add close-on-exec flags. - [`182039b`](https://github.com/koral--/android-gif-drawable/commit/182039bf4a0c1b7437083057f35e2c0f253bca19) Fix native out of memory errors handling. - [`ffeecd8`](https://github.com/koral--/android-gif-drawable/commit/ffeecd8be14b1b65bb685516ba71dc2918ea3378) Unify Java exception checks in native code. - [`c57b374`](https://github.com/koral--/android-gif-drawable/commit/c57b37423c45905079e0d86a807b95ee6961d434) Remove extraneous file descriptor close, fixes [#600](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/koral--/android-gif-drawable/issues/600). - Additional commits viewable in [compare view](https://github.com/koral--/android-gif-drawable/compare/v1.2.15...v1.2.16)

title: Device credentials bypass due to Settings crash
body:
### Steps to reproduce
1. Make sure you set Lock mechanism to "Device credentials" 
2. Make sure you start app for first time (i.e. by first killing it via Android Settings).
3. Hold phone in landscape mode
4. Start NextCloud app. (Settings crashed).
5. Press "Open again" 
6. Voila, NextCloud app starts without unlocking.

[Video demo](https://youtu.be/Xjqb7YZUZco)


### Expected behaviour
App should open only after valid unlock.

### Actual behaviour
App opens without any unlock validation


## Server configuration detail

**Operating system:** Linux 4.15.0-39-generic #42-Ubuntu SMP Tue Oct 23 15:48:01 UTC 2018 x86_64

**Webserver:** Apache (fpm-fcgi)

**Database:** mysql 5.7.24

**PHP version:** 

7.1.24-1+ubuntu18.04.1+deb.sury.org+1
Modules loaded: Core, date, libxml, openssl, pcre, zlib, filter, hash, Reflection, SPL, session, standard, cgi-fcgi, mysqlnd, PDO, xml, apcu, bcmath, bz2, calendar, ctype, curl, dom, mbstring, fileinfo, ftp, gd, gettext, gmp, iconv, igbinary, intl, json, exif, mcrypt, msgpack, mysqli, pdo_mysql, pdo_sqlite, apc, posix, readline, shmop, SimpleXML, sockets, sqlite3, sysvmsg, sysvsem, sysvshm, tokenizer, wddx, xmlreader, xmlwriter, xsl, zip, Phar, memcached, Zend OPcache

**Nextcloud version:** 14.0.3 - 14.0.3.0

**Updated from an older Nextcloud/ownCloud or fresh install:** 

**Where did you install Nextcloud from:** unknown

title: Simplify grep + awk command to just awk in readme file
body: Awk is just as capable as grep to filter lines, so grep is not needed.

title: How to use davdroid for calender and task syncing
body:
I log in via nextcloud and i want to see the davdroid contact and calender but no vain. In the settings, I get synchronized but i did not get the file in nextcloud server. I tried this link https://nextcloud.webo.hosting/remote.php/dav/ 
and get message that
"This is the WebDAV interface. It can only be accessed by WebDAV clients such as the Nextcloud desktop sync client."

Could you tell how to access the calender syncing or suggest a news software freely available.

title: Domains and dynamic IP's
body:
Sorry wrong thread! I'll leave it here if someone wants to test against android too!

I just wanted to suggest a slight change to the PC client app or to make it an option. 

I use a website url to forward all calls to a dynamic IP, Example:
https://mydomain.com/NC/params?*
this server returns a 307 temporary redirect to the current dynamic IP like so:
https://123.123.123.123/NC/params?*


This works fine, except that the Next Cloud pc client remembers the dynamic IP url and not the domain that I entered on setup, so whenever the IP changes I have to delete and setup my user info again.
Can we have it remember the domain entered and not the resolved redirect? (or an option to do so would be awesome for the next app release!)

Thanks, love the program!


### Actual behaviour
- PC app remembers http://123.123.123.123/NC

### Expected behaviour
- it should remember http://myDomain.com/NC
 
### Steps to reproduce
1.  Setup a webserver that forwards all traffic via a 307 redirect to another url/ip. (or ask me to set one up)
2.  Setup a PC client to point to the URL
3. Client saves the redirect, not what was entered.


### Environment data

Nextcloud app version:  Version 2.3.3 (build 1)

Nextcloud server version:   Nextcloud 13.0.5 (updating now)

Server logs shouldn't be needed... you can see the client adding the url.

title: Add buttons in the notification for twofactor_nextcloud_notification
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
Hello !
I use NickV's twofactor_nextcloud_notification app ever since it was released :)
It is very helpful BUT ...

When I attempt to login, I expectedly get a notification telling me about it.
I then need top open this notification : it opens the Android app and then I have a choice : _Accept_ or _Reject_ the connection, thanks to 2 buttons.

A better solution :
I'd really like to _Approve_ or _Reject_ connection from within the notification, thanks to 2 buttons.
(Messaging app often have 2 buttons in notification : _Reply_ and _Mark as read_)

I initially booked an issue on the app repo (https://github.com/nickv-nextcloud/twofactor_nextcloud_notification/issues/48) but I was told this should be managed by the Android app.

If this F.R. should only be about buttons, please let me know, I'll amend the Issue :)

What do you think ?
Thanks
Guillaume

title: Portrait mode saves each photo in a new directory
body:
### Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.
Google Camera on Pixel 2/3 in Portrait mode saves each photo in a new folder.

See:
 - https://forum.xda-developers.com/pixel-2-xl/help/portrait-mode-creates-folder-t3709779
 - https://productforums.google.com/forum/#!category-topic/phone-by-google/qScg2CMrzGA
 - https://productforums.google.com/forum/#!topic/phone-by-google/LyB4OLy528o
 - https://www.reddit.com/r/GooglePixel/comments/7qx6hm/pixel_2s_portrait_mode_makes_folders_for_each/
 - https://androidcommunity.com/gcam-tool-fixes-the-way-modded-google-camera-apps-save-portrait-mode-images-20180220/

This makes camera photo backups impossible because you'd need to add a new folder to backup.

### Describe the solution you'd like

It would be awesome if Nextcloud app could recognize DCIM/IMG_* folders and back their content into Camera upload location together with all other photos.

### Describe alternatives you've considered
I can manually move each portrait to the Camera directory, but that sucks.

title: Upload existing files
body:
### Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.
Setting up auto upload, it shows thumbnails from that folder. I would expect that it would sync everything in the folder... OR have the option to do so. It just seems like something that should be there or that the app should do. Other sync apps do this. 

### Describe the solution you'd like
To be able to sync everything in a folder on my phone. Not just new files. It does this on the linux desktop sync. 

### Describe alternatives you've considered
Manually uploading the files via sftp and doing an occ scan... 

### Additional context
I LOVE LOVE LOVE LOVE LOVE next cloud. I've got my wife and i using it. Keep up the great work!

title: Android Talk after DNS change
body:
Opened Per Mario feedback via google play
### Actual behaviour
I copied my NC files and DB to a new VM (moved it from 1and1 hosting). Then upgraded from 13 to 14. Talk app would not login, just said "Redirecting" and logs shows an invalid login for my user. Web interface worked fine. The Nextcloud app worked just fine. 
The background was intentionally made different so i could tell when DNS switch had started working. Both Android NextCloud Talk and the Next Cloud app showed the new background image. 

### Expected behaviour
It would login. 
 
### Steps to reproduce
1. Move to a new IP for your NC instance
2. Try to login with Talk
3. Fail

### How I fixed it
Cleared the data and cache on the Talk App. It appeared (after watching network attempts via packet capture) that it had cached the IP of the URL. Once I cleared it's data, it correctly used the new IP.

Seems it should resolve the url to IP on each open.

### Environment data
Android version: 8

Device model: LG V20

Stock or customized system: Stock

Nextcloud app version: Talk 3.1.0beta4

Nextcloud server version: 14.0.3

title: Modification times not preserved when loading files from other apps
label: [Label(name="bug")]

### Actual behaviour
When files are loaded into Nextcloud from another app (Gallery, Camera, browsing for specific filetypes, etc.) their modification times aren't preserved and the files are saved in the Nextcloud server with their upload times as modification times. If files are loaded into Nextcloud by directly browsing the phone's filesystem the modification times are preserved.

### Expected behaviour
Files' modification times should always be preserved and displayed in the Nextcloud web interface and in the apps.
 
### Steps to reproduce
1. open the Nextcloud app and add a file from another app
2. wait for the upload to end 
3. check the file's modification time

Device model: Huawei P8 Lite 2015 ALE-L21

Nextcloud app version: 3.3.2

Nextcloud server version: 14.0.3

title: LDAP, AD authentification - locking users AD acounts after PW change
label: [Label(name="needs info/discussion")]
body:
### Enviroment
Nextcloud using LDAP authentification
Win Domain - with policies:
- change PW every X months
- Password can not be the same
- after 6x wrong password, Active Directory account is locked - User can not login into domain - can not using PC, VPNS and other services because account is locked and must be manually unlocked in AD

### Actual behaviour
App is trying to log in with saved password, which leads to blocking users AD account.

### Expected behaviour
After not successful login with saved password, ask for password for this nextcloud account
 
### Steps to reproduce
1. login in APP to nextcloud with LDAP account 
2. Change PW - forced domain policy - change PW every X months
3. app using old PW til AD account is locked


### Environment data
Android version: every version

Device model: 
standard android phones like samsung etc

Stock or customized system:
all roms
Nextcloud app version:
latest
Nextcloud server version:
13.0.6

title: Automatically exclude certain folders (albums, podcasts, etc.) from auto-upload
label: [Label(name="design"), Label(name="enhancement"), Label(name="needs info/discussion")]
body:
### Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.
I find it very annoying that every time any app I use downloads an image nextcloud will then create an auto upload folder connection. Here are some scenerios where the current behavior is a problem:

1. Sometimes I download an app just to try it out, or use it temporarily and then I uninstall it. But even once I uninstall, that doesn't get rid of the left over auto-upload folder connection. Over time this creates lots and lots of auto-upload folders that are useless and may not even be referencing an existing folder on either local or remote. 
2. Sometimes apps will create folders that have recognizable media that triggers the creation of an auto upload folder but I don't want these folders auto uploaded nor should they be junking up the auto upload folder connection UI. The nextcloud devs can't really predict where some apps devs might choose to stick folders, and it would be bad design if the installation of one unscruplous app could throw the NC UX into disarray. 
For instance, I have a folder where I store Gameboy ROMs for emulation on my phone. Sometimes the ROM distributors will include a small screenshot picture so that the folders will be easier for a human to visually scan in a desktop file manger program. I don't want 65 individual 125kb images each getting their own  auto upload connection and cluttering up the UI. 
Another example, I am subscribed to 137 podcasts, and while I don't listen to them all, all the time, I do have most of them set to auto download the latest episodes when on wifi. If a podcast app chose to cache the album art images to the user's folder then it would be chaos!
3. Sometimes I change my mind about where I want the app to be remotely. In my case, I originally had my camera upload to InstantUploads/Camera on my server. Then I changed my mind and I created a folder called Phone/Camera on my server. I could change the existing auto upload folder, but if I uninstalled and then reinstalled NextCloud it would create 2 auto upload folder connections! One for InstantUpload/Camera and one for Phone/Camera. Very annoying!
4. Sometimes I have a folder that contains many subfolders with media, but I really only need the top layer folder to be identified by the autoupload folder connections. In my case, I have a folder called "Library" in which I put audio books on my server that I want to be then synced over to my phone. But the NextCloud client doesn't set up a folder for "Library", it sets up an auto upload folder connection for every single book in the library, because every book is in it's own sub folders. The auto upload folder connection is triggered by the presence of album art in the folder. This is also a huge problem for people who might want to sync over their Music Library, which I imagine is a really common use case for the NextCloud android client. 



### Describe the solution you'd like
Currently it is possible to edit folder connections. This is good (though it does not appear to be very persistent as shown by my uninstalling and reinstalling issues mentioned in example 3 above). 

It is also possible to set an auto upload folder connection to inactive. This is also a good feature

 But it should also be possible to delete/hide inactive connections. Doesn't really matter which, it just needs the ability to reduce the amount of extra chaos added to the UI by all the extra crud. 

### Describe alternatives you've considered
I have uninstalled the NextCloud android client and set up a bunch of syncing folders with FolderSync [[link]](https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=dk.tacit.android.foldersync.full&hl=en_US)

I would prefer to support/use/test the NextCloud client though. The foldersync is not specifically made for NextCloud so it has a more cluttered interface, setting up syncs is less straightforward, and because it relies on a webdav connection the instant sync feature only works when adding or deleting files on the android side of things, and can not work the other way around.

### Additional context
A lot of my issues can be tracked by this previous bug report when I originally thought that this was possible and the difficulty in doing this thing was not by design: https://github.com/nextcloud/android/issues/3161

Also see related feature request issue here https://github.com/nextcloud/android/issues/3239

title: "Motion Photos" create entries for missing files in autoupload list
label: [Label(name="enhancement"), Label(name="needs info/discussion")]
body:
### Actual behaviour
The Harry Potter-esque Motion Photos (Android naming - iOS calls it Live Photos) are uploaded as they should, but it seems as if there are temporary jpeg files which are tried to be autouploaded but then could not be found. This creates a lot of entries in the "uploads" sections of the app with the following content:
"IMG_20181028_161552_095.jpg - Lokale Datei nicht gefunden"
The file name of the correctly uploaded motion picture is silghtly different: MVIMG_2018... There is no file in the local photo directory without the MV in front of the filename.

### Expected behaviour
Just ignore the temporary created jpg files.
 
### Steps to reproduce
Settings:
- Only on WIFI: yes
- Only when charging: no
- Use subfolders: yes
- Keep original files: in original folder

### Environment data
Android version:
8.1 (Android One)

Device model: 
BQ Aquaris X2

Stock or customized system:
Stock

Nextcloud app version:
3.3.2

Nextcloud server version:
14.0.3

title: SyncedFolderAdapter: add locale for number
use suggested timeout of 10min
body:
> Wakelocks have two acquire methods: one with a timeout, and one without. You should generally always use the one with a timeout. A typical timeout is 10 minutes. If the task takes longer than it is critical that it happens (i.e. can't use JobScheduler) then maybe they should consider a foreground service instead (which is a stronger run guarantee and lets the user know something long/important is happening).

So using 10min (10 min * 60s /min * 1000msec/s)

Signed-off-by: tobiasKaminsky <tobias@kaminsky.me>

title: disable lint warning on not secure RNG on < 4.3
body:
> Key generation, signing, encryption, and random number generation may not receive cryptographically strong values due to improper initialization of the underlying PRNG on Android 4.3 and below.

The RNG in question is used to generate a random number for inter-app communication and thus it is not needed to that strong, but only needs to be random.

title: The ability to toggle the automatic creation of auto-upload folders
label: [Label(name="enhancement"), Label(name="needs info/discussion")]
body:
### Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.
Personally I think it would be a good idea for the user to have the option to toggle off and on the automatic creation of auto-upload folder connections. 



### Describe the solution you'd like
Having the auto addition of folders can be helpful but it can also be annoying. The ability to toggle that behavior off and on would be a good start. 

I think this is a good idea because sometimes users will upload a massive number of media folders, such as a music library and they don't want every single album with album art in it to get it's own connection. 

### Describe alternatives you've considered
I have uninstalled the NextCloud android client and set up a bunch of syncing folders with FolderSync [[link]](https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=dk.tacit.android.foldersync.full&hl=en_US)

I would prefer to support/use/test the NextCloud client though. The foldersync is not specifically made for NextCloud so it has a more cluttered interface, setting up syncs is less straightforward, and because it relies on a webdav connection the instant sync feature only works when adding or deleting files on the android side of things, and can not work the other way around.


---------------
This request is part of a more general issue I have with the lack of control that the nextcloud android client provides clients in their syncing process. 

A lot of my issues can be tracked by this previous bug report when I originally thought that this was possible and the difficulty in doing this thing was not by design: https://github.com/nextcloud/android/issues/3161


See related feature request issue here: https://github.com/nextcloud/android/issues/3263

title: Crash when loading "Deleted files"
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
Nextcloud app version: 3.3.1 Nextcloud server version: 14.0.3 The app crashes when there are many files with equal names in the trashbin. ### Stack trace: 
E/AndroidRuntime: FATAL EXCEPTION: main
    Process: com.nextcloud.client, PID: 10317
    java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Comparison method violates its general contract!
        at java.util.TimSort.mergeHi(TimSort.java:895)
        at java.util.TimSort.mergeAt(TimSort.java:512)
        at java.util.TimSort.mergeCollapse(TimSort.java:437)
        at java.util.TimSort.sort(TimSort.java:241)
        at java.util.Arrays.sort(Arrays.java:1523)
        at java.util.Collections.sort(Collections.java:238)
        at com.owncloud.android.utils.FileSortOrderByName.sortTrashbinFiles(FileSortOrderByName.java:76)
        at com.owncloud.android.ui.adapter.TrashbinListAdapter.setTrashbinFiles(TrashbinListAdapter.java:89)
        at com.owncloud.android.ui.trashbin.TrashbinActivity.showTrashbinFolder(TrashbinActivity.java:256)
        at com.owncloud.android.ui.trashbin.TrashbinPresenter$1.onSuccess(TrashbinPresenter.java:72)
        at com.owncloud.android.ui.trashbin.RemoteTrashbinRepository$ReadRemoteTrashbinFolderTask.onPostExecute(RemoteTrashbinRepository.java:211)
        at com.owncloud.android.ui.trashbin.RemoteTrashbinRepository$ReadRemoteTrashbinFolderTask.onPostExecute(RemoteTrashbinRepository.java:175)
        at android.os.AsyncTask.finish(AsyncTask.java:660)
        at android.os.AsyncTask.-wrap1(AsyncTask.java)
        at android.os.AsyncTask$InternalHandler.handleMessage(AsyncTask.java:677)
        at android.os.Handler.dispatchMessage(Handler.java:102)
        at android.os.Looper.loop(Looper.java:154)
        at android.app.ActivityThread.main(ActivityThread.java:6077)
        at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Native Method)
        at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit$MethodAndArgsCaller.run(ZygoteInit.java:866)
        at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit.main(ZygoteInit.java:756)
I think it's because `AlphanumComparator().compare(o1, o2);` always returns -1 for identical filenames (at least for files with a '.' in their name) in com.owncloud.android.utils.FileSortOrderByName:84. Workaround: `if (o1.getFileName().equals(o2.getFileName())) return 0;` before FileSortOrderByName.java:84

title: Default to IPv6 when both AAAA and A record is returned by resolver
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
Normal home internet connection will only be given 1 IPv4 address and use NAT. If there is another service using TCP/443, you will not get another TCP/443 for other service. Since there are no NAT for IPv6, you can open TCP/443 to the Internet on multiple machine without needing to use other port number for port forwarding.

**Describe the solution you'd like**
Use IPv6 by default when DNS resolver return both IPv6 and IPv4 addresses. Fallback to IPv4 if IPv6 connection does not works.

**Additional context**
Follow the Internet Standard! 
Nextcloud desktop sync client seems to use IPv6 by default, why not do the same for android app?

title: Detect configured instant upload folder across accounts
label: [Label(name="enhancement"), Label(name="needs info/discussion")]
body:
I have two accounts configured, my private Nextcloud and my company Nextcloud.

On my private account I have configured my local media folders for instant upload. But every once and a while I get a notification that new media upload folders where detected. If I click on the notification the instant upload configuration dialog for my company account opens.

It would be nice if the Android app would detect that instant upload for this folder is already configured for a different account and don't show this notification.

label: [Label(name="bug")]
body: My nextcloud client on a Samsung Galaxy Note 4 opens lots of connections to the server and doesn't  close these connections. (CLOSE_WAIT) Apache2 starts a lot of tasks which consume 100% of the processor  resources. Nextcloud client and Nextcloud servers are not usable.

title: In both if branches was the same
body:
Found via FindBug.
Previously we did this
- switched to grid on PHOTO_SEARCH
- post event on NO_SEARCH) or REGULAR_FILTER
- OR post event on everything else

now last two branches are combined

Still searchEvent can be null, e.g. on fresh start or if suspending app without any search.

Ref: https://github.com/nextcloud/android/pull/3176#discussion_r227669886

title: Round off buttons 'pill style' like on the website/server
label: [Label(name="design"), Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
With the server progressing towards a design change (among other changes) regarding the buttons https://github.com/nextcloud/server/pull/11943 - we can adopt that one too ;)

* Round buttons are defined within Material Design in the "Crane Design" see https://material.io/design/material-studies/crane.html
* These "new" buttons or rather the different new styles for buttons are implemented via the new `MaterialButton`s which deprecate the existing `AppCompatButton`s, see https://material.io/design/components/buttons.html in general and https://material.io/develop/android/components/material-button/ for API
* To be able to make use of these new implementations we need to move away from the Android Support Libs to the successor AndroidX, which @tobiasKaminsky already started working on here #3089 

* [ ] requires #3089

Pinging @tobiasKaminsky and @nextcloud/designers @jancborchardt for feedback. While due to the requirement (#3089) we can't tell when this issue can actually be tackled, still wanting to start the discussion now :)

title: Fix AutoUpload notification
body:
fix #3163 

- fix not working detection of already defined synced folders
- delete not used (and wrong) function

Problem was that passing everything into selection did not worked.
Also this is error prone to sql injection (yes, very theoratical with folder names), but changing it to use correct parameter solves both.

Steps to test:
- have images in camera folder
- make sure that download folder is not in media scanner (delete images from download in gallery app)
- clean installation of app
- set up camera folder
- take image -> no notification
- delete all files in camera folder
- take image -> no notification
- download image e.g. with Firefox --> see notification

Signed-off-by: tobiasKaminsky <tobias@kaminsky.me>

title: Backport #3114: create a task for each button
body:
disable buttons until request is complete: error -> re-enable / success: delete notification
success check: added 202 (accepted)

Signed-off-by: tobiasKaminsky <tobias@kaminsky.me>

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/13740715/37007559-d908285e-20ab-11e8-995f-276838df49b2.png)![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/13740715/37007575-f0d53c6a-20ab-11e8-8e49-b48e53979a40.png)


### Actual behaviour                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               

This is the actual behavior:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/13740715/37007595-08c72c2a-20ac-11e8-869f-8fd90fde8d5f.png)

I don't want to swipe a hundred times or more just to look at older photos on NC. It's so much swiping! I have thousands of photos, and if I want to back in time, it would be nice to have a "Scroll bar" that will accelerate quickly and let me see photos down the list more quickly.

Please, this is a make-or-break feature, it's not a proper photos app without a scroll bar. :(

### Steps to reproduce                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             
Go to Any Folder on Android app, cannot see "scroll bar" on the right side.

### Android version
V8

### App version
V3.3.0

### Server configuration

**Operating system**:  Raspberry Pi 3  using NextCloudPi (Raspbian Lite)

**Web server:**  

**Database:**  i'm using NextCloudPi v0.64.2

**PHP version:**  7

**Nextcloud version:** (see Nextcloud admin page)   v14.0.3.0

### Actual behaviour

Once the Lock setting has been set to Device credentials changing it to None has no effect, i.e. the app still requires Device credentials.

### Expected behaviour

When Lock is set to None no credentials should be required to open it.

May seem like a trivial complaint but unless I can disable this I cannot take screenshots of the app.

Device model: Essential PH-1

Stock or customized system: Stock

Nextcloud app version: 3.3.0 (F-Droid)

Nextcloud server version: 14.0.3

If somebody could clarify where to get applicable logs am happy to provide.

label: [Label(name="approved"), Label(name="bug")]

### Actual behaviour
When I connect to my smartphone via _adb logcat_ and open my app, I see a _JSONException_, because the server response does not seem to be right. The exception complains about this part: `"expire_date":{"enabled":true,"days":"admin","enforced":false}`
I am not sure about the impact of this. But actually I tried to debug other issues that could interfere with this...

The value for "days" should be a number and make more sense, right? -> no exception

title: Auto Upload Notification recreation
label: [Label(name="approved"), Label(name="enhancement"), Label(name="pr exists")]
body:
### Actual behaviour
- Picture is taken
- Nextcloud detects the new picture
- Uploads it
- Deletes the local picture (like it should)
- DCMI folder is empty
- Nextcloud sends a notification that a new upload folder has been found (actual bug)

### Expected behaviour
- There should be no notification about the new folder becuase it is not a new folder.
 
### Steps to reproduce
- Like above in "Actual behaviour".

### Comments from me
It is like a nag screen. The good thing is though that in the app no settings are altered. It seems from the outside just like a bug with the notifications.

### Environment data
Android version: 

Device model: Huawei P9 Plus (VIE-L09) & Samsung Galaxy S8 (SM-G950)

Stock or customized system: Huawei with Smart Launcher (5.1 build 048K), Samsung 100% Stock

Nextcloud app version: 3.3.0 on both

Nextcloud server version: 14.0.1 & 14.0.3

### Logs
#### Web server error log
```
Should not be relevant and the timespan is too huge to include everything.
```

#### Nextcloud log (data/nextcloud.log)
```
The log is too long that I can assure that there is no sensetive data in it. From my point of view there are even no current log entrys. I will now empty the log and trigger the bug and look into the new one.

UPDATE: There is no log of any events. Not the successful upload of the picture nor the re-detection notification of the Camera folder. On both phones. The log is blank, not a single entry.
```

I used to be able to open all my external apps (NC external apps addon) inside the Nextcloud app internal browser or whatever implementation it is, now after last couple updates in dev version it has changed. thanks

title: Hard seperation of client / library
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
Currently most of the server manipulation tasks are in serve, but e.g. RestoreTrashbinFileOperation is in client.

This is wrong for multiple reasons
- no other app can use it
- testing library cannot test this operation
- testing on client side is also harder

(I guess that I did this out of lazyness /hide)

So the idea is to have
- in library: all server related tasks, actually manipulation is done here
- in client: call library tasks and parse results

With this, we could (at some point) mock the complete library and test the complete app without any real server/library usage.

title: Use dav4android with okhttp3
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
This is technically in android-library, but will also affects client.

In longer term we should switch to [Dav4android](https://gitlab.com/bitfireAT/dav4android) and okhttp3 (as they also use it).

One of the main benefits will be that the library allows streams.
So imagine that we want to get a list of 50k files, then we do not have to wait until all is downloaded and parse it then, but we can start in parts directly, which will make UX much more convenient.

title: Use Lombok
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
Please see the video on https://projectlombok.org

It is a compile-time only library, but it helps to avoid lots of boilerplate code, e.g. you do not have to write any getter/setter. Instead you briefly annotate it with "@getter).
There are lots of other features.

title: Switch to WorkManager
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
https://developer.android.com/topic/libraries/architecture/workmanager

> The WorkManager API makes it easy to specify deferrable, asynchronous tasks and when they should run. These APIs let you create a task and hand it off to WorkManager to run immediately or at an appropriate time.

> WorkManager chooses the appropriate way to run your task based on such factors as the device API level and the app state. If WorkManager executes one of your tasks while the app is running, WorkManager can run your task in a new thread in your app's process. If your app is not running, WorkManager chooses an appropriate way to schedule a background task…

Currently we use android-job from Evernote and they suggest to [switch over](https://github.com/evernote/android-job#workmanager).

title: Switch to modern system
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
Our current architecture system is really old and evolved over years.
I think it is a good point to migrate it step by step to a modern system, as described [here](https://developer.android.com/jetpack/docs/guide).

This is an overview, how it looks like:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5836855/46952468-36030800-d08b-11e8-93f1-ac1c5935343c.png)

In short:
- [separation of concerns](https://developer.android.com/jetpack/docs/guide#separation-of-concerns)
- use Dagger2 for dependency injection (DI)
- use [Data Binding](https://developer.android.com/topic/libraries/data-binding)
- use Room
- use LiveData
- use [ViewModel](https://developer.android.com/topic/libraries/architecture/viewmodel)
    - to prevent rotation problems
    - avoids async task problems
    - share data between fragments: later usable for split view on tablets
    - [further reading](https://medium.com/androiddevelopers/lifecycle-aware-data-loading-with-android-architecture-components-f95484159de4)
- Network handling: https://developer.android.com/jetpack/docs/guide#addendum
- benefit: get a more easy [testing environment](https://developer.android.com/jetpack/docs/guide#test-components)


I would like to test this first on UserInfo Activity as this is a nice well defined part of our app. I will add caching to it.

Later I would go with Activities, which will also benefit from caching.

title: Next app architecture steps
label: [Label(name="overview")]
body:
Since the last days I read a lot on how to improve the app on a more deeper level.
So here are my rough ideas, which can and should be discussed.

I will list them as an overview and then open new issues to get in more detailed discussion.

- [switch to modern system](https://github.com/nextcloud/android/issues/3146)
- [switch to WorkManager](https://github.com/nextcloud/android/issues/3147)
- [use Lombok](https://github.com/nextcloud/android/issues/3148)
- [use dav4android, with okhttp3](https://github.com/nextcloud/android/issues/3149)
- [hard seperation of client / library](https://github.com/nextcloud/android/issues/3150)

title: Fix IllegalArgumentException on files with dots in name, add test case
body:
This PR fixes a problem were dots in file names can cause the app to crash with an `IllegalArgumentException: Comparison method violates its general contract!`.

I added a test case. Since I don't want to disclose information on the person who found this bug (i.e. file names), and I wasn't able to cause the error with a nice and simple 5 item list, I generated a test case with 200 random names in the format `Year.Month.RandomNumber`.

title: auto sync
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body: I've scanned the open and closed issues for auto sync info. some of the features sound like they *may* result in what I think of as auto sync... do any of them (auto pull new files to phone)? the description of 'favorites' sounds like it may. And many issues make 'auto upload' sound like it was just poorly named. ? Is there a way to auto sync(pull new files to phone automatically)? also is it possible to make the documentation describe the features / name the features less ambiguously? great

title: About Us
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body: Don't you think having an about us section will make people know more about your project.  If you don't mind, I can write it for you

title: Increase number of Nextcloud rings
body: Hi, can you increase the number of rings when you receive a call?

title: Show only size of local files when browsing `On device` directories
body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**

When browsing files `On device`, the size displayed for the directories is still the total size of the directories' contents on the server.

**Describe the solution you'd like**

It would be good to show the total size of _only the files actually present on the device_, for each subdirectory. It would help a lot when trying to clear up local space.

**Describe alternatives you've considered**

None.

title: fix exception handling
body: Exceptions such as NetworkOnMainThread exceptions were not passed on to the client as some error occurred while reading the exception message. (`println needs a message`)

title: App crashes when uploading files to Nextcloud
body:
- In Android Pie(API 28) if user tries to upload a files to nextcloud it will crash with below errors.

**Logcat error:**

Process: com.nextcloud.client, PID: 30549 java.lang.RuntimeException: Unable to start service com.owncloud.android.files.services.FileUploader@6fd73c0 with Intent { cmp=com.nextcloud.client/com.owncloud.android.files.services.FileUploader (has extras) }: java.lang.SecurityException: **Permission Denial: startForeground from pid=30549, uid=10278 requires android.permission.FOREGROUND_SERVICE**

Reason:
Apps that target Android 9 (API level 28) or higher and use foreground services must request the FOREGROUND_SERVICE permission.
https://developer.android.com/guide/components/services#Foreground

- Added **android.permission.FOREGROUND_SERVICE** permission in android manifest.

title: Activity: use image url instead of generating previews by oneself
label: [Label(name="1. developing")]
body:
Needs https://github.com/nextcloud/android-library/pull/73 and https://github.com/nextcloud/activity/pull/300

Previously we tried to find a referenced file in our database and then generated a thumbnail out of it.
Now we rely on the server to get a preview url. This way we can have thumbnails for files we never had in our database before.

TODO
- [ ] add backwards compatibility

Signed-off-by: tobiasKaminsky <tobias@kaminsky.me>

title: Add autofill hints
body:
Can be tested with https://github.com/googlesamples/android-AutofillFramework

Username and password fields I specified for auto fill.
Other things, like folder name, I set to "no" as I cannot imagine any value by autofill.

Signed-off-by: tobiasKaminsky <tobias@kaminsky.me>

title: share link with password not fit to password rule ('Updating share failed')
label: [Label(name="approved"), Label(name="bug"), Label(name="hacktoberfest")]
body:
### Steps to reproduce
1. password rule have to be set (for example 10 characters) on nextcloud
2. in the android app share a file or folder
3. enable "share link"
4. set a password (ex. Test123456)
5. v3.3.0: this is a common used password - android notice ony 'Updating share failed' 
v201809: this is a common used password - android notice "Password is among the 1,000,000 most common ones. Please make it unique" and later ony 'Updating share failed' 

[Youtube Screencast](http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QAvxZilUN-0)
00:00 - 00:10 seconds: Nextcloud DEV (with Server v14.0.1)
00:11 - 00:21 seconds: Nextcloud v3.3.0 (with Server v13.0.6)

### Expected behaviour
If the set password doesn't fit to the password rules, it have to be shown the right error message.

### Actual behaviour
Only universal error message 'Updating share failed' shown

title: Nextcloud app stops/crashes when opening .ics file
label: [Label(name="bug"), Label(name="good first issue"), Label(name="hacktoberfest")]
body:
If you have an .ics file (like from a Bahn booking) and tap on it, the app crashes saying

> Unfortunately, Nextcloud dev has stopped

This does not happen when you open the 3-dot-menu and choose "Open with", where you can open it with a calendar and there are no problems.

It seems there is no default action set for .ics files? When you tap them, it should be as if "Open with" was chosen.


Latest Nextcloud dev (from F-Droid) on Fairphone Android 6.0.1

title: Animated GIFs still broken!
body:
The issue [https://github.com/nextcloud/android/issues/3020](url) here says it fixed, but it's not. Because the error is still there for me.

### Actual behaviour
- Animated GIFs are still broken!

### Expected behaviour
- Should be playing!
 
### Steps to reproduce
1. Install latest 14.0 and upload images.
2. Browse files thru the Android app.
3. GIFs are still static!


### Environment data
Android version: 8.1

Device model: OnePlus 5

Stock or customized system: Stock

Nextcloud app version: 3.3.0

Nextcloud server version: 14.0

title: Filesize threshold for cellular data
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
I've setup my camera app (Open Camera) to store raw image files as well as jpgs. I have also setup the Nextcloud app to upload new images even when on cellular data. This works as expected and raw images are uploaded as well. Unfortunately the raws are much larger than the jpgs, thus taking longer to upload over cellular and eating into my data plan.

It would be nice if we could set a filesize limit that can be uploaded via cellular data. It has already been discussed in #486 but I guess a separate issue was never opened about this.

Such a filesize limit would of course be applicable to all kinds of files and would even enable someone to instantly upload small videos, while waiting for wifi for larger videos.

title: Android mobile app high background data usage
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
### Actual behavior
- Tell us what happens
High background data usage of android mobile app. About 150MB per day. When I noticed that couple weeks ago I switched off background data and after few days switched on thinking that Nextcloud might not work properly. As you can see on the chart, until end of the month usage curve did get flat. Now it ramp up again. From the chart it seems that something happened around last week of August and after that data usage started to go up. I remember resetting Davdroid and some other apps in August... 
I am not heavy user of Nextcloud on my mobile, mostly I use Nextcloud News (90%).

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/40382662/46662982-c08fc700-cbb4-11e8-88b4-cbd541967621.png)




### Expected behavior
- Data usage should be with in tens of MB per day as it was before.
 
### Steps to reproduce
???

8.0.0

Device model: 
Samsung Galaxy S7

Stock or customized system:

3.3.0

0.9.9.16

2.0.3

title: Release 3.4.0 - Roadmap
label: [Label(name="overview")]
body:
Planned RC1: 26.11.18

**Create stable x.y.z branch & use it for release**
- [x] create branch ```stable-3.4.x```
- [x] make it protected
- [x] set up Codacy, Drone as required status
- [x] change ```drone.yml```
- [x] change ```getBranchName.sh```
- [ ] delete old stable-x.y.z branch (https://github.com/nextcloud/android/branches/all?utf8=%E2%9C%93&query=stable)

**Bump**
- [ ] release new library version & use this is in app
- [ ] Bump version name and version code in ```build.gradle``` files
- [ ] Update ```CHANGELOG.md``` adding new features
- [ ] check if code is outdated due to last supported server version ```@NextcloudServer``` annotation

**Test app with all supported Android version**
- access all activities
- auto upload
- upload / download files/folders
- use external sdcard
- what's new slides correctly shown on first start

All tests on
  - [ ] Android 4
  - [ ] Android 5
  - [ ] Android 6
  - [ ] Android 7
  - [ ] Android 8

**RC1**
- [ ] Verify that the new version number is shown in settings
- [ ] Verify that logging is enabled
- [ ] Tag new version as ```rc-3.4.0-01``` with private dev key (not on github)
- [ ] Build and release to Play Store as beta release and :shipit: 
- [ ] Publish it on f-droid as optional release: edit metadata and open new merge request on gitlab
- [ ] Verify that it is shown on f-droid (within 24h)

**Final Release, after two weeks time (max) of latest RC release**
- [ ]  replace screenshots (https://github.com/nextcloud/screenshots/tree/master/android/phone)
- [ ] Verify that the new version number is shown in settings
- [ ] Verify that logging is disabled
- [ ] update translations from transifex
- [ ] Test that what's new is shown correctly on upgrade
- [ ] Tag new version as ```stable-3.4.0``` with private dev key (not on github)
- [ ] Build and release to Play Store as stable release and :shipit: 
- [ ] Update Play store changelog based on condensed ```CHANGELOG.md``` infos
- [ ] Publish it on f-droid as release: edit metadata, bump "current version" and open new merge request on gitlab
- [ ] Verify that it is shown on f-droid (within 24h)

title: Stuck in auth since fingerprint is enabled
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
### Actual behaviour
- Stuck by drawing schema or fingerprint : 
    if schema/fingerprint right = loop in "Informations d'identification erroné" (have to back as many time as tries)
    if schema/fingerprint wrong = schema incorrect

### Expected behaviour
- not stuck
 
### Steps to reproduce
1. enable fingerprint auth when I reopen the app since days


### Environment data
Android version: 8.1.0

Device model: Xiaomi mi A1

Nextcloud app version: 3.3.0

Nextcloud server version: 14.0.1

### Logs
#### Web server error log
```
no log about issue
```

#### Nextcloud log (data/nextcloud.log)
```
no log about issue
```

### Additionnals info
Try 1 => reinstall app => login by user and password => stuck
Try 2 => reinstall app => login by token => OK => close app => open app => stuck
Try 3 => reinstall app => login by token => OK => settings => lock to none => stuck

title: Changed "Copied to clipboard" text to "Link copied"
body: Resolves #3110.

title: Tapping files in upload view should open the file view in the Nextcloud app
label: [Label(name="design"), Label(name="enhancement"), Label(name="good first issue"), Label(name="hacktoberfest")]
body:
Currently when I tap a file in the uploads view, either it opens it in the local image viewer, or I get this:
![](https://cloud.jancborchardt.net/s/eRXRK2n7Aq5zqXg/preview)

Apart from this being very technical wording no one should ever see, tapping a file in this view should open the file view (like viewing the image) inside Nextcloud, no?

Alternatively also the detail view works. But when you upload pictures to share, currently you upload - tap upload notification - get to uploads view - tap file - file opens in local viewer - you can use the share function there …?

title: Tapping successful upload notification should open the details view directly
label: [Label(name="design"), Label(name="enhancement"), Label(name="good first issue"), Label(name="hacktoberfest")]
body:
Currently when you upload a file and then tap the notification to edit details, you are sent to the Uploads view.

That's not very useful – better would be to show the detail view of the file so you can add comments, share, rename etc.

title: Link share "Copied to clipboard" bar should say "Link copied"
label: [Label(name="design"), Label(name="enhancement"), Label(name="good first issue"), Label(name="hacktoberfest")]
body:
Simpler wording and shorter. People don't really know what a "clipboard" is. ;) 

This shows up as a bottom toast/snackbar when you share via link.

body:

After photo being autouploaded you can only delete it immideately or move to nextcloud directory 
### Expected behaviour
Uploaded photos should be deleted after specified amount of time, not immediately (e.g. week or month). Also useful option could be keeping last X photos.

label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
### Actual behaviour
- While uploading a file to cloud, user will be given three options.
   a. Move file to NextCloud server.
   b. Keep file in source folder.
   c. Delete file from source folder.

### Expected behaviour

title: no search in text-file viewer
label: [Label(name="enhancement"), Label(name="pr exists")]
body:
### Actual behaviour
- open a text file in the nextcloud app
- press the search-icon in the top bar
  - enter a search term which appears in the file (and press enter/search)
  - note that nothing happens
- press *back* (either the system button or "←" in the top bar) to quit searching
- press *back* to quit viewing the file and go back to its containing folder
  - note that you don't view the folder, but search results for files/folders with your search from above
  - press *back* to get to view any folder
    - note that the view is now empty, but to regularly view any folder you have to use the swipe-menu on the left or reopen the app (this might be a separate bug, actually)

### Expected behaviour
- searching while a file is viewed should search that view
- when in search results, going back should go to the previous regular folder view
 

### Environment data
- Android version: 7.1
- Device model: golden / Samsung S3 Mini
- Stock or customized system: inofficial ROM
- Nextcloud app version: 3.2.3 from F-Droid
- Nextcloud server version: 13

title: Auto-Upload issue: Photos taken are not uploaded when no network traffic possible at create time of photos
label: [Label(name="AutoUpload"), Label(name="bug")]
body:
### Actual behaviour
Camera app's folder are set to auto-upload. Works mostly stable (have seen a couple of similar issues already open here), but, new for for me, NOT in the following  scenario:

- was off-site, no wifi, and with no mobile data, as no "credit" for (prepaid) mobile data. Means that technically devices shows mobile data (4G) connection as established, but no traffic comes through, blocked from telco company.
- I have taken some photos when "no network", as described above.
- Nextcloud app "sees" network connection established, tries to auto-upload. Forever, no time-out.
-  Even when later again a network connection had been established, NC app shows still no progress on auto-upload notification. Had to kill NC app, finally, to get rid of the "uploading files ...." notification.
- NO chance to get these never-uploaded photos auto-uploaded after NC app restart.
-  Even a manually "forced" re-scan doesn't detects them, they're not shown as failed, just nothing
- Later taken photos, with "normal" network connection, again are auto-uploaded fine, as desired.

### Expected behaviour
- NC app should run in a timeout, or at least be able to detect "skipped" files later on, latest with a manual forced re-scan
 
### Steps to reproduce
(already described above)

### Environment data
Android version: 6.0
Device model: Lenovo C2 / K10a40
Stock or customized system: Stock
Nextcloud app version: 3.2.3, F-Droid
Nextcloud server version: 14.0.0, OpenSuse Leap 15.0 repo version
### Logs
nothing in log for these photos, unfortunately

title: Auto-uploaded files on external SD-Card should be deleted after upload, but they don't
label: [Label(name="AutoUpload"), Label(name="bug")]
body:
### Actual behaviour
- Tell us what happens
I uses the autoupload feature and configured it to delete the original file, after upload.
The upload folder is located on a external SD-card. 
The nextcloud storage is located as well on the same SD-card, so access rights should be already granted.
(Didn't try is with internal memory. )

### Expected behaviour
- Tell us what should happen
After upload, the original file should be deleted, it isn't.
 
### Steps to reproduce
1.  Configure auto upload folder on (external) sd-card, with setting "delete" original after upload.
2. Move some file in upload folder
3. Wait until the file is uploaded in the cloud.
4. Original file is not deleted. 


### Environment data
Android version: Android 6.0.1

Device model: Sony Xperia Z3 compact

Stock or customized system:

Nextcloud app version: 3.3.0

Nextcloud server version: 13.0.5

### Logs
#### Web server error log
```
Insert your webserver log here
```

#### Nextcloud log (data/nextcloud.log)
```

title: Hard UX on syncing: Confusing words and no documentation
label: [Label(name="bug"), Label(name="design")]
body:
Android client has: "Auto upload", "Download", "Sync", "On Device", "Set as available offline"... but no explanation at all, and the behavior of those features are not always the expected one.

File syncing can lead to disasters if the user does not clearly understand what is going to happen with hir files.

As far as I know, Nextcloud Android users would like to understand how to set a folder with:
- One-way sync from server to client
- One-way sync from client to server
- Two-way sync

In case that is possible, what about using these standard and accurate words?

In any case, it would be nice to have some Help, maybe just a very simple Readme file on how each feature works, whatever its name is.


Once that is done, it would also be nice to somehow document how sync conflicts are solved.

title: User not warned when using an unencrypted server connection. (Add connection security status icon)
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
First, Nextcloud is awesome! Keep up the good work!

### Actual behaviour
When using the Nextcloud app to connect to a Nextcloud server over an unencrypted connection, the user is not warned that the connection is **not** secure. This does not happen at first nor subsequent logins.

### Expected behaviour
When a user attempts to connect to a Nextcloud server over an unencrypted connection, the user should be warned that their connection is not protected/private, and that their data is at risk.
Currently the app **does** display this kind of warning when connecting to a server that has a **self-signed** certificate. So I think it makes sense to also warn when encryption is not in use at all.

One could argue that a user should already know if a server is using encryption based on the connection information they enter, or that Nextcould should never be available over an unencrypted channel, and I would have to agree. But I still think they deserve the warning.

#### UI Suggestion:
Add an icon or some other indication that the connection to the server is secure.
or
Add an icon or some other indication only when the connection is **not** secure. 
 
### Steps to reproduce
1. Set up Nextcloud, but do not configure encryption (https) on the web server.
2. As admin, set up a new user.
3. Use the Nextcloud Android app to connect to the server and log in for the first time as the new user.
4. Observe that no warning is presented to the user regarding the lack of connection security.
5. After the initial log-in, restart the app to reconnect.
6. Observe that no warning is presented.


### Environment data
Android version: **6.0**

Device model: (**Generic**)

Stock or customized system: **Stock**

Nextcloud app version: **3.3.0**

Nextcloud server version: **14**

title: Items added using 'Add to Nextcloud' from the 'On Device' page are not added to the device.
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
First let me say that I have just started using Nextcloud, and it is awesome!
Keep up the good work!

### Actual behaviour
When creating new folders or uploading files from the 'On Device' directory tree, the newly created/uploaded items do not then appear in the current 'On Device' directory. Instead they are created on the server and require you to navigate back out of 'On Device' and locate them in 'All Files' and perform a manual sync. Then the new items are visible from 'On Device'.

### Expected behaviour
If a user performs an 'Upload files' or 'Create new folder' action from an 'On Device' directory, the item should be created on the server (as it currently is) and then synced/pulled down to the device so it is immediately visible/available in the current 'On Device' directory.
I believe this to be the appropriate behavior since the item is being created from 'On Device'. If the user did not want it to be immediately available on the device, I think they would create it from 'All Files'.
 
### Steps to reproduce
1. Select 'On Device' from the main menu.
2. Push the + button and use 'Upload files' or 'Create new folder' to add content to Nextcloud.
3. Observe that the item does not become visible in the current 'On Device' directory
4. Select 'All Files' from the main menu and navigate to the same directory you were viewing from 'On Device'
5. Observe that the file does exist in this 'All Files' location and is not synced.

### Environment data
Android version: **6.0**

Device model: (**Generic**)

Stock or customized system: **Stock**

Nextcloud app version: **3.3.0**

Nextcloud server version: **14**

title: Codacy fixes
body:
needs https://github.com/nextcloud/android-library/pull/180

fixing several codacy warning categories, while for the for-loop I am respecting https://developer.android.com/training/articles/perf-tips :
> With an ArrayList, a hand-written counted loop is about 3x faster (with or without JIT), but for other collections the enhanced for loop syntax will be exactly equivalent to explicit iterator usage.

* codacy: String.indexOf(char) is faster than String.indexOf(String).
* codacy: Do not add empty strings
* codacy: Avoid the use of value in annotations when its the only element
* codacy: Avoid unnecessary constructors - the compiler will generate t…
* codacy: No need to check for null before an instanceof
* codacy: String.startsWith can be rewritten using String.charAt(0)
* codacy: A getX() method which returns a boolean should be named isX()
* codacy: No need to call String.valueOf to append to a string.
* codacy: Avoid using redundant field initializer
* codacy: This for loop can be replaced by a foreach loop

title: Codacy fixes
body:
* codacy: field has the same name as a method
* codacy: avoid using Literals in Conditional Statements
* codacy: avoid the use of value in annotations when its the only element
* codacy: consider simply returning the value vs storing it in local variable
* codacy: avoid unused imports
* codacy: all methods are static. Consider using a utility class instead. 
* codacy: String.indexOf(char) is faster than String.indexOf(String).
* codacy: useless qualified this usage in the same class.
* codacy: avoid using redundant field initializer
* codacy: avoid instantiating new objects inside loops
* codacy: useless parentheses
* remove unused return value from method signature

### Steps to reproduce
1. took picture
2. go to the folder view and try to view it
3. booooom

### Environment data
Android version: 8.0.0
plus 'Samsung Experience 9.0'

Device model: Samsung Galaxy S7
Stock, unrooted.

Nextcloud app version: 3.3.0RC3

Nextcloud server version: 14.0.0

### Logs
#### Web server error log

-> note: also crashes when network is OFF. Thumbnail preview shows in grid and list view, just opening the image - BOOM.

Image in question:

https://cloud.nextcloud.com/s/4B7JJTP8ciwFC5T

title: Bump drone version
body: Signed-off-by: tobiasKaminsky <tobias@kaminsky.me>

title: Feature request -- Port knocking before sync attempt
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
For security reasons I don't like to leave my NextCloud server always exposed on the internet.  Something as simple as a port knocking feature would allow security conscious people to expose their server for a brief period (for new connections) of time after a port knock.

In this scenario, firewall rules allow established connections to pass through just fine.  But new ones would only be permitted for say 10 seconds or 5 minutes on that port number.  [Wikipedia link](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Port_knocking)

If I could specify a port knock port number and timeout (in case several shorter lived connections are made by the android app) this would likely be sufficient UI elements.

IMO, this would go a long way towards helping home users more securely host their own nextCloud and reduce the amount of stories we hear on the Internet about non updated versions of nextCloud being hacked.

title: App tries to "fetch most recent version of the file" while VPN is in waiting for usable network mode
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
### Actual behaviour
- Nextcloud app tries to fetch newest version of synced file while vpn is in offline/waiting for usable network mode

### Expected behaviour
- Nextcloud should show synced file while vpn is in offline/waiting for usable network mode
 
### Steps to reproduce
1. Enable internet connection (e.g. wifi) and connect to a VPN through openVPN
2. Download a file for offline mode (just sync it)
3. Disable internet connection (vpn still connected, icon is shown in status bar)
4. Open Nextcloud app and click on that synced file

-> Nextcloud app tries to download the newest version of that file because it is thinking it has an internet connection

-> You cannot view the synced file without disconnecting the vpn in offline mode


### Environment data
Android version: 7.1.2 (Lineage 14.1)

Nextcloud app version: 3.3.0 RC1

Nextcloud server version: 14.0

### Steps to reproduce

2. Open any folder
3. Open any file
Alternatively
2. Synchronize any folder


### Environment data
Android version: 7.0 Secpatch 2018-06-01

Device model: SM-T719

Stock or customized system: stock

Nextcloud app version: 3.2.3 (fdroid)

Nextcloud server version: 13.0.4.0

### Comment
I guess this is a feature request. If not I can provide client logs.

title: Open a (downloaded) file with Nextcloud app
label: [Label(name="needs info/discussion")]
body:
Hi,

### Actual behaviour

Sometimes I download files with Firefox for Android for instance and want to push them to Nextcloud. Once the file is downloaded, I can click on the "download is complete" notification and this opens an "Open with" dialog but Nextcloud is not in the available apps.

![screenshot_20180913-110313](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3856586/45479070-c32e0680-b745-11e8-9146-18f36d66ef53.jpg)

If I then manually browse to the downloaded file with a file manager and choose to "Open with", same thing, Nextcloud is not available.


### Expected behaviour

I would have expected to be able to directly open the file with Nextcloud app, which would have been the same as opening the Nextcloud app and choosing to upload this specific file.
 
### Steps to reproduce

1. Download a file with Firefox for Android
2. Click the notification "download is complete", Nextcloud app is not listed there
3. Browse to the file using a file manager and choose "open with", Nextcloud app is not listed there


### Environment data
Android version: 7.0

Device model: Asus Zenfone 3 max

Stock or customized system: Stock + Asus overlay

Nextcloud app version: 3.2.3 from F-Droid

Nextcloud server version: 14.0


I found a couple of related issues for using Nextcloud as a storage provider (basically "open from"), but did not find any issues related to opening files with Nextcloud.

Thanks!
