title: Bump jacocoVersion from 0.7.4.201502262128 to 0.8.2
label: [Label(name="dependencies")]
body:
Bumps `jacocoVersion` from 0.7.4.201502262128 to 0.8.2. Updates `org.jacoco.ant` from 0.7.4.201502262128 to 0.8.2
Release notes *Sourced from [org.jacoco.ant's releases](https://github.com/jacoco/jacoco/releases).* > ## 0.8.2 > ## New Features > > * Experimental support for Java 11 and Java 12 class files, including JEP 12 "preview features" (GitHub [#719](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/jacoco/jacoco/issues/719), [#738](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/jacoco/jacoco/issues/738), [#743](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/jacoco/jacoco/issues/743)). > * Branches and instructions generated by javac 11 for try-with-resources statement are filtered out (GitHub [#669](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/jacoco/jacoco/issues/669)). > * Synthetic classes are filtered out during generation of report (GitHub [#668](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/jacoco/jacoco/issues/668)). > * Part of bytecode generated by ECJ for `switch` statements on `java.lang.String` values is filtered out during generation of report (GitHub [#735](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/jacoco/jacoco/issues/735), [#741](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/jacoco/jacoco/issues/741), [#746](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/jacoco/jacoco/issues/746)). > * Methods added by the Kotlin compiler that do not have line numbers are filtered out during generation of report. Idea and implementation by Nikolay Krasko (GitHub [#689](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/jacoco/jacoco/issues/689)). > * Branch added by the Kotlin compiler for reading from `lateinit` property is filtered out during generation of report. Implementation by Fabian Mastenbroek (GitHub [#707](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/jacoco/jacoco/issues/707)). > * Bytecode generated by Kotlin compiler for implicit `else` of `when` expressions that list all cases of `enum` or `sealed class` is filtered out during generation of report (GitHub [#721](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/jacoco/jacoco/issues/721), [#729](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/jacoco/jacoco/issues/729), [#749](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/jacoco/jacoco/issues/749)). > * Additional bytecode generated by Kotlin compiler for when expressions on `kotlin.String` values is filtered out during generation of report (GitHub [#737](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/jacoco/jacoco/issues/737), [#746](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/jacoco/jacoco/issues/746)). > * Classes and methods annotated with runtime visible and invisible annotation whose simple name is `Generated` are filtered out during generation of report (GitHub [#731](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/jacoco/jacoco/issues/731)). > * Maven goal report-aggregate now also considers dependencies specified using version range. Idea and implementation by Lukas Krejc (GitHub [#658](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/jacoco/jacoco/issues/658)). > > ## Fixed Bugs > > * Don't insert stackmap frames into class files with version < 1.6, this fixes regression which was introduced in version 0.6.5 (GitHub [#667](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/jacoco/jacoco/issues/667)). > * Question mark in filter expressions now correctly matches exactly one character (GitHub [#672](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/jacoco/jacoco/issues/672)). > * Part of bytecode that javac generates for `switch` statement on `java.lang.String` values with a small number cases is now correctly filtered out during generation of report (GitHub [#730](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/jacoco/jacoco/issues/730)). > > ## Non-functional Changes > > * JaCoCo now depends on ASM 6.2.1 (GitHub [#706](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/jacoco/jacoco/issues/706), [#725](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/jacoco/jacoco/issues/725)). > * Improved error message when already instrumented classes are used for instrumentation or analysis (GitHub [#703](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/jacoco/jacoco/issues/703)). > * JaCoCo build now requires at least Maven 3.3.9 and JDK 8 (GitHub [#711](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/jacoco/jacoco/issues/711)). > API Changes > * The XML report now has an optional attribute `sourcefilename` on the `class` element to allow unambiguously relate classes to source files. The JaCoCo DTD version has been updated to 1.1 (GitHub [#702](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/jacoco/jacoco/issues/702)). > > ## 0.8.1 > ## New Features > > * JaCoCo now supports Java 10 (GitHub [#629](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/jacoco/jacoco/issues/629)). > * Empty constructor without parameters in enum is filtered out during generation of report (GitHub [#649](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/jacoco/jacoco/issues/649)). > > ## 0.8.0 > ## New Features > > * JaCoCo now officially supports Java 9 (GitHub [#600](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/jacoco/jacoco/issues/600)). > * JaCoCo now comes with a simple command line interface (GitHub [#525](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/jacoco/jacoco/issues/525)). > * Limit configuration of Maven `check` goal and Ant `check` element now also supports percentage values (GitHub [#534](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/jacoco/jacoco/issues/534)). > * Manifests of JAR files now have `Automatic-Module-Name` for Java 9 (GitHub [#565](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/jacoco/jacoco/issues/565)). > * Maven aggregated reports will now also include modules of `runtime` and `provided` dependencies (GitHub [#498](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/jacoco/jacoco/issues/498), [#572](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/jacoco/jacoco/issues/572)). > > During creation of reports various compiler generated artifacts are filtered out, which otherwise require unnecessary and sometimes impossible tricks to not have partial or missed coverage: > > * Methods `valueOf` and `values` of enum types (GitHub [#491](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/jacoco/jacoco/issues/491)). > * Private empty no-argument constructors (GitHub [#529](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/jacoco/jacoco/issues/529)). > * Methods annotated with `[**lombok**](https://github.com/lombok).Generated` to better integrate with Lombok >= 1.16.14. Initial analysis and contribution by Rüdiger zu Dohna ([**t1**](https://github.com/t1)) (GitHub [#513](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/jacoco/jacoco/issues/513)). > * Methods annotated with `[**groovy**](https://github.com/groovy).transform.Generated` to better integrate with Groovy >= 2.5.0. Thanks to Andres Almiray ([**aalmiray**](https://github.com/aalmiray)) for adding the annotation to Groovy (GitHub [#610](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/jacoco/jacoco/issues/610)). > * Part of bytecode for `synchronized` blocks (GitHub [#501](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/jacoco/jacoco/issues/501)). > ... (truncated)

Implementation by Fabian Mastenbroek (GitHub [#707](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/jacoco/jacoco/issues/707)). > * Bytecode generated by Kotlin compiler for implicit `else` of `when` expressions that list all cases of `enum` or `sealed class` is filtered out during generation of report (GitHub [#721](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/jacoco/jacoco/issues/721), [#729](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/jacoco/jacoco/issues/729), [#749](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/jacoco/jacoco/issues/749)). > * Additional bytecode generated by Kotlin compiler for when expressions on `kotlin.String` values is filtered out during generation of report (GitHub [#737](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/jacoco/jacoco/issues/737), [#746](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/jacoco/jacoco/issues/746)). > * Classes and methods annotated with runtime visible and invisible annotation whose simple name is `Generated` are filtered out during generation of report (GitHub [#731](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/jacoco/jacoco/issues/731)). > * Maven goal report-aggregate now also considers dependencies specified using version range. Idea and implementation by Lukas Krejc (GitHub [#658](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/jacoco/jacoco/issues/658)). > > ## Fixed Bugs > > * Don't insert stackmap frames into class files with version < 1.6, this fixes regression which was introduced in version 0.6.5 (GitHub [#667](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/jacoco/jacoco/issues/667)). > * Question mark in filter expressions now correctly matches exactly one character (GitHub [#672](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/jacoco/jacoco/issues/672)). > * Part of bytecode that javac generates for `switch` statement on `java.lang.String` values with a small number cases is now correctly filtered out during generation of report (GitHub [#730](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/jacoco/jacoco/issues/730)). > > ## Non-functional Changes > > * JaCoCo now depends on ASM 6.2.1 (GitHub [#706](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/jacoco/jacoco/issues/706), [#725](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/jacoco/jacoco/issues/725)). > * Improved error message when already instrumented classes are used for instrumentation or analysis (GitHub [#703](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/jacoco/jacoco/issues/703)). > * JaCoCo build now requires at least Maven 3.3.9 and JDK 8 (GitHub [#711](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/jacoco/jacoco/issues/711)). > API Changes > * The XML report now has an optional attribute `sourcefilename` on the `class` element to allow unambiguously relate classes to source files. The JaCoCo DTD version has been updated to 1.1 (GitHub [#702](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/jacoco/jacoco/issues/702)). > > ## 0.8.1 > ## New Features > > * JaCoCo now supports Java 10 (GitHub [#629](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/jacoco/jacoco/issues/629)). > * Empty constructor without parameters in enum is filtered out during generation of report (GitHub [#649](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/jacoco/jacoco/issues/649)). > > ## 0.8.0 > ## New Features > > * JaCoCo now officially supports Java 9 (GitHub [#600](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/jacoco/jacoco/issues/600)). > * JaCoCo now comes with a simple command line interface (GitHub [#525](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/jacoco/jacoco/issues/525)). > * Limit configuration of Maven `check` goal and Ant `check` element now also supports percentage values (GitHub [#534](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/jacoco/jacoco/issues/534)). > * Manifests of JAR files now have `Automatic-Module-Name` for Java 9 (GitHub [#565](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/jacoco/jacoco/issues/565)). > * Maven aggregated reports will now also include modules of `runtime` and `provided` dependencies (GitHub [#498](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/jacoco/jacoco/issues/498), [#572](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/jacoco/jacoco/issues/572)). > > During creation of reports various compiler generated artifacts are filtered out, which otherwise require unnecessary and sometimes impossible tricks to not have partial or missed coverage: > > * Methods `valueOf` and `values` of enum types (GitHub [#491](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/jacoco/jacoco/issues/491)). > * Private empty no-argument constructors (GitHub [#529](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/jacoco/jacoco/issues/529)). > * Methods annotated with `[**lombok**](https://github.com/lombok).Generated` to better integrate with Lombok >= 1.16.14. Initial analysis and contribution by Rüdiger zu Dohna ([**t1**](https://github.com/t1)) (GitHub [#513](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/jacoco/jacoco/issues/513)). > * Methods annotated with `[**groovy**](https://github.com/groovy).transform.Generated` to better integrate with Groovy >= 2.5.0. Thanks to Andres Almiray ([**aalmiray**](https://github.com/aalmiray)) for adding the annotation to Groovy (GitHub [#610](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/jacoco/jacoco/issues/610)). > * Part of bytecode for `synchronized` blocks (GitHub [#501](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/jacoco/jacoco/issues/501)). > ... (truncated)

title: Fix upload filepicker footer view

(e.g. black on white background, white on blue background)

As this is needed for brander, and we want to release branded 3.3 version, this should be backported.

backport of #3025

title: Handling of conversation shares
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
In Nextcloud 14 there was a new share type introduced: `10`
https://github.com/nextcloud/server/blob/857bb4536628814cdae3591c795bb1e21e9704b7/lib/private/Share/Constants.php#L42

It would be nice if the shares are flagged as `displayname (conversation)` when listing all the shares, and when you also would allow to create such shares in the client. You can test this easily, by going to an instance with talk installed, create a conversation "Test room", go to the files app, open the share sidebar and try to share with "Test room". There should be a suggestion `Test room (conversation)`

title: Delete proguard
body:
As discussed in https://github.com/nextcloud/android-library/issues/160 proguard.cfg is not correctly working.
As we do not use it, this should be removed.

title: add own sso token manager with custom dialog
label: [Label(name="backport-request")]
body:
Fixes some issues related to the Android Account Manager. Uses a custom Auth-Dialog instead of the build-in authentication manager dialog.

Details: https://github.com/nextcloud/Android-SingleSignOn/issues/30

title: The "Device credentials" feature doesn't work with fingerprints
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
### Actual behaviour
- If the "Device credentials" lock feature is selectedif a device has both passphrase and fingerprint set to unlock, only the passphrase is working to unlock the app.

### Expected behaviour
- If the "Device credentials" lock feature is selectedif a device has both passphrase and fingerprint set to unlock, either of these should unlock the app.
 
### Steps to reproduce
1. Set up both encryption passphrase and fingerprint for unlocking
2. Set "Device credentials" in the NC app
3. Close then open the app and only the passphrase unlocks the app

Although the screen that requests the credentials has the fingerprint icon below the passphrase input area and if the sensor is touched this icon turns green but the password is asked again.
BTW for example AndOTP has this same feature and it works correctly with fingerprint too.

### Environment data
Android version:
8.1
Device model: 
Lenovo K6 power
Stock or customized system:
Lineage OS
Nextcloud app version:
3.3.0 RC2
Nextcloud server version:
14.0

title: Backport #3018: Server sends a HTTP-201 (not 200) for a newly created avatar on Nc14
body: HTTP-201 (CREATED) is actually the correct HTTP code since the resource has just been created and is part of the body/reply

title: menu action naming schema for client/server related file actions
label: [Label(name="enhancement"), Label(name="needs info/discussion")]
body:
For a detailed discussion please see https://help.nextcloud.com/t/how-to-set-a-folder-as-available-offline/36209

At the moment the client has several actions regarding files/folders that trigger downloads and syncs with the server like:
* folders: `sync` (which it seems just downloads a files within the folder)
* files: `download` (which simply downloads the file), `set available offline` (which downloads the file and keeps it in sync with the server)

* and then we have `auto upload` (which uploads new and changed files to the server but doesn't "sync" deletions and maybe/probably also shouldn't do that)

I haven't gotten any feedback regarding a use case for "download and not keep in sync" while one issue remains that at least from a user perspective `sync`and `download` more or less do the same thing with different names.

Any input and feedback is highly welcome @nextcloud/android @nextcloud/designers

title: Share dialog: user list not really visible
label: [Label(name="approved"), Label(name="bug"), Label(name="design")]
body:
- open image
- click on share/send
- open share dialog

![2018-09-12-074909](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5836855/45406350-7cb5aa80-b666-11e8-8942-44f29f6593ee.png)


--> User list is too narrow

@AndyScherzinger and me discussed to split this view into "user" and "link" via tabs (same like on file detail). Also height should be adjusted to have ~80% of visible space.
Then every tab has more space and it will also work better on landscape mode on mobile.

title: App (All versions)  crashes frequently if there are files/folders in the user folder root that are shared in chat
label: [Label(name="approved"), Label(name="bug"), Label(name="pr exists")]
body:
### Actual behaviour
- The app crashes randomly in most screens where there are files/folders. Started happening after server was upgraded to 14

The error seems to be 
```
android java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Empty values
at android.database.sqlite.SQLiteDatabase.updateWithOnConflict(SQLiteDatabase.java:1619)
```

### Expected behaviour
- It should not crash
 
### Steps to reproduce
1. Install app (Server NC 14)
2. log in
3. Watch it crash


### Environment data
Android version:
8.1.0
Device model: 
Lenovo K6
Stock or customized system:
Runs Lineage OS
Nextcloud app version:
All versions (Play Store 3.2.4, 3.3.0 RC2, FDroid 3.2.3, FDroid Dev)
Nextcloud server version:
14

title: Fix Avatar fetching for Nc14 server
body:
Fixes #3015 - server sends a HTTP-201 (not 200) for a newly created avatar on Nc14

HTTP-201 (CREATED) is actually the correct HTTP code since the resource has just been created and is part of the body/reply (in case no other client has requested the avatar with the requested solution)

Testing 3.3.0 on my device I realized that the avatars aren't showing up anymore at all (restarts don't change that) and afaik @tobiasKaminsky could also reproduce this with a fresh install on an emulator. title: [3.2.4/3.3.0RC] Sharing broken
label: [Label(name="bug"), Label(name="needs info/discussion")]
body:
When I share a file with an Nc user of the same instance (probably the same for any other kind of sharing) it fails with the corresponding snackbar while the share is actually created when checking the webUI.

The reason for this: The server for me Nc14 / for a user in the forum Nc 13 (https://help.nextcloud.com/t/sharing-not-possible-teilen-nicht-moglich/36636/6) is replying with the result code 35 with translates to the ordinal value `35`-> `SHARE_FORBIDDEN` and the mData value `Connection could not be established with host 127.0.0.1 [Connection refused #111]`. This might be a server (configuration issue) or a client side change to the interpretation of the server response, that I don't know :/

Android 7/8
Client 3.2.4 and latest master

![share](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1315170/45362339-d9688500-b5d4-11e8-92e3-cfa57456f330.png)

title: Store mnemonic as typed in
body:
Ref: https://github.com/nextcloud/android/pull/2381#issuecomment-399385582

We have to distinguish two cases:
- first setup e2e on user, then also currently the mnemonic is stored with withespaces
- setup client with existing e2e: this now stores the mnemonic as the user types it.

We cannot automagically split the words, but I guess it is ok if the user gets back what he/she typed in before.

Signed-off-by: tobiasKaminsky <tobias@kaminsky.me>

title: Codacy
body:
This yet another housekeeping PR which fixes several codacy warning categories, malicious findbugs warnings and some java compiler warnings:

* :mag: codacy: this statement should have braces
* :mag: codacy: a class which only has private constructors should be final
* :mag: codacy: position literals first in String comparisons for EqualsIgnoreCase
* :mag: codacy: replace with local variable
* :mag: codacy: combine nested if statements
* :mag: codacy: make utilities classes final with private constructor 
* :mag: codacy: avoid using Literals in Conditional Statements
* :bug: findbugs: malicious code vulnerability Warnings (4, missing file stream closing in finally block)

title: "dependencies" label do not need a pull approve
body:
As we discussed in one issue (I hope I recall it correctly), we want to merge new deps as soon as possible.
Therefore we added dependabot. If one of those PRs turn green, we can directly merge.
This PR should trigger pullapprove to ignore those PRs.

title: Use native Android file browser when uploading files within NC
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
When uploading files from within the NC app, it uses a custom file browser (screenshot 1). It would be much nicer if could use the standard file browser in Android (screenshot 2), because then the use can upload from different apps like Google Drive Dropbox, Google Photos etc. This dialog is most other apps use and it is something Android users are used too. 

This gives the user a much wider choice of files to upload, and much easier to find. I think this is way more important than the custom feature of whether to keep the original file or not after upload with the current file browser in NC.

![screenshot_20180908-095630](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/175286/45251891-3ef71000-b34e-11e8-9c68-2d110884b228.png)


![screenshot_20180908-100025](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/175286/45251888-39012f00-b34e-11e8-9903-63666f772b95.png)

title: Bump parceler from 1.1.9 to 1.1.11
label: [Label(name="dependencies")]
body:
Bumps [parceler](https://github.com/johncarl81/parceler) from 1.1.9 to 1.1.11.
Changelog *Sourced from [parceler's changelog](https://github.com/johncarl81/parceler/blob/master/CHANGELOG.adoc).* > == Release 1.1.11 (2018-06-28) > > Enhancements:: > * Added gradle specific incremental annotation processing. > > Bug Fixes:: > * Fixes issue with Parcels utility class classloader reference. > > == Release 1.1.10 (2018-12-30) > > Bug Fixes:: > * Fixes issue accessing collections with generics in separate packages via package helpers.

title: Bump glide from 3.7.0 to 4.8.0
label: [Label(name="dependencies")]
body:
Bumps [glide](https://github.com/bumptech/glide) from 3.7.0 to 4.8.0.
Release notes *Sourced from [glide's releases](https://github.com/bumptech/glide/releases).* > ## Glide 4.8.0 > ## Features > * Multiple `RequestListener`s can be added to a single request (93289994a4ba59c6251aad0ccdf332c0d758d9c7, thanks to Adrian) > * Added a safer version of Glide's base target methods that force callers to implement `onLoadCleared` and deprecated the unsafe versions. Failing to implement onLoadCleared in > a Target can lead to UIs displaying incorrect images, runtime exceptions, or various other [resource re-use errors](http://bumptech.github.io/glide/doc/resourcereuse.html#common-errors) (3a7060777d17fa4d9ca2b68b019fd2d448f54ea6, thanks to azlatin@). > > ## Bugs > * HEIF orientation is supported on O MR1 and higher via ExifInterface (a3f8114d015be983d365410fa0655de95fb80fef) > * Improved error message for network failures ([#2894](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/bumptech/glide/issues/2894), ff463d779ef8bccffc224e3647dbaf6dbc27fd57) > * Placeholder/error/fallback drawable and id variants now replace previous calls to the same method with the other variant. For example, placeholder(Drawable) will replace previous calls to .placeholder(R.id.xyz)(2dccb5c2fb265cbfa67b328cea30e922c67feb9e) > * Improved synchronization in ModelLoaderRegistry (62e6c11e6e4e4d0cf5f4c380219fe10129bb2694, thanks to [**jnlopar**](https://github.com/jnlopar)) > > ## Deprecations > * Deprecated `SimpleTarget` and `ViewTarget`, see the `CustomViewTarget` description in Features in these release notes for more detail. > > ## Behavior Changes > * Requests that are started with a paused RequestManager, usually in a paused Activity or Fragment, are immediately paused so that they display a placeholder instead of nothing (a55e935eba859b9ea4f6e4357b8ac4e7e4a8327f) > > ## Breaking Changes > * The deprecated `PREFER_ARGB_8888_DISALLOW_HARDWARE ` `DecodeFormat` has been removed. Use `RequestOptions#disallowHardwareConfig()` instead (7eb59f7f217adc7b0e017d586ea0814bf75c53d0) > * Remove `pause()` and `isPaused()` from the internal `Request` interface (9089752d2a4f4ccd6e7a6a7bbf7ea85db3f0949b) > * Glide now uses resource ids (in `CustomViewTarget`) and therefore can no longer be released as a straight jar. > > ## Build Changes > * Added support for androidx annotations (c3328fe63214c0aedefca3d5496bb222a2fd29ef, thanks to [**colinrtwhite**](https://github.com/colinrtwhite)) > * Updated to Android Gradle 3.1.3. > > > > ## Glide 4.7.0 > ## Features > * Added support for data Uris when they're provided as Uris (17c1c3d5781e953379904a60bae08524632e5053) > * Improved scrolling performance by optimizing some Glide internal calls (7664c826ef2a55c67a4b55fbe61e33203355f2ee, d7635bda9105dbeb27ed8a3fbda69832396960f5, 7ff3bdeed52d6047e8e9f879ccb3f67afe50fa2d, thanks to paulsowden@) > * Added support for downsampling in `VideoBitmapDecoder` (97d130d338349220cc8158141bbae1dfda496efe) > * Provide better default names for annotation generated classes (58bcf53681e8944add93c8680578fa7fdd617785, thanks to [**SUPERCILEX**](https://github.com/SUPERCILEX)) > > ## Bugs > * Improved handling of cancellation in `VolleyStreamFetcher` (a690f38859ebf5f4f06172060596842a35cc16d8) > * Improved handling of `TRIM_MEMORY_RUNNING_CRITICAL` (d939314e04b26709e7e890ba8f88494551111e23, thanks to [**ygnessin**](https://github.com/ygnessin)) > * Avoid delaying the first few requests started in Fragments or Activities by defaulting `RequestManagers` to started when the containing Activity or Fragment is started (7d1898e92600a6a2698d72e12ec26c6715fb8fc5) > * Fixed failures in annotation processor for classes with `_` in the package name (99723e3e7e14eecd908685da630d522e0e304b40, thanks to [**TWiStErRob**](https://github.com/TWiStErRob)) > * Obey themes when retrieving drawables when the appcompat support library is present (5212e953ff8fb0db390214eafb5a89b826884142, thanks to [**julianostarek**](https://github.com/julianostarek)) > * Fixed a bug that could cause loading another application's launcher icon to fail if the calling application's support library version didn't match exactly (f508d7cce947a8075806e088e798cfb6593647b0) > * Fixed a bug where a pixel was swapped in the output of `GifDecoder` (7fb8b1258a3aabbedad3b8d15f59c8091498160a, thanks to [**mtopolnik**](https://github.com/mtopolnik)) > > ## Behavior Changes > * VideoBitmapDecoder will now obey `DownsampleStrategy` (97d130d338349220cc8158141bbae1dfda496efe) > * Preload ahead the first page when using the `RecyclerView` or `ListView` preloader before the user scrolls for the first time (dd7fe186e0eb4ea2b17f8611317a2714b81ff03b, thanks to Anton111111) > > ## Breaking Changes > ... (truncated)
Commits - [`914996c`](https://github.com/bumptech/glide/commit/914996cac11108ec1a02c21a10af53ebc4980d7f) Bump version to 4.8.0 - [`a50a751`](https://github.com/bumptech/glide/commit/a50a7512ec7a99d4b3d8c1a2df9d8af48aa543cc) Update Android Gradle versions. - [`9c1652c`](https://github.com/bumptech/glide/commit/9c1652ca86e9015743153ade3e720a0009130875) Add InstrumentationRegistry to workaround Mockito/androidx incompatibility. - [`38cf861`](https://github.com/bumptech/glide/commit/38cf86168015f6dd4d9df370f74305a1bbc2dd1a) Add android dependencies to instrumentation. - [`0c73d1c`](https://github.com/bumptech/glide/commit/0c73d1c4c7dc483a38008b8d7ca0e5238ceaca6c) Fix various build issues. - [`d861c67`](https://github.com/bumptech/glide/commit/d861c67cbeffb4f0c6222f2c10ffe8d61736f524) Cleanup preparing for [] - [`62e6c11`](https://github.com/bumptech/glide/commit/62e6c11e6e4e4d0cf5f4c380219fe10129bb2694) A couple tweaks to ModelLoaderRegistry to improve potential contention. - [`229cb11`](https://github.com/bumptech/glide/commit/229cb11e2fd984939d9abde4071b858a1f24f6b6) [third_party] Avoid saving Robolectric shadow instances; instead, save the re... - [`c4b08d4`](https://github.com/bumptech/glide/commit/c4b08d4689b746c524c5e31cf723f8976a7173ac) Replace references to android.support.test with androidx.test. - [`3a70607`](https://github.com/bumptech/glide/commit/3a7060777d17fa4d9ca2b68b019fd2d448f54ea6) Create a CustomViewTarget to replace ViewTarget. - Additional commits viewable in [compare view](https://github.com/bumptech/glide/compare/v3.7.0...v4.8.0)

[![Dependabot compatibility score](https://api.dependabot.com/badges/compatibility_score?dependency-name=com.github.bumptech.glide:glide&package-manager=gradle&previous-version=3.7.0&new-version=4.8.0)](https://dependabot.com/compatibility-score.html?dependency-name=com.github.bumptech.glide:glide&package-manager=gradle&previous-version=3.7.0&new-version=4.8.0) Dependabot will resolve any conflicts with this PR as long as you don't alter it yourself. title: Bump gson from 2.8.2 to 2.8.5
label: [Label(name="dependencies")]
body:
Bumps [gson](https://github.com/google/gson) from 2.8.2 to 2.8.5.
Changelog *Sourced from [gson's changelog](https://github.com/google/gson/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md).* > ## Version 2.8.5 > _2018-05-21_ [GitHub Diff](https://github.com/google/gson/compare/gson-parent-2.8.4...gson-parent-2.8.5) > * Print Gson version while throwing AssertionError and IllegalArgumentException > * Moved `utils.VersionUtils` class to `internal.JavaVersion`. This is a potential backward incompatible change from 2.8.4 > * Fixed issue https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/google/gson/issues/1310 by supporting Debian Java 9 > > ## Version 2.8.4 > _2018-05-01_ [GitHub Diff](https://github.com/google/gson/compare/gson-parent-2.8.3...gson-parent-2.8.4) > * Added a new FieldNamingPolicy, `LOWER_CASE_WITH_DOTS` that mapps JSON name `someFieldName` to `some.field.name` > * Fixed issue https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/google/gson/issues/1305 by removing compile/runtime dependency on `sun.misc.Unsafe` > > ## Version 2.8.3 > _2018-04-27_ [GitHub Diff](https://github.com/google/gson/compare/gson-parent-2.8.2...gson-parent-2.8.3) > * Added a new API, `GsonBuilder.newBuilder()` that clones the current builder > * Preserving DateFormatter behavior on JDK 9 > * Numerous other bugfixes
Commits - [`f649e05`](https://github.com/google/gson/commit/f649e051411e092f0123878e16c5132500a2d01e) [maven-release-plugin] prepare release gson-parent-2.8.5 - [`4c685b2`](https://github.com/google/gson/commit/4c685b21a83b754abdf129f2efe9b9129aab8768) Private constructor ([#1324](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/google/gson/issues/1324)) - [`d84e26d`](https://github.com/google/gson/commit/d84e26d80c39e3b8e34c7e8bbef0ffb35e2947b5) Issue 1242: Printing Gson version when throwing AssertionError and IllegalArg... - [`1215841`](https://github.com/google/gson/commit/1215841e46f1e90d964d335acbc0d8c9aad43590) Merge pull request [#1281](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/google/gson/issues/1281) from greatjack1/master - [`3547420`](https://github.com/google/gson/commit/354742088597d78a14672c56325ddb66589f37ad) Merge branch 'master' into master - [`a6890bb`](https://github.com/google/gson/commit/a6890bbaba29fb1074388c06bf0c231f8e06b4f2) Fixed https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/google/gson/issues/1310 ([#1311](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/google/gson/issues/1311)) - [`57085d6`](https://github.com/google/gson/commit/57085d621242cdca665e94dbd880738c37b9490b) 2.8.4 README - [`f2dd56d`](https://github.com/google/gson/commit/f2dd56d98ce7d6ea0c0f7fe9f16be51b2ea26105) 2.8.4 changelog - [`f77615e`](https://github.com/google/gson/commit/f77615ecff5d5f4f5d3164ea64923840f982876f) 2.8.4 - [`d8857cd`](https://github.com/google/gson/commit/d8857cd615f5b040c479df72384b24af513741b7) updated release process to the current steps - Additional commits viewable in [compare view](https://github.com/google/gson/compare/gson-parent-2.8.2...gson-parent-2.8.5)

title: Bump annotations from 2.0.1 to 3.0.1u2
label: [Label(name="dependencies")]
body:
Bumps [annotations](https://github.com/findbugsproject/findbugs) from 2.0.1 to 3.0.1u2.
Release notes *Sourced from [annotations's releases](https://github.com/findbugsproject/findbugs/releases).* > ## Preview 2 for 3.1.0 branch supporting Java 9 > The tag is the second preview of findbugs 3.1.0 release containing support for Java 9 as runtime and target platform. > > ASM is the official ASM 6.0_ALPHA jar, built from version 1827 on branch ASM_6_FEATURE: > See http://mail.ow2.org/wws/arc/asm/2016-06/msg00005.html and > http://websvn.ow2.org/revision.php?repname=asm&path=%2F&rev=1827&peg=1827 > > BCEL6 is the officiaal BCEL 6.0 RC1, built from version 14039: > See http://mail-archives.apache.org/mod_mbox/commons-dev/201606.mbox/%3CCAB917R%2BmcbEarP5-ZBTDUTkt-xAwQCYagtmAbMqm3ub1KB5xDw%40mail.gmail.com%3E > > To update Eclipse plugin, download findbugs_3.1.0_preview2_update_site_3.1.0.20160619-68c6293.zip and use it as a local update site. > > ## Preview for 3.1.0 branch supporting Java 9 > The tag is needed to publish a snapshot of ASM 6 / BCEL6 as the first preview of findbugs 3.1.0 release containing support for Java 9 as runtime and target platform. > > ASM snapshot is built from version 1818 on branch ASM_6_FEATURE: > http://websvn.ow2.org/revision.php?repname=asm&path=%2F&rev=1818&peg=1818 > > BCEL6 snapshot is built from https://github.com/iloveeclipse/commons-bcel/commit/25dfa20fd99e4053e68b6054ff21f55fd915e003 > > To update Eclipse plugin, download update_site_3.1.0.20160609-91ad577.zip and use it as a local update site. > > ## 3.0.2 preview 2 with Eclipse 4.6 support > This is a second preview build of 3.0.2 Eclipse plugin with Eclipse 4.6 support. > > The `fb_3.0.2_preview2.zip` file is an Eclipse update site which can be used from Eclipse via `Help->Install New Software->Add...->Archive->...` to install FindBugs plugin into Eclipse. > > Alternative way to install the plugin is to put the `edu.umd.cs.findbugs.plugin.eclipse_3.0.2.20160306-90c514b.jar` to the `eclipse/dropins` folder. > > This build fixes FindBugs plugin incompatibilities introduced with Eclipse 4.6 (broken icons). > > ## 3.0.2 Eclipse plugin preview with Eclipse 4.6 support > This is a preview build of 3.0.2 Eclipse plugin with Eclipse 4.6 support. > > The `fb_3.0.2_preview.zip` file is an Eclipse update site which can be used from Eclipse via `Help->Install New Software->Add...->Archive->...` to install FindBugs plugin into Eclipse. > > This build fixes FindBugs plugin incompatibilities introduced with Eclipse 4.6 (broken icons).
Commits - See full diff in [compare view](https://github.com/findbugsproject/findbugs/commits)

You can trigger Dependabot actions by commenting on this PR: - `@dependabot rebase` will rebase this PR - `@dependabot merge` will merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot cancel merge` will cancel a previously requested merge - `@dependabot reopen` will reopen this PR if it is closed - `@dependabot ignore this [patch|minor|major] version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this minor/major version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this dependency` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this dependency (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot use these labels` will set the current labels as the default for future PRs for this repo and language - `@dependabot use these reviewers` will set the current reviewers as the default for future PRs for this repo and language - `@dependabot use these assignees` will set the current assignees as the default for future PRs for this repo and language - `@dependabot use this milestone` will set the current milestone as the default for future PRs for this repo and language - `@dependabot badge me` will comment on this PR with code to add a "Dependabot enabled" badge to your readme Additionally, you can set the following in your Dependabot [dashboard](https://app.dependabot.com): - Update frequency (including time of day and day of week) - Automerge options (never/patch/minor, and dev/runtime dependencies) - Pull request limits (per update run and/or open at any time) - Out-of-range updates (receive only lockfile updates, if desired) - Security updates (receive only security updates, if desired) Finally, you can contact us by mentioning @dependabot.

title: Bump libs
body:
* juniversalchardet v2.0.0->2.1.0
* parceler 1.1.9->1.1.11
* screengrab 1.0.0->1.2.0

title: Bump to 3.3.0 RC2
body: Signed-off-by: tobiasKaminsky <tobias@kaminsky.me>

title: Backport #2980: prevent NPE on media stream
body:
backport #2980
Signed-off-by: tobiasKaminsky <tobias@kaminsky.me>

title: Backport #2982: add provider Exception
body:
backport #2982
Signed-off-by: tobiasKaminsky <tobias@kaminsky.me>

title: File picker icon size
body:
Hey guys,

this solves #2526.

I added a "Large Preview" section to upload options menu.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22942381/45219964-ecb1e280-b2ac-11e8-873a-29a707bf36e4.png)

On click you end up with a two column grid with larger thumbnails

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22942381/45220104-65b13a00-b2ad-11e8-9d24-2bea033d0274.png)

Let me know what you think.

title: Add provider Exception
body:
Fix #2977 

Signed-off-by: tobiasKaminsky <tobias@kaminsky.me>

title: Launcher actions
label: [Label(name="enhancement"), Label(name="needs info/discussion")]
body:
With newest android versions we can support launcher actions, when long pressing on the icon.

This is an issue to brainstorm, what kind of actions are useful to implement

(Idea by @AndyScherzinger in #1115)

title: Prevent NPE on media stream
body:
- fix typo
- if load stream url takes too long, media player is already destroyed, so a NPE on file can occur -> this does not fix streaming, but only prevent app from crashing


Signed-off-by: tobiasKaminsky <tobias@kaminsky.me>

title: Auto Upload does not work
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
### Actual behaviour
- Tell us what happens
After setting up the auto upload folder on my android device (upload on wifi) files do not sync. This is true when the selected folder is either on the phone itself or the SD card

### Expected behaviour
-  Pictures and other data in the folder should sync
 
### Steps to reproduce
1. Enable syncing for folder (in my case, DCIM/Camera)
2. Take pictures or fill up folder with content
3. observe nothing being uploaded


### Environment data
Android version:
8.0.0
Device model: 
Samsung Galaxy S8
Stock or customized system:
Stock
Nextcloud app version:
3.2.4
Nextcloud server version:
Nextcloud 13

### Logs

``` will do later, not near server
Insert your webserver log here
```

title: [3.3.0] Nullable check on exit mode
body:
Fixes #2970
Backport of #2974

title: Autoupload options missing when uploading elsewhere
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
### Actual behaviour
Currently, when a number of files are uploaded to NC by Androids share function, it lets you choose which folder to upload them to, and that's it. Meanwhile, autoupload gives some highly useful options such as automatically separating via folder and deleting the files afterwards. These don't exist when uploading manually.

### Expected behaviour
The same options that are available in autoupload (auomatic subfolders, deleting the file afterwards etc) should be available, regardless of which method is used to upload.
 
### Steps to reproduce
1. Select a ton of photos to upload (because upload pre-existing photos still doesn't work)
2. Choose "share" > Nextcloud > NC Folder
3. Have to manually choose separate folders for each photo and manually check which photos were uploaded and manually delete each one instead of having the app do it for you.

title: Nullable check on exit mode
body:
Fix #2970 

Signed-off-by: tobiasKaminsky <tobias@kaminsky.me>

title: Support gplay/free also for versionDev
label: [Label(name="1. developing")]
body:
These changes lead to a 2x2 matrix:
mode: generic, versionDev
google: free, gplay

gradle will build then all 4 variants out of it, eg. genericFree, genericGplay.
It can also build for each 4 variants a debug/release version, leading to max 8 different apks.

I am not satisfied with the naming…

This then will also need some testing for fdroid/metadata and additional changes of build targets, ….

Signed-off-by: tobiasKaminsky <tobias@kaminsky.me>

title: Do not block on check for dev version
body:
Previously we/I used a blocking call, so that UI hung until network call was finished.

This affects only manually installed dev version, as fdroid does not have this switch enabled.

Signed-off-by: tobiasKaminsky <tobias@kaminsky.me>

title: Fix Timsort (again)
body:
Fix #2946 

- change long to bigInteger
- add another test

Some files may have a very big numerical part. Previously we used long for parsing this number, but this can lead to a NumberFormatException, when we then compared the strings. This wrong handling lead to TimSort error.

The correct way is to use BigInteger, which have no real max value, but are only limited by space/memory.

I also removed the catch clause as this lead to a wrong comparison. It is better to have a crash with a meaningful error, than to hide the error by a strange TimSort error…

Signed-off-by: tobiasKaminsky <tobias@kaminsky.me>

title: download of any file not working, crashes dev version.
label: [Label(name="bug"), Label(name="pr exists")]
body:
### Actual behaviour
Trying to sync files, app tries to download files, stable version fails. Dev version crashes immediately.
I see in the webserver log an attempt to access a webdav file, if I copy/paste the webdav url in a browser, the file gets downloaded without a problem..


### Expected behaviour
App downloads files onto phone's fs.

### Nota Bene
Download/sync used to work a couple of months ago. Changes since then include ubuntu upgrade to 18.04, nc server upgrade to 13.05 and 13.06, app update to 3.2.3.
I cannot pinpoint exactly when this behavior started. But my gut says it is a change in the android file permissions scheme, as ghost commander too is unable to touch any file besides the ones in the download folder.

Now, the app seems to not be able to touch files on the fs. Once sync used to work, I had a bunch of files on my phone's fs. Now, when I delete some of these files in the app, they're still on the fs. Double checked app permissions, has storage read/write permissions.
 
### Steps to reproduce
Install a fresh nc app,
Connect to server,
In app, select a directory you want to sync, tell it to sync,
app 3.2.3 shows notification "downloading file ...", but stays at 0%
Dev version 20180829 crashes immediately when I want so sync a dir.


### Environment data
Android version:
8.1.0
Device model: 
wileyfox swift 2
Stock or customized system:
stock
Nextcloud app version:
3.2.3 and dev version 20180829
Nextcloud server version:
13.0.6

### Logs
Will post logs if necessary.

title: bump to 3.2.4
body:
There is no code change from 3.2.3 -> 3.2.4 except of the version number as the missing push notification came from a wrong build chain.

Resolves #2931

Signed-off-by: tobiasKaminsky <tobias@kaminsky.me>

title: Upload not working in stable; working in dev
body:
### Actual behaviour
- Nextcloud is installed on my server, behind Cloudflare. Starting around a month ago, photos stopped uploading. I cannot manually upload either.

### Expected behaviour
- Images should be uploaded
 
### Steps to reproduce
1. Take a picture while in Wi-Fi range
2. Attempt to upload the picture
3. Fail


### Environment data
Android version: 8.0.0

Device model: Asus Zenfone 3, Samsung Galaxy S8

Stock or customized system: Stock

Nextcloud app version: 3.2.3 (does not work) - 20180825 works

Nextcloud server version: 13.0.6

### Logs

title: Use hashed/salted token
body:
@David-Development I created this as a different PR, based on #1116, so that this is easier to review.

As discussed, this generates a new token on each AuthToken call, returns the token in cleartext and stores it hashed in its own database for more security.
On each call, the 3rd party app has to send the cleartext token and files app will hash and compare it.

Signed-off-by: tobiasKaminsky <tobias@kaminsky.me>

title: Can't edit text files with external app
label: [Label(name="bug"), Label(name="needs info/discussion")]
body:
Since Dropbox is effectively [shutting down Linux ](https://linux.slashdot.org/story/18/08/10/2120248/dropbox-is-dropping-support-for-all-linux-file-systems-except-unencrypted-ext4) support, I'm now one of the Dropbox2Nextcloud migrating users.

My main use case with Dropbox has been for years and years to view and edit `.txt` files on shared between my laptop and my mobile phone. Unfortunately this use case it not working for me with Nextcloud Android.



### Actual behavior
External text editors can't open or save a `.txt` file from Nextcloud.  I've tried these following text editor which all works fine with editing text files from Dropbox with. See attached Screenshots at the end of this issue.


* [Quoda](https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.henrythompson.quoda)
   * Shows a blank file.
* [TED](https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=fr.xgouchet.texteditor)
   * Shows error message 
* SE Text Editor ([Solid Explorer](https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=pl.solidexplorer2&hl=en))
   * The file contents is actually loaded, but saving changes gives errors. 




### Expected behavior
Opening `.txt` files with external text editor apps should work. It should be possible to open them for reading and editing. When saving from external app, Nextcloud should upload the changes (Like Dropbox works) 

 
### Steps to reproduce
1.  Pick a `.txt` in Nextcloud android app which has content inside. 
2. Select "Open With" 
3. Select a text editor 
4. Error opening & saving file from external app.




### Environment data
Android version: 6.0.1

Device model: Oneplus 2

Stock or customized system: Stock

Nextcloud app version: 3.2.3

Nextcloud server version: 13.0.5




# Screenshots

![quoda](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/175286/44958267-1e5a3080-aede-11e8-8daa-779360ed8abd.png)

![ted](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/175286/44958215-50b75e00-aedd-11e8-869f-f48e95cd3500.png?s=200)


![se_editor](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/175286/44958311-db4c8d00-aede-11e8-9fe3-48a233eb4eef.png)

title: Drop Android 4.0.x support for app release 3.4.0
label: [Label(name="enhancement"), Label(name="needs info/discussion")]

I'd like to slowly but steadily remove support for (very) old Android versions and would like to start with dropping 4.0.x making 4.1 the minimum version (baby steps). Looking at the numbers the app lost 16% of the total 4.0.x active installations dropping down to 161 devices, so I think we are safe to remove the support after 3.3.x which would then be the last feature release which is the first one to support Nc14 features.

Here is the actual 4.0.x active installations graph for the last month:

title: Sort Deleted files by "Deletion date" by default
label: [Label(name="design"), Label(name="enhancement"), Label(name="pr exists")]
body:
### Actual behaviour
- Deleted files are sorted alphabetically by default, which is quite confusing.

### Expected behaviour
- Because you are likely to want to restore files which you recently deleted, they should be sorted like that.
 
_Not_ by "Newest first" but by "Recently deleted". :) Also, this should happen regardless of what you set by default on your main file view, as "Recently deleted" makes most sense for deleted files. Of course unless people change that sort option – then it should be remembered (for Deleted files only).

### Expected behaviour

### Steps to reproduce
1. Hard to say how. But setting up a large instance with LDAP backend (>1000 users)
2. Try to share a file with someone who is definitely in the correct LDAP group and has access to Nextcloud instance.

title: Further codacy fixes
body:
*  codacy: don't create same object in a loop
*  codacy: don't assign null
*  codacy: remove useless parentheses
* codacy: avoid declaring a variable if it is unreferenced before a possible exit point
* codacy: avoid using redundant field initializer
* codacy: replace literals with constants
* codacy: using varargs for methods or constructors which take an array the last parameter
* codacy: all methods are static. Consider using a utility class instead.

title: How to configure Proguard for Android Client library
body:
I’m using the Nextcloud Android library to add Nextcloud support to an android app using Android Studio. I’m having trouble configuring Proguard. When I run with minifyEnabled false all is fine, but with minifyEnabled true I get lots of Proguard related warnings and error. For example:

com.owncloud.android.lib.common.ExternalLink$$Parcelable: can’t find superclass or interface org.parceler.ParcelWrapper

library class org.apache.commons.codec.binary.BinaryCodec extends or implements program class org.apache.commons.codec.BinaryDecoder

org.apache.jackrabbit.webdav.server.AbstractWebdavServlet: can’t find referenced method ‘int getContentLength()’ in program class org.apache.jackrabbit.webdav.WebdavRequest

I can run with disabling the warings , for example
-dontwarn com.owncloud.android.lib.**
etc.
But then the app crashes as soon as a client completes.

I have tried copying the Proguard.cfg settings from the Nextcloud client app on Github, but that does not make a difference.

Any idea how to configure Proguard to make this work?

Android version:
Android 8.0

Device model: 
Huawei SHT-W09, but happens on any model, it's compiling problem.

title: fix android 4.x
body:
In theory 4.x should work with xml vector drawables instead of png files as gradle should automatically generate them, when 
```
vectorDrawables.useSupportLibrary = true
``` 
is enabled.
In reality, this crashes 4.x
So this uses real images instead of vector drawables.
Once we drop 4.x support, we can replace images by vectors.

As this is a hotfix, I'll release right now.

Signed-off-by: tobiasKaminsky <tobias@kaminsky.me>

title: Use capability to check if activity app is enabled
body:
This uses capability to check if activity app is enabled and if not remove it from drawer.

Only problem is, that right after adding an new account, we do not have capability in place and thus we do not know if activity app is enabled.
So what to do? Show the menu entry and maybe later hide it?
(on Trashbin this is the same problem, there I chose to hide it first, and then show it if it is supported).

title: NextCloud remains in "powersave" mode while being whitelisted with Power Manager on Samsung S7
label: [Label(name="AutoUpload"), Label(name="approved"), Label(name="bug")]
body:
### Actual behaviour
Nextcloud app was added to "Unmonitored Apps" and in "Optimise Battery Usage" the app is listed with a gray button (=should be ignored). Power saving mode is on (permanently).

New files do not seem to be detected, "force rescan" needed to detect new file. Upload queue items (created through a forced rescan) remain in "Waiting to exit power save mode" even when (creating a new file while) charging. 

This might be due to PowerUtils.java only containing a check for PowerManager.isPowerSaveMode without checking if PowerManager.isIgnoringBatteryOptimizations is true. I'm not an Android developer, I only googled around a bit.

### Expected behaviour
If the Nextcloud app is whitelisted it should upload while power saving mode is on.
 
### Steps to reproduce
1. Get a Samsung S7 (only have this device, sorry !)
2. Enable Power Saving mode: go to "Battery" -> Set "Power Saving Mode" to MID (customised; ensure at least "Background network usage" is enabled, rest can all be off)
3. Whitelist attempt 1: go to "Battery" -> "Unmonitored apps", add "Nextcloud"
4. Whitelist attempt 2: go to "Battery" -> "Battery Usage" -> 3 dots -> "Optimise Battery Usage"; ensure "All Apps" are shown; Disable button next to "Nextcloud"
5. Open Nextcloud (with expert mode on and Screenshot folder autoupload enabled) -> "Uploads", Take screenshot => nothing happens
6. "Force Rescan" => screenshot will appear in queue with "Waiting to exit power save mode"
7. Put phone in charger, new screenshot, Force Rescan => same result as 6.
8. Disable Power Saving mode => Uploads are processed and finish successfully


### Environment data
Android version: 8.0.0 (Samsung Experience 9.0)

Device model: SM-G935F

Stock or customized system: Stock

Nextcloud app version: 3.2.1

Nextcloud server version: 13.0.5

### Logs
#### Web server error log
I didn't attach this as I believe it's purely on the Android side.

#### Nextcloud log (data/nextcloud.log)
```
I didn't attach this as I believe it's purely on the Android side.
```

title: ADD: [instantupload] setting to also upload existing files
label: [Label(name="1. developing")]
body:
Please be kind, first time I put my nose into the code.

This adds a setting to the instant uploads to also upload files already present on the device at the time instant upload is setup.
Ref: https://help.nextcloud.com/t/why-doesnt-android-client-upload-existing-pictures/10365

95% of the PR is for handling of the setting itself.
It might be worth wondering whether this deserves a setting at all, really, ie whether *not* uploading existing files is worthwhile, as it's a bit counter-intuitive, imo

title: Fix npe during files sync
body:
While debugging S9+ I found that the FilesSyncJob sometimes fails, if the date cannot be extracted from Exif (file not found, unparseable, …).
This then leads to killing the whole job, so only those files get uploaded until the crash is reached.

title: Replace image caching system with Glide 4
label: [Label(name="2. to review")]
body:
This replaces our old image caching system with Glide 4.
I first updated Glide 3 to 4 and then replaced our old system step by step.
Unfortunately it was not really possible to have this in smaller steps :-(

Info:
- cache defaults to 250mb (by glide) http://bumptech.github.io/glide/doc/configuration.html#disk-cache
- removing of column (FILE_UPDATE_THUMBNAIL) is not working on sqlite on android, but this will not created on new installations anylonger

TODO:
- [x] video play icon overlay: on grid view bigger @AndyScherzinger maybe you have a nice idea?
- [ ] video without generated thumbnail also has "play button", which then overlays the dummy thumbnail, @AndyScherzinger maybe?
-  [ ] external links: 
	- not parsed correctly with svg, image is too small. But this is working correctly on activity stream, so this must be a problem with MenuItem

After finishing, I will squash and rebase.

### Actual behaviour
- files are on phone (available offline, because the intention was to use them in remote areas where there is no internet, or I cannot access my nextcloud server)
- click on such a file (in my case a pdf with some chinese stuff) - a modal window opens which says: "Fetching most recent version of the file"
- and then nothing happens...

### Expected behaviour
- It should be possible to open the such local files again.  

### Steps to reproduce
1.  Disable wifi, and sim card internet should also not avaiable
2.  see actual behaviour



### Environment data
Android version: 6.0

Device model: mediatek china grumpel

Stock or customized system: customized, rooted + afwalled 

Nextcloud app version: from FDROID 20180726

Nextcloud server version: 13.0.5

title: Open files in new task
label: [Label(name="enhancement"), Label(name="pr exists")]
body:
### Actual behaviour
Resuming Nextcloud opens into the last app used if a file was opened from Nextcloud.

### Expected behaviour
When opening a file, in my opinion the app used to open the file should be opened in its own task so that when resuming Nextcloud later on, you actually launch into the Nextcloud app itself instead of opening the last used app, which can be pretty confusing.
 
### Steps to reproduce
1. Open Nextcloud from the app drawer
2. Open a keepass .kdbx file using Keepass and unlock the database
3. Lock the database and return to the home screen (not using the back button to navigate back into the Nextcloud app)
4. Open Nextcloud from the app drawer to be taken to the Keepass login dialog

### Environment data
Android version: 8.1

Stock or customized system:

Nextcloud app version: 3.2.1

Nextcloud server version: 13.0.5

title: add redirect info to external link
body:

Latest external app allows to choose if external site can be embedded or not, so this reflects the setting:

Signed-off-by: tobiasKaminsky <tobias@kaminsky.me>

title: Apply auto upload changes to the upload queue
label: [Label(name="AutoUpload"), Label(name="bug")]
body:
### Actual behaviour
When changing the auto upload to upload not only on unlimited wifi, the existing files in the upload queue do not upload. Not even tapping the files in the queue can force an upload.

### Expected behaviour
The existing files in the upload queue should upload on any connection when I change the auto upload settings. This is necessary because I am suddenly forced to use a mobile hotspot for wifi (my tablet with a sim card that has unlimited data, yet is not recognized by the app as unlimited), and now some of my uploads are stuck in the queue.

Is there any way for me to fix this?
 
### Steps to reproduce
1. Switch from wifi to a mobile hotspot or to mobile data
2. Take pictures that are added to the upload queue by auto upload
3. Change the settings to upload files even when not on an unlimited connection


### Environment data
Android version:
LineageOS 14.1 (Android 7.1.2)
Nextcloud app version:
3.2.1 (appears to be the newest from Google Play)

Update: I solved my specific problem (WiFi hotspot that was not recognized as unmetered) by going to "Data usage" in the settings, then "Network restrictions", then marking my WiFi hotspot as unlimited connection. However, this would not have worked with a mobile data connection.

Hence, it would be nice to be able to manually force an upload, even on a connection with limited data.

title: Clear file selection after performing various multi file selection actions - fix#2859
body:
As described in issue #2859, the selection was not deselected after performing copy/move/download/sync/set-available-offline for multiple files in selection mode.

This PR implements changes so we exit the selection mode after performing these actions, in addition to the afore mentioned actions the unset-available-offline action now also exits the selection mode.

Resolves #2859

Edit:
There is one more commit incoming for this PR.'

Edit2:
I noticed that deleting files locally did not clear the selection, the latest commit addresses this.

title: Fix findbugs
body:
* replace int based for-loops
* literal string comparisons passing the literal as an argument
* fix trims a String temporarily
* use isEmpty() to check for empty collection instead of size <= 0
* remove unused parameters
* remove locally saving values right before returning them

title: AutoUpload does not work on all folders
label: [Label(name="AutoUpload"), Label(name="bug")]
body:
### Actual behaviour
- Some folders sync successfully using the AutoUpload feature (confirmed setup)
- Images from [seek thermal camera](https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.tyriansystems.SeekThermal) are not automatically uploaded.
- The files do not pop up in the upload section of the app, thus they seem not be detected.
- The folder is marked for auto upload but all check boxers are disabled to avoid side effects.

### Expected behaviour
- Some time after the images have been taken they are queued for upload. Further steps depend on state (WiFi?, Error during upload etc).
 
### Steps to reproduce
1. Take an image and wait a few minutes/hours. No upload will be tried.

Unfortunately there is no log of the app (is there?) as far as I saw. Further a manual sync from android settings seems not to help. Same when I click on rescan in the app in expert mode.

Adding a text file in the folder to be uploaded using another app (ES file explorer) also did not make the app start syncing anything.

### Environment data
Android version: 6.0

Device model: Ulefone Power

Stock or customized system: Stock

Nextcloud app version: 3.2.1

Nextcloud server version: 13.0.4

### Logs
No server side logs are provided as the problem is purely inside the app.

title: StringIndexOutOfBoundsException in OCFile.getLocalId
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
via GPlay for v3.2.1:
```
java.lang.StringIndexOutOfBoundsException: 
  at java.lang.String.substring (String.java:1971)
  at com.owncloud.android.datamodel.OCFile.getLocalId (OCFile.java:744)
  at com.owncloud.android.ui.fragment.FileDetailActivitiesFragment.lambda$fetchAndSetData$4$FileDetailActivitiesFragment (FileDetailActivitiesFragment.java:230)
  at com.owncloud.android.ui.fragment.FileDetailActivitiesFragment$$Lambda$2.run (Unknown Source:14)
  at java.lang.Thread.run (Thread.java:764)
```

The code fragment(s):
```
GetRemoteActivitiesOperation getRemoteNotificationOperation = 
        new GetRemoteActivitiesOperation(file.getLocalId());
```
and
```
public String getLocalId() {
        return getRemoteId().substring(0, 8).replaceAll("^0*", "");
}
```

Which means the remote ID isn't `null` but shorter than 8 characters and likely length zero... 

I know @tobiasKaminsky will argue that we need to find out _why_ it is not set I actually don't care about that too much. The client crashes so even without knowing the root cause of this we should harden the client and simply not fetch the activities if we don't have a remoteId of >=8 characters.

Nevertheless whoever has the time _and_ an idea on how to find out as to why this situation happens, feel free to join forces :)

cc @ardevd @mario

title: Improve TalkBack screenreader support
body:
Resolves #2780

- [x] Top left menu button just reads out "Open" – should be "Open sidebar"
- [x] The "+" menu FAB is spoken as "unlabeled button", should be "Add or upload"
- [x] In the file list, "thumbnail" is spoken, shouldn't be
- [x] In the file list, "more icon menu" should be simply "More menu"
- [x] The content descriptions currently are quite visual. For example "fingerprint icon", "shared icon" or "activity icon". I would like to suggest to strip the "icon" in this case.
- [x] In the file list, the content description (currently "shared icon") should indicate whether a file or folder is currently shared. In case the item is not shared, the content description should be "share", if the item is shared, it should be "shared".

title: Upload fails with SSL error
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
### Actual behaviour
- I want to upload files (pictures) with my android mobile app (manuel or auto upload). 
- Iploads fails after some files with an SSL initialisation error on app side.
- Powersaving modes in android are deactiviated, mobile phone is not used during upload
- I have to restart all files manually in the app
- For 40 files I need about 4-5 retries to get all files uploaded

### Expected behaviour
- Upload all files without needing to restart
 
### Steps to reproduce
1. Take pictures > 10
2. Use auto upload
3. Do nothing with mobile phone
4. upload failes after 5-10 minutes

Android version: Android 8.0.0

title: AutoUpload stuck on "Waiting for Wifi" when using VPN
label: [Label(name="AutoUpload"), Label(name="bug")]
body:
Actual behaviour: When VPN is active, and Nextcloud app is set to "Upload photos on unmetered Wifi", and (unmetered) wifi is connected, files fail to upload. They remain queued "waiting for wifi". 

Expected behaviour: files should upload when unmetered wifi is connected

Steps to reproduce
1. Set photos to AutoUpload when unmetered wifi is available
2. Activate VPN. In my particular case, I use DNS66, which provides ad-blocking without root. It does so by routing all traffic via its own internal DNS-server, blocking known ad-domains. It is able to do so by posing as a VPN to the OS.
3. Photos will not upload, but will remain queued "waiting for wifi" forever, until
  - either the VPN service is disconnected/switched off -- at that point, NEW photos will auto-upload as expected;
  - or: the Nextcloud app is allowed to bypass the VPN (in my case, DNS66 has an app exclusion list). In this case too, new photos will auto-upload as expected
 
Environment data: Nokia 7 plus, stock Android 8.1 (July update), unrooted. 
DNS66 installed and running as VPN service.
Newest Nextcloud beta app. Nextcloud server 13.0.4 (other Android clients not using VPN upload to this server without issues)

I should add that I started having this problem about two months ago. I have been using DNS66 for much longer. It appears that Autoupload used to work correctly via VPN in previous Nextcloud app versions, but stopped working due to some recent changes.

title: Found via strictMode: missing close
body:
Missing close on cursor, thus leads to memory leak

Signed-off-by: tobiasKaminsky <tobias@kaminsky.me>

title: One folder refuses to sync
label: [Label(name="AutoUpload"), Label(name="bug")]
body:
I'm having a constant problem with one of my folders not syncing to the server. It's my main photos folder which contains both stills and video files. If I change what folder on the server to sync to, nothing happens. If I move or copy the file to another local folder on my phone, that file will sync, with what ever folder on the server I assign it to.

I tried to duplicate the problem on my Android tablet, but the pics sync appropriately. 

I've uninstalled and reinstalled the app to no avail. 

I'm stumped.

Using Galaxy S9 plus on Verizon, running 3.2.1.

title: Wording on dialog actions
label: [Label(name="design"), Label(name="enhancement"), Label(name="good first issue")]
body:
Instead of generic words like "OK", "Yes" and "No" on dialogs, we should use specific action words:
- For deletion, the actions should be: "Delete", "Delete locally" (or something shorter?) and "Keep"
- For folder creation, it should be: "Create" and "Cancel"

![2018-07-19-143143](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5836855/42942548-8acb30f8-8b60-11e8-8deb-04af6f556515.png) ![2018-07-19-143153](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5836855/42942549-8ae5ed12-8b60-11e8-93d6-ed00446dd14f.png)
(Yes I took these screenshots from [your issue comment](https://github.com/nextcloud/android/issues/2835#issuecomment-406260398) @tobiasKaminsky ;)

title: Button style and layout
label: [Label(name="design"), Label(name="enhancement"), Label(name="needs info/discussion")]
body:
From the [Material buttons](https://material.io/design/components/buttons.html#hierarchy-placement) page, this fits our case nicest:
- The primary button is filled and the secondary button only outlined (not grey) because it is less important.
- Both are right-aligned and the primary action is on the right, just like we do in the web interface for notifications for example.
![](https://material.io/design/assets/1irg4ghZHzb5pR6oCgOYhwk2kyvd0Wy9w/buttons-layout-do-outlined.png)

(Copied over from discussion at https://github.com/nextcloud/android/pull/2778#issuecomment-406193365)

title: Auto upload doesn't work
label: [Label(name="AutoUpload"), Label(name="bug")]
body:
### Actual behaviour
- When I add or enable a folder in the auto upload list, nothing gets uploaded. In this case, I have a bunch of .md files with notes which I want to be automatically uploaded to the folder 'Notes' in my Nextcloud. They do not get uploaded and no error is shown.

### Expected behaviour
- Files should be uploaded/synchronized
 
### Steps to reproduce
1. Set up a folder to automatically upload in the android client


### Environment data
Android version: 7.1.2

Device model: Sony Z1 Compact

Stock or customized system: AICP Android (based on LineageOS)

Nextcloud app version: 3.2.1

Nextcloud server version: 13.0.4

title: Not possible to update password or remove account?
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
### My story

My Nextcloud password (via LDAP) changed (it does so regularly, and so should yours).

Now the app cannot access the cloud anymore (makes sense).

### Issue

* It is not possible to change the password the app is using
* It is not possible to remove an account from the app

title: Show offline info
body:
Basically its "Show offline info #2805" which has been merged against the wrong branch (this one).

Thus merging directly after build turns green

title: dialog: Removed unused RemoveFileDialogFragment class.
body: The dialog class is never used.

title: activity: Automatically enter newly created folders.
body:
If a new folder is successfully created, we enter it by passing the remote path returned by the remote operation to `getListOfFilesFragment().onItemClicked()`.

This closes #2572

title: Capabilities are queried too often
body:
Before every time a new activity was created, the capabilities were queried.
We have this still, when 
- refreshing the root folder
- changing account (as we reload the app with different account and start with root folder --> point 1)

Signed-off-by: tobiasKaminsky <tobias@kaminsky.me>

title: very slow opening apps when using local copy only
label: [Label(name="bug"), Label(name="high")]
body:
I'm often without internet access.  For those cases, I have files tagged as available offline.

When I do end up offline, I get a message/prompt, stating that the app must make use of its local copy.  I'm sorry I don't have the message right now, but it is along the lines of "can't fetch newest version, using local copy".

Up until this point, all is fine.

However -- it now takes around 30+ seconds, maybe even a minute to open the file.  It's all nextcloud here, since I know immediately when the file is to be opened -- I have no defaults set, and it prompts for what app to use to open (for example) a PDF or JPG.

I don't know why the delay exists, but Nextcloud android app should, once it knows it is opening the local copy only, immediately do so.  Not pause for 30 seconds, 1 minute.
 
I've seen some other reports, with similar issues -- but, none of them refer to the app *knowing* it is offline, saying it will open the local copy, then pausing for a minute to do so....

title: Android 9 High Batteryuseage
label: [Label(name="bug"), Label(name="needs info/discussion")]
body:
Hello,

On Android 9, When the App is running in Background, the Batteryuseage is top much. Yesterday for me 37% in 18 Hours.
![screenshot_20180714-055049](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3295104/42720594-e34c5d0a-8729-11e8-9b9d-8ed43056d342.png)

title: Feature request : add ability to remotely log out (i.e revoke) a specific session within the mobile app
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
Hi,

on desktop, through the WebUI, I'm able to remotely log out any session (i.e. revoke a selected session)

I'd like to have such a feature in the android app : be able to revoke a _specific_ session (i.e. remotely log out a specific session in any browser).

**Use case :** 
I opened a session at work (I dont take my pro computer home). 
I forget to log out. 
While going home (long trip in train), within the app, I can kill this session (and not forget to do it later from home through the WebUI ... or avoid logging from the android browser device to do so).
By being able to select the specific session I want to kill, when I arrive home, my personal computer is still logged in and I dont need to bother logging in again (which I would have had to do if the feature had logged every session out)

Thanks
GLLM

title: Add push values to setup.xml
body:
Fix #2824 

As discussed in https://github.com/nextcloud/android/pull/2618, this changes the way we provide our push values:
- they are now in gplay/setup.xml
- gplay.build is used if task contains "Gplay"

Big thanks to @mario as I did c&p from talk app.

Signed-off-by: tobiasKaminsky <tobias@kaminsky.me>

https://github.com/nextcloud/android/blob/3e6a782af8cc26f434bc287d7230aa15b4fe7507/src/main/res/layout/list_fragment.xml#L26-L29.

We used to have this for any Snackbar calling an activity/used in FDA:
```
DisplayUtils.showSnackMessage(this,

```

Now we would have to check if OCFileListFragment is available and if so, use the CoordinatorLayout, else use the previous way.

Or do you have a nicer approach @mario, @AndyScherzinger?

title: operations: Replace use of Vector with a unsynchronized equivalent.
body:
Early classes of the Java API, such as Vector, Hashtable and StringBuffer, were synchronized to make them thread-safe. Unfortunately, synchronization has a big negative impact on performance, even when using these collections from a single thread.

It is better to use their new unsynchronized replacements. ArrayList is pretty much a drop-in replacement for Vectors and I cant see any reason to use Vector unless there is some sort of special requirement for it. ArrayList will generally give you better performance and only half the data growth when items are added to the list.

title: jobs: Use previously defined constants instead of hard coded values.
body:
Use ACCOUNT_NAME_GLOBAL and KEY_MEDIA_FOLDERS constants where applicable.

Duplicated string literals make the process of refactoring error-prone.

body: There are two ways to write lambdas that contain single statement, but one is definitely more compact and readable than the other.

Fastlane then can automatically pick the changelog and uploads it to play store.

title: Add "upload existing"-option to autoupload
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
Hello guys,

I wondered if there is any reason, why the auto upload is just uploading new files, which from my perspective does not fulfill a good UX. As an example, i recently showed NC to my parents and the first expected behaviour was, that it would automaticially upload the whole folder and new files. 
So that is, why i'd like to suggest to either add an info to the screen, stating that only new files will be uploaded, or add a "upload existing"-checkbox in the autoupload UI.

I think this could improve the UX on this significantly, because uploading a folder manually is not as easy as the autoupload interface, which seems to be more intuitive.

Just a suggestion, id like to hear your opinions on this,
Keep up the good work 👍

Greetings

title: Rephrase "Lock" term to make it clearer that it is a app access restriction
label: [Label(name="approved"), Label(name="design"), Label(name="enhancement"), Label(name="good first issue")]
body:
see https://help.nextcloud.com/t/android-client-pin-fingerprint-protection-pointless/33590/2 

The thread shows that the access restriction we have is/can be misinterpreted as a file access restriction while it is a app access restriction. So I think we should thus show this fact as in maybe renaming "Lock" to "App access restriction" or something like that. Not a native speaker so maybe @nextcloud/designers or @mario @tobiasKaminsky have a better term to be used here :)

title: Show maintenance info
body:
Fix #989

We have on nearly all occasions a snackbar, when server is in maintenance mode (e.g. renaming, delete files).
But if you browse into a subfolder or go back, you do not get an info, but outdated/none folder content.

Please note that there is no automatic/in background check if server is available again.

Steps to test:
- open up app w/o server in maintenance mode
- browse
- set server in maintenance mode
- browse, see info on top
- try other operations (CRUD on files, share, remove share)

![2018-07-05-101525](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5836855/42310690-5cc55ec4-803c-11e8-8532-32d22d03937a.png)

The first part (extension of Toolbar) was done by @AndyScherzinger :tada:.

title: ConcurrentModificationException
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
```
java.util.ConcurrentModificationException: 
  at java.util.ArrayList.sort (ArrayList.java:1472)
  at java.util.Collections.sort (Collections.java:201)
  at com.owncloud.android.utils.FileSortOrderByName.sortCloudFiles (FileSortOrderByName.java:52)
  at com.owncloud.android.ui.adapter.OCFileListAdapter.swapDirectory (OCFileListAdapter.java:505)
  at com.owncloud.android.ui.fragment.OCFileListFragment.listDirectory (OCFileListFragment.java:1068)
  at com.owncloud.android.ui.fragment.OCFileListFragment.listDirectory (OCFileListFragment.java:1006)
  at com.owncloud.android.ui.activity.FileDisplayActivity.refreshListOfFilesFragment (FileDisplayActivity.java:672)
  at com.owncloud.android.ui.activity.FileDisplayActivity.onCreateFolderOperationFinish (FileDisplayActivity.java:2030)
  at com.owncloud.android.ui.activity.FileDisplayActivity.onRemoteOperationFinish (FileDisplayActivity.java:1714)
  at com.owncloud.android.services.OperationsService$1.run (OperationsService.java:726)
```

Background: https://medium.com/@edouard.kaiser/collections-sort-the-java8u20-modification-d6a9acf96861

So as far as I understand, we need to the old way by hand:
- first copy to array
- sort
- update list with sorted array

We can do this then here?
https://github.com/nextcloud/android/blob/c36239859196f234798a90ef8d9675ec51528529/src/main/java/com/owncloud/android/utils/FileSortOrder.java#L62-L64

@mario @AndyScherzinger is this correct?

body:
Lint:
>The res/drawable folder is intended for density-independent graphics such as shapes defined in XML. For bitmaps, move it to drawable-mdpi and consider providing higher and lower resolution versions in drawable-ldpi, drawable-hdpi and drawable-xhdpi. If the icon really is density independent (for example a solid color) you can place it in drawable-nodpi.
More info: http://developer.android.com/guide/practices/screens_support.html

--> I checked both usages on a high-end device and it looks good to me:
spinner is shown somewhat small, so density is good enough
checker: is repeated and thus also not blurry


Signed-off-by: tobiasKaminsky <tobias@kaminsky.me>
