title: TimSort, first fix values, then sort
body:
TimSort is crashing because values (e.g. upload status) is changing while sorting.
Therefore the idea is to "fix" these values for sorting.
Drawback is that it can happen that sorting is already outdated, once sorting is done.
But we refresh after each upload and also a manual refresh can be triggered.

This is currently #1 bug on google play console.

For developing, I set each value of OCUpload to random and had a crash on nearly every sorting/refresh.
With this enhancement, I had no crash at all, although every value changed at any time.

We are using these fixedValues only for sorting and read-only.
So a changing status, e.g. because upload failed, will still be reflected on next sort.

Signed-off-by: tobiasKaminsky <tobias@kaminsky.me>

title: Issues found testing with TalkBack screenreader
label: [Label(name="accessibility"), Label(name="approved"), Label(name="bug"), Label(name="design"), Label(name="good first issue"), Label(name="pr exists")]
body:
I did some quick testing with the [TalkBack screenreader](https://support.google.com/accessibility/android/answer/6283677) which is included in the Android accessibility settings and here’s some basic issues I found:

- Top left menu button just reads out "Open" – should be "Open sidebar"
- The "+" menu FAB is spoken as "unlabeled button", should be "Add or upload"
- In the file list, "thumbnail" is spoken, shouldn't be
- In the file list, "more icon menu" should be simply "More menu"
- ~~In the sidebar, the active menu item has "checked" prepended ("checked All files"), probably shouldn’t have~~
- ~~In the file list, it reads out "4 MB, 2 days ago", but should either say "4 MB, modified 2 days ago", or not read it at all?~~

And from @henningoschwald:

- The content descriptions currently are quite visual. For example "fingerprint icon", "shared icon" or "activity icon". I would like to suggest to strip the "icon" in this case.
- In the file list, the content description (currently "shared icon") should indicate whether a file or folder is currently shared. In case the item is not shared, the content description should be "share", if the item is shared, it should be "shared".

What do you think @nextcloud/accessibility @henningoschwald? cc @nextcloud/android

title: ClassCastException
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
Found via google play console

```
java.lang.ClassCastException: 
  at com.owncloud.android.ui.activity.FileDisplayActivity.getShareFileFragment (FileDisplayActivity.java:1930)
  at com.owncloud.android.ui.activity.FileDisplayActivity.onCreateShareViaLinkOperationFinish (FileDisplayActivity.java:1824)
  at com.owncloud.android.ui.activity.FileDisplayActivity.onRemoteOperationFinish (FileDisplayActivity.java:1720)
  at com.owncloud.android.services.OperationsService$1.run (OperationsService.java:726)
``` 

@AndyScherzinger maybe you have an idea?
It seems that those are the steps to reproduce:
- enter file details view
- share a file via link
- (somehow) navigate away from detail view (share via link is a blocking dialog)
- crash as second fragment is no longer a FileDetailFragment

We can easily have a check prior casting, but still it is strange how this can be triggered at all.

title: Add clickable link to notification
after download: update file via remote id
body:
Found via google play console:
```
Caused by: java.lang.NullPointerException: 
  at com.owncloud.android.ui.activity.FileDisplayActivity$DownloadFinishReceiver.onReceive (FileDisplayActivity.java:1493)
  at android.app.LoadedApk$ReceiverDispatcher$Args.lambda$-android_app_LoadedApk$ReceiverDispatcher$Args_52225 (LoadedApk.java:1319)
```

https://github.com/nextcloud/android/blob/f8801115f2f9a27b6da52aaf5b1c36940b1f2652/src/main/java/com/owncloud/android/ui/activity/FileDisplayActivity.java#L1518-L1520

The file gets refreshed because metadata could have changed.
Somehow then storageManager cannot find it anylonger.
(mWaitingToSend is *not* null, as this would produce an IllegalArgumentException).
So my assumption is that somehow the the remote path is changed and thus the file cannot be found anymore.
--> remoteId stays the same, so it is better to use.

Additionally, I added a null check, so that in doubt nothing happens, but at least also do not crash.

Signed-off-by: tobiasKaminsky <tobias@kaminsky.me>

title: Social Login App not allowing to log in
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
### Actual behaviour
Using Google login option only (authorized url https://mydomain.com/apps/sociallogin/oauth/google)

The Nextcloud instance is being accessed through a web browser (computer) and Android app. Everything works great on the web browser (both computer and Android devices). The Google button is pressed and the user is redirected to the Nextcloud instance.

The problems start when trying to log in using the Android app. The button to login using Google is there as expected after providing the instance to acces. When pressed, it shows a login screen (I would have expected it to use the credentials of the account on the Android device). Once the user logs in, the web page version of Nextcloud is displayed and not the Android frontend. It's like the web page that is being displayed for login is never closed and the user is never really logged in. After about 30 seconds, at the bottom of the screen, the "go back to old login method" message shows up. Clicking on it brings the user back to the login page. (An example of this problem #1587 although the cause of the problem is different). If I disable the Google login, the problem disappears.

Is there anybody using the Social Login app on the Android app? I have tested on 4 different devices (HTC 10, Samsun S8, Motorola X Play And Asus ZenPhone 5Q. I haven't tested with the iOS version.

An initial report was posted on the Social App project ([here](https://github.com/zorn-v/nextcloud-social-login/issues/35) and it was suggested to report it here instead.

### Expected behaviour
To be able to use Social Login's login method to log in to my instance of NextCloud.
 
### Steps to reproduce
1. Install Social Login app
2. Create OAuth2 Client IDs on Google API Console
 a. Create a new project
 b. Create a new web app
 c. Set "Authorized redirect URIs" to https://mydomain.com/apps/sociallogin/oauth/google
3. Back in the NextCloud instance, logged in as an Admin, go to Settings -> Social login
4. Under the Google section, provide the App ID and the secret that were created at step 2
5. Set the new user access to a group that doesn't have access to anything
6. From the Android App, provide the instance to connect to on the first screen
7. On the login page, scroll down and select the Google button
8. A Google login will be displayed. Provide Username and Password
9. Redirected to web version of NextCloud (not the Android App) and "go back to old login method" message shows up at the bottom of the page after less then a minute which will bring the user back to the initial screen to provide the instance.


### Environment data
Android version: 8.0.0

Device model: HTC 10

Stock or customized system: Stock

Nextcloud app version: 3.2.0 and beta verison

Nextcloud server version: 13.0.3

Social App version: 1.8.0

### Logs
#### Web server error log
no errors

#### Nextcloud log (data/nextcloud.log)
Going through the logs unfortunately doesn't show any new logs that are generated on login attempt.

title: Added missing @Override annotations above applicable method signatures.
body:
Using the @Override annotation is useful for two reasons:

- It elicits a warning from the compiler if the annotated method doesn't actually override anything, as in the case of a misspelling.
- It improves the readability of the source code by making it obvious that methods are overridden.

title: "Unresponsive App" error popup when syncing
label: [Label(name="approved"), Label(name="bug")]
body:
### Actual behaviour
- When manually syncing a large and partially-synced directory, Android O will complain about "App not responding [Close/Wait/Report]" after about 5-20 seconds. This does not happen when the process encounters new/modified files early enough, i.e. before the "unresponsive"-popup occurs. I think, every encountered new/changed file resets some kind of timeout of the popup.
- Even when selecting "wait", the Nextcloud app seems to be closed after some moments when not encountering new/changed files (even if there are plenty to be found later down the tree), thus stopping all sync activity. So the wild guess is that Android misinterprets the idle-ness of "nothing to download" as "app is stuck" and gives up waiting anyways after asking the user once?

### Expected behaviour
- No error popup about unresponsive app when syncing large directories
 
### Steps to reproduce
1. Have a large directory tree with mostly un-synced files
2. Tap it -> Menu -> Synchronize
3. wait for error popup


### Environment data
Android version: 8.0.0

Device model: Moto Z Play

Stock or customized system: Stock

Nextcloud app version: 3.2.0

Nextcloud server version: 13.0.4

title: Activity stream design enhancements on file detail
label: [Label(name="design"), Label(name="enhancement"), Label(name="pr exists")]
body:
From https://github.com/nextcloud/android/pull/2690#issuecomment-397328377.

We are re-using the activity stream, which can be accessed via drawer -> activities, so each change will also affect the other stream:

![2018-06-20-135633](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5836855/41656896-c8e8bd78-7491-11e8-90e2-3493246be46f.png) ![2018-06-20-135644](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5836855/41656897-c9072786-7491-11e8-8fdd-04c307893d59.png)




> - The first line of the comment »Commented by you« is not really useful. It should simply say »You« instead

Needs to be done on activity app

> - Similar for the icon: Instead of the generic comment icon, it should show your avatar

Wouldn't it be better to have the big icon as "action icon" and just before "test" (user) we show the avatar?

> - And the comment text below should have the same text size as the normal text. We shouldn’t have too many different text sizes as that looks strange.

Currently we have 3 font sizes:
- Date (today, yesterday, monday, May 28)
- "action" (new version was created, you changed file, you commented)
- "value" (file size, comment text)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5836855/41657329-559179d0-7493-11e8-9c74-c9a9df17d42a.png)

--> action and value both in size of "action"?

> - We can remove the »Today« header – it’s not necessary to show that one. Should only start with »Yesterday«.

This will then also be in activity stream. Is this ok for you?

What about the bold text? Personally I do not like them at all.
(there is no thumbnail because the files are already deleted)


File details only:
do we want to hide the thumbnails, as the user knows which file he is viewing?
![2018-06-20-140942](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5836855/41657439-a5f5ecb2-7493-11e8-9050-2ea5813d5593.png)

@jancborchardt

title: uploaded files are moved to app folder with 0KB and are wiped from local storage
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
### Actual behaviour

This issue happened on the Fairphone 2 (18.04.1)

I tried to manually upload pictures to nextcloud (auto upload was diabled and never used before on this device).

To my horror all pictures were moved to the app directory and were 0KB in size
They were also uploaded like that.

For whatever reason nextcloud not only deleted but pretty much wiped the pictures of the local storage source folder.

I rooted the phone and tried diskdigger which comes up with none of the missing pictures.

This is a terrible bug when your application to backup your pictures not only does not backup anything but wipes your files beyond repair.
This made me loose all of my holiday pictures and so far no luck in recovering them.

This seems to be somehow related to this issue:
https://github.com/nextcloud/android/issues/735
where i also commented

It is worth noting that the server might have been out of storage but still that should not wipe the pictures from local storage.

### Expected behaviour
- your pictures should stay on your phone and should be backed up by nextcloud without being destroyed beyond repair.
 
### Steps to reproduce
1. get fairphone 2
2. try to upload 300 pictures manually
3. try to find your pictures on the phone

title: When changing SD Card user should get a migration option
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
### Actual behaviour
- change the SD Card (incl. Backup)
- all uploads / downloads fails without giving a hint about the cause

### Expected behaviour
- When Changing an SD Card and storage path gets outdated / inaccessible, guide the user by saying "Storage Folder is not accessible" to the setting to allow him to move over to a new path
- pause downloads / uploads unless a valid path is set to avoid error notifications

possibly:
- auto-detect a changed SD Card an just ask if we should temporarily ignore this - means pause nextcloud - or if we should notice the swap 
 
PLUS:
- When storage path set is no longer available in selection for new users, give a hint to let user set a new (secure) path (incl. migration << issue https://github.com/nextcloud/android/issues/1048)

### Steps to reproduce
1. existing installation with external external SD Card set as storage path:
`/storage/0381-09EC/Android/data/com.nextcloud.client/files` (aside that this is too technical https://github.com/nextcloud/android/issues/1088) it is now outdated?! (referring to https://github.com/nextcloud/android/issues/1048) << no Kitakat+ SD Card formatted as internal Storage extension!
3. change the SD Card (possibly user story: change to use a bigger one)
4. uploads  / downloads fail
5. you have to manually find the cause and setting yourself, 

Actually it is even not possible for technical advised users to just select the new SD Card which has a 1:1 copy of the old 
due to the fact, that there are now paths in the selection, that doesn't allow to reuse the copied data on the SD Card (referring to path mentioned in step 1)
** `/storage/emulated/0/Android/media/com.nextcloud.client` aka internal Storage
** `/storage/B840-C408/Android/media/com.nextcloud.client` aka external Storage / new SD Card
** `/data/user/0/com.nextcloud.client/files` ?!? whatever 
** `/data/emulated/0/Android/data/com.nextcloud.client/files` (internal again, but path different to option 1 but would match what was set on my previous SD Card)

^  user: lost

### Environment data
Android version: 7.1.1

Device model: Moto G 4 Play

Stock or customized system: Stock

Nextcloud app version: 3.2.0 (actually latest)

title: Refactor search
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
This is a brainstorming issue.

Currently we have multiple "search" functionalities:
- name based search on server (in FileDisplayActivity)
- webdav search (e.g. favorites, shared) via DrawerActivity

Both result in a call to OCFileListFragment and this makes this fragment really huge.

So my idea is to separate this:
- NamedSearchResultFragment, which extends OCFileListFragment
	- get & store search result bound to lifecycle of this fragment
	- if you open enter a folder (which is a search result), go back, you will get back to the search result list
	- clicking back on search result list opens up root of server file list
- FixedSearchResultFragment, which extends NamedSearchResultFragment
	- no search view at all

Additionally searchView in FileDisplayActivity should just call the new fragments, if a search was entered, but not be responsible for anything else.

We can then easily swap/exchange the fragments, and all fragments have a (hopefully) more lightweight lifecycle.

What do you think?

title: deleting files on tab 'Auf dem Gerät' deletes also files on nextcloud instance
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
### Actual behaviour
Having an 'auto-upload' folder defined which I have choosen to 'syncronize'. The result was, that the folder appeared on `Auf dem Gerät` on my smartphone. I didn't wanted to have those files **twice or double** ...
- one in the **original folder** e.g. `/storage/emulated/0/ProgramData` (which is uploaded to /OnePlus2/ProgramData)
- and the **sync** in `/storage/emulated/0/nextcloud/OnePlus2/ProgramData`

so I decided to delete the local sync `OnePlus2` which is shown under tab `Auf dem Gerät` ... but also `/OnePlus2` folder on my nextcloud instance was deleted

### Expected behaviour
From my point of view **only** the **local sync** of files should be deleted when deleting files on the tab `Auf dem Gerät` on your smartphone and **NOT** the **source** on the nextcloud instance ...
 
### Steps to reproduce
1. sync files from nextcloud that they will be downloaded from your nextcloud instance to your device
2. select 'Auf dem Gerät' to see the local synced of files
3. delete the sysnced folder in the tab 'Auf dem Gerät'
 ... before you try enable the usage of Trash on your nextcloud that you can restore deleted files.


### Environment data
Android version: 8.1.0

Device model: OnePlus 2

Stock or customized system: RR-O-v6.0.0-20180530-oneplus-Official

Nextcloud app version: 3.1.0

Nextcloud server version: 12.0.7

title: Enhance error message when failing to sync file due to illegal filename
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
I accidentally had a directory in my nextcloud which contained a colon in its filename, e.g. `tro:lol`. Btw, this is totally legal in unix and I think in OSX, aswell.

When trying to sync the folder (to the fat32 sdcard) with the android client, i get an error message.

### Actual behaviour
- A notification is sent: 
```
Download failed
Could not download tro:lol
```

In case a directory contains a colon, the dir including it's content does not sync.
In case a file contains the colon, the file is not synced.

### Expected behaviour
- As far as I know the sync to external SD card can't work because on fat32, `:` is a reserved char. The error message should be more specific, e.g.:
```
Download failed
Could not download tro:lol : Illegal filename
```
 
### Steps to reproduce
1. Create files on workstation in synced nextcloud folder: `mkdir tro:lol; cd tro:lol; touch 1 2 3`
2. wait till on server
3. in Android app, select the three dots of the `tro:lol` entry and select `Sync`.


### Environment data
Android version: 7.1.2

Device model: Samsung S5 (klte)

Stock or customized system: LineageOs (microg)

Nextcloud app version: 3.1.0

Nextcloud server version: 13.0.2-1

title: fragment:util: Added private constructor to hide the inherit public one
body:
Utility classes, which are collections of static members, are not meant to be instantiated.

Java adds an implicit public constructor to every class which does not define at least one explicitly. Hence, at least one non-public constructor should be defined.

title: Disable lint check for gradle dependencies
body:
Once a new version comes up, this prevents all our PRs from merging as lint is complaining.
From time to time we simply should look at our deps and update them.
This should happen then in a separate PR, with extensive testing.

title: Use eTags to test if new thumbnails are needed
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
With #2685 we also need eTags as we can have theoretically have multiple thumbnails per fileId.
Currently we are checking the modification date of file during sync, to determinate if we need a new thumbnail.

Similar to avatar generation, we should use eTags also for thumbnails.

This can be done independently from our planned change to glide.

title: utils: Duplicate key in FILE_EXTENSION_TO_MIMETYPE_MAPPING
label: [Label(name="approved"), Label(name="bug"), Label(name="pr exists")]
body:
In the MimeTypeUtil.java class you have a FILE_EXTENSION_TO_MIMETYPE_MAPPING map. This has a duplicate entry for the "gz" mimetype. 

`FILE_EXTENSION_TO_MIMETYPE_MAPPING.put(1"gz", Collections.singletonList("application/x-gzip"));`

`FILE_EXTENSION_TO_MIMETYPE_MAPPING.put("gz", Collections.singletonList("application/x-compressed"));`

It is highly suspicious when a value is saved for a key or index and then unconditionally overwritten and I'm assuming it's a bug. However, I'm not certain which one you want to keep.

title: util: Added @Override annotation where applicable.
body:
Using the @Override annotation is useful for two reasons :

It elicits a warning from the compiler if the annotated method doesn't actually override anything, as in the case of a misspelling.
It improves the readability of the source code by making it obvious that methods are overridden.

title: ui:fragment: Use isEmpty() to check if list of activities is empty.
body: Using Collection.size() to test for emptiness works, but using Collection.isEmpty() makes the code more readable and can be more performant

title: Application Crash Upon Loading Large Folder
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
### Actual behaviour
When opening a large folder (~1.5GB) on the Android NextCloud application on my phone, the application will load for a couple seconds, then crash. After this, subsequent attempts to access the folder result in an instant force close. This folder has 268 files, all audio files. All other folders work, including folders with more files. Removing a few files from the folder solves the issue, so I believe the issue has something to do with the amount of data stored in the folder rather than the number of files. I can view the folder just fine on desktop.

The folder on my NextCloud instance is Audio/Unsorted

### Attempted Solutions/Debugging

1. Cleared data and cache for application.
2. Reinstalled application.
3. Recreated folder by downloading all data from original folder and re-uploading it into a new folder.
4. Tried a different phone, a Huawei Honor 5X KIW-L24 (same version of NextCloud app).
5. Tried a different NextCloud instance (same version) being run on a different server with the same folder contents.
6. Deleted roughly 50 megabytes of data from the folder, which stopped the crashing.

### Expected behaviour
The folder should load normally.
 
### Steps to reproduce
1. Open NextCloud application
2. Log into server
3. Navigate to a folder with a large amount of data (~1.5GB or more)

### Environment data
Android version: 7.0

Device model: Alcatel A30 5046G

Stock or customized system: Stock

Nextcloud app version: 3.1.0

Nextcloud server version: 13.0.2
Web server: Apache/2.4.18 (Ubuntu)
PHP: 7.0.30-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
MySQL: 14.14 Distrib 5.7.22
OpenSSL: 1.0.2g  1 Mar 2016
Server OS: Ubuntu 16.04 LTS, Linux Kernel 2.6.32-042stab127.2

### Logs
#### Web server error log

title: Display application password / token as QR Code
body:
### Actual behaviour
Authenticating via an app password (or 'token') is complicated because of the length of the generated app passwords : you have to type it with the smartphone's tiny keyboard.

### Expected behaviour
- When connecting with an app password, allow : 
  - from the web interface to display it as a QR code
  - to scan this QR code from the mobile app to fill the field without typing
 
### Steps to reproduce
1. Add a connection through the app
2. Choose 'login with app password' (or whatever label in english)
3. Try to type the password you got from the web interface


### Environment data
Android version:
6.0.1
Device model: 
Fairphone 2

Stock or customized system:

title: Application password / token should not be hidden
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
### Actual behaviour
Authenticating via an app password (or 'token', don't know how it's called in english, french translation is not consistent between the server and the app) is complicated because of the length of the generated app passwords : you have to type it with the smartphone's tiny keyboard and it's hidden.

### Expected behaviour
- The app password is very long and complicated to type on a phone so it should not be hidden or there should be a button to reveal it so I can check that I've not mistyped it.
 
### Steps to reproduce
1. Add a connection through the app
2. Choose 'login with app password' (or whatever label in english)
3. Try to type the password you got from the web interface


### Environment data
Android version:
6.0.1
Device model: 
Fairphone 2

Stock or customized system:
N/A
Nextcloud app version:
3.1.0
Nextcloud server version:
13
### Logs
#### Web server error log
N/A
Insert your webserver log here
N/A

title: Iteration 4 for file detail & new sharing
label: [Label(name="1. developing")]
body:
Iteration 1 can be found here: #2533 :ballot_box_with_check:
Iteration 2 can be found here: #2573 :ballot_box_with_check:
Iteration 3 can be found here: #2671

WiP for #2485 and collab with @tobiasKaminsky for adding commenting.

This PR/branch stack on top of ```fileDetails-3``` until that one has been merged.

**TODOs**:
* [x] add comment box UI
* [ ] send new comments to server (right away)
* [ ] update activities list after comment has been send to server (async)
* [ ] update activities list after comment could not be saved on server (error handling)

My idea behind the described to dos is to update the UI right away while reverting that in case the server couldn't store the comment. For starters I guess it'd be fine if it works synchronously to have it working and then improve upon that.

@tobiasKaminsky would you fancy taking on the part of client/server communication? :heart:

title: Auto upload On device directory
body: I would like to sync the On device directory an I guess it works as follows: I activate the Expert mode and then set up Auto upload to sync the Local directory $STORAGEPATH/nextcloud/$USER/ with the root Remote directory. My expectation is that after that every change I make in that directory will be synced with the server while only the files selected in the client are downloaded. I did not try this up till now because I am not sure if I am really right about how this works. So can anyone tell me if it is safe to set up the client this way and if it will work as I expect?

title: Codacy fixes
body: Fix some codacy warnings about complexity by extracting some logic into separate methods

### Expected behaviour

### Steps to reproduce

title: Disable Google Analytics introduced by Firebase
body:
Since you have introduced Firebase, you might need to explicitly disable Google Analytics (https://firebase.google.com/docs/analytics/). :-)



The instruction https://firebase.google.com/docs/analytics/android/start/ actually says:
> Getting started with Analytics is easy. **Just add the Firebase SDK to your new or existing app, and data collection begins automatically**

> Analytics automatically logs some events and user properties; **you don't need to add any code to enable them.** 


**So how can you disable the Analytics?** 


If you have a look at https://firebase.google.com/docs/android/setup#available_libraries it says that the `firebase-core` library corresponds to the Analytics part of FireBase. 
The `firebase-core` is pulled in as a dependency automatically once you add the Firebase SDK to you project.

Hence you would like to remove it:
```configurations.all {
exclude group: 'com.google.firebase', module: 'firebase-core'
}
```


The official guide to disable Analytics does not tell you about this solution (or at least it's pretty good hidden) and suggests another:

> **Permanently deactivate collection**
> 
> If you need to deactivate Analytics collection permanently in a version of your app, set firebase_analytics_collection_deactivated to true in your app's AndroidManifest.xml in the application tag. For example:
> 
> `<meta-data android:name="firebase_analytics_collection_deactivated" android:value="true" />`
> 
> **Disable Advertising ID collection**
> y
> If you wish to disable collection of the Advertising ID in your Android app, you can set the value of google_analytics_adid_collection_enabled to false in your app's AndroidManifest.xml in the application tag. For example:
> 
>` <meta-data android:name="google_analytics_adid_collection_enabled" android:value="false" />`
> 

Source: https://firebase.google.com/support/guides/disable-analytics

See also https://stackoverflow.com/questions/39327141/disable-the-analytics-service-for-firebase-cloud-messaging


PS: Nextcloud Talk for Android already disabled it:

-  https://github.com/nextcloud/talk-android/blob/1f1eb30123faed81c496bbe2ff948a67ac0f829c/app/src/gplay/AndroidManifest.xml#L17
- https://github.com/nextcloud/talk-android/blob/0a55a110c17c524476570a5de8edf52ae6dfab7f/app/build.gradle#L71

title: Do not process result of async task if activity is stopped
body:
Fix #2640 

This is quite a hacky way as it does not stop the async task.
There are lots of different approaches out there how to handle "long running" async tasks.
We should discuss this and take also in account how to cancel the tasks to prevent unneeded network calls.

But for now this is hopefully a "good" solution.

title: Automatically switch to grid view for folders that contain only files of type media
label: [Label(name="enhancement"), Label(name="needs info/discussion")]
body:
### Actual behaviour
With Nextcloud I started to share quite a lot of my photos. Others upload photos as well. So I start having more and more folders filled with photos. As there are close to non open source webdav based gallery apps out there, the Nextcloud for android gets my primary photo gallery app. But it still has a drawback. I manually have to switch folders to grid view even there are no other files than photos. The grid view is by far the best view to watch photos. Other file functions are (luckily) also available in this view.

### Expected behaviour
The Nextcloud android app checks the type of all files that should be displayed in the current folder. If all files are from type "media", switch to the grid view automatically. Also nice: for someone who doesnt like this smart detection, an option in settings could prevent it.
 
### Steps to reproduce
1. Create a folder on the server
2. Upload only fotos
3. Navigate in the android app to this folder
4. Check if the folder is open in grid view


### Environment data
Android version: 7.1.2

Device model: BQ X5P

Stock or customized system: LineageOS

Nextcloud app version: 3.1.0

Nextcloud server version: 13.0.1

### Logs
#### Web server error log
```
-
```

#### Nextcloud log (data/nextcloud.log)
```
-
```

title: IllegalArgumentException  in FileUploader$UploadRequester.retryFailedUploads
label: [Label(name="bug"), Label(name="needs info/discussion")]
body:
GPlay reported als 3.1.0 (~9000 reports...)
```
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: 
  at android.app.ContextImpl.registerReceiverInternal (ContextImpl.java:1838)
  at android.app.ContextImpl.registerReceiver (ContextImpl.java:1794)
  at android.app.ContextImpl.registerReceiver (ContextImpl.java:1788)
  at android.content.ContextWrapper.registerReceiver (ContextWrapper.java:489)
  at com.evernote.android.job.util.Device.getBatteryStatus (Device.java:55)
  at com.owncloud.android.files.services.FileUploader$UploadRequester.retryFailedUploads (FileUploader.java:417)
  at com.owncloud.android.utils.FilesSyncHelper.lambda$restartJobsIfNeeded$0$FilesSyncHelper (FilesSyncHelper.java:239)
  at com.owncloud.android.utils.FilesSyncHelper$$Lambda$0.run (Unknown Source)
  at java.lang.Thread.run (Thread.java:833)
```

Crashing line:
```
charging = charging || Device.getBatteryStatus(context).getBatteryPercent() == 1;
```
to then do afterwards
```
if (!isPowerSaving && gotNetwork && checkIfUploadCanBeRetried(failedUpload, gotWifi, charging)) {
   retry(context, currentAccount, failedUpload);
 }
```

So a simple solution is to have a try/catch for the IllegalArgumentException - we only need to decide if we then "just" use whatever value charging had before or if we explicitely just retry / not retry in case of an exception.

What do you think @mario @tobiasK . devices are mostly Huawei...

title: Upload not working correctly
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
### Actual behaviour
The App uploads the file / picture / contact to 100%, but then gets stuck with full progress bar. When I check via webinterface the file is there.
After the upload ran into an timeout, i get the message an error occured. But a few seconds later it tries again and would run in the same issue.

Thats an image of the resulting files on my nextcloud (contact backup):
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/39102356/40600621-75646324-6252-11e8-8d4e-bc1d2e0e29d2.png)

The behaviour with otherfiles is the same:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/39102356/40600955-81973eae-6253-11e8-9d9c-7ca4b61ba560.png)


### Expected behaviour
- The file gets uploaded once.
 
### Steps to reproduce
1. Upload anything with the nextcloud app


### Environment data
Android version:
7.0
Device model: 
LG-H850
Stock or customized system:
Stock
Nextcloud app version:
3.1.0 beta
Nextcloud server version:
13.0.2 stable
### Logs
#### Web server error log
Noting related realy

title: Syntax Errors in SQL
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
### Actual behaviour
- There are various syntax errors in FileContentProvider.java  which are affecting the functioning of SQL database.

### Expected behaviour
- These errors should be removed .

### Environment data

Nextcloud app version: latest build version

![screenshot from 2018-05-28 11-33-15](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/31107831/40600140-e0c0ab12-626d-11e8-80e8-6bc1386d7413.png)

### Would you like to work on this issue?
Yes , I want to work on this issue.

title: Add Swipe Support
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body: I would like to add a suggestion for left swipe support, so if a user swipes left then they are taken back one directory.

title: Destroyed file due to failed opening of .ipf file
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
### Actual behaviour
I tried to oben a igor procedure file on my smartphone. Since the format is not supported by any app i then tried to copy it to another folder, change the ending to .txt and then open it (which did not work). I then deleted the copied version. The next day when syncing with a nextcloud desktop client i saw, that the original file was broken, meaning having 0kb of size and being empty. Restoring a previous version did save the file, but it seems opening unsupported datatypes can destroy files.

### Expected behaviour
I expected to file to be opened as a txt file, since it is simply a plane text file of code with a different file ending.
 
### Steps to reproduce
1. upload an igor procedure file (.ipf)
2.  try to open in adroid app
3. copy
4. rename copy
5. delete copy
6. sync original file to desktop by client


### Environment data
Android version:

Device model: Samsung galaxy s8+

Stock or customized system:

Nextcloud app version: 3.1.0

Nextcloud server version: 13.0.0

### Logs
 from android app:
-file changed (<- probably this is the problematic entry)
-file created
-created file renamed
-renamed file deleted

title: Shorten code and improve readability via a menu helper
body:
Preview*Fragment hides a lot of menu items thus I use the helper implementation to reduce the code and improve the readablity. To be further utilized e.g. for sharing fragments, but only after this PR has been merged to reduce the risk of large merge conflicts.

cc @ardevd @tobiasKaminsky @mario for review :)

title: Renaming of offline files
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
### Actual behaviour
- When an "offline" file is renamed on the server, the app detects it as a completely new file. The "old" file is deleted from the cache, and a "new" file appears on the device (in the app) and must be downloaded again 

### Expected behaviour
- The app should be able to detect that the file has just been renamed (or moved) and update its cache without re-downloading the file.
This probably requires some metadata-communication-channel between the server and the app, where the app can fetch a list of file-operations (moving, deleting etc) without basing sync solely on the file-list from the server.

### Steps to reproduce
1. Set a file as "Available offline" in the Android App
2. File is downloaded and cached locally on the device
3. Rename the file on the server (using the WEB UI or whatever other method - NOT the app)
4. Notice how the "new" file is not cached on the device


### Environment data
Android version: 7.1

Device model: Verified on Samsung, Sony and Lenovo

Stock or customized system: Stock

Nextcloud app version: 3.1.0

Nextcloud server version: 13.1

### Logs
#### Web server error log
```
Insert your webserver log here
```

#### Nextcloud log (data/nextcloud.log)
```
Insert your Nextcloud log here
```
**NOTE:** Be super sure to remove sensitive data like passwords, note that everybody can look here! You can use the Issue Template application to prefill some of the required information: https://apps.nextcloud.com/apps/issuetemplate

title: Deleted shares can not be reactivated
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
Need server-side: nextcloud/server#2192

### Actual behaviour
If you -deliberately or by accident- delete a share (folder or file) shared to you as read only in the Android app no option to reactivate/reinstantiate the folder is available to the user to whom the entity was shared.
The event of sharing the object is still visible in the activity protocol but clicking on the link fails.
The only option to get the shared object back is to revoke the share as sharing user and share again.

### Expected behaviour
It should be possible to reinstantiate the shared folder, e.g. via activity protocol or a special menu within settings.
 
### Steps to reproduce
1. Let user A share a folder with user B or a group user B belongs to with read only permissions
2. Log in user B to the Android client
3. User B deletes the shared folder in the Android client (I deleted “globally“, not only “local“ but I think it doesn't matter)
4. Open activity screen in Android client and select the (grayed out) deleted share

### Environment data
Android version:
Android 7.0

Device model: 
Samsung S7

Stock or customized system:
Stock

Nextcloud app version:
3.1.0

Nextcloud server version:
13

title: Cleanup unused code, housekeeping post #2616
body:
codacy hasn't detected the unused code for whatever reason in #2616 
So here is another try of me to have zero unused code reported by codacy :fork_and_knife: 

cc @mario @tobiasKaminsky @ardevd

title: ui:preview Verify that bitmap is not null before setting imageDrawable.
body: A reference to null should never be dereferenced/accessed. Doing so will cause a NullPointerException to be thrown

title: ui:activity: Removed @NonNull annotation for method where null can be returned
body: The return value is marked @NonNull and is therefore assumed to only return non-null values. Therefore setting one of these values to null, or failing to set such a class field in a constructor, could cause NullPointerExceptions at runtime. In this case, view might be null.

title: Minor cleanup of FileSortOrderByName and FileSortOrderBySize
body: Minor lint fixes such as use of lambdas, missing override annotations and stricter access declarations.

title: ui:activity Removed unused override method in ManageAccountsActivity
body: Overriding a method just to call the same method from the super class without performing any other actions is useless and misleading.

title: Obsolete Gradle Dependency
body:
Fixes #2614 
I have updated the outdated gradle dependencies to the latest version.
Build is successful on all build variants.
App is tested on Redmi Note 4.

title: Ignore translations files
body:
Should ignore all translations files, otherwise if new translations in a language are added, coverage will be reduced, but this is not meaningful for us.

Signed-off-by: tobiasKaminsky <tobias@kaminsky.me>

title: Remove analytics
body:
As discussed this will completely remove analytics.
If we ever need this again, it will be in a different build flavor, so that regular gplay flavor will not have it included.

Signed-off-by: tobiasKaminsky <tobias@kaminsky.me>

title: Logo/Icon Proposal
body:
Sorry for not having the template
Hi good day! Im Jibbie Eguna, a graphics designer, I would like to ask for your permission to propose a new designs of logo in your application/project. I would like to help projects in open-source .I would just like to propose new designs if you are needing it. Hoping for your positive response Thank You!

title: Obsolete Gradle Dependency
label: [Label(name="enhancement"), Label(name="pr exists")]
body:
### Actual behavior

title: Ignore "unused quantity"
body: original PR has been merged to already merged PR, thus directly merging this PR to get master to build again

title: Replaced legacy custom ImageView and ViewPager class with PhotoView and stock ViewPager
body:
I have removed all code related to the custom ImageView and ViewPager that's been in use and replaced it with PhotoView and the ViewPager from the Android support library.

Some immediate benefits include:

- Getting rid of legacy code that nobody wants to deal with
- Double-tap-to-zoom now has two zoom levels instead of one. The first double tap zooms in a bit, which is often the actual zoom level you want, while the next double tap zooms in further. The legacy custom ImageView just zooms all the way in immediately.

Animated gifs are not supported yet, but if we use Glide to load the image we could achieve that. I'd be happy to do it but I reckon that should be a separate PR.

Please test it out and let me know if there's anything that doesnt work as it's supposed to.

This closes #2583

title: Uploads of multiple or subsequent files to Nextcloud incomplete
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
### Actual behaviour
I have observed this when trying to share especially multiple pictures from my gallery at once to my Nextcloud server. It just fails for some pictures without any warning or error. Some files are neither uploaded nor can be found in the upload queue of the Nextcloud app. While mostly the first or second file succeeds, subsequent items just do not trigger any action in the Nextcloud client anymore. The queue is also missing any trace of the missing pictures. Any subsequent try to upload to the same folder mostly fails in this condition, even if it is a single file only. I could not find out under which conditions this can be reproduced. Sometimes I see it happening for single but subsequent uploads. 
My current workaround is to switch to the Nextcloud app and jump back and forth between some folders and then try again. Then at least I can upload the next files.

### Expected behaviour
Anything that is shared by the share button to the Nextcloud app should be at least put into upload queue or uploaded immediately to the Nextcloud server.
 
### Steps to reproduce
1. Try to upload multiple selected files from eg. the gallery
2. Check if all files have been uploaded on server
3. Check upload queue if all files shared to the app have been registered for upload


### Environment data
Android version:
8.1.0
Device model: 
Pixel 2
Stock or customized system:
Stock
Nextcloud app version:
3.1.0
Nextcloud server version:
13.0.2

no errors in server log

title: Ignore "unused quantity"
body:
> Android defines a number of different quantity strings, such as zero, one, few and many. However, many languages do not distinguish grammatically between all these different quantities.
>
>This lint check looks at the quantity strings defined for each translation and flags any quantity strings that are unused (because the language does not make that quantity distinction, and Android will therefore not look it up).
>
>For example, in Chinese, only the other quantity is used, so even if you provide translations for zero and one, these strings will not be returned when getQuantityString() is called, even with 0 or 1.


As transifex is not that smart to prevent translation of those languages that not have all quantities, we simply ignore lint.

Signed-off-by: tobiasKaminsky <tobias@kaminsky.me>

title: Lib refers always to master
body:
- lib refers always to master
- only releases, in our release branch, target a specific library version

This way we can merge any PR to library without having to release inbetween version.

Signed-off-by: tobiasKaminsky <tobias@kaminsky.me>

title: Support for trashbin
body:
Fixes #2557

- initial support for trashbin
- introduces a common interface for OCFile and TrashbinFile
- no storage, all "on the fly" as it son meaningful to show possible outdated trashbin
- used MVP, but no repository pattern (I am unsure, if we really need this here. For files, activities, etc., we can try it so that we have two repositores (online & offline), but adding this here is "useless" overhead for me).

Discuss and maybe TODO in later PR: 
- multiselect items and delete them

Please have a look into it, especially @ardevd as you added MVP :-)

title: Replace legacy and stale custom ImageView and ViewPager classes with a better alternatives
label: [Label(name="approved"), Label(name="enhancement"), Label(name="pr exists")]
body:
We currently include a `com.ortiz.touch.ExtendedViewPager` class that provides zooming/scrolling functionality for preview images. It's only used in the `PreviewImageActivity`.

The code is seemingly not maintained anymore and the source is pretty clunky. 

As @AndyScherzinger recommended, let's look for a replacement in form of a third party library that will remove the need to maintain old code nobody knows how to work with and perhaps give a better user experience as well.

I'll be happy to look into this. @AndyScherzinger proposed [PhotoView](https://github.com/chrisbanes/PhotoView) which looks good to me. I'll see if I can dig up other alternatives too though and play around with them to see what works.

- Replaced toLowerCase() with equalsIgnoreCase() for better performance and readability

- Make anonymous inner class a lambda.

title: case-insensitive filename bug?
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
I am seeing what appears to be a bug in the Android client related to filenames. Here is how I reproduce it:

1. Create new folder on my Linux desktop running Mint.
2. Add two files: somefile.pdf and SomeFile.pdf.
3. Open this folder in my NextCloud android client.
4. Tap on of one these to open it. The client downloads and opens it a PDF viewer.
5. Tap on the second file. The client reports a version collision. If I select server version I end up with two versions of the first file, even though the filenames are different. This change is propagated back to the server and the the desktop client.

Somewhere in the app there seems to some filename comparison code which is case-insensitive.

Nextcloud android client v3.1.0
Nextcloud desktop client v2.3.3.
Nextcloud server: v13.0.1

title: Verify context before getting file type icon.
body:
The context object passed to `getFileTypeIcon` can be null and we should therefore verify that it's not before calling `context.getResources()`. 

Furthermore, `context.getResources()` was deprecated in Marshmellow and we should be using the new theme aware equivalent.

This fixes #2569

1. Open the upload dialog
2. navigate to a folder with multiple files
3. change sorting method


### Environment data
Android version: 7.1.2

Device model: OnePlus X

Stock or customized system: Lineagos 14.1

Nextcloud app version: 3.1.0

Nextcloud server version: 13.0.1

title: [F-Droid Dev version] App crashes on Auto upload option openning
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
Similar behavior on 2 different devices:
Xiaomi Redmi Note 3 with rooted LineageOS 14.1 latest
Google Pixel XL with non-rooted latest 8.1
Nextcloud Dev F-Droid 20180427 version.

title: Fix local sorting
body:
Fix #2467
Fix #2699

Signed-off-by: tobiasKaminsky <tobias@kaminsky.me>

title: authentication: Fixed HTTPS prefixed URL normalization.
body: I'm assuming here that the if statement is supposed to be checking whether the normalized URL starts with HTTP or HTTPS. The current version seemingly has a typo which this commit fixes.

title: MainApp: Fixed auto upload state check.
body: This is almost certainly a mistake. Using the same value on either side of a binary operator makes no sense. It should check whether photo uploads or video uploads are enabled.

title: Adding @ardevd to the list of reviewer
body:
To gain speed (and possibly time on everybody's side) I propose to add @ardevd to the list of reviewers, of course only if you (@ardevd) would like to also do reviews.

What do you think @tobiasKaminsky @mario

title: Option to open direct links in the app
label: [Label(name="enhancement"), Label(name="needs info/discussion")]
body:
### Actual behaviour
- Opening direct links like https://cloud.example.com/f/12345 is not possible

### Expected behaviour
- It should be possible to open direct links like https://cloud.example.com/f/12345 in the app, e.g. if I receive one via email.

I'm not sure if this is somehow possible on android, since Nextcloud instances are hosted on custom domains, but maybe someone from @nextcloud/android has an idea. Maybe we could extend the web ui with some button like "Show in the client" that is shown on mobile and calls some custom url like: `nc://directlink/https://cloud.example.com/f/12345`

title: No login possible
body:
See #2552 for details.
It is the same issue as described in #1958 and #1531 .

Removing the nextcloud account from accounts_ce.db only fixed it until i reboot my phone.
I am using external_sd as adopted storage and the phone is encrypted.

Any help would be appreciated.

title: Nextcloud does not sync when some subfolders are already synced
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
###Actual behaviour

I have all my music synchronized to Nextcloud. This is quite a big folder having 43GB Containing 8835 Files in 776 subfolders (strucutred by artist/album/filename.mp3 if that is important)
Yesterday I started to sync that folder already (see #2559 ) but needed to cancel syncronisation. After restarting it this morning when the display turned black after about half a minute the Syncronisation stopped and Nextcloud got terminated. As far as I could check now this only happens before Nextcloud is downloading new files probably due to the power saving of Android even if I exclude it from Battery Optimisation

###Expected behaviour

Nextcloud should sync in Background and keep the app running until everything is synced

###Steps to reproduce

1.    create a folder containing many subfolders and files below it 
2.    Start Syncing and cancel Syncronisation after more than half n hour
3.    sync the whole folder to Android

###Environment data

Android version: Android 8.1 Security Level 1st April 18

Device model: Nokia 5 TA-1053

Stock or customized system: Stock rom not rooted

Nextcloud app version: 3.1.0 (from F-Droid)

Nextcloud server version: 13.0.2

### Logs

```
Insert your webserver log here
```

label: [Label(name="bug")]

After upgrading my phone to newest lineageOS, the first login worked just fine.
At some point later the same day i opened the app and i found myself logged out,
could never login again.

- Enter URL
- Fill in login data or app token generated in the webinterface and confirm
- App closes
- Repeat as many times as you wish

### Expected behaviour

- Enter URL
- Fill in login data
- App shows my files etc.

title: Incorrect filenames sharing files to the Nextcloud app due to different Android versions / file managers
label: [Label(name="approved"), Label(name="bug")]
body:
filed here after having discussed with @jospoortvliet 

### Actual behaviour
I use two different HUAWEI phones. On my newer phone I notice - since at least many months - a strange behaviour when I upload a file via the "share" function inside the Huawei filemanager: the original filename e.g. ```test.test``` or ```1.1``` or ```00001.vcf``` is not transported to the Nextcloud server directory, intead a plain number like ```101663``` is shown, the file and filesize appears to be intact.

The filename is preserved when I "upload" a jpeg file via the share function.

### Expected behaviour
I expect that the correct filename is used and transported to the server directory.
 
### Steps to reproduce
1. Start the Filemanager, navigate to an internal or SD card directory
2. Rename a ```file.jpg``` to ```1.1``` (or create a file with that name)  
3. Long-click the file and select "Weitergeben" (~ share) in the "Mehr" ("more") context menu
4. Select to share with the "Nextcloud" app
5. Navigate to a suited Nextcloud directory and start the upload to there.
6. Nextcloud closes and the upload starts
7. Re-open Nextcloud and notice, that the filename is now something like ```101663``` instead of ```1.1``` in the example.

### Environment data
On the newer phone, there is the problem.
Android version: 7.0
Device model:  HUAWEI P8 LITE 2017
Filemanager: "Dateien Version 7.2.3.319_Local"
Stock or customized system: Stock
Nextcloud app version: 3.1.0
Nextcloud server version: 13.0.2

Older phone (no problem):
Android version: 6.0
Device model: HUAWEI P8 LITE
Filemanager: "Dateien Version 7.1.1.301_L"
Stock
Nextcloud app version 3.1.0
Nextcloud server version: 13.0.2

### Logs
#### Web server error log
```
Insert your webserver log here
(no relevant messages there)
```

#### Nextcloud log (data/nextcloud.log)
```
Insert your Nextcloud log here (I cannot find it)
```

title: datamodel: String function use should be optimized for single characters
body: An lastIndexOf call with a single letter String can be made more performant by switching to a call with a char argument.

title: Anonymous inner classes containing only one method should become lambdas
body:
Before Java 8, the only way to partially support closures in Java was by using anonymous inner classes. But the syntax of anonymous classes may seem unwieldy and unclear.

With Java 8, most uses of anonymous inner classes should be replaced by lambdas to highly increase the readability of the source code.

title: ui: Corrected '&' to '&&' in boolean if statement.
body: The use of non-short-circuit logic in a boolean context is likely a mistake - one that could cause serious program errors as conditions are evaluated under the wrong circumstances.

title: ortiz.touch: End switch case with an unconditional break.
body: No idea who maintains the TouchImageView class, but it seems like a bug to me that the switch case is missing a break.

title: authentication: Added @Override annotations to applicable methods.
body:
Using the @Override annotation is useful for two reasons :

It elicits a warning from the compiler if the annotated method doesn't actually override anything, as in the case of a misspelling.
It improves the readability of the source code by making it obvious that methods are overridden.

title: activities: A couple of code quality fixes for the Activities component
body:
- Added Override annotation to the onDestroy method.
- Use isEmpty() to check whether the activities list is empty.
- Added private constructor to the data Injection class

title: Changing time Zone will cause massive upload
label: [Label(name="AutoUpload"), Label(name="bug")]
body:
### Actual behaviour
- I flew from Europe (UTC +2) to Asia (UTC +7) and after my phone automatically adopt to local time (what is 5 Hours behind) my nextcloud Client goes crazy and started auto uploading of all media Files in a Camera Folders. Those files were already synced long time ago, but it does not care - client just duplicating them with no end. Only way to stop it is to open Upload status menu and stop files one by one - that is MASSIVE amount of work.
 On a way back never seen this issue (from UTC +7 to UTC +2)

### Expected behaviour
- Changing Time back (time Zone from UTC +x to UTC +x+y) should not causing massive uploads of already synced files.
 
### Steps to reproduce
1. Have a folder for auto uploads configured 
2. check if auto upload works
3. change time zone backwards for you local time (e.g. UTC +1 to UTC +7 will cause 6 Hours time back)
4. enjoy uploads...

### Environment data
Android version: Tested on 6x and 7.x

Device model: SM-A510F

Stock or customized system: Stock

Nextcloud app version: Seen since beginning of 2017, current version is 3.1.0 - still has this bug

Nextcloud server version: 13.0.1

body:

- [x] https://github.com/nextcloud/server/pull/9178

Fixes: #379 

This enables video/audio streaming without exposing any credentials.

Test cases:
NC14
- non downloaded file
    - stream video internally
		- toggle to fullscreen
    - stream audio internally
    - stream video with external app
    - stream audio with external app
- downloaded file
    - play video/audio directly

NC13
- no option to stream
- non downloaded file
    - download media, then play
- downloaded file
    - play video/audio directly

title: Remove build tools from build.gradle
label: [Label(name="enhancement"), Label(name="pr exists")]
body:
When outdated build tools are specified, we get this warning: 

> The specified Android SDK Build Tools version (26.0.2) is ignored, as it is below the minimum supported version (27.0.3) for Android Gradle Plugin 3.1.2.
Android SDK Build Tools 27.0.3 will be used.
To suppress this warning, remove "buildToolsVersion '26.0.2'" from your build.gradle file, as each version of the Android Gradle Plugin now has a default version of the build tools.

I think it is safe to remove it, as we nearly immediately get a notice of a failing build (either on devs machine or drone).

title: Preferences: Don't start FileDisplayActivity when pressing the back button
body:
Since the `FileDisplayActivity` has its launch mode set to '`multiple`' (the default) and `FLAG_ACTIVITY_SINGLE_TOP` is not being used, using `FLAG_ACTIVITY_CLEAR_TOP` will effectively [finish any existing activity and then re-create it](https://developer.android.com/reference/android/content/Intent.html#FLAG_ACTIVITY_CLEAR_TOP). This will cause the launch screen to be showed again. This is probably not the behavior we want.

We could consider declaring the FileDisplayActivity with `android:launchMode="singleTask"` if you want to prevent duplicate entries in the back stack.

This fixes #2507

title: fix more  lint issues
body:
see subject fixing some more lint warnings:

* lint: fix set android:baselineAligned="false" on this element for better performance
* lint: fix the image ic_favorite.png varies significantly in its density-independent (dip) size across the various density versions (ic_ needs to comply with standard icon sizes)
* lint: fix the image ic_account_circle.png varies significantly in its density-independent (dip) size across the various density versions
* lint: fix This tag and its children can be replaced by one <TextView/> and a compound drawable _and_ unnecessary parent element
* lint: fix attribute networkSecurityConfig is only used in API level 24 and higher (current min is 14)
* lint: fix attribute splitTrack is only used in API level 21 and higher (current min is 14)
* lint: Fix the resource R.string.upload_list_loading appears to be unused
* lint: fix the resource R.layout.list_fragment_expandable appears to be unused
* lint: fix possible overdraw: Root element paints background @color/background_color with a theme that also paints a background (inferred theme is @style/Theme.ownCloud.Toolbar)
* lint: fix implicitly using the default locale is a common source of bugs: Use toLowerCase(Locale) instead. For strings meant to be internal use Locale.ROOT, otherwise Locale.getDefault().

title: [MVP] Refactored the Activities activity
body:
I have refactored the entire Activities List activity.

The old activity class has been split up into a View (Activity) and a Presenter with a Contract interface that connects them. Additionally, I have implemented a repository pattern for all remote data access. Currently I've kept things specific to the Activities screen but it would be possible to use it for all remote data operations throughout the app instead of the various duplicate AsyncTasks and Thread implementations you currently have.

I have added unit tests with a 100% coverage for the Presenter and the Files and Activities repository data classes. Instrumented tests can be written to cover the View. 

Note that when launching the activities screen you will currently see a NullPointerException due to #2502. Applying #2503 fixes the issue it seems.

I've taken some liberties and cleaned up some stuff that just didnt make sense to me. Most notably the multiple ways progress was being shown to the user. I think the SwipeToRefresh-indicator sufficiently indicates  progress to the user so I removed the `emptyContentProgressBar` progress indicator by setting it to Invisible. I also removed the funky way you guys showed the empty content view when no activities are available. You had a separate RecylerView with an associated RecylerView  for empty content to give the user the ability to swipe-to-refresh when no activities where shown in the list. I simplified this by removing the redundant recyclerview all-together by moving the included `empty_list` view into the primary `SwipeRefreshLayout` used for the recyclerView used for actually displaying Activities and simply toggling visibility according to the availability of activities. Looks a lot cleaner to me :) 

Finally, this is still WIP. I'm sure there's a bunch of stuff I've missed and corner cases I havent accounted for. The obvious TODO's I've identified is getting rid of the hardcoded error strings and replace them with string resources. (The old implementation also used hardcoded strings btw). Furthermore, it would be nice to get rid of the Toast messages and replace them with as Snackbar message instead. I saw some discussion somewhere yesterday of doing that globally through the app so I'll leave that up to you guys for now as that can easily be fixed later.

Looking forward to your feedback. Hope this makes sense. There is still room for a lot of cleanup here but at least it's a lot nicer than it was imho.

title: adapter: Pass valid context to setImageDrawable()-call.
body:
Pass a valid `Context` to the call to setImageDrawable(). With the recently refactored theming syntax introduced in 5b432b3ed0a608d50388768f0503e47b1504afe8 the null `Context` passed here seemingly results in an NPE crash.

Fixes #2502.

title: Null context passed in ActivitiesListAdapter. Results in NPE crash.
label: [Label(name="bug"), Label(name="pr exists")]
body:
I'm assuming this is due to 5b432b3ed0a608d50388768f0503e47b1504afe8 but the null value passed as the context argument at L257 in the ActivityListAdapter now results in a NullPointerException crash. 

https://github.com/nextcloud/android/blob/3aad742e0c1f9d4f44c96bd2b9ca5863c9efb1f6/src/main/java/com/owncloud/android/ui/adapter/ActivityListAdapter.java#L257

Context.getResources() is being called on the passed null value which leads to the crash.

The issue seems to be fixed when a valid context object is passed to the `setImageDrawable` call.

PR coming shorty.

title: Use userId for webdav search
body:
Fix #2400 
* [x] Needs https://github.com/nextcloud/android-library/pull/141

We have two different things:
- loginname (username in our app): 
	- this is what you use to authenticate with, eg. on web ui or very first login on android app
	- it is used for re-authenticate once our token is expired
	- it can be different than userId on certain backends
- userID:
	- this is used for all new dav endpoints
	- it is a unique id for each server

The problem in #2400 was that loginname was used instead of userId.

Signed-off-by: tobiasKaminsky <tobias@kaminsky.me>

title: Fix double search
body:
Adding proposed fix by @AndyScherzinger (https://github.com/nextcloud/android/pull/1704#issuecomment-380098314)

Fixes #1908
Fixes #1704 
Fixes #2015
Fixes #1698 
Fixes #2100
Fixes #2198

`onViewStateRestored()` is executed directly after `onActivityCreated()` when starting the app / switching to e.g. favorite search from "all files". 
But after previewing a file from favorite search, only `onViewStateRestored()` is called, therefore we need to keep it there and thus remove it in `onActivityCreated()`.

Signed-off-by: tobiasKaminsky <tobias@kaminsky.me>

title: Roadmap: file detail & new sharing
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
During hackweek @jancborchardt draw a new sharing system, which is nearly the same as web UI and which should then be also in sync with iOS.

* [x] Iteration 1 for File detail & new sharing #2533 (revamped UI approach)
* [x] Iteration 2 for File detail & new sharing #2573 (sharing in general)
* [x] Iteration 3 for File detail & new sharing #2671 (e-mail sharing permissions, details)
* [x] Iteration 4 for File detail & new sharing #2700 (create e-mail shares)
* [x] Iteration 5 for File detail & new sharing #2690 (comments)
* [x] Display copy icon and adding send action to the link menu #2730
* [x] Share link creation via bottom sheet for files in OCFileList #2747
* [x] implement #2742
* [ ] Add label/tag support - TBD
* [ ] Remove legacy sharing screen completely - TBD

Enhanced file detail view:
![detail](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5836855/38919147-102edd3a-42f0-11e8-8fcb-3b4403b27f6b.jpg)
This is an enhanced view for images/videos which have a preview:
- no overflow menu on top, but next to filename
- clicking on star toggles favorite
- tags opens up editing
- activity and sharing as "tabs" which can be toggled

Activity tab:
- combined activity, comments, versions (endpoint on server side is needed for this, https://github.com/nextcloud/server/issues/658)
- on top: text input box for commenting

Share tab:
![sharing](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5836855/38919558-32a34026-42f1-11e8-8c11-0b33347f3528.jpg)
- sharees are sorted by permissions (from max permissions to read only)
- on each sharee there is an overflow menu with its specific sharing permissions

Sharing to a new user/group/link:
- click on text input on share tab hides activity/sharing toggle to have more space for actually searching
- share link as entry beneath search field
	- with "can edit" 
	- click on it opens up existing app chooser to receive link
- during input we show the list of results
	- username
	- group
	- federated sharing
	- share by mail

![2018-04-18-102204](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5836855/38919944-5ed57262-42f2-11e8-8d79-1e14863440d3.png)
- share (left) -> opens up share dialog of file detail
- link (right) -> directly creates read-only link (if needed) and open list with apps to send to. "copy link" should be first entry as otherwise users might not find it (@schiessle)

cc: @rullzer @marinofaggiana for other clients

This is an overview issue, where I will link each PRs into it.
My plan is to do this step by step, so that each PR is rather small.

Of course any feedback is welcome :-)

title: [Suggestion] Migrate to MVP
label: [Label(name="enhancement"), Label(name="needs info/discussion"), Label(name="pr exists")]
body:
The current codebase is a bit difficult to work with in my opinion. Unit testing is especially difficult and it doesnt seem like a testable design architecture is being used. There are about a gazillion different architectures and patterns out there and while I have by no means tested them all I find that MVP is easy to understand and test. Additionally, you could consider something like the repository pattern for easier API development.

I'll be happy to create PR with a proposed MVP example. I havent been able to find the easiest place to start as it's pretty time consuming trying to wrap my head around the various bits and pieces related to an isolated activity and/or view.

Migrating to a cleaner architecture means we can actually write effective unit tests for the application. MVP would make it trivial to write unit tests for the presenter and instrumented tests for the view for full code coverage. 

* [x] #2504
* [ ] TBD

title: Set timeouts instead of using defaults in connectivity checks
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
default timeouts appear to be 60 sec

https://github.com/nextcloud/android-library/blob/70f0f44500a0ac14822b4723104cfd3f21572e08/src/com/owncloud/android/lib/common/OwnCloudClientFactory.java#L55

https://github.com/nextcloud/android-library/blob/70f0f44500a0ac14822b4723104cfd3f21572e08/src/com/owncloud/android/lib/common/OwnCloudClientFactory.java#L52

I think it would make sense to set shorter timeouts for connection checks like in this case...

https://github.com/nextcloud/android/blob/1cbee0e903e2cc7ef22cf417ae8cd537dbb97677/src/main/java/com/owncloud/android/utils/ConnectivityUtils.java#L69

title: isInternetWalled returns wrong value for servers behind firewall
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
isInternetWalled "pings" the server only if device is online ***and*** is using WiFi. 
Current implementation is missing the use case in which server is not reachable (e.g. because server is behind firewall or in maintenance mode). 

Assuming server requires VPN to work, isInternetWalled returns wrong value:
If the device is connected without VPN and not using WiFi: isOnlineWithWifi returns false, Device.getNetworkType returns != ANY and as a consequence isInternetWalled returns false, this in turn allows synch jobs to start even if server is not reachable.

Why is the server not contacted if the device is connected, but not using WiFi?  

I suggest to replace
https://github.com/nextcloud/android/blob/1cbee0e903e2cc7ef22cf417ae8cd537dbb97677/src/main/java/com/owncloud/android/utils/ConnectivityUtils.java#L52
with
`if (!Device.getNetworkType(context).equals(JobRequest.NetworkType.ANY)) {`

title: Instant crash when switching to "raster mode"
body:
### Actual behaviour
When you switch to "raster view" in a folder with photos, the app instantly crashes.
Restarting the app and revisiting the same folder keeps crashing the app.
However, visiting other folders still  "list view" is still possible, so it seems the raster setting is a per folder setting.

### Expected behaviour
It does not crash and displays the photos as it should.
 
### Steps to reproduce
1. Go to a folder with photos in it
2. Select "rasterindeling" (this is Dutch, i do not know the exact wording in English) from the options menu (3 dots on the right top of the screen)
3. "Nextcloud is stopped" appears and you can submit a report


### Environment data
Android version: 6.0.1

Device model:  samsung s5

title: Added a splash screen
label: [Label(name="design")]
body:
Resolves #2444

Added a splash screen. This is done by defining a launch screen theme with an associated XML resource that configures the appearance. Then we associate the launch screen theme with the launcher activity (`FileDisplayActivity`) in the manifest. Finally, we set the default theme in `onCreate()` before super in `FileDisplayActivity` so that it's applied when the activity is ready to the view is set. 

This approach is better than implementing the launch screen as a separate activity since we dont get the negative performance impact of adding an additional activity transition every time the app is started.

I used the default logo drawable which I think looks fine but I'm sure the designers should chime in and give their input. Screenshot is attached.

![screenshot_20180409-220616](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/366855/38520292-ac42efae-3c42-11e8-9fa7-2b26e5360c4b.png)

This fixes #2444

title: Possibility of locking the app with fingerprint with PIN fallback
body:
Currently the Nextcloud App can be locked only with either fingerprint or pin. This is an issue if for some reason fingerprint reader is not available but the pin can be known. Usually apps use the fingerprint first/pin or passcode fallback. 
Nextcloud could use this with enforcing a pin to be set then fingerprint be enabled.

title: On Lineage OS 15.1 wifi connection is not detected if VPN is connected
label: [Label(name="bug"), Label(name="needs info/discussion")]
body:
### Actual behaviour
- Tell us what happens

I have Nextcloud configured to upload photos if i am connected to wifi and the phone is charging. I use an always-on VPN when im not on my home wifi.
If i am somewhere else and i have wifi connection, phone is charging and the VPN is connected ( workplace etc) Nextcloud does not upload photos and videos, it lists the files but in the "waiting for wifi" state.
It works as expected if i connect only to wifi.

### Expected behaviour
- Tell us what should happen
 When i connect to a wifi regardless if have a VPN connected or not, it should upload photos and videos.

### Steps to reproduce
1. Set Nextcloud to upload photos/videos on wifi+charge
2. Connect to an always-on VPN (restrictive, all traffic redirected through it)
3. Take some pics/videos, connect to wifi, put the phone to charge

### Environment data
Android version:
Android 8.1.0_r15(Lineage OS 15.1 Unofficial)

Device model: 
Lenovo K6 Power

Stock or customized system:
Customized

Nextcloud app version:
3.1.0RC1
Nextcloud server version:

### Logs
#### Web server error log
```
Insert your webserver log here
```

#### Nextcloud log (data/nextcloud.log)
```
Insert your Nextcloud log here
```
**NOTE:** Be super sure to remove sensitive data like passwords, note that everybody can look here! You can use the Issue Template application to prefill some of the required information: https://apps.nextcloud.com/apps/issuetemplate

title: Enhance what's new screen
label: [Label(name="design")]
body:
Fixes #2396 

- make top header is not bold
- more spacing above and below the top header
- less space between feature header and feature detail text

title: Add splash screen for Nextcloud
label: [Label(name="design"), Label(name="enhancement"), Label(name="needs info/discussion"), Label(name="pr exists")]
body: When you do not have Nextcloud app running already on your Android phone and you turn it on, you will receive a blank screen initially while the application starts up. My recommendation is to add a splash screen which can then be customized by anyone who wishes to compile their version. This splash screen would show up while the application initializes.

title: Improve uploading/sharing options
label: [Label(name="design"), Label(name="enhancement"), Label(name="needs info/discussion")]
body:
I am running Android 8.1.0 and have found the options currently there in the app for example when you press the "share" button in the application for a specific folder:

https://i.imgur.com/5Jq4VXH.png

My recommendation would be the following:

Change "share" option to Share Settings"
Remove the options below "share" and "link" and add "send file" option instead.

Also if you press the Messages button and the file is extremely large as my file is 646.7MB this would cause issues in the sending the actual files, I feel that Nextcloud app should have some kind of limit to prevent the user from inadvertently causing themselves issues when sending files too large.

title: FileContentProvider: limit calling package check
body:
As calling package is only the package name, we can use equals instead of contains, so we can prevent other apps like com.nextcloud.client2

Signed-off-by: tobiasKaminsky <tobias@kaminsky.me>
