title: E2E: Private key decryption fails on fresh install. IV mismatch
label: [Label(name="E2E"), Label(name="needs info/discussion")]
body:
I've tested the following on API level 23 with the code from master and on API level 27 with #2154 and the same issue happens on both. 

Steps to reproduce: 

1. Install the app, create an encrypted folder, saving the pass phrase. 
2. Uninstall the app, re-install it
3. Try to access the encrypted folder. You are prompted for the pass phrase. Enter the previously used pass phrase.
4. Decryption fails. The user is hinted about the pass phrase possibly being incorrect.

Debugging reveals that the pass phrase is being parsed correctly and matches the one used to encrypt the private key in step 1. However, the IV is completely different. It's not clear to me how the IV is retrieved across re-installs of the app so that they can match up. Is the IV stored server-side along with the salt?

Currently, this means that it's impossible to recover your encrypted files should you ever change devices or re-install the app. 

What am I missing here?

title: App access.
body:
Hello guys,

Don't know if this already exists in a closed testing app, but, I think we should have access to as many apps as you guys can adapt for the mobile app, like video calling with "talk" and others. Is there a payed app or something for this ?

Thanks in advance.

title: Encryption: Get IV directly from the cipher object when encrypting the private key
label: [Label(name="E2E")]
body:
In Android O and newer (at least) javax.crypto.spec.IvParameterSpec is unsupported. Get the IV directly from the cipher object instead. This has been tested on API level 27 and found to work well. E2E encryption keys can now be stored correctly since the private key can be encrypted successfully.

This fixes #2134 and all the other issues describing the same issue.

title: If app fails to store the E2E encryption keys the public key should be deleted from the server
label: [Label(name="E2E"), Label(name="bug"), Label(name="pr exists")]
body:
Currently, the public key is posted to the E2E server side app and stored there for the user before the Android app tries to store the associated keys locally. If this fails, the user is prompted to create a new key the next time they try to go through the encryption process. This will then always fail because the server will return a 409 error as a public key already exists. I think the correct behavior would be to send a DELETE request to the E2E API to remove the uploaded public key.

Furthermore, the private key needs to be removed as well.

title: User information leaking through debug logs.
body:
adb logcat reveals several debug log entries marked with "GetRemoteUserInfoOperation". Here is one example.

`02-09 23:12:33.410 28516  3060 D GetRemoteUserInfoOperation: Successful response: {"ocs":{"meta":{"status":"ok","statuscode":100,"message":"OK","totalitems":"","itemsperpage":""},"data":{"enabled":"true","id":"xxx","quota":{"free":110406975803,"used":50654297797,"total":161061273600,"relative":31.45,"quota":161061273600},"email":"xxx@xxx.xx","phone":"","address":"","website":"https:\/\/redacted.com","twitter":"@redacted","groups":["admin"],"language":"en","display-name":"Redacted"}}}
`

It makes sense to print these as a debugging measure, but it doesnt belong in a production ready deployment. My recommendation would either be to use a wrapper class to filter the log prints away from RELEASE builds or use Proguard to filter out the debug code completely.

The weird thing is that I havent been able to figure out where in the source these are coming from.

title: Release 3.1.0 - Roadmap
body:
As discussed, we want to release approx. every 2 months, so RC1 will be tagged at 23.03.18.

- [x] Bump version name and version code in ```build.gradle``` files
- [x] Update ```CHANGELOG.md``` adding new features
- [x] check if code is outdated due to last supported server version @NextcloudServer annotation

**Test app with all supported Android versions**
- access all activities
- auto upload
- upload / download files/folders
- use external sdcard
- what's new slides correctly shown on first start

**To be fixed**
- [x] #2439 
- [x] #2438 

**Translation update**
- [x] fetch latest transifex translations -> #2456

**merge PR** 
- [x] #2451
- [x] #2452
- [x] #2453
- [x] https://github.com/nextcloud/android/pull/2456

All tests on
  - [x] Android 4
  - [x] Android 5
  - [x] Android 6
  - [x]  Android 7

**RC1**
- [x] Verify that the new version number is shown in settings
- [x] Verify that logging is enabled
- [x] Tag new version as ```rc-3.1.0-01```
- [x] Build and release to Play Store as beta release and :shipit: 
- [x] Publish it on f-droid as optional release: edit metadata and open new merge request on gitlab
- [x] Verify that it is shown on f-droid (within 24h)
- [x] ~Publish APK (generic) to https://download.nextcloud.com/android/~

**RC2**
- [x] Verify that the new version number is shown in settings
- [x] Verify that logging is enabled
- [x] Tag new version as ```rc-3.1.0-02```
- [x] Build and release to Play Store as beta release and :shipit: 
- [x] Publish it on f-droid as optional release: edit metadata and open new merge request on gitlab
- [x] ~Verify that it is shown on f-droid (within 24h)~
- [x] ~Publish APK (generic) to https://download.nextcloud.com/android/~

**Final Release, after two weeks time (max) of latest RC release**
- [x]  replace screenshots (https://github.com/nextcloud/screenshots/tree/master/android/phone)
- [x] Verify that the new version number is shown in settings
- [x] Verify that logging is disabled
- [x] update translations from transifex
- [x] Test that what's new is shown correctly on upgrade
- [x] Tag new version as ```stable-3.1.0```
- [x] Build and release to Play Store as stable release and :shipit: 
- [x] Update Play store changelog based on condensed ```CHANGELOG.md``` infos
- [x] Verify that it is shown on f-droid (within 24h)
- [x] Publish APK (generic) to https://download.nextcloud.com/android/

title: Auto-uploaded files that are moved to app folder are deleted from local storage the next time the folder is viewed in the app
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
exactly the same issue like described in #735 and fixed by @tobiasKaminsky 
### Actual behaviour
After images are taken and auto-uploaded, they are moved to the app folder as expected. However, the next time the folder containing those images are viewed in the Nextcloud app, the images are deleted.

### Expected behaviour
The images should not be deleted and should appear with a green checkmark as with all other locally-available files.

### Steps to reproduce
1. Enable auto upload for e.g. the camera
2. Change "Original file will be..." to "moved to app folder"
3. Take a picture
4. View the upload subfolder of the app folder in a file explorer and notice that the image has been moved there
5. Open the upload folder in the app and notice that the newly-uploaded image has a green checkmark, then see the checkmark is gone and file is deleted in file system
6. View the upload subfolder of the app folder in a file explorer again and notice that the image is gone

## Environment data
Android version:

Device model: 
Redmi 4x

Stock or customized system:
LineageOS

Nextcloud app version: 3.0.0

Nextcloud server version: 13.0.0

title: File Observer indicator
label: [Label(name="bug"), Label(name="pr exists")]
body: I think it is a poor choice to have this icon always present on the device, especially without an ability to disable it. This bar should be left for notifications in my view and is arguably the standard for apps.

Just a improvement proposal! :)

HANNES

title: End threads on end of lifecycle
label: [Label(name="approved"), Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
For example if you have a list of files, for which thumbnails needs to be generated, these ~10 are queued and executed in this order. If you meanwhile click on an image, the generation of the resized image/scale down of the big image is done afterwards.

--> Every fragment / activity should "kill" their threads when it is closed/hidden.

title: Offline file is reset to cached content during editing.
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
### Actual behaviour
While editing a file marked as offline (and saving changes), the file occasionally gets reset to the last synced cached version (or does not update with what was just saved), eradicating any changes made since the last sync.

### Expected behaviour
The file should not get updated until synchronised online, and should be in the state that it was last saved in by the editing program.
 
### Steps to reproduce
1. Open a file that is marked as offline.
2. Make some changes to the file using droidedit and save.
3. Reopen the file from nextcloud (before synchronising). The changes are lost. The file may also  change during editing and force a reload, losing all changes.

### Environment data
Android version:
5.1.1

Device model: 
Google nexus 10, original, also occurs on Blackberry priv with 6.0.1 stock

Stock or customized system:
Stock

Nextcloud app version:
3.0.0

Nextcloud server version:
13

### Logs
Logs and webserver version irrelevant as this is an offline issue.

title: Account deletion is too well hidden
label: [Label(name="enhancement"), Label(name="needs info/discussion")]
body:
### Actual behaviour
Deleting the account is too hidden.

### Expected behaviour
Most users we have tested this with, do not find out how to delete the account. Have the account deletion not that well hidden. Maybe not in the three dots menu at the top of the user page, but on the user page itself. Or even earlier than that in one of the menus.
 
### Steps to reproduce
1. Click on the menu in the top left.
2. Click on the user name.
3. Click on "Manage accounts"
4. Click on the account name.
5. Click on the three dots in the menu on the top right.
6. Click on "Delete account"

Moto G5 Plus

2.0.5

title: Idea: Upload only when connected to "x" network
label: [Label(name="enhancement"), Label(name="needs info/discussion")]
body:
I'm really dying for the ability to allow automatic uploading only when connected to a specific network.

Currently I'm using Tasker to basically start the Nextcloud app only when I am connected to my home network. When on the local network where my Nextcloud server is running it allows uploading of images 100x faster. The problem is the mess of having to set this up and kill the app on a device reboot (so it won't upload on the wrong network).

Could we please get a simple feature to specific the SSID of networks we allow auto upload jobs to run when connected to?

Thanks.

title: Upload fails due to connection timeout (connection seems cached)
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
### Actual behaviour
I noticed this happening intermittently. Took me some time to hunt it enough to create issue. Basically, my automatic uploads are failing and files will not be uploaded after I switch from telco provider internet to wi-fi. Only solution seems to be to restart phone (killing app doesn't seem to help). My upload directory is set to "only on wi-fi". I take a picture while away from home (on telco 4G connection), and when I am back home, upload is failing.

Now, weird thing in exception is mentioning of address "217.65.192.33". This is not my Nextcloud server and [searching for it online](https://duckduckgo.com/?q=217.65.192.33) gives that it is gateway of my provider. I do not know what the heck is my telco provider's gateway doing in exception *after* I have been connected to wi-fi:) This is why I am suspecting it has to do something with caching of connections, but I am not sure. I am hoping experts can help.

This is [where I commented](https://help.nextcloud.com/t/android-app-cant-connect/24615/10) and which seems like a similar (or same) issue (not ipv6 related, I think).

### Expected behaviour
Upload should work:)
 
### Steps to reproduce
1. Set up directory to automatically upload on wi-fi only
2. Go to telco internet connection (away from where any wi-fi will be automatically connected),
3. restart phone, so any connection cache is cleared
4. Take a picture
5. ??? (cannot easily reproduce, not sure what it is, but there ain't no profit afterwards:)
6. Go back to wi-fi connection
7. Automatic upload should upload picture, but it is not working with ConnectionTimeout


### Environment data
Android version:
6

Device model: 
Samsung J5

Stock or customized system:
LineageOS

Nextcloud app version:
2.0

Nextcloud server version:
12

title: Auto uploads 'Waiting for Wi-Fi' when connected to VPN over Wi-Fi
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
### Actual behaviour
For auto upload of photos, I have the setting enabled 'Only upload on Wi-Fi' enabled. This option works fine on Wi-Fi without VPN enabled. With VPN enabled, all my uploads sit in the queue with 'Waiting on Wi-Fi'. 

I did a little debugging and built my own APK with additional logging and the call to Device.getNetworkType() is returning NOT_ROAMING. It looks like this decision is made in the android-job library which is making a call to ConnectivityManagerCompat.isActiveNetworkMetered() (https://github.com/evernote/android-job/blob/master/library/src/main/java/com/evernote/android/job/util/Device.java#L107) which is returning true for some reason when connected over VPN. 

This lead me down a path of finding out that Android adheres to a DHCP option that can set the network as metered, so I thought maybe the Wi-Fi network I was connected to was returning this value (although I would expect it to exhibit same behavior without VPN connected). I followed the instructions here (https://stackoverflow.com/questions/23877476/android-why-connectivitymanager-isactivenetworkmetered-always-returning-true#23879816) to explicitly mark my Wi-Fi as unmetered but I still am seeing the same behavior where network type is returning as NOT_ROAMING.

Some additional debug logging I added to UploadFileOperation.java when connected to VPN:
```
02-02 22:17:56.067 12027 12070 I UploadFileOperation: DEBUG: networkInfo.getType(): 1
02-02 22:17:56.577 12027 12070 I UploadFileOperation: DEBUG: networkInfo.getTypeName(): WIFI
02-02 22:17:56.842 12027 12070 I UploadFileOperation: DEBUG: networkInfo.isAvailable(): true
02-02 22:17:57.192 12027 12070 I UploadFileOperation: DEBUG: networkInfo.isConnected(): true
02-02 22:19:54.116 12027 12070 I UploadFileOperation: DEBUG: Device.getNetworkType(mContext): NOT_ROAMING
```

### Expected behaviour
When I'm connected on Wi-Fi, ignore the fact I'm connected to VPN, and upload my photos.
 
### Steps to reproduce
1. Connect to strongSwan VPN
2. Enable 'Only upload on Wi-Fi' option for camera photos
3. Take a photo
4. Photo sits in queue 'Waiting for Wi-fi'

### Environment data
Android version: 8.1

Device model: Pixel XL

Stock or customized system: customized (CopperheadOS)

Nextcloud app version: latest (built from master)

Nextcloud server version: 12.0.5

### Logs
Nothing useful in the server logs

title: Apply new theming when folder refresh finishes
label: [Label(name="1. developing")]
body:
When synchronization of the folder finishes it is possible that theming can also change. At this moment it is not possible to tell. So what we do is to re-setup parts of the UI to stay consistent with the server theming.


===

This is not even close to being elegant solution, but at the moment so many things would required to be hanged that the small pain of re-setup views doesn't sound as a bad trade-off.

The purest of the solution would require the following:
* Storing capabilities should be moved from ContentResolver to other database API, preferably Room, since it supports LiveData
* Activity should subscribe to the database by using LiveData for any theming changes, then apply them to its subchildren. Fragments could do the same
* Ideally there should be a way to generate Theme object on the fly and apply it to the children, doable, but have several drawbacks

title: Fix upgrade from 1.4.3 to 3.0.0
body:
As checkIfColumnExists is not working reliable when the same column is altered within the same onUpgrade(), we need to check the old version.
1.4.3 has versionCode 20, so if you upgrade from this, it will get all needed columns on the respective upgrade step and therefore we can ignore it in the sanity step 30.
For all other version the sanity step 30 is needed as it can happen due to beta/alpha testing, that some columns are missing.

--> next time we never ever are allowed to change upgrade once it is published

Signed-off-by: tobiasKaminsky <tobias@kaminsky.me>

title: Capabilities update are not distributing on live view
label: [Label(name="approved"), Label(name="bug"), Label(name="pr exists")]
body:
When user is updating the list, it often happens that server capabilities are also updated.
Server capabilities for instance contains theming colors. After refreshing is completed FileDisplayActivity is refreshing its fragments, which are refreshing its list adapter.
The list adapter is getting the theme information directly from ThemeUtils, which has up to date information about coloring. So what happens if theme is changed between refreshes is that the icons are changing colors and app theming stays the same.
![zrzut ekranu 2018-01-30 o 17 30 17](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1734309/35578047-5140af8c-05e3-11e8-911e-16e28c961fbe.png)
This might lead to some bad user experience, from visual point of view, but could have more devastating causes, (undeleting?).
The question is do we care about such cases or should there be a mechanism which distributes the capabilities updates or at least the caller of update should be checking those and inform of potential updates?

title: Fixes #2070: Move the responsibility of FAB's theming to its owner

title: Use fetched userID
body:
Fix #2056 

As the current weblogin allows "TOBI" and returns also "TOBI" instead of "tobi" (which is the userid), we have to make sure that we have correct id for E2E.

This needs https://github.com/nextcloud/android-library/pull/114

Signed-off-by: tobiaskaminsky <tobias@kaminsky.me>

title: "Retry failed upload" button: show again after finishing queue
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
Currently the button is hidden after the first click to avoid too frequently restarting of failed uploads.
Better is to show the button again after processing of the queue is done, so that the user can click it again if  the first run remained failed uploads.

title: Fix for autoupload
body: Fixes #2000  and others.

title: Setting up encryption on another device
label: [Label(name="E2E"), Label(name="pr exists"), Label(name="release candidate")]
body:
### Actual behaviour
I have a NC 13.0.0 RC2 (now RC3) with the 1.0.2 E2E encryption app. I use it with 2 (already configured) android devices. I signed up for the Beta and both devices got updated to the 3.0.0 RC2 android clients.

On devce A I set a folder as encrypted, it showed me the 12 words passcode. I checked on the server and everything is encoded. Fine.

On device B I checked and the folder is shown as encrypted. I tried to enter that folder and it tells me, it is setting up encryption and creating a new key (obviously false behaviour). It then told me it could not write the key (because there already is one stored on the server?). 
On device B I set a second folder as encrypted. Worked. I tried to enter it, again it tried to set up encryption and write the key.
On device A I entered the encrypted folder and everything looks good.

I tried to manually configure the encryption with my keywords, but I could not find anything.
I uninstalled the nextcloud app on device B and reinstall and configure it. No change.

### Expected behaviour
If the encryption is already set up, I would expect a dialog to enter the keywords (passwords?), or the possibility to deconfigure the encryption and delete all encrypted data (with extra safety, please).
 
### Steps to reproduce
1. Configure encrypted folder on device A
2. Try to access that folder from device B

### Environment data
Android version: 
A/B: 7.0

Device model: 
A: Samsung Galaxy S7 Edge (SM-G935F)
B: Samsung Galaxy Tab S2 (SM-T810)

Stock or customized system:
A: Stock with Root
B: Stock

Nextcloud app version:
A/B: 3.0.0 RC2

Nextcloud server version:
3.0.0 RC2 (now RC3 but no change)

title: folder rename on server not visible in the device
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
### Actual behaviour
- the renamed folder is not available on the device. I.e. if I swipe down in the parent folder, there is no update. The view still shows the old folder.
- the rename is visible in the activities view.
- after clearing the cache in settings -> application the rename was visible.

### Expected behaviour
- the rename should be mirrored to the device, either automatically or at least when I reload (swipe down)
 
### Steps to reproduce
1. Go to a folder with several subfolders on the device
2. Rename one of the subfolders on the server (for instance via web browser)
3. Try to reload (swipe down) on the device

Android version: 8.0.0

Device model: Nokia 8

Stock or customized system: stock

Nextcloud app version: 3.0.0 RC 2

Nextcloud server version:
12.0.5

title: I do not see last uploads
label: [Label(name="bug"), Label(name="needs info/discussion"), Label(name="release candidate")]
body: the beta 3.0.0 rc2 application does not view the latest files uploaded by PC or in general those that are loaded even by forcing the update with the bottom panel

title: Autoupload only works for image file types
body:
### Actual behaviour
Non-image files in a monitored folder are not autouploaded to InstantUpload folders on the server.This has been the case since v2.0.0. Expert mode force rescan doesn't help. Unfortunately logs are not available because the v3 beta client crashes when trying to look at the logs, and the v2 client doesn't generate logs.

The Android client version prior to 2.0.0 would upload all files in a monitored folder, whether image or non-image. It would only allow selecting folders with images in them for autoupload, but at least once selected it would upload all the files in that folder.

### Expected behaviour
All files in an autoupload folder should be uploaded, not just image files.
 
### Steps to reproduce
1. Select folder for autoupload.
2. Add PDF or other non-image file to autoupload folder.
3. File is not uploaded to the server.


### Environment data
Android version: 8.1.0

Device model: Nexus 5X

Stock or customized system: Stock

Nextcloud app version: 3.0.0 RC2

Nextcloud server version: 12.0.3

### Logs
#### Web server error log

Webserver logs are not useful because the Android client doesn't try to upload non-image files.

title: Fix renaming folder
label: [Label(name="bug"), Label(name="high")]
body:
Filename must only be changed on encrypted files (a folder name itself is never encrypted)

Steps to test
- rename folder
- see if folder was renamed

This must be in 3.0 as it is a regression.
I'll see if google dev console has anything else critical, otherwise we need to have a RC3 for this :/

Signed-off-by: tobiaskaminsky <tobias@kaminsky.me>

title: Sharing encrypted folder
label: [Label(name="E2E"), Label(name="bug")]
body:
Hi,

**Issue**
An encrypted folder has been shared with a user and he can neither access the files in the folder nor upload to it. Maybe the sharing feature is simply not ready yet? 



**Setup**
Client: Android 6.0.1, Nextcloud Android 3.0.0 RC2
Server: Centos 7, PHP 7.0, Nextcloud 13, end_to_end_encryption app 1.0.3

**How to reproduce**
1) UserA creates an encrypted folder with userB
2) UserA uploads a file to the encrypted folder
3) UserA shares the encrypted folder with userB with all permissions available through webUI
4) UserB accesses the shared folder. The file names he sees are scrambled (a mix of numbers and lower case letters) and when he clicks to download a file, error with title "Download failed" and message "The file is no longer available on the server" appears
5) UserA uploads another file to the encrypted folder
6) UserB accesses the shared folder. Since step 5) it oddly appears empty now
7) UserB tries to upload a file to the shared folder, but upload fails


Thanks 😃

title: Auto-Upload completely messes up the nextcloud file base
label: [Label(name="AutoUpload"), Label(name="bug"), Label(name="pr exists")]
body:
### Actual behaviour
You can set up a custom auto upload folder. You can do so by selecting the local nextcloud data folder, hoping to get something resembling the two-way sync the windows client has been able do perform for years.
Actual behavior: the android client does upload the whole folder structure, **ignoring** folder names in the process. You end up with millions of files in the ROOT folder.

After deleting the messed up crap, I can sync as often as I want, the millions of files remain on the android client. I have to delete the account completely and re-setup everything

### Expected behaviour
Any behavior other than what is happening in the 3.0.0 RC2
Best guesses: don't accept the nextcloud data folder, if keeping the folder structure is such a big deal
 
### Steps to reproduce
1. using windows set up some files in subfolders
2.  sync everything to the android client. You have to select EVERY subfolder manually to do so.
3.  set up auto-upload to upload the /sdcard/0/nextcloud/user@server/ folder to /
4. sit back and watch the android client up- and downloading all the files

Nextcloud app version:
3.0.0 RC2
Nextcloud server version:
12

title: Butterknife: null
label: [Label(name="bug"), Label(name="pr exists")]
body:
>java.lang.NullPointerException: 
  at com.owncloud.android.ui.activity.ActivitiesListActivity.lambda$null$3$ActivitiesListActivity (ActivitiesListActivity.java:267)
  at com.owncloud.android.ui.activity.ActivitiesListActivity$$Lambda$5.run (Unknown Source)

https://github.com/nextcloud/android/blob/7a06cbce79eb2a232ea9663e923b92ef1a9b5a7d/src/main/java/com/owncloud/android/ui/activity/ActivitiesListActivity.java#L264-L276

-> swipeEmptyListRefreshLayout is null
This is set via ButterKnife.

title: Static Context
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
https://github.com/nextcloud/android/blob/f04f500669b1ea3c9fc85eb022b10f4345ae464e/src/main/java/com/owncloud/android/MainApp.java#L101-L101

> Do not place Android context classes in static fields; this is a memory leak (and also breaks Instant Run) less...
A static field will leak contexts.  Non-static inner classes have an implicit reference to their outer class. If that outer class is for example a Fragment or Activity, then this reference means that the long-running handler/loader/task will hold a reference to the activity which prevents it from getting garbage collected.  Similarly, direct field references to activities and fragments from these longer running instances can cause leaks.  ViewModel classes should never point to Views or non-application Contexts.

Maybe we can avoid this somehow?

title: Speed up sync
body:
- change order as file.getFileID() is faster than file.getRemotePath()
- enhance finding of encrypted ancestor

This reduces a fresh sync of a folder with 5k images from ~40s to 12s.

title: Do not ignore ignoreEtags
body:
Currently we have set ignoreEtags to true on refresh and on swap directories.
This leads to a full sync of folder and its direct content (fetching all metadata), even if the etag is not changed.

For browsing, refreshing I think it is safe to rely on changing Etags as this is the whole purpose of them.
@rullzer can you imagine any situation when you (on desktop) are doing a full resync of a folder?

"ignoreEtags" was introduced with this commit message, years ago:
> Add boolean parameter 'ignoreTag' to SyncronizeFolderOperation constructor and pass ignoreTag = true in calls to #startSyncFolderOperation at FileDisplayActivity and MoveActivity in #onRefresh()

title: How to enable auto-upload for all file types and not just pictures?
body:
On Nextcloud Android App v2.0.0 I am able to successfully auto-upload images to my Nextcloud server from Chromebook Pro. The problem is I don't want to just auto-upload pictures. I need everything to auto-upload that goes into this particular folder, such as tar.gz files and pdf files and 7z files and maybe binary files. I suspect this might be an intended limitation, but considering image-uploads work just fine I don't quite understand why it would be unavailable to other file types. As such, I've made an assumption that perhaps it must be available and I simply cannot find where to enable it. What really surprises me is I cannot find previous tickets, questions or forum posts about this particular subject as I would expect it to be a highly demanded feature.

Any suggestions would be appreciated.

title: Supported Android versions
label: [Label(name="needs info/discussion")]
body:
Looking at the actual Play store stats and the offline discussions I'd like to raise this topic:
Which Android versions should we support?

Right now we support 4.0.x - 8.x (aka latest)

The Play store stats for the bottom ranking Android versions are:
* Android version - active devices (total) - active devices (%)
* Android 4.4 - 5,928 - 3.9%
* Android 4.2 - 1,152 - 0.8%
* Android 4.1 - 865 - 0.6%
* Android 4.3 - 532 - 0.4%
* Android 4.0.x - 229 - 0.2%

This adds up to 5,9 percent or >8000 devices. 

I suggest to drop 4.0.x (no proper font support) at least or even 4.1 (no proper RTL support). 
To be discussed could be to drop all of the above mentioned and go for minimum version Android 5.

In any case I would vote for doing this after 3.1 hoping that E2E will then be shipping increment 2 and we have the second release with Nc13 support, so people could still use that release until Nc14 comes out (roughly a year) until then 4.x numbers should be even lower.

What do you think @tobiasKaminsky @mario @nextcloud/android ?

title: Switching Wifi only preference does not affect already queued jobs
label: [Label(name="enhancement"), Label(name="pr exists")]
body:
### Actual behaviour
The preference of whether uploading should be done over only Wifi or allow mobile data is stored into every queued job, instead of getting polled from the folder preferences. If a job is already queued, it will get queued using the initial settings that were set during its creation. Any changes to the settings after that are ignored.

### Expected behaviour
-A job belonging to the autoupload of a certain folder should poll the current settings of that folder to know how to proceed, not insist on using the settings that existed during the job creation.
 
### Steps to reproduce
-Have the Camera folder set to autoupload using Wifi only.
-Turn off Wifi
-Take a bunch of photos.
-You notice they are in the queue, but waiting for Wifi to upload
-Go to Camera autoupload preferences, switch off the "wifi only" option, to allow mobile data uploads.
-The queued jobs would still wait for Wifi.
-Taking a new photo will instantly upload over mobile data. But already queued ones will wait indefinetly till Wifi is turned on.

Workaround: Move the files to a temp folder. Force rescan, all jobs will fail as files are now missing. Copy the files to their original folder (moving for some reason didn't work, does the app keep inodes or something?), the App will now recreate the upload jobs using new settings. Once upload completes, delete temp folder.


### Environment data
Android version: 7

Device model: Samsung Note 8

Stock or customized system: Stock, December security update.

Nextcloud app version: 2.0.0

Nextcloud server version: 12.0.4

title: Files and folders are displayed twice after they had once marked as favorite
label: [Label(name="bug"), Label(name="pr exists"), Label(name="release candidate")]
body:
As requested in the help forum (https://help.nextcloud.com/t/help-test-the-android-3-0rc1-client/25912/14) , I've created this issue ticket. The root cause might be related to other issues which have already been reported, like https://github.com/nextcloud/android/issues/1908.

### Actual behaviour
After I’ve installed the latest app version (3.0 RC1) I realized the following behavior:

- In the past I had marked several folders and files as favorites which caused double entries in the favorites menu. Although I’ve removed the favorite marker, I still got double files and folders displayed if I browsed through the folder tree.

- I’ve removed all favorite markers in the app so that the favorites folder itself was empty. Nevertheless some of the favorite markers automatically reappearing after I’d refreshed the folder?!

As recommended in the help forum I tried to get rid of the double entries by using the refresh function. Unfortunately the refresh function seems not to work as expected because I wasn’t able to delete double entries by refresh the folder view. On my web server I saw that the app requested an update but it had no effect on how the sub-folder was displayed in the app.

### Expected behaviour
File and folder entries shouldn't be displayed twice if they had been marked as favorite for a while.
 
### Steps to reproduce
1. I decided to delete the app to start from scratch. After I've installed the app again and entering my credentials I opened the folder and now all sub-folders and files were only displayed once. Then I marked a file and a sub-folder as favorite and switch to the favorite menu entry in the app.
2. Surprisingly both favorites were displayed twice again. I return to the original folder and checked the original file and and folder entries again and now the **favorite** directory and file entries were displayed twice in that view too.
3. I wasn’t able to solve it be deselecting the favorite markers. The folder view still showed double entries.

It might be of relevance that the files and folders reside on a WebDAV share.

### Environment data

Device model: Samsung Galaxy S7
Stock or customized system: Stock ROM
Nextcloud app version: 3.0 RC1
Nextcloud server version: 12.0.4

title: Auto-upload not working since the 2.0 update
label: [Label(name="AutoUpload"), Label(name="bug")]
body:
### Actual behaviour
Files don't get auto-uploaded. Specifically, they're not queued as they are created; when I click "Force rescan" under Uploads, the Nextcloud app 'notices' them and uploads them perfectly, respecting the charging/WiFi requirement.

### Expected behaviour
New files in selected folders should be queued as they appear.
 
### Steps to reproduce
1. Set photos to be synced with a server-side folder.
2. Take a photo.
3. Auto-upload does not occur.


### Environment data
Android version: 5.1.1

Device model: Samsung Galaxy J3 (J320-FN)

Stock or customized system: SuperSU root and NextApp SDFix
Nextcloud app version: 2.0.1 (from F-Droid)

Nextcloud server version: 13.0.0 Beta 2

### Logs
#### Web server error log
n/a

#### Nextcloud log (data/nextcloud.log)
n/a

title: Context.startForegroundService() did not then call Service.startForeground()
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
Highest number of reports for ANRs since 2.0.0 in the Dev console - Android 8 only - >5K reports in 60 days

Reason I found google-ing: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/44425584/context-startforegroundservice-did-not-then-call-service-startforeground

> From Google's docs on Android 8.0 behavior changes:
> The system allows apps to call Context.startForegroundService() even while the app is in the background. However, the app must call that service's startForeground() method within five seconds after the service is created.

--> https://developer.android.com/about/versions/oreo/android-8.0-changes.html

title: Retrying failed uploads stops the app
label: [Label(name="bug"), Label(name="release candidate")]
body:
### Actual behaviour
- Retrying failed uploads stops the app

### Expected behaviour
- The failed uploads are retried
 
### Steps to reproduce
- Open Nextcloud
- Go to "Uploads" from sidebar
- Notice some uploads failed
- Select "retry failed uploads" from the `...` menu
- Get an Android system message "Nextcloud has stopped" with options to open again, send feedback,e tc.

### Environment data
Android version: 7.1.2

Device model: HTC One M9

Stock or customized system: Custom (LineageOS 14.1)

Nextcloud app version: 3.0.0 RC1

Nextcloud server version: 12.0.4

### Logs

No app logs.

#### Web server error log/Nextcloud log (data/nextcloud.log)

Omitted because it's probably not relevant, but I'll add it if you want.

Note that the uploads *do* still eventually happen if I re-launch the app and just let it run in the background.

Can you imagine where this happen? (It is quite often (216x since 11/17)

  at android.widget.AdapterView.performItemClick (AdapterView.java:345)
  at android.widget.AbsListView.performItemClick (AbsListView.java:1547)
  at android.widget.AbsListView$PerformClick.run (AbsListView.java:3821)
  at android.widget.AbsListView$3.run (AbsListView.java:5843)
  at android.os.Handler.handleCallback (Handler.java:739)
  at android.os.Handler.dispatchMessage (Handler.java:95)
  at android.os.Looper.loop (Looper.java:158)
  at android.app.ActivityThread.main (ActivityThread.java:7225)
  at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke (Native Method)
  at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit$MethodAndArgsCaller.run (ZygoteInit.java:1230)
  at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit.main (ZygoteInit.java:1120)
```

This happens when clicking on "retry failed uploads" (on expert mode I guess).
I cannot reproduce it.

Here we use IsInternetWalled() and this is maybe on main thread:
https://github.com/nextcloud/android/blob/45bcdebd9dd51c60ce7870dbe0547d2243cfe54c/src/main/java/com/owncloud/android/files/services/FileUploader.java#L384-L385

@mario do you have an idea how we can do this in thread/async task?

title: Android (playstore) app will not log in to server 12.04 backend
label: [Label(name="bug"), Label(name="needs info/discussion")]
body:
### Actual behaviour
- Unable to log in with either the Beta client or the regular android client. This happened on an install of server 12.03 and then an upgraded version of 12.04 as well as a fresh install of 12.04 (except I preserved the data folder). When attempting to log in I click the "grant access" button enter a user name and password and the app "spins" for ever before prompting me to revert to the older style login. Tailing the logs on the server shows that the request is made, I see responses from `remote.php/webdav` and some entries. When I try and invalid password the app still spins for ever but the server logs show the invalid access attempt. 

If I keep trying (I spent 3 hours trying to log in and debug this myself) one in maybe 20 tries the login succeeds but I am greeted with no files or folders and what appears to be constant scanning until either the app crashes or my screen goes to sleep. When either event happens the app is logged out (despite having clicked the "remember" option) and I have to start the whole process again.

Using a mobile browser yields no problems. Additionally, using the *owncloud beta* android app (which is free) allows me to log in and have the instant upload of my photos (which is my main concern). Desktop browsers as well as desktop integration works as expected so I am sure this is a problem with the android app. Previously I had no problems, I have been using the beta app for the last several months without issue

### Expected behaviour
- I expect to be able to log in and see my files as I am able to with the owncloud app
 
### Steps to reproduce
1.  Download the nextcloud-client app (or beta) from the play store
2.  Attempt to log in with username and password
3.  Never actually able to log in


### Environment data
Android version: Android 7.0 with Nov 6, 2017 security patches
Kernel: 4.1.18-g6583b88

Device model:  Honor 6XXX

Stock or customized system: Stock

Nextcloud app version: Latest version from the play store (as well as the latest beta)

Nextcloud server version: 12.04

### Logs
#### Web server error log
```
To follow shortly when I test 
```

#### Nextcloud log (data/nextcloud.log)
```
Unable to locate nextcloud.log, it does not show up in filesystem searches and `data/com.nextcloud.client` has no logs
```

title: Cannot accept federation-shared file
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
### Actual behaviour
In the Activity pane, clicking on the filename of a file that has been shared to me shows a toast with "File not found!".
This occurs only when opening a file from a federated share.

### Expected behaviour
The app should open the file if already accepted by another interface.
If the file has not yet been accepted or declined, it should open a dialog to choose to accept or decline the file.
 
### Steps to reproduce
1. Be shared a file from a federated instance
2. Open 'Activity' pane
3. Click on shared file's name


### Environment data
Android version: 7.1.1

Device model: motorola XT1562

Stock or customized system: Stock

Nextcloud app version: 2.0.0

Nextcloud server version: 12.0.4

### Logs
#### Web server error log
(This is the access log, the error log is empty.)
```
1.2.4.8 - christopher [15/Jan/2018:19:16:03 +0100] "PROPFIND /remote.php/webdav/null HTTP/1.1" 404 1022 "-" "Mozilla/5.0 (Android) ownCloud-android/2.0.0"
```
#### Nextcloud log (data/nextcloud.log)
(Just one line, the adjacent lines said the same.)
```
{"reqId":"Q3K70wSdh6EucrRSFvUS","level":0,"time":"2018-01-15T18:15:33+00:00","remoteAddr":"1.2.4.8","user":"christopher","app":"webdav","method":"PROPFIND","url":"\/remote.php\/webdav\/null","message":"Exception: {\"Exception\":\"Sabre\\\\DAV\\\\Exception\\\\NotFound\",\"Message\":\"File with name null could not be located\",\"Code\":0,\"Trace\":\"#0 \\\/var\\\/www\\\/html\\\/3rdparty\\\/sabre\\\/dav\\\/lib\\\/DAV\\\/Server.php(967): OCA\\\\DAV\\\\Connector\\\\Sabre\\\\ObjectTree->getNodeForPath('null')\\n#1 \\\/var\\\/www\\\/html\\\/3rdparty\\\/sabre\\\/dav\\\/lib\\\/DAV\\\/Server.php(1666): Sabre\\\\DAV\\\\Server->getPropertiesIteratorForPath('null', Array, 0)\\n#2 \\\/var\\\/www\\\/html\\\/3rdparty\\\/sabre\\\/dav\\\/lib\\\/DAV\\\/CorePlugin.php(355): Sabre\\\\DAV\\\\Server->generateMultiStatus(Object(Generator), false)\\n#3 [internal function]: Sabre\\\\DAV\\\\CorePlugin->httpPropFind(Object(Sabre\\\\HTTP\\\\Request), Object(Sabre\\\\HTTP\\\\Response))\\n#4 \\\/var\\\/www\\\/html\\\/3rdparty\\\/sabre\\\/event\\\/lib\\\/EventEmitterTrait.php(105): call_user_func_array(Array, Array)\\n#5 \\\/var\\\/www\\\/html\\\/3rdparty\\\/sabre\\\/dav\\\/lib\\\/DAV\\\/Server.php(479): Sabre\\\\Event\\\\EventEmitter->emit('method:PROPFIND', Array)\\n#6 \\\/var\\\/www\\\/html\\\/3rdparty\\\/sabre\\\/dav\\\/lib\\\/DAV\\\/Server.php(254): Sabre\\\\DAV\\\\Server->invokeMethod(Object(Sabre\\\\HTTP\\\\Request), Object(Sabre\\\\HTTP\\\\Response))\\n#7 \\\/var\\\/www\\\/html\\\/apps\\\/dav\\\/appinfo\\\/v1\\\/webdav.php(76): Sabre\\\\DAV\\\\Server->exec()\\n#8 \\\/var\\\/www\\\/html\\\/remote.php(162): require_once('\\\/var\\\/www\\\/html\\\/a...')\\n#9 {main}\",\"File\":\"\\\/var\\\/www\\\/html\\\/apps\\\/dav\\\/lib\\\/Connector\\\/Sabre\\\/ObjectTree.php\",\"Line\":173}","userAgent":"Mozilla\/5.0 (Android) ownCloud-android\/2.0.0","version":"12.0.4.3"}
```

A resulting problem of this is that I cannot accept shared files within the app, anywhere. I have to use the other interfaces.

title: SSL initialisation failed
body:
### Actual behaviour
The app is unable to establish initial connection with the host. This error is shown:
"SSL initialisation failed"

### Expected behaviour
The connection should be established and user should receive a possibility to log in.
 
### Steps to reproduce
1. Install Nextcloud app on Samsung J5 (2017)
2. Type in the domain name of Nextcloud server.
3. Receive error.


### Environment data
Android version: 7.0

Device model: Samsung J530FXXU1AQI3

Stock or customized system: stock (Samsung Experience - 8.1)

Nextcloud app version: 2.0.0 (tried both Playmarket and F-Droid)

Nextcloud server version: 12.0.4

### Logs
#### Web server error log
No logs

#### Nextcloud log (data/nextcloud.log)
No logs

The thing is that the issue is more than weird. I do have an older smartphone Meizu M2 with Android 5.1 and Flyme OS 4.5.3I and Nextcloud app is working well with Nextcloud server.

Here is server SSL configuration:

```
        listen 443 ssl http2;
        ssl on;
        ssl_certificate /etc/nginx/ssl/ec.crt;
        ssl_certificate_key /etc/nginx/ssl/ec.key;
        ssl_protocols TLSv1.2;
        ssl_prefer_server_ciphers on;
        ssl_ciphers "ECDHE-ECDSA-CHACHA20-POLY1305 EECDH+ECDSA+AESGCM !aNULL !eNULL !LOW !3DES !MD5 !EXP !PSK !SRP !DSS !RC4 !SEED !CAMELLIA";
        ssl_session_cache shared:SSL:10m;
        ssl_session_tickets off;
        ssl_ecdh_curve auto;
        ssl_stapling on;
        ssl_stapling_verify on;
        ssl_trusted_certificate /etc/nginx/ssl/full-chain.crt;
```

The certificate is generated with secp384r1 elliptic curve and Must-Staple extension, however that shouldn't be a problem, since it is working with older Android.

I commented each additional directive one by one until just a standard SSL setup left and tested the app but it didn't connect. 

Unfortunately, the device is not rooted and I'm not able to get logs from Samsung, tried with CatLog.

Server details if needed:
OS: Ubuntu 16.04
Web server: Nginx 1.13.6
OpenSSL: 1.1.0f  25 May 2017
PHP: 7.0.15

title: Release next version as 2.5 or even 3.0
body:
cc @tobiasKaminsky @AndyScherzinger @jospoortvliet 

Due to a lot of changes, namely:

1) Storage improvements
2) IPv6 support
3) Encryption

And a thousand papercuts, I'm in favour of release version 2.5 or even 3.0, rather than 2.1.

What do you think?

title: Remove unused resource
body:
Fixes lint error

Signed-off-by: tobiaskaminsky <tobias@kaminsky.me>

title: Add support for slightly modified nc13 background (bigger dots)
body:
Fix #1869 
Needs https://github.com/nextcloud/android-library/pull/108

This now supports 
- NC13
	- custom image
	- dots with any color
	- plain color
- NC12
	- plain color
	- custom image

Signed-off-by: tobiaskaminsky <tobias@kaminsky.me>

title: Share permission dialog
label: [Label(name="design"), Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
### Actual behaviour
- The sharing permission dialog looks strange.

### Expected behaviour
- The iOS app looks better here. I would say that the options should all be a checkbox or a slider and they should be all named like 'kann ...'.
 
### Steps to reproduce
1. Share a file / folder and edit the permissions.

### Environment data
Android:

![android](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1869584/34871027-5140782e-f78c-11e7-871a-f059eaddafdf.png)

iOS:

![ios](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1869584/34871276-5da583ba-f78d-11e7-9b9b-fb4c980dd74d.png)

title: New, overhauled data storage management
body:
Improved & rebased version of the awesome community PR found here:
https://github.com/nextcloud/android/pull/1836

We don't do files migration automatically yet, I'd suggest we implement that for 2.2 since it needs some UI as well, but push keys are properly migrated if they exist.

title: Add code of conduct
body:
Ref: https://github.com/nextcloud/server/pull/7768

Signed-off-by: tobiasKaminsky <tobias@kaminsky.me>

title: Selection colour is applied to often
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
### Actual behaviour
- If you have a list for example with 30 files and select the third file the selection colour (light grey) will be applied to every third file instead of only the third file.

### Expected behaviour
- Only the selected item should be highlighted.
 
### Steps to reproduce
1. Select a file from the list and scroll threw the list

### Environment data
![android](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1869584/34871477-180733d4-f78e-11e7-9840-a19f6ae04224.png)

title: Activity stream: handle all useful infos
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
Here all available infos of activity stream are noted.
We should compare which infos are missing and are useful and then discuss how to implement & show them.

https://github.com/nextcloud/server/blob/0913bc2157293acafa186afec4018ad25d7fbb22/lib/public/RichObjectStrings/Definitions.php

title: Can't connect with android app
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
### Actual behaviour
-Tell us what happens

Android app won't connect but appears connected in the personnal security pannel of the user

### Expected behaviour
-Tell us what should happen

The app should be connected 

### Steps to reproduce
1. I'm using nextcloud through a reverse proxy.
2. The browser access works fine.
3. The android app access does'nt.
4. when I'm asked to enter my credentials, it's ok, but then I got a screen telling me that it's trying to connect to the server, it show "Redirecting..." and I'm stuck there, nothing more.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/23720319/34817540-97bd0468-f6b8-11e7-8027-f49b906d9277.png)


5. But, when I'm connect (via my browser to the server)  to the personnal pannel of the user, I can see that my android phone is connected (I guess).

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/23720319/34817247-bf1a7992-f6b7-11e7-9d2c-af3f3c6a9e1a.png)

The logs don't really show anything to me, hope you can help me with this.


### Environment data
Android version:

5.0

Nextcloud app version:

2.0.0

Nextcloud server version:

12.0.4

#### Nextcloud log (data/nextcloud.log)
```

title: Link Talk app in drawer if available on server
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
If the talk app is available on server (should be announced via capabilities), we can show it on drawer.
If the app is not installed then open up google play store for easily setup?

Position could be beneath "participate" or beneath "uploads"?

![2018-01-11-084450](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5836855/34813831-b8b0c6f8-f6ab-11e7-8a0f-93d270fac15e.png)

title: Unable to login via new (default) method
body:
### Actual behaviour
Client reports an error while attempting to connect to my nextcloud server instance. Old login method works.

### Expected behaviour
Both methods (new and old) should be working.
 
### Steps to reproduce
Start Nextcloud, enter server hostname

### Environment data
Android version: 6.0.1

Device model: Samsung S5

Stock or customized system: Stock

Nextcloud app version: 2.0.0

title: Fix external storage permission
body: Signed-off-by: Mario Danic <mario@lovelyhq.com>

title: Add notifications on sync failure
body:
In addition, I've hardened documents provider a bit as it's very fragile. Still doesn't always work for me, but it's something for a start at least...

Signed-off-by: Mario Danic <mario@lovelyhq.com>

title: same account , different accessing causes different sync status on android
body:
Accessing server from loacl network /lan  and accessing from internet /wan via dynDNS with the same account shows different sync status of the same file on android-app. There are 2 folders created (user@ local IP and user @ dynDNS) on android and although the same account the same syncing file has to be downloaded twice (once in folder user@localP and once in folder user@dynDNS) to show status 'synced' erverywhere.  Wouldn't it be usefull or possible to have just one folder for the same user and once to download the file to have a green hook (synced) nearby file for this account no matter how accessing ? 
Kind regards !

title: E2E
body:
This is a rebased version of #1598 
  
ToDo:
- [x] change version number
- [x] fix #1938

title: Uploads view doesn't need a user info line if only one account is in the app
label: [Label(name="enhancement"), Label(name="good first issue")]
body: The row with the username for every upload is only necessary as soon as there are at least 2 accounts in the app.

title: Successful upload notification should link to file directly, not uploads page
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
The scenario is: I want to upload a file, picture or whatever, and directly share it. I'm in the picture viewer and share it to Nextcloud, and it gets uploaded.

Now I wait for the upload to finish, and tap the upload notification. I get to the uploads view, from where nothing is clickable and there's no previews either.

Instead, the upload notification should link to the parent folder of the file, ideally with it highlighted.

title: Is there a New Beta Release Data
body:
Hello, 

Just wondering if there will be a new beta release anytime soon for nextcloud 13 features?

title: App stops unexpectedly upon retrying uploads
label: [Label(name="AutoUpload"), Label(name="bug")]
body:
### Actual behaviour
- Android informs me that the app stopped unexpectedly

### Expected behaviour
- Unsuccessful uploads should be retried
 
### Steps to reproduce
1. Open app
2. Select "Uploads"
3. Choose "Retry unsuccessful uploads"


### Environment data
Android version: 8.0.0 (Oxygen OS 5.0)

Device model: OnePlus 3T

Stock or customized system: Stock

Nextcloud app version: Dev, 20180109

Nextcloud server version: 12.0.4

### Logs
#### Web server error log
No relevant logs.

title: E2E Allow to select/copy the encryption passphrase
label: [Label(name="E2E"), Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
### Actual behaviour
- The passphrase in the "Note your encryption passphrase" dialogue is not "selectable" in order to copy it to the android clipboard.

### Expected behaviour
- Maybe this is by design but IMHO you should be able to select (and copy) the passphrase in the "Note your encryption passphrase" dialogue in order to paste the phrase to a safe location.
 
### Steps to reproduce
1. Mark folder
2. Choose "set as encrypted"


### Environment data
Android version:
7.1.1
Device model:
Sony Xperia X
Stock or customized system:
Stock
Nextcloud app version:
2.1.0-e2e-01
Nextcloud server version:
13.0.0 Beta 4

title: Can't connect to Nextcloud 10 from android app
label: [Label(name="bug"), Label(name="needs info/discussion")]
body:
### Actual behaviour
-Tell us what happens

I can connect to my nextcloud from any browser but not from the app

### Expected behaviour
-Tell us what should happen
 
I should be able to connect to nextcloud from the app

### Steps to reproduce

1. When I enter the nextcloud URL in the app, it says secured connection established
2. When I want to log in and press the connect button, it says that an "unknown error" happened
3. I get nothing from the httpd logs.
4. If I enter a wrong password is says "wrong password or credential", so the error only happens when the credentials are right and it tries to connect to the server.


### Environment data

Android version:
5.0

Nextcloud app version:
2.0.0

Nextcloud server version:
10.0.4 (stable)

title: When creating existing directory during loading app crashes
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
### Actual behaviour
When you create an existing directory while the app is not yet showing the files, it crashes

### Expected behaviour
Message box: folder already exists or so
 
### Steps to reproduce
1. Close the app completely
2. Open it
3. While loading, press create directory
4. It will crash


### Environment data
Android version:
7.0
Device model: 
Huawei Honor 6X (europe)
Stock or customized system:
Stock EMUI 5
Nextcloud app version:
2.0.0
Nextcloud server version:
11
### Logs
#### Web server error log
```
I do not have access to the log
```

#### Nextcloud log (data/nextcloud.log)
```
No access to logs
```
I am sorry that I could not post the webserver errors, but I think it is an issue in the app, so it wouldn't matter anyway

title: do not use id twice
body:
fix #1464 hopefully

Previously we had the same id (e.g. drawer_username). Now it is a unique id. 
In theory it should be no problem as drawer does not exist in this view, but who knows if butterknife is finding the right view...

Signed-off-by: tobiasKaminsky <tobias@kaminsky.me>

title: Contact backup removal
body:
Remove contacts backup job on account removal

If we do not do this this will result in a NPE...

title: Contacts backup NPE
body:
fix potential NPE
fix #1537

title: Fix crashing search while copy/move
body:
fix #1800

Remaining: when searching in copy/move only folders should be shown, as files cannot be a target for copy/move
@mario as you implemented the search: can I limit the scope to folders only easily?

**NOTE: in order to test/compile it is currently linked against master branch of library. This must then be changed prior merge**

Signed-off-by: tobiaskaminsky <tobias@kaminsky.me>

use interface
fix #1918

title: Thumbnails of deleted pictures are still visible in activity list
body:
### Actual behaviour
The thumbnails of deleted photos are still visible in the activity list of my android nextcloud -app . It seems that they are saved (cached or whatever) on android system (!?) Accessing server’s activity list with desktop browser there are of course no thumbnails visible .In android they appear as if the photos/pictures are still accessable (of course when I click on the link to the photo in activity list the notification “Not accessable” appears).
**_That’s irritating for me - why are the thumbnails not deleted too ?_**
Moreover since the activity list can’t be deleted (nor a time window can be choosen) the list gets longer and longer. Ok.does’nt matter, but since the thumbnails are apparently saved on mobile device they need memory on my device (though only little). The longer the server is runnung ( and the the activity-list increases) the more memory of mobile device is used.
Is that normal behavior ? 

### Expected behaviour
-When pictures/photos are cleared the thumbnails should be removed too.
 
### Environment data
Android version: 6.0.1

Device model: Samsung Galaxy S5neo

Stock or customized system:

Nextcloud app version:2.0.0

Nextcloud server version:12.0.4

title: Catch sorting error
body:
Since long time we try to get rid of the TimSort error. This occurs if the underlying data set is changing while sorting, e.g. if the upload status changes during sorting.

This does not solve this, instead it only tries to prevent crashing the app.
Shall I add this to all other Arrays.sort(...) and Collections.sort(...)?

title: No upload at charging if battery is on 100%
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
Hi! :)

I set 2 folders to auto upload when phone is charging. Now i recognised, if the phone is plugged in to the charger and the battery is below 100% it is working fine. But if the battery is at 100% (and the phone still on the charger) it is not working and the app/the upload is waiting for charging.

Could it be possible, that the app does not recognise the charger if the phone battery is on 100%?

Best regards,
HANNES

title: Fixes #1903: Fix image scaling in navigation drawer
body:
Fix #1903

* Insted of setting a background in ViewGroup add a ImageView inside it, stretch it, set cropping scaleType and then set a background image downloaded from server.
* CenterCrop will scale the image to fill the View, if needed image will be cropped in the center but the aspect ration will be kept
* Cleanup code to use more general types instead of direct layout type, previously enforcing LinearLayout wasn't using anything special about this class.

title: Make Basic Auth work
body: This is related to #371, which is closed, but I feel that the resolution is inadequate. I want to use basic auth *in addition* to the normal web login flow, and there's no reason why the app can't accept a server URL in the form `https://username:password@myserver.com/", as that's standard HTTP. The app should obey the standard there and use HTTP basic auth if it has been specified in the URL.

title: Ellipsis with spaces
body: Ellipsis indicate that a word or a part of a word is omitted. If a complete word is omitted a whitespace is needed.

title: Delayed deletion of photos
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
I really like the automatic upload and automatic deletion functionality for photos and videos, because this saves space on my android devices and make new photos and videos quickly available on my desktop system/nextcloud server.

There is only one thing which is little bit annoying:
Very often the upload and deletion is already performed when i want to review the media files on my phone (with familiy members, friends, ....) and it is a bit clumsy to reach these medias...

Therefore it will be great to have the possibility to delay the deletion of the media files if the are already uploaded after a certain amount of days.
A fixed amount of days (i.e 14 days) would be great for a initial implementation to reduce the amount of modifications of the ui.

title: syncing problem
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
### Actual behaviour:
**_When I used android nextcloud-app earlier it worked fine. Now I have problems:_**
First -In local lan (only using http) : When I select a menu-item like 'favorites' (and choosing this, the error always happens using http in lan!) in the app-menu then the screen shows 'Loading.....' and don't stop showing this message -but nothing happens until I manually do an update (by wiping down on the screen).
When I do this, it seems that that strange behavior spread over on other menu items: Seems to sync or is updating but nothing happens. And when I choose 'photos' the pictures sometimes are shown twice !
Only when I start the app and choose ' all files' -menu item and do not leave this , the behavior is normal ! 
Second- using https and accessing server from lan as well as from wan (via dynDNS) the behavior is similar (although menu item 'favorites' seems to work here most of time). But in menu item 'photos' pictures are also shown twice. When I manually update (wiping down on handy screen) then each picture is listet only once (normal).  To sum up : The **_problem seems to be the app menu_** in the app ! Browsing the menu and choosing a menu item in the list sometimes causes the strange behavior. When I start app and only choose item 'all files' and do not change  this menu item there are no problems.

Comment: Auto-upload doesn't work too !

### Expected behaviour:
The sync should take only a few seconds and the updated files should be shown correctly  .. even after browsing the menu (like Cirrus-app does!).
 
### Environment data
Android version: 6.0.1

Device model: Samsung Galaxy S5neo

Stock or customized system:..

Nextcloud app version:latest v2.0.0

Nextcloud server version:12.0.4

### Logs

Nextcloud log errors shown below only occurs when running nextcloud in virtual machine - no significant errors on physical machines, but similar strange behavior.
#### Nextcloud log (data/nextcloud.log)
```

title: One server offline prevents upload to any account
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
### Actual behaviour
I have two accounts added to the android app, from two separate Nextcloud server instances. If I attempt to upload a file (via the 'share to' feature of android) when one of the servers is down, the upload to the working (online) server instance will never happen.

Aside from this, attempts to upload when I have two accounts are never guaranteed, it is extremely unreliable.

### Expected behaviour
-The file should upload successfully and consistently, regardless of whether another, unrelated server instance is down.
 
### Steps to reproduce
1. Have two accounts added to the app from separate server instances
2. Have one server offline
3. Try to upload a file via the 'share to' feature to the server instance which is online
4. Observe the notification area icons never appear, uploads always fail
5. Remove the account of the server which is offline
6. Attempt an upload again, observe the app functioning correctly

Note that even when both servers are up, uploading is very unreliable. I have developed a habit of dwelling in a particular folder prior to tapping "upload" as it seems to give an upload more chance of working.

### Environment data
Android version: 8.1.0

Device model: LG Nexus 5x

Stock or customized system: Stock

Nextcloud app version: 2.0.0

Nextcloud server version: 12.0.4

### Logs
None are included as none contained anything for this issue, the upload simply did not occur. I went as far as adb logcat (log showed nothing after the upload action) and packet sniffing with tcpdump, but due to the use of HTTPS nothing useful could be gleaned.

title: Walled garden: 204 response: length is -1 (unknown) or 0 (null)
body:
Fix #1880 
We only checked if length is -1, but it can also be 0.
As this is a bug fix, and prevents uploading file on NC13, it needs to get into next release.

title: Local DNS server ignored: IP address connection works, hostname connection shaky
body:
### Actual behaviour
When attempting to connect to my local network hosted server (lets call it **myserver.localdomain, ip address: 192.168.1.100**): the nextcloud android client displays the following behavior:

- takes a very long time to connect: often says 'unable to connect', occasionally connects
- even when it connects (after multiple attempts to get it to do so), and I login: loading the folders/files takes a very long time.  File downloads fail citing connection issues.
- the server itself has redis caching enabled: if I load the nextcloud on google chrome on the same phone running nextcloud client: everything is snappy.

As soon as I switch to using the ip address (using the hostname/ip address I listed above for the example), I get the following behavior:
https://192.168.1.100/nextcloud - everything works **very well**.  Login is instantaneous, file/directory listings are instantaneous
https://myserver.localdomain/nextcloud - very problematic connection behavior

**As a sidenote: please note that there is no problem in the linux and windows desktop clients, only in the android one.**

### Expected behaviour
My phone and android tablet are both running on the local network, and are using the local router for dns name resolutions.  There should be the exact same behavior for accessing the local (but not public to internet) domain names as for accessing via I.P. address.
 
### Steps to reproduce
1. Host nextcloud on a local server with a made-up domain name (that does not exist in the internet).  Make sure the local dns server (usually wifi router) resolves this name.  In my case: my router resolves <hostname>.<domainname I set in router> for each new host that connects to it.
2. Access it from nextcloud client using the local hostname: problematic behavior
3. Access it from the browser using the same hostname: behavior is fine
4. Access it from nextcloud client using the hardcoded ip address: behavior is fine


### Environment data
Android version:

Device model: 

Stock or customized system:

Nextcloud app version:

Nextcloud server version:

### Logs
#### Web server error log
```
Insert your webserver log here
```

#### Nextcloud log (data/nextcloud.log)
```
Insert your Nextcloud log here
```
**NOTE:** Be super sure to remove sensitive data like passwords, note that everybody can look here! You can use the Issue Template application to prefill some of the required information: https://apps.nextcloud.com/apps/issuetemplate

title: MIME type lookup assumes to have lowercase MIME types
body:
fix #1882 

The (internal) MIME type lookup function from Android fails if we use uppercase MIME types.
Strangely this does not happen in every situation, see #1882 for details.

title: DEV App: cannot use the Android 'share' function to upload files
label: [Label(name="approved"), Label(name="bug"), Label(name="pr exists")]
body:
### Actual behaviour
I cannot use the Android 'share' function to upload files with the DEV version (from F-Droid). It starts to upload, reports upload error in status bar. File is in "to be uploaded"-section of the app, Re-upload doesn't change anything - error again. Works with PlayStore Beta App on the same server.

### Expected behaviour
Should upload as the beta/release versions did.
 
### Steps to reproduce
1. Open Gallery on your Android device
2. Select a photo (or screenshot in my case) and "share" it (Android-"Share" not Nextcloud's)
3. Select Nextcloud as "share"-Method
4. Confirm PIN/Fingerprint if configured
5. Switch account if necessary
6. Select target directory and press "Upload" button

### Environment data
Android version: 8.0
Device model: OnePlus 3T
Stock or customized system: Stock (OOS Beta)
Nextcloud app version: 20171212 (F-Droid)
Nextcloud server version: 13b3

### Logs
#### Web server error log: No entry while trying to upload file.
#### Nextcloud log: No entry while trying to upload file.

title: renaming values-es-rUS to values-b+es+419
body:
i have tested the resource qualifier name for android version 16 device, although i do not have any sdk15 devices to test this on, but this change was introduced in api level 24 and it is working with version 16 so i think version 15 devices will also comply with it.
this pr is in reference to closed pr #1874

title: changing values-es-rUS to values-b+es+419
body:
as mentioned above i am changing the values files
by the time of my first commit the values-es_419 file was causing build error
to resolve this i went through this stack overflow thread with this [answer](https://stackoverflow.com/a/42282526/6166726)
i have mentioned this in #1874

title: Error: Invalid resource directory name
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
Project is not able to be built,
whenever i try to do so i get the error
the error is pointing towards this particular file
<Path to  android studio project folder>NextCloudApp/src/main/res/values-es_419

What i figured out here is that the issue is with resource resolution folder for latin american - spanish translation.

but according to the stackoverflow answer [here](https://stackoverflow.com/a/42282526/6166726)
we should rename the values folder to values-es-b+es+419.

i would like to create a PR for this issue if it's passed as valid.

title: Contact Backup: Handle different address books / accounts
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
### Actual behaviour
Current implementation of Contacts Backup seems to export all VCARDS from ALL accounts / address books to a single .vcf file.
E.g. I have one address book synced with Nextcloud and at least one other account e.g. Gmail.

### Expected behaviour
It would be nice, if each address book / account is handled separately.
* It should be possible to choose accounts to be backuped. 
* Each exported .vcf file should get the account name in addition to the timestamp.
* During recovery it should be possible to select the .vcf file and selecting the account in which the contacts should be restored.

### Environment data
Android version: 7.1.2 / 6.0.1
Nextcloud app version: 2.0.0 / 20171212
Nextcloud server version: 12.0.4

title: E2E Show info bevor creating first key pair
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
### Actual behaviour
-Tell us what happens
Keys are created and user is ask to store the secret in a safe place.

### Expected behaviour
First make shure that the user is somewhere where he has a pen and paper to write the words down, or let him cancel the process at this point.

I think this is important maby the user is not in a save location someone could be watching him. Thinking of somebody is having a presentation opening by mistake a folder marked as encrypted some time before, or he is like me laying in a hotel room without pen and paper. The user could although just sit in the tram or subway playing with new features.

So i think we can not allways expect the user to have something to write down the words.

title: .mp4 preview missing
body:
### Actual behaviour
-There's no preview for mp4 videos. My mobile takes .mp4 videos and when uploading with InstantUpload to my self hosted nextcloud, there's no preview pictogram. See this picture: https://photos.app.goo.gl/x6zPFfjZfyk6a3oA3 
I don't know if this is an issue with my installation, or if there's no preview at all.

### Expected behaviour
-Tell us what should happen
I expected to see a preview pic for mp4 files. Either a "still" of a random frame or the first frame of the video. If this is not possible, maybe a default pictogram for all MP4s.

### Steps to reproduce
Check pictures in the InstantUpload folder in your browser (Chrome 63 on Kubuntu 17.04)

body:
I expect lint to fail as warnings will increase, which I will then adjust

This was changed sometime back to 1.0.33 which is wrong.
For dev version we want to have the latest client commit alongside with the latest library, which is always "-SNAPSHOT"

title: Change userAgent to Nextcloud-android
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
For E2E we need a way to prevent all older clients to access an encrypted folder, as otherwise they will sea and can delete the encrypted files, but cannot do something useful with it.
As we currently use the old "onwcloud-android/$versionID" user agent we cannot block the clients depending on versionID as we would have to block <2.1 and so a real owncloud client 2.5 can still access the encrypted folder.
Therefore we need to change this to "Mozilla/5.0 (Android) Nextcloud-android/2.1" instead of "Mozilla/5.0 (Android) ownCloud-android/2.1"
I tested it and it works without a server change.
I am unsure about the sideffects, e.g. can oC users still use our client on their server.

@mario @AndyScherzinger 
@schiessle for server

title: New release schedule
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
As we see our milestone planning is not working quite well.
With the new dev version based on master we always have users who test our latest master versions, so we can hopefully get errors and bug reports more recent.
So I suggest that we release 
- every 2 months a stable version, currently 2.x
     - branch off from master, publish RC1
     - new PRs can be merged into master while stabilizing 
     - wait 1 week and if not publish it as stable
- if needed a minor version 2.x.y
     - fix bug on master
     - backport it to 2.x branch 

With 2 months as a (short) cycle we can ensure that not too much new is into it, so we hopefully have only 1-2 RC.
If you, @mario aand @AndyScherzinger agree, I would copy this into  wiki page on github, same as in /server and also would keep track of releasing it on time.
(the next release will have to wait a bit longer as we want to have E2E included)

title: Overhauled data storage management
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
Storing user data and RSA keys on the root of the external storage is not a good idea. The data storage system has been overhauled here with the following changes.

- The `STORAGE_PATH` user preference is now set to the [private internal app storage directory](https://developer.android.com/guide/topics/data/data-storage.html#filesInternal) by default.
- The DataStorageProvider's getAvailableStoragePoints method now returns the [private internal data directory](https://developer.android.com/guide/topics/data/data-storage.html#filesInternal) and, if available, the [private external storage directory](https://developer.android.com/guide/topics/data/data-storage.html#filesExternal).
- `PushUtils` will now store and handle the RSA keypair in the [private internal storage directory](https://developer.android.com/guide/topics/data/data-storage.html#filesInternal). The keys need to be here since even the private external storage directory is accessible to everyone with the `READ_EXTERNAL_STORAGE` permission. Therefore we specify the internal storage directory for these instead of using the `STORAGE_PATH` preference. 

Please ignore 8ca99c6. I updated this as intended in d4670ad

This fixes #1833
fix #1707

title: nc-keypair files on /sdcard
label: [Label(name="approved"), Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
I notice that the Nextcloud app stores a keypair on the /sdcard partition under Nextcloud/nc-keypair/. The two files listed are push_key.priv and push_key.pub. 

Is there any good reason for a keypair to be stored on the world-readable/writable /sdcard partition? Why isnt these files at least stored in the app's private data folder? I havent looked through the source to find out what the keypair is used for but this doesnt look good. I can see they keyfiles are generated in PushUtils.java and are seemingly used to push some sort of registration token to the OwnCloud server.

I highly recommend storing these somewhere else. I'd be happy to provide a patch for this. Since the keys are seemingly only used for a single operation it would be trivial to simply store them in a more appropriate location and either keep them there or delete them after use since it doesnt seem like they are used more than once.
