title: Nexcloud Android "Account" disappears after reboot, when nextcloud app has been moved to sdcard, sdcard formatted as internal storage (Android 6.0)
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
### Actual behaviour
Took me a while to narrow down...

As Nextcloud's Android account are disappearing reproducible after each phone reboot, I have to "grant access" and enter server name and login credentials after each reboot. Somewhat annoying ;-)



### Expected behaviour
- Server name and Login credentials should be asked once and stored permanently. Android "account" type "Nextcloud" should "survive" reboots/shutdowns.
 
### Steps to reproduce
maybe a "prerequisite" for this bug, don't know:  My smartphone is encrypted.

Small internal storage (8GB), so 32GB sdcard added. 
pre-req 1:  sdcard formatted as internal storage !
pre-req 2: install nextcloud app 
pre-req 3: "Change storage" for Nextcloud app from "Internal storage" to sdcard. 

Again: sdcard is formatted as internal storage, all above done with native Android functionality.

1.  start nexcloud app
2.  enter server name and login credentials

all I need is working fine at this moment
remark: I can see an Android "account", type "Nextcloud", in my smartphone's system settings from this point on.

3.  reboot
4. Android "account" type "Nextcloud" is gone. Start at step 1 :-(

IMPORTANT: This bug ONLY happens, when Nextcloud app has been "Change storage"-'d from "Internal storage" to sdcard. Which, in fact, is a necessity for smartphones with low internal memory. Esp. for Apps like the nextcloud app, which needs usually lot of smartphone's storage for offline synching etc.

REMARK: I found this bug also for other apps, as long as they're using Android "accounts", like German "Onleihe" App (which also need mass storage on the phone for downloaded media, and the German XING social network app. So I'm highly interested if this an app bug or maybe an Android bug.

6.0 Marshmallow

Device model: 
Lenovo C2 aka K10a40

Stock

2.0.1 (F-Droid version)

12.0.3

title: Set wait time after charger connect for auto upload
label: [Label(name="AutoUpload"), Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
### Actual behaviour
If i connect the power / charger to my phone the app imediatly uploads all the pictures of the day. I connect the power in normal case if the phone is almost empty. Then the upload is starting and uses a lot of power if there are many pictures. Sometimes it is to much power and the phone is shutting down.

### Expected behaviour
Set a timer to wait after I connect the charger. The most users will charge the phone over the night so there is enough time to upload. Older phones are almost unuseable if they are uploading data.
 
### Steps to reproduce
1. Activate auto upload 
2. Enable the feature "on charger only"
3. Got a lot of pictures over the day
4. Connect the phone
5. Have fun if you want to do something else with the phone


### Environment data
Android version: CM13.1

Device model: 

Stock or customized system:

Nextcloud app version: 2.0.0

Nextcloud server version: 13.0.3-3

title: Frequent failure to upload/download even though server's fine (beta)
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
### Actual behaviour
There are a variety of symptoms, but essentially I can tell when it's started because automatic uploads just error out. Usually a notification says "Could not complete operation. Server unavailable" Occasionally it says "Server in maintenance mode." (It definitely isn't though.)

Downloads will also fail at this point eg. if I tap on a photo, the progress bar doesn't move past 0 and eventually I get a notification "Could not download IMG_....jpg".

However, the server is fine. I confirm this by visiting it in a browser, and if I forcible kill the Nextcloud app and restart it manually, everything suddenly works. This suggests to me it's the app that's the problem, not the server.

### Expected behaviour
Network operations work if the server and internet are fine.
 
### Steps to reproduce
For me, it happens pretty much once a day. I might have a heap of photos waiting to be uploaded (automatically), and it'll fall over on the last ten or so. Not sure beyond that.

### Environment data
Android version: 7.1.2

Device model:  HTC One M9

Stock or customized system: Customised (LineageOS 14.1 20171107 nightly himaul)

Nextcloud app version: 2.0.0

Nextcloud server version: 12.0.3

### Logs

There are no errors on the webserver and the logs section of the settings is blank!

title: Client TLS negotiation issue
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
### Actual behaviour
Nextcloud fails to upload with "Connection error"

### Expected behaviour
Upload should complete successfully.
 
### Steps to reproduce
1. Configure Apache SSL settings with "SSLOpenSSLConfCmd	Curves secp521r1:secp384r1"
2. Attempt to connect to server with Nextcloud client
3. Profit.


### Environment data
Android version: 7.0

Device model: Samsung Galaxy S7 (SM-G930F)

Stock or customized system: Stock

Nextcloud app version: 2.0.0

Nextcloud server version: ownCloud 9.1.6 stable

### Logs
#### Web server error log
nothing shows

#### Nextcloud log (data/nextcloud.log)
nothing shows

My ownCloud server is behind an Apache2 reverse proxy which also does the SSL. I hardened my SSL configuration but Nextcloud Android client does not like Curves secp521r1:secp384r1. The ownCloud desktop client works fine. If I comment that line out of my config, the Nextcloud Android client works fine.

title: Trigger sync/download/upload
label: [Label(name="AutoUpload"), Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
### Actual behaviour
There is no such methodology available

### Expected behaviour
Some form of lightweight class/snippet to trigger a sync/download/upload. This way apps could trigger re-sync of existing or custom files from Nextcloud. Because of often not-reacting Auto-Upload of this app, and the coming changes in Android O+ I think it would be a good idea to have some sort of outside trigger available to hint  the official Nextcloud app to do it's work, and especially sync specified file(s).

My example is [Markor](https://github.com/gsantner/markor), which edits local files, in this case a file inside Nextcloud: `NCROOT/todo.txt`, which is tagged `offline available` and `favourite`. Still, somehow it doesn't sync accordingly in background, always have to start NC app to see if it is really latest version. In O+ there may be no way for Nextcloud app to run in background (or at least at the right time when something has changed in between), so sending a resync-Intent with an path extra to trigger a forced sync would be very helpful. NC app could than e.g. send a broadcast/intent back in return.

Tell me if there are open questions, the description sounds quite complicated currently :D.

### Environment data
Android version: nougat

Device model: Nexus 5

Stock or customized system: LOS 14.1

Nextcloud app version:  v2.0.1

Nextcloud server version: 12

title: Device credentials and pincode / fingerprint
label: [Label(name="enhancement"), Label(name="needs info/discussion")]
body:
In #1657 we get thanks to @rhari991 the possibility to use device credentials to lock our app (for Android M and later).
Previously we had pincode and fingerprint implemented on our own.

Do we need pincode and fingerprint independent of device credentials? Or can we remove/hide them?
Is there a use case where the device is unlocked, but an user wants to lock only our app with e.g. fingerprint or pincode?

To simplify our code base and UI I vote for removing it (fingerprint is already done in the PR I guess).
Removing in >= Android M as we should still allow passcode on older devices.

title: Full Next Search: UI displaying search results
label: [Label(name="enhancement"), Label(name="needs info/discussion")]
body:
If full next search is enabled, we can use this to search within files.
The result is then the file with one (or more) search exerpts, e.g:

Nextcloud Manual.pdf with search "test":
>"\/<username>\/nextcloud\\ndavfs user,rw,auto 0 0\\n\\n8. Then test that it mounts and authenticates",

>" to Internet Options, Content Tab, Clear SSL State.\\n\\n17. Close browser, then re-open and test.\\n\\nProblem",

>", as this scenario illustrates:\\n\\n1. User1 shares a folder “test” with User2 and User3\\n\\n2. User2",

>" (the recipient) deletes a file\/folder “sub” inside of “test”\\n\\n3. The folder “sub” will be moved"

This is the current search result:
![2017-11-07-081307](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5836855/32481419-82db334c-c393-11e7-8fb3-5ce0d48eeef1.png)

@jancborchardt

title: Show all text files
label: [Label(name="enhancement"), Label(name="needs info/discussion")]
body:
### Actual behaviour
The clients shows .txt and .md file with an internal editor.
AFAIK the client looks at the file extension before deciding how to open it.
### Expected behaviour
All text (or at least a wider range of text files) files should be viewable from the client.
 
### Steps to reproduce
1. Create a file text with extension .adoc, .rc, .conf, .gitignore, .todo, .cfg, or without any extension
2. Load the file on the nextcloud client
3. On the android client tap on the new file


### Environment data
Android version: 5.1.1

Device model: 

Stock or customized system: Customized

Nextcloud app version: 2.0.1, from FDroid

Nextcloud server version: 12


I know that one cannot simply determine from the file extension if a file is a text file or not, maybe the best option would be to give the user the possibility to choose if the file extension/file type is not recognized.
On the other hand, I think that some formats, like .adoc for asciidoc, are only used for text files, it may be therefore safe to open them automatically with the internal editor, like for .md files.

title: Update master.html only on master branch
body:
Try for #1754: if on master branch, then update master.html.
On master is 
- each merge commit (when mergin a PR)
- transifex update

title: Lint: master.html
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
We are using "android lint" to check if error/warning count stays same or decreases on new PRs.
If count increases we reject the PR.

If count decreases, we store the html output of this feature branch as the new master.html. But lint-results.txt will only be updated once the branch is merged.

So then we have a non-sane state, for example a branch/PR fixes 5 warnings:
- master.html before: 200 warnings
- branch/PR: 195 warnings in lint-results.txt (on branch)
- master.html now: 195, whereas lint-results on master still shows 200.

Depending how much time passes between check and merge this is quite inconsistent and confusing...

I think that I can write a script which will get executed once a new commit is pushed to master. This will then update the master.html.
Am I correct or did I get confused completely?

title: Timestamp lost when synchronizing a folder
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
### Actual behaviour

### Expected behaviour
- Local timestamp of synchronized files match the remote timestamp.
 
### Steps to reproduce
1.  Choose 'synchronize' in folder options
2.  Watch the contents of the downloaded folder


### Environment data
Android version: Android 6.0

Device model: H60-L04

Stock or customized system: EMUI 4.0

Nextcloud app version: 2.0.0

Nextcloud server version: 12.0.3

Addition to the problem: I am aware of the bug in android that non-root users cannot modify a file's timestamp. Is that the cause of this problem? 
A workaround would then still be possible by changing the order of syncing to ordered-by-age instead of alphabetically-ordered

title: Auto upload - file not found event if it exists
label: [Label(name="AutoUpload"), Label(name="bug")]
body:
### Actual behaviour
I'm using auto upload in Nextcloud 2.0.0 for several folders since a few days ago. One folder is the one that contains screenshots. Most of the uploads from the different folders have worked well (both custom folders (expert mode) and folders suggested by the app). But one screenshot image is not uploaded. Instead the Nextcloud app tries to upload it but then says "File not found" in the list under "Uploads" in the menu (could be something similar to "file not found" since I use another language). But the file is in the screenshots folder and Nextcloud shows a thumbnail of it. Retried several times. This is not a "custom folder" but a folder suggested by the app for auto upload.

### Expected behaviour
Nextcloud should not mark a file that exists as "file not found" but instead upload all files that actually exists in the auto upload folder in question.

### Environment data
Android version: 7.0

Device model: Samsung Galaxy S7 Edge (SM-G935F)

Stock or customized system: stock

Nextcloud app version: 2.0.0

Nextcloud server version: 12.0.3

title: Auto upload overwrites existing files
label: [Label(name="AutoUpload"), Label(name="bug")]
body:
### Actual behaviour
I have enabled auto upload on my camera images and also enabled option that the files are moved from camera to NextCloud.

Now I discovered that if my images start at DSC_0001.JPG then after moving the next photo taken is named the same and when uploaded to NextCloud folder, it will not be named as "DSC_0001 (1).JPG" as was done in previous releases, but it will overwrite existing file.

For instance, I have now in my previous month's folder image DSC_0001.JPG with 10 different versions. I guess I will eventually lose data because some versions will be automatically removed by some internal clean-up logic, right?

### Expected behaviour
Duplicate files should be uploaded with a different name.
 
### Steps to reproduce
1. Enable auto upload of DCIM/100ANDRO folder for instance.
2. Set option "Original file will be... " to "moved to app folder"
3. Create new photo, let it be uploaded/moved to NextCloud
4. Create another photo that will be named the same as the previous one, let it be uploaded/moved to NextCloud

### Environment data
Android version: 7.1.1
Device model: Sony Xperia Z5 Compact
Stock or customized system: stock
Nextcloud app version: 2.0.0
Nextcloud server version: 12.0.3

```
BUILD SUCCESSFUL in 59s
30 actionable tasks: 29 executed, 1 up-to-date
Exception in thread "Thread-36" java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: com/android/utils/PathUtils$1
        at com.android.utils.PathUtils.deleteIfExists(PathUtils.java:47)

title: Open image crash
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
### Actual behaviour
1. Open a folder that contains images.
2. Open an image and it downloads and shows the image. (It now has a green tick on the thumbnail.)
3. Reopen the folder.
4. Open the downloaded image and it shows white screen.
5 Open an image in the same folder, the app crashes. (See the error log below)
6. Open an image in the different folder (Same as 2)

P.S. the folders are on external storage on local folder. I don't know if it is the problem.
### Expected behaviour
Not Crash
 
### Steps to reproduce
See Actual behaviour

title: constant "uploading files" on android
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
### Actual behaviour
There is a constant "uploading files" activity notification on my android device since updating to 2.0.0. I cannot get rid of this notification as android most likely is considering this as an activity. An example is shown in the following screenshot:
![screenshot_20171030-232021](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11562522/32206159-de5a194c-bdc9-11e7-959f-f25a67879b3f.png)


### Expected behaviour
-There should not be a constant activity running from this app that tries to upload files

### Environment data
Android version: 7.1.1

Device model: moto z play

Stock

Nextcloud app version:2.0.0

Nextcloud server version: 12.0.3

title: Open OAUTH in default browser
label: [Label(name="enhancement"), Label(name="needs info/discussion")]
body:
### Actual behaviour

The OAUTH login opens in a webview thing…

### Expected behaviour
Open it in the default browser, because:
* I think that is what the spec recommends
* users can use their addons/password managers/known browsers
* enjoy the security stuff of your browser, instead of a potentially outdated webview (often not updated on old devices)

title: Failed Uploaded files can not be cleared
body:
On version 2.0. I have about 700 fileds in my uploaded files list that failed because the local file can not be found. But there seems to be no way to clear this, other than 700 times tapping the bin icon behind each warning.

Otherwise no bugs found yet. Thanks for the great update!

title: File chooser does not retrieve updated file
label: [Label(name="approved"), Label(name="bug"), Label(name="pr exists")]
body:
### Actual behaviour
Choose file from another app through the nextcloud online fs gives the local version if available

### Expected behaviour
Choose file from another app through the nextcloud online fs gives the online version, or - if the local version is up-to-date - the local version.
 
### Steps to reproduce
1. Open pdf file in Nextcloud app (now it is stored locally)
2. Modify the file on the server (Now local file is the old version)
3. Choose the file from another app 


### Environment data
Android version:
Android 6.0

Device model: 
H60-L04

Stock or customized system:
EMUI 4.0

Nextcloud app version:
2.0.0

Nextcloud server version:
12.0.3
### Logs
Not applicable

title: Cannot set folders (local and remote) in autoupload settings
label: [Label(name="AutoUpload"), Label(name="bug")]
body:
### Actual behaviour
I cannot change or select a folder in upload setting. When I select a local or a remote folder nothing appear in "Preferences for autoupload files" (sorry for translation, it's "Préférences pour le téléversement automatique").

### Expected behaviour
Folder's name are displaying as expected when selection is done.
 
### Steps to reproduce
1. Open app
2. Go to Autoupload settings
3. Select one local folder (or clic on manual selected local folder in the top*)
4. Selecting remote (or local + remote for case*) via opened window
5. Local or remote path aren't displaying on the new window and I have "Select a remote folder" (or "select the local folder" *) again. There are no change


### Environment data
Android version:
7.1.2
Device model: 
Nexus 4
Stock or customized system:
LineageOS 14
Nextcloud app version:
20171026 (but I have this issue since >2)
Nextcloud server version:

### Logs

No error
Insert your webserver log here
No web server log (no remote call needed for local selection)

Nothing special (no remote call)

title: Resized images - updated
body:
Successor of #69, rebased and updated to master.

What it does, copied from the ownCloud repo and heavily discussed there, so here just a CR:
- Clicking on an image loads a reduced version to the cache.
- The width and height is determinated by the screen.
- the benefit is a very small, but yet usable preview of the image.
- it can be used to send via whatsapp, or as a file to another app (like k9) with the correct filename.
- resized images are not treated as downloaded files. If the user wants to have the real file, he has to long-click and select download.
- clicking on an image shows first a square thumbnail (if available) until the resized image is loaded

**ToDo**
- [x] test with disabled API (gallery app)
  - test if thumbnails api can be used -> not possible right now
- [x] Unsupported image formats https://github.com/owncloud/android/pull/1599#issuecomment-229400874
  - [x] svg
  - [x] tiff
- [x] Bad preview of landscape images https://github.com/owncloud/android/pull/1599#issuecomment-229406324 [WIP]
- [x] sharing a non-downloaded image on Android N fails (at least with whatsapp)
- [x] sharing a non-cached resized image fails -> first download resized version
- [x] a resized image should load immediately (first on queue or dismiss all other current downloads)
- [x] ~~download of a resized image also with a nice download animation on the bottom?~~
- [x] snackbar is sometimes beneath virtual keys
- [x] ~~if resized version show "sending resized image" otherwise "send" (as it is  now)~~
- [x] test with disabled data
  - [x] show resized image if available
  - [x] show thumbnail if resized image not available
  - [x] show (something smart) if both is not available -> default image icon
- [x] on air plane mode: snackbar is shown all the time as resized download files -> prior check of connection

Assumptions:
- users do not want to download the whole image, instead just like streaming have only a resized version
- if an user wants to have many images in original quality, he can synchronize the folder

This leads us to
- always show a resized version
- if an user zooms in (> 2x) a snackbar "download full image: yes" will be shown (on every time)
- (to have the old behaviour: add setting "click on image downloads full image" (as checkbox))

Update: Talked to Jan @conf:
- behaviour setting can be removed
- otherwise approved

title: Prevent action bar title from being overwritten
label: [Label(name="hacktoberfest")]
body:
Proposed fix for #1693 

Resolves #1693 

Setting the title within the AsyncTask to prevent the ToolbarActivity from overwriting the title with the default provider title. I did some testing and it seems to work fine since the setTitle function is being called to run on the UI thread.

title: Push doesn't work
label: [Label(name="bug"), Label(name="high"), Label(name="pr exists")]
body:
Unfortunately for majority of users automatic storage location detection doesn't work. As a consequence generating the nc-keypair directory and key pair doesn't work either.

Manually selecting one of the available locations fixes this, but the location should be detected automatically or we'll never have some things working (like push here!).

Only a few of our users receive push notification, and this is bad :(

cc @tobiasKaminsky @AndyScherzinger 

please try to look into it.

title: Nextcloud app flashes notifications
label: [Label(name="bug")]

### Actual behaviour
Since the latest update of the Nextcloud app, it seems to repeatedly flash notifications for fractions of a second.

The notification shows up as both, a notification itcon on the top left corner of the screen as well as a "proper" notification bar across the screen that shows up when the phone is locked.

The flash is so short, that it is impossible to see the content. The notification bar doesn't even complete its animation before disappearing. However, the icon is shown just long enough to make out the Nextcloud logo.

When I "force stop" the Nextcloud app, the flashes disappear. When I then launch the app again, the flashes start again.

### Expected behaviour
Notifications should either be long-term if important or not shown at all.
 
### Steps to reproduce
1. Have the Nextcloud app installed
2. Observe notifications flashing up.
3.

Nextcloud app version:
2.0.0

Nextcloud server version:
12.0.3

title: Remove auto upload behaviours
label: [Label(name="enhancement"), Label(name="needs info/discussion")]
body:
There are several issues with auto upload behaviours, some of which can and some of which aren't that EASILY fixable.

Because the new Auto Upload overwrites files on the server (https://github.com/nextcloud/android/issues/1685), users think this is unwanted behaviour. Unfortunately this is indeed INTENDED - if you modify a file, you should get a file uploaded. And CREATE + DELETE + CREATE == modification.

In general, I think we should not touch the files outside our Nc data folder so I would suggest we completely eliminate Auto Upload behaviours.

title: Auto uploads replaces files with the same name.

It's hard for users to "read / guess" what is the section title and what are the entries ;-), see the "list" bellow where titles are purple:
![settings - not enough clear difference between title and entries](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1452146/31561715-1048c51c-b059-11e7-870f-ceea5006d5f8.png)

### Expected behaviour
Do a clear difference between title and entries for instance BIG / CAPITALIZED TITLE and Lower font size for entries or change the position of entries (little right indent).

title: Android app doesn't show user icon if user name contains whitespace
label: [Label(name="bug"), Label(name="hacktoberfest"), Label(name="pr exists")]
body:
Bug opened as requested in https://help.nextcloud.com/t/solved-android-app-doesnt-show-user-icon-if-user-name-contains-whitespace/22217 by Andy:

### Actual behaviour
I have several accounts with profile photos. Only for the account with a space in the username, the profile photo is not shown in the app. It’s shown on the web. The same photo is shown in a test account (without whitespace in its user name) when I upload the identical file.

### Expected behaviour
Profile photo should be shown in app, too.
 
### Steps to reproduce
1. create a user with whitespace, such as "maidenname surname".
2. assign a profile photo to that user.
3. add that account to the app. Profile photo is not shown.

### Environment data
Android version: 7.1.1
Device model: OP 3T
Stock or customized system: stock OOS
Nextcloud app version: 1.4.x and 2.0 betax
Nextcloud server version: 12.0.3

### Logs
Please request which logs you need. But you should be able to reproduce yourself easily ;-)

2. Set the phone to aeroplane mode
3. Take a picture

Android version: 7.1.2 

Device model: Hammerhead

Stock or customized system: Lineage OS 14.1 2017-08-22

Nextcloud app version: 2.0.0RC5

Nextcloud server version: 12

### Logs
Not relevant: application-side only.

title: Feature Request: limit upload bandwidth
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
### Actual behaviour

Nextcloud uploads/autouploads use 100% available bandwidth of my home internet. Due to crapiness of my ISP, draining 100% of upload results in super slow internet for every internet user in my network. It's not a router problem. It's an ISP problem. But it's also a Nextcloud Android problem because Nextcloud Desktop has a way to limit the upload bandwidth. 

### Expected behaviour

A mechanism that allows to limit upload bandwidth similar (but not identical) to Nextcloud desktop.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/611746/31525956-844d7f32-af89-11e7-9158-02a66e78ba37.png)

title: Activity is always empty
label: [Label(name="approved"), Label(name="bug"), Label(name="pr exists")]
body:
### Actual behaviour
Activity is always empty even when file downloads are in progress.

### Questions
Is it the designed behaviour? I guess not, for instance see #1639.
What kind of info should be displayed under Activity entry in the Android Sync Client? Why can it be empty?

title: Avatar Etags
body:
Resolves #1566

This caches the etag of an avatar and sends the etag to server and gets
- a new avatar if etag changed -> use new one
- a 304 response, meaning nothing changed -> show old avatar

Edit: not query the server too often we could also implement a 15min timeout, or whatever time.

label: [Label(name="bug"), Label(name="needs info/discussion")]
body:
### Actual behaviour
-Tell us what happens
While being away, I had trouble getting reliable internet access, it seems my http connection was working but everything related to https was being blocked.
Browsing with Firefox was not a problem but NC and Gmail were no go.
So in absence of connection, NC, but possibly SMS app linked to my server seemed to being the culprit in taking my phone down in a matter of a few hours. 4 or 5 hours seemed to be the time required to drain my phone from a full charge.
I came to the point where I disabled WiFi altogether but even that didn't stop the battery from being drained.

### Expected behaviour
-Tell us what should happen

title: Issue with certificate while traveling
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
### Actual behaviour
-Tell us what happens
I just came from a trip and at the hotel I wanted to get access to the WiFi. I had the required credential to get WiFi up and running, but I have noticed the following:

- I was able to connect to the WiFi access point but I need to enter the credential to access the Internet (which I didn't do right away) because the signin pages is to slow to popup.
- I then start NC and upon starting it, I get a dialog requesting to accept or decline the certificate. At this point NC believes it has to update the certificate which is not true as the certificate on my server and my NC account on the phone have not been updated.

- For me to access NC, I have to enter the credential for the access point.
- I can then access NC.

### Expected behaviour
-Tell us what should happen
 NC shouldn't mess with the certificate when it is connected to an access point without Internet access. Internet access should be available once credential of the access point are specified.

### Steps to reproduce
1. See above
2. 
3. 


### Environment data
Android version:
6.0
Device model: 
LG3
Stock or customized system:
Stock
Nextcloud app version:
2.0.0RC8
Nextcloud server version:
12.3

title: add transparency to navigation bar for image preview

Fixes: #1638

title: Bug with photo export
label: [Label(name="approved"), Label(name="bug"), Label(name="hacktoberfest")]
body:
### Actual behaviour
The export function doesn't work well. I can't download the file on my device. It seems the bug comes from the type MIME misdetected when the extension is in uppercase.
See android/src/main/java/com/owncloud/android/utils/MimeTypeUtil.java, this code is case-sensitive (won't work with uppercase).

### Expected behaviour
When I click the export link, Android should suggest me to copy the file on my device. 
 
### Steps to reproduce
1. Sync a jpg file with the extension in uppercase (.JPG)
2. Try to export it with the app


### Environment data
Android version: 7.0

Device model: Honor 8

Stock or customized system: Stock

Nextcloud app version: 1.4.3

Nextcloud server version: 12.0.3

title: "Quota": If no quota is set, show the total usage/space of the server
label: [Label(name="needs info/discussion")]
body:
resolves #471 by showing the usage of the account

@tobiasKaminsky is this what you intended? Because it doesn't give you the free disc space... I shows used space by that user / total disc space

title: Some small issues with search
label: [Label(name="bug"), Label(name="hacktoberfest")]
body:
- [ ] When you open a folder and then directly search, the background refresh will kick you out of the search
- [ ] The header text is not alinged correctly. Should be left-aligned just like the heading (or with the content text in the list view)
- [ ] The search spinner should say a more contextual »Searching …« instead of »Loading«
- [ ] When removing the search or going back, you see »No files in here« first, which is confusing or alarming since it seems like the files are gone.

title: Activity section design details
label: [Label(name="design"), Label(name="enhancement"), Label(name="pr exists")]
body:
Currently the Activity section looks like this:
![screenshot_2017-10-03-19-25-35](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/925062/31353776-228cdbbe-ad34-11e7-8b82-6600a98261d5.png)

To make it look more in line with the Nextcloud style, here’s some detail fixes:
- [x] The big headings should not repeat the small detail timestamp. The first one is »Today« (if any), followed by »Yesterday« (if any), followed by the date like »Saturday, October 7«, then »Friday, October 6« etc and so on (also include the year as soon as the event history goes to last year)
- [x] The links should have no underline, bolding is enough
- [x] The link color can be black instead of the Nextcloud blue / primary color as it looks quite out of place. What do you think @nextcloud/android?
- [x] In the web interface we have 50% opacity on all of the action icons on the left since they are a bit too overpowering otherwise.
- [ ] Of course it would be great to have avatars of the other people in this view left next to their name. :)

title: In detail view (when viewing a picture), also make the background of the lower bar transparent
label: [Label(name="design"), Label(name="enhancement"), Label(name="good first issue"), Label(name="hacktoberfest")]
body:
Just like the background of the header with filename etc is half-transparent, the bottom bar (with back, home, switcher) should be half-transparent too. Currently it’s black.

Then when you zoom into images there’s more perceived space for them. :)

title: Also display share icon in detail view, left next to 3-dot-icon
label: [Label(name="design"), Label(name="enhancement"), Label(name="good first issue"), Label(name="hacktoberfest"), Label(name="pr exists")]
body:
As a follow-up to File actions in the list #579, we should also have the share icon directly displayed in the detail view header (where currently only the 3-dot-icon is).

Also cc @rhari991 who is working on Add options for operations on single files #1613

title: Hide select and deselect all on preview and details fragments, fix #1574
label: [Label(name="hacktoberfest")]
body:
resolves #1574

This change makes select/deselect menu items invisible on fragments where they should be invisible. To do this, first was needed to "split" two different "select all" actions into different ones, so they are not overlapped. For that, one of them was changed from "action_select_all" to "action_select_all_action_menu". Second, in method filter() that decides which menu items are visible, "inSingleFileFragment" bool is pushed. This is how we decide are we under some listing, or showing single file (either details or any preview fragment).

title: Adding sdcard prompts immediate backup
label: [Label(name="AutoUpload"), Label(name="bug")]
body:
### Actual behaviour
I've migrated to a new device and as normal have moved the SD card over with it.

Nextcloud detects all media files in autoupload folders as brand new and attempts to immediately upload on 1800 media files, overwriting those already there.

I've had to remove and re-add the account to prevent this.

We need some form of check against what's uploaded already on the server.



### Environment data
Android version: 7.1.1

Device model: Moto Z Play

Stock or customized system: stock

Nextcloud app version: RC7

Nextcloud server version: 12.0.3

title: Migrating apps & data to a new device - bad config rc7
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
### Actual behaviour
I've set up a new device opting to migrate accounts and data from the old phone. 

NC requests a login, however in the background already has a config in place leading to ghosts of folders that don't exist on an SD card that isn't present.

.. then it uses battery trying to upload nothing (notification is there, nothing happens).
 
### Steps to reproduce
1. Run android setup wizard (new phone or factory reset)
2. Opt to transfer data 
3. Try to configure auto upload
4. See all folders present from old phone, set to upload but not existing.


### Environment data
Android version: 7.1.1

Device model: Moto Z Play (migrating from Moto Z)

Stock or customized system: Stock

Nextcloud app version: RC7

Nextcloud server version: 12.0.3

Screenshots wanted?

title: End to end encryption - overview
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
Remaining tasks
- [x] never re-use key/iv if uploading, always generate new key/iv
- [x] simplify upload encryptedUpload() and normalUpload()
- [x] harden up/download process: revert if something is failing
- [x] handle existing user
    - [ ] Get public system key from server to validate the signature of the users public key.
- [x] upload existing file -> automatically rename it
- [ ] synchronize file
- [x] handle error if folder is locked
- [x] resume existing upload with token
- [ ] create new folder within encrypted folder
    - same as upload new file
    - encrypt folder name and store in metadata.files
- [ ] move folder
- [ ] copy folder
- [ ] move file
- [ ] copy file
- [ ] rename file
- [ ] sharing
  - [ ] add/remove users
  - [ ] add sharing options back to UI
  - [ ] encrypt/decrypt metadata to multiple public keys
- [ ] tint setup dialog correctly
- [ ] metadata integrity: In case an encrypted referenced file is deleted from the file system but still found in the metadata a warning should be displayed to the user.
- [ ] integrity part 2: In case a file is referenced in the metadata but cannot be found on the WebDAV file system the user should be warned about this. If the file exists locally but not on the file system the client should reupload the file.
- [ ] Confirm encryption passphrase: https://blog.bitpay.com/content/images/2015/12/backup.png
- [ ] discuss how and when to show the passphrase again
- [ ] CN of X.509 certificate must be set to the currently logged-in User ID
- [ ] show real file name during upload ![2017-09-18-154501](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5836855/30545174-25783898-9c89-11e7-97d4-5e9505ff5f3b.png)
- [ ] handle if folder is locked
    - on folder enter: persistent snackbar "folder is locked by another client"
    (currently only possible via a second call)

title: First release of E2E
body:
This is the first release to support end to end encryption.
Server app is needed: https://github.com/nextcloud/end_to_end_encryption

TODO:
- [x] handle if folder is locked
   - [x] during upload 
   - [x] during download: error message of server is displayed
- [x] handle interruption during upload
    - [x] save metadata, unlock token
   - [x] on retry upload file, metadata and then use unlock token
- [x] correct appending (2), (3) if files have the same name
- [x] Set new versionCode/VersionName for next release:
    versionCode="20010051"
android:versionName="2.1.0-e2e-01
- [x] delete local keys on account removal
- Test upgrade from
    - [ ] 2.0.0
    - [ ] first e2e version
- [x] disable logger prior merge in setup.xml

title: SQL and php error in PDOStatement.php#91
body:
Hi, i switched from owncloud to nextcloud last month. Now i checked the errorlogs and found 2 errors:

> An exception occurred while executing 'SELECT `uid`, `displayname` FROM `EGUq6_users` WHERE LOWER(`uid`) = LOWER(?)' with params ["Butzback"]: SQLSTATE[HY000]: General error: 2006 MySQL server has gone away

> Error while sending QUERY packet. PID=31955 at /www/htdocs/w01750fc/3rdparty/doctrine/dbal/lib/Doctrine/DBAL/Driver/PDOStatement.php#91

The first message is i think because i use a uppercased B in my username... But why i can enter uppercase letters, when its not supported by nextcloud?

And the second error i dont understand. is this a bug?

Best Regards.

title: Retry failed uploads automatically if mobile data connection comes back/gets enabled by user
label: [Label(name="AutoUpload"), Label(name="bug")]

-The upload should be retried if a mobile data connection becomes available again/the user reenables it and "Upload using Wifi only" is disabled.

1. Add a file to the instant upload list (for example taking a picture) while without a mobile data connection and having "Upload using Wifi only" is disabled.

title: Add customizable delay on removal of original file
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
### Actual behaviour
Received pictures are uploaded and removed directly, and are therefore not viewable by the apps.

### Expected behaviour
Being able to at least see the received pictures for some time, *before* they are being removed by Nextcloud, even if conditions of "only upload via Wi-Fi" and "original file will be removed" are correctly met. A setting to upload immediatly, but only remove the original file after X time should fix this.
 
### Steps to reproduce
1. Set "only upload via Wifi" and "original file will be removed" preferences, and have an active wifi connection.
2. Receive pictures in one of the monitored folders (ie. WhatsApp images)
3. Pictures will be uploaded already -kudos!- and removed, therefore not viewable in WhatsApp. 


### Environment data
Android version: 7.0
Device model: Samsung Galaxy 6 Edge Plus
Stock or customized system: Stock

title: Disappearing menu items in autoupload list
body:
### Actual behaviour
As autoupload isn't working on my device (Meizu m3 note, flyme 6, android 5.1), I'm launching autoupload sync manually with menu item at upload status screen. But when I click any menu item - it is disappearing until I reopen upload status screen.

Nothing in logs. Absolutely.

### Expected behaviour
Menu items do not disappear.
 
### Steps to reproduce
1. Open upload status screen.
2. Click on ANY menu item.
3. Item disappeared until upload status screen is reopened.


### Environment data
Android version: 5.1 (flyme 6 global)

Device model: Meizu m3 note

Stock or customized system: stock

Nextcloud app version: 2.0.0RC6

Nextcloud server version: 11.0.5

### Logs

Nothing in logs on my phone. Absolutely.

title: suppress annoying "warning: Ignoring InnerClasses"
body:
This is due to FreeMarker, and as we cannot change this lib, we can suppress the warning, I guess.

```
warning: Ignoring InnerClasses attribute for an anonymous inner class
(freemarker.ext.beans.MapModel$1) that doesn't come with an
associated EnclosingMethod attribute. This class was probably produced by a
compiler that did not target the modern .class file format. The recommended
solution is to recompile the class from source, using an up-to-date compiler
and without specifying any "-target" type options. The consequence of ignoring
this warning is that reflective operations on this class will incorrectly
indicate that it is *not* an inner class.
```

title: Can't download files
label: [Label(name="bug"), Label(name="needs info/discussion")]
body:
Dear Sir or Madam,

I would be glad to have some of your thoughts about my issue.
Thank you for your time.

Sincerely,

N.

### Actual behaviour
-Tell us what happens
The android client doesn't download some types of files (.pdf/.doc/.txt/...). The problem seems to be related to "text files", the videos, pictures and sounds are downloaded correctly.
It also seems to be a problem from my server, I tried to use NextCloud's demo  account on the app and the files got downloaded correctly.

Everything works fine with the Windows client or the webui and the encryption isn't enabled.

I used to have this issue on my ownCloud server before installing NextCloud from scratch hoping to fix it.

This issue seems to be related to this thread [#347](https://github.com/nextcloud/android/issues/347) 

### Expected behaviour
-Tell us what should happen
 The client should open every type of files.
### Steps to reproduce
1. Open android's Nextcloud client
2. Add a new account with the following credential 
>Server address : https://durst-webmaster.fr/cloud
Username : test
Password : **\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\***
3. Try to download Nextcloud Manual

Android version:

Device model:

Stock

title: In file detail view, »Deselect all« is shown in 3-dot-menu

body: Open a picture and go to the 3-dot-menu in the header. One of the actions it will show is »Deselect all« which makes no sense here. ;)

title: Filetype icons and previews are quite small now
label: [Label(name="bug"), Label(name="design"), Label(name="hacktoberfest"), Label(name="pr exists")]
body: Some time ago, the filetype icons and previews seem to have shrunk. Weren’t they a bit bigger in the past? They are pretty small now so it would be good to bring them back to the size they were. Or is there an Android standard to those sizes?

title: Remove action should be called »Delete« everywhere, and always be at bottom of lists such as long press menu and details view menu
label: [Label(name="1. developing"), Label(name="design"), Label(name="enhancement"), Label(name="good first issue")]
body: Currently it’s called »Remove« and somewhere in the middle of the list.

title: Login fails "Access denied: Local file does not exist"
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
### Actual behaviour
- Try to login to the Android App 2.0 RC7
- input username and password
- message appears: "zugriff fehlgeschlagen: Local file does not exist" (Access denied - Local file does not exist")
### Expected behaviour
-Grant access to my files
 
### Steps to reproduce
1. Open Android Nextcloud App 2.0 RC7 from Google Playstore Beta program
2. Grant Access with username/password (NOT via "App token" - does not seem to work either with different error message)
3. Enter username/password
4. See error message

### Environment data
Android version: 7.0

Device model: Samsung Galaxy S7

Stock or customized system: Stock ROM

Nextcloud app version: 2.0 RC7 (same error appears since RC2)

Nextcloud server version: 12.03 (also in 12.02 - I have just upgraded to 12.03, no change)

### Additional Info
1. Nextcloud is installed in a subfolder: https://my.domain/nextcloud/
2. I have added this in .htaccess to force SSL connections:
```
RewriteCond %{HTTPS} off
RewriteRule (.*) https://%{HTTP_HOST}%{REQUEST_URI} [R=301,L]
```



### Logs
At the time of the failed login, I can see these messages in the logs. At first glance, nothing seems to be related to the login behaviour I have described - but please double check (I am certainly not a professional...)

#### Web server error log
```

title: Add option to undo "remove failed uploads" if selected accidentally
body:
### Actual behaviour
- If an upload fails for whatever reason and "remove failed uploads" is tapped accidentally instead of "restart failed uploads", there is no easy way to revert this operation. Instead all failed uploads have to be found (no list or anything, which means it is very difficult if it happens for a lot of files) and selected by hand for uploading.

### Expected behaviour
- An undo button (maybe at the bottom) should be shown like Nextcloud does everywhere else because it is good UI/UX design.
 
### Steps to reproduce
1. Generate an upload that fails (enabling instant upload and taking a picture with the camera while losing connection for example)
2. Retry to upload the image but instead accidentally tap the "remove failed uploads" in the menu instead of "retry failed uploads"

title: Refresh user avatar
label: [Label(name="approved"), Label(name="enhancement"), Label(name="pr exists")]
body:
### Actual behaviour
-Change user photo (or other info) and nextcloud client not reflect it.

### Expected behaviour
-When change any user info on server must be reflected in the client. This already happens for the background image. So both images should be cached for a certain amount of time, e.g. 24 hours.
 
### Steps to reproduce
1. Login on android client.
2. Change user profile on nectcloud server
3. Launch android client.
4. See sidebar info and see old profile...


### Environment data
Android version: 6.0

Device model: Moto X

Stock or customized system: Stok

Nextcloud app version: 2.0.rc5 or anything else..

Nextcloud server version: 2.0.1

### Logs
#### Web server error log
```
IMHO Irrelevant
```

#### Nextcloud log (data/nextcloud.log)
```
IMHO. Irrelevant
```
**NOTE:** Be super sure to remove sensitive data like passwords, note that everybody can look here! You can use the Issue Template application to prefill some of the required information: https://apps.nextcloud.com/apps/issuetemplate

title: Fix bug if photo is URL
body:
Currently if photo is not a blob, but an URL a NPE results.
This prevents NPE, but shows currently "only" the default icon.
https://github.com/nextcloud/android/issues/1564 is an enhancement to also fetch & store these images.

title: Support image url in photos in vCards
label: [Label(name="enhancement"), Label(name="hacktoberfest"), Label(name="pr exists")]
body:
From wikipedia:
```
BEGIN:VCARD
VERSION:2.1
N:Mustermann;Erika;;Dr.;
FN:Dr. Erika Mustermann
ORG:Wikimedia
ROLE:Kommunikation
TITLE:Redaktion & Gestaltung
PHOTO;JPEG:http://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:Erika_Mustermann_2010.jpg
TEL;WORK;VOICE:(0221) 9999123
TEL;HOME;VOICE:(0221) 1234567
ADR;HOME:;;Heidestrasse 17;Koeln;;51147;Deutschland
EMAIL;PREF;INTERNET:erika@mustermann.de
REV:20140301T221110Z
END:VCARD
```

This is already correct parsed by vcard library: either data is filled or url is set.
So the url must be fetched and stored.

title: double uploads
body:
### Actual behaviour
i only have my camera folder set-up so it auto-syncs to my nextcloud-server (only wlan) splitted into pics and videos (seperated dirs server) but some images and videos are uploaded/copied to the instant-upload-folder ("SofortUpload/Camera"), and then uploaded / synced too, which is REALLY annoying.
Since we are 6 people/phones and even more desktop-endpoints in my house using this feature (syncing) you can understand, that this gets really critical in terms of wasted space. 

### Expected behaviour
it should catch new files in the camery-folder, seperate pics and videos and transfer them to the server when wlan is on 
 
re-installing didn't help, since from what i read here, the settings et.al never gets deleted, but since i use this app from the very beginning, it might have corrupted some settings while i took updates i was offered (in fact g-play does that automagically for me in the background). 

### Steps to reproduce
1. 


### Environment data
Android version: 
8 (Oreo)

Device model: 
Nexus 5x
Stock or customized system:
Stock
Nextcloud app version:
1.4.3 
Nextcloud server version:
12.3 (just updated)
### Logs
#### Web server error log
```
Insert your webserver log here
```

#### Nextcloud log (data/nextcloud.log)
```
Insert your Nextcloud log here
```
**NOTE:** Be super sure to remove sensitive data like passwords, note that everybody can look here! You can use the Issue Template application to prefill some of the required information: https://apps.nextcloud.com/apps/issuetemplate

btw:
i love what you do guys, so bare with me, when i sound a little too critical since this app is free, but i need this to be fixed ;)

title: NPE if pending uploads exists on account removal
body:
Steps that triggered NPE:
- have pending uploads
- remove last existing account

-> NPE in getCurrentAndPendingUploadsForCurrentAccount() and other due to null in
AccountUtils.getCurrentOwnCloudAccount(mContext)

I changed the function to 
public static @Nullable Account getCurrentOwnCloudAccount(Context context)

now the IDE warns if one access a potentially nullable variable. Very useful!

update to latest gradle Android plugin version update to 3.0.0-beta6

title: CentOS automatic updates break external storage (Windows shares)
label: [Label(name="bug"), Label(name="needs info/discussion")]
body:
Hello All,

My Nextcloud instance runs on CentOS 7 with yum-cron for automatic updates.

Last friday my external storage stopped working, it seems a new samba was rolled out in centos 7 and it requires the use of domain\username and not just username.

Adding the domain for shares with global stored credentials worked, however, it does not work when the option 'log-in credentials save in session' is used. I cannot add a domain there (option missing). And my users log on via webdav and can't add it either.

The error is vague, 
'could not get credentials because session is unavialable'

What can be a possible work-around?

title: Update some Korean translation
body:
I just updated some Korean translations.
There were bunch of mistakes about spacing and words.

title: Do not show warning on very first start of fresh installation
body:
The "account is corrupt" warning for RC version was also shown on fresh installations.

onCreate() in FileContentProvider is only called on very first start, so it is safe to put it in there.
I know this is a hack as has nothing to do with Database, but I hope it is fine as we can remove it on final 2.0 release?

P.s: In opposite to what we discussed @AndyScherzinger your very first idea was so much smoother and simpler that I had to use it ;-)

title: 2.0.0RC6: NPE - SyncedFoldersActivity.load
label: [Label(name="bug"), Label(name="pr exists")]
body:
```
java.lang.RuntimeException: 
  at android.app.ActivityThread.performLaunchActivity (ActivityThread.java:2817)
  at android.app.ActivityThread.handleLaunchActivity (ActivityThread.java:2892)
  at android.app.ActivityThread.-wrap11 (Unknown Source)
  at android.app.ActivityThread$H.handleMessage (ActivityThread.java:1593)
  at android.os.Handler.dispatchMessage (Handler.java:105)
  at android.os.Looper.loop (Looper.java:164)
  at android.app.ActivityThread.main (ActivityThread.java:6541)
  at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke (Native Method)
  at com.android.internal.os.Zygote$MethodAndArgsCaller.run (Zygote.java:240)
  at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit.main (ZygoteInit.java:767)
Caused by: java.lang.NullPointerException: 
  at com.owncloud.android.ui.activity.SyncedFoldersActivity.load (SyncedFoldersActivity.java:218)
  at com.owncloud.android.ui.activity.SyncedFoldersActivity.setupContent (SyncedFoldersActivity.java:197)
  at com.owncloud.android.ui.activity.SyncedFoldersActivity.onCreate (SyncedFoldersActivity.java:150)

  at android.app.Instrumentation.callActivityOnCreate (Instrumentation.java:1213)
  at android.app.ActivityThread.performLaunchActivity (ActivityThread.java:2770)
```

LoC:
```
if (syncedFolder.getAccount().equals(currentAccount.name)) {
```

This has been reported only once (bySept. 15th) and it is unclear what is ```null```. It could be ```syncedFolder```, ```getAccount()``` or ```currentAccount```. While none of them makes any sense to me, the only one that I think would be possible is ```currentAccount``` being ```null```.

title: Using theme utils instead of custom implementation for color fallback
body:
resolves  #1551

the code wasn't error-prone if the background image wasn't empty or a valid URL the code tried to parse it as color which should always fail and the proper fallback is to use the primary color and do that via theme utils which also has a fallback to the Nc color in case the theme's color is corrupt.

This is a 2.0.0RC crash so it should be part of the 2.0.0 final.

cc @tobiasKaminsky @mario

title: User does not stay logged in.
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
Currently I am using SSO & SAML app for user login so this could be part of the problem, however whenever the app closes, the app does not save the user's login state. 

If I open the app, enter in the URL and login (In my case its a google login using SAML) everything comes up as it should. Then if I close the app and re-open it again, I am given the same screen requesting the server URL again. 

The app does not appear to save the user state or even save the last nextcloud server URL when I close the app. 

I currently cannot test with the SSO & SAML app disabled, so its possible that its the SAML login that is causing this issue. 

==Specs==

Nextcloud Server 12.0.2
Nextcloud Android Version 20170903 (downloaded using fdroid)
Android 6.0.1
Samsung Note 4

title: [feature request] Sync with check
body:
Hi,

The actual feature to auto upload files on folders is very good, but I think it can miss a little option or function.

Is there any way to add an option to tell nextcloud app to check if there are missing files on the server, to upload missing files ?

For example, I create the sync for my camera folder, but only new files will be uploaded, not old ones already present on my phone.

If we can had a sort of real replication can be very very usefull (and not only for pictures), maybe like a simple "one shot" button to tell "upload missing files".

By the way I'm talking only for a one way replication (android to server).


Thanks ;)

title: RC6 queues and subsequently overwrites files already previously uploaded
label: [Label(name="bug"), Label(name="pr exists")]
body:
### Actual behaviour
Installed RC6
Removed existing account
Re-added account
Setup autoupload with alllllll my folders
700+ photos immediately queued, most of which already exist on the server and are therefore overwritten

### Expected behaviour
1. Shouldn't be uploading anything by design but:
1.1 Could validate the remote folder against the local if it's going to try to upload ALL THE THINGS out of the blue to avoid this problem
1.2 Could duplicate rather than overwrite as there's no guarantee the images won't corrupt after extended time on SD.
 
### Steps to reproduce
1. Upgrade from RC5 to RC6 via Play
2+ See actual behaviour


### Environment data
Android version: 7.1.2

Device model: Moto Z

Stock or customized system: Stock

Nextcloud app version: RC6

Nextcloud server version: 12.0.2

title: Remove/insert same SD card causes duplicate auto-upload of all images/videos
body:
### Actual behaviour
- Remove SD card with images/videos that have already been auto-uploaded
- Re-insert same SD card
- Observe that Nextcloud re-uploads duplicates of all images/videos

### Expected behaviour
-Nextcloud doesn't upload duplicates
 
### Steps to reproduce
1. Setup Nextcould to auto-upload new images/videos.
2. Take some pictures/videos and save them to the SD card.
3. Observe that Nextcloud correctly auto-uploads them.
4. Remove the SD card.
5. Re-insert the SD card (note that some devices combine the SD and SIM slots, so it isn't possible to swap SIMs without removing the SD card as well).
6. Observe the Nextcloud re-uploads duplicates of all images/videos that it previously auto-uploaded from the SD card.

### Environment data
Android version:
Android 7.1.2

Device model: 
BlackBerry BBD100-2

Stock or customized system:
Stock

Nextcloud app version:
1.4.3

Nextcloud server version:
Owncloud v8.x

title: nextcloud dev crashes and won't create user account
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
### Actual behaviour
The nextcloud dev app crashes unexpectedly or simply reverts to the initial account creation display

### Expected behaviour
The app should create an account (on my android device).  At the least provide a normal user some feed back as to why the app is crashing or can't create an android account (even if this isn't the nextcloud app's fault - see below). 
 
### Steps to reproduce
Apologies, I've had with so many flippin problems with this app (note this issue will happen on the non-dev version) that I'm no longer sure how I got here and going off on it will likely not be helpful...

Likely I got here along the lines described in the response "answered Jun 20 '16 at 16:06 hiBrianLee" to
this post:

https://stackoverflow.com/questions/37406666/accountmanager-does-not-add-custom-account-in-android-n-preview

See also: https://github.com/nextcloud/android/issues/820

This problem has not happened (to me) if the nextcloud account entry on the android device is preserved during an update event.

Again apologies if this has already been reported and a fix is forthcoming... I'd sure like to know about it.

### Environment data
Android version:7.1.2 lineageos 14.1 20170908

Device model: surnia

Stock or customized system: custom, no-gapps

Nextcloud app version: fdroid nextcloud dev 20170903. also affects fdroid nextcloud dev 20170707, fdroid nexcloud 2.0.0 RC5

Nextcloud server version:12.0.0, Ubuntu 16.04.3 LTS (GNU/Linux 4.4.0-93-generic x86_64), TOPT enabled, https only, redirected from DDNS service at a high port that is redirected to port 443 by my router.  

This configuration has worked for many months prior to this event.  

FWIW, this problem does not happen (I could create an account on the android device) when on my own network and using the ip address of the server without port redirection.  

The mysql table oc_bruteforce_attempts had entry's but this problem persisted after I removed them and restarted the nextcloud server.  In any event, it seems like an android account creation problem to me - see below.

### Logs
A connection is made to my server and an "app password" is created by the android app on the nextcloud server.  The nextcloud app apparently crashes/resets after that.  logcat on the android device indicates the account already exists on the android device similar to that described in the post:

https://github.com/nextcloud/android/issues/820

Examination of the files: /data/system/sync/accounts.xml and /data/system_de/0/accounts_de.db (pulled from the android device while in recovery) showed no nextcloud accounts; however, four nextcloud accounts entries from prior attempts to troubleshoot this were in /data/system_ce/0/accounts_ce.db.  Removing the nextcloud entries from the accounts_ce.db file and pushing the modified version back to the device fixes the issue.

HTH.

title: Feature Request: 2FA via Mobile App
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
It would be really nice to be able to use the Mobile App to accept 2FA Logins via the Webbrowser.
Several Online Banking Apps use this Kind of 2FA for Transactions.

Workflow example - Login via Webbrowser:
1. Login with usual Username/Password
2. User chooses "Mobile App" as 2FA Mechanism
3. Mobile App: Message Popup with Browser/IP Address of the Browser Login
4. User can Accept/Decline it (There should be some Kind of Timeout. e.g. 60sec which should also be visible in the Browser)
If Fingerprint is activated in the App - An additional Fingerprint Request is made
5. If the User clicks "Accept" in the User will be logged in

There should be some kind of blacklisted 2FA Mechanisms, depending on the Access/Login.
e.g. On Login with the Mobile App, the Mobile App 2FA should be blacklisted and alternative Mechanism like TOTP enforced.

title: Delaying upload if device is in power save mode
body:
This change adds handling for uploads from device when it is operating in power save mode and is part of the fix for #1277. In those case, uploads are behaving similar as if upload requires Wi-Fi (or that device needs to be charging) and those conditions are not met - they are delayed until device exits power save mode. Same thing holds true for contacts backup and explicit uploads - they are not delayed. Difference with Wi-Fi (and charging) conditions is in that 1) this delay cannot be set per synced folder and 2) it is turned on by default. For devices that don't have this capability (API level < 21) - old behavior (backward-compatible) is used; they behave as this check is not present.

Also added is listener for power save mode, albeit it makes sense only if user explicitly turns off power save mode while it is in it, as putting device to be charged will restart all jobs already by design (another listener that already exists).

title: Update contributing.md with new merge/git workflow
label: [Label(name="enhancement"), Label(name="pr exists")]
body:
As discussed on the conf we want to try a slightly different workflow with master and a 2.x release branch.
@AndyScherzinger has the corresponding images and volunteered to draw & update the contributing.md

title: Dev version: no independant branch, but master
label: [Label(name="enhancement"), Label(name="pr exists")]
body:
As decided on conf we want to have the dev version to focus on the current master, to test all merged features as soon as possible. 

For this we need a new flavor which replaces the appid,provider names, ...
It is a good start to compare dev-base (https://github.com/nextcloud/android/tree/dev-base) with master to see which files are necessary to be changed.

There will still be a nightly cronjob to test if something has changed and then publish the new version both to Fdroid and our internal https://download.nextcloud.com/android/dev/

This change will be done as soon as all "ready for dev" branches are merged, so that ideally no one experience a difference ;-)

label: [Label(name="enhancement"), Label(name="hacktoberfest"), Label(name="pr exists")]
body:
Frankly, I never updated anything of the user manual and we have hardcoded checkout of a rather old version:
Submodule path 'user_manual/ocdoc': checked out '343496c792616459e8204b6614fd42a1b16a6d68' from 26 Jan 2015.

I suggest to drop this reference from our repo, so this will not get checked out anymore (will also speed up drone).

If we have (ever) time, we can do a rewrite of docs.

title: Backup: exclude database
label: [Label(name="approved"), Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
In backup.config.xml we currently exclude evernote_jobs.* and we should also exclude our database.
Otherwise it can happen that the database is restored from a (google) backup and leads to inconsistent.

On uninstalling the app, following should be deleted

label: [Label(name="enhancement"), Label(name="pr exists")]

### Actual behaviour
OCFileListFragment.generateFooterText doesn't honor languages with multiple plurals. In those languages, translations are limited (and wrong). For example, "file_list__footer__files" is not plural resource and as such, will not make sense in those languages

### Expected behaviour
Use plural resource to show files and folders in footer. Ideally, logic of this method could be simplified greatly.
 
### Steps to reproduce
1. Change language of phone to language with multiple plurals (Serbian is example I know)
2. Notice that generated translations are nonsensical and weird

Android version:
Dev

title: Using Arbitrary Data Provider for Layout and Sort Order
label: [Label(name="approved"), Label(name="enhancement"), Label(name="pr exists")]
body:
Based on #1484

########

> How do you clean up preference entries once say a folder dissappears?:)

Well, first of all, I would evaluate if that's really an issue.
If it's really an issue, I then would ask the person who wrote isGridViewPreferred, what his evaluation was, and how he intended to solve it if at all. :)

If I had to solve it, I tend to use a database having foreign keys and constraints available. So, in case a folder gets removed, we only need to remove all sort-entries for all users of that particular folder.
Folder ids also have the benefit of being path-unrelated. So, less hassle for a user, if he moves some dirs.

My preliminary evaluation tends to "it's not an issue". I cannot imagine that those few bytes are a problem at all. Take this with a grain of salt, as I am new to the project, I might mis-estimate here.

########

Talking practically, it might not be an issue. Talking good design, it is an issue.

As for Arbitrary Data ... yes, it was one of the ideas behind it. You'd basically have "sort_13245" (as an example, where 13245 is folder ID) as a key, and value as the actual sort preference.

I would not mind moving layout preferences to Arbitrary Data as well ... "layout_12345" and then "grid"/"list" as value. Wishful thinking? :)

@mario  @tobiasKaminsky

title: Bruteforce protection and login
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
* do a lot of failed logins
* try to login via Android
* expected: it takes long, but will log in (max penalty for this is 30 seconds on the server - so 40 seconds should be fine)
* actual: it says "Request takes too long" and fails

Maybe there could be a soft-fail: after 5 seconds a little hint that expands below the circle: "Yes, request is still running. Either the server is slow or the brute force protection (link) is triggered."

based on discussion https://twitter.com/robtranquillo/status/905411667139469312

@AndyScherzinger @tobiasKaminsky @robtranquillo

title: Cannot connect via app over LAN
body:
### Actual behaviour
The android app cannot connect to a Nextcloud server over LAN, but it can connect to the same server from outside the local network. There is no issue in connecting via a web browser, local or not, even on android.

### Expected behaviour
The app shouldn't have a problem connecting if a web browser has no problem connecting.
 
### Steps to reproduce
1. Install Nextcloud on a server and connect to a router.
2. Install the Nextcloud app on an android phone and connect to the same router. The app can't reach the server.
3. Navigate to the same url that the app uses, but in a web browser on android (Chrome). Connecting works smoothly, and files are accessible.


### Environment data
Android version: 7.1.1

Device model: Oneplus 3

Stock or customized system: Stock

Nextcloud app version: Bug exists both in 1.4.3 and Beta 2.0.0RC5

Nextcloud server version: 12.0.2

### Logs
#### Web server error log
Nothing on topic. The client here, 192.168.1.69, is my laptop. The access.log is full of my laptop polling the server every 30 seconds.
```
2017/09/05 07:42:49 [error] 24939#24939: *3832 access forbidden by rule, client: 192.168.1.69, server: www.vance.homelinuxserver.org, request: "GET /nextcloud/data/.ocdata?t=1504611769602 HTTP/1.1", host: "vance.homelinuxserver.org"
```

#### Nextcloud log (data/nextcloud.log)
The latest server log was from 2 days ago and involved connecting via the app from outside LAN. Or it might have been Chrome on android... I really can't remember.
```
{"reqId":"GYkOVQy20JakiTi8ogYG","level":3,"time":"2017-09-02T15:03:10+00:00","remoteAddr":"107.4.53.178","user":"--","app":"PHP","method":"GET","url":"\/nextcloud\/index.php\/login\/flow","message":"Undefined index: oauthState at \/var\/www\/nextcloud\/core\/templates\/loginflow\/authpicker.php#38","userAgent":"Oneplus ONEPLUS A3000","version":"12.0.2.0"}
```

This would not be the same as using the app to browse images, as that needs to fetch the thumbnail/preview from server. What I am asking for is to generate that locally before deleting the uploaded image to server.

body:

This gets rid of all prebuilt jars in the repo.

* libs/disklrucache-2.0.2.jar doesn't seem to be used anymore, app builds
  fine when removing it.
* libs/touch-image-view.jar is indeed required but is not anywhere available
  via gradle. So instead we include the source of this long unmaintained
  library directly.

It builds fine but I'm not sure if this repo structure is  prefered by you. There are of course a few different ways to sole this problem.

title: Integration with office apps
label: [Label(name="enhancement"), Label(name="pr exists")]
body:
### Actual behaviour
Office files are opened in read-only mode by the official Microsoft Office Android apps (Excel etc.)

### Expected behaviour
Office files are opened in read/write mode with the possibility to save changes directly to the server again
 
### Steps to reproduce
1. In any of the MS Office android apps choose 'Open' and then 'Other Cloud Storage'. 
2. From there select Nextcloud and then browse to any office file in your nextcloud account.
3. Now the file is being downloaded and opens in the Office app - in Read-Only mode.


### Environment data
Android version: 6.0

Device model: H60-L04

Stock or customized system: EMUI 4.0

Nextcloud app version: 1.4.3

Nextcloud server version:12.02

I am not sure whether this is a server issue or an issue in the nextcloud app. The latter could be because the app is first downloading the file instead of providing the office app with a 'cloud version' of the file (i.e. webdav link or something).

…notifications have been deleted

successor of #1478 - please have a look @tobiasKaminsky @mario :)

Installed latest stable 10.2 and the APP 1.4.3 on my Samsung p600 Tablet, my Honor 9 and my Huawai Mate 9 Smartphone. Android V 7.x.x
If starting Nextcloud APP - loading - appears and then - no files available- Keine Dateien vorhanden in german.
Also not possible to upload or create folder
No Problem if trying with webdav.

title: Proper notifications list refresh when list moves to empty
body:
resolves #1477 properly showing empty message after refresh when all …notifications have been deleted.

please review/approve @mario @tobiasKaminsky 

testing see ticket, simply receive a notification
1. open the list
2. delete the notification on the server
3. pull-to-refresh
4. list must show "empty icon/message", not the former notification

title: Notifications list doesnt really refresh
label: [Label(name="approved"), Label(name="bug"), Label(name="pr exists")]
body:
### Steps to reproduce
1. Receive a push notification
2. Tab on the push notification
3. See list of notifications
4. Web UI: delete the notification
5. Phone: pull down the notifications list
6. See the loading circle

### Expected
After loading circle the list should be empty

### Actually
The item is still shown.

### Steps to continue
7. Open side navigation
8. Go to notifications
9. A new view starts with the empty list
10. Back button brings you back to the old notification list with the already deleted entry


### Environment data
Android version: 6.0

Device model: Huawei P8 lite

Stock or customized system: stock

Nextcloud app version: 2.0.0rc5

Nextcloud server version: 12.0.2

title: Fix duplicate string in contribute UI
body: Fixes #1475

title: "Join the Chat on IRC" shown twice
label: [Label(name="approved"), Label(name="good first issue"), Label(name="low"), Label(name="pr exists")]
body:
In the "Participate" section 

of the android app (20170829) latest Nextcloud dev from F-droid.
![participatemenu](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/13802408/29949240-a413df60-8eb3-11e7-9751-c81188583086.png)

It says "[Contribute on IRC](https://github.com/nextcloud/android/blob/53a870b5a5dc252c2b04c33eb1bd75be5561ce7b/src/main/res/values/strings.xml#L559) twice:
![englishcontribute](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/13802408/29949214-7a5b9e92-8eb3-11e7-8f5a-702d89d48834.png)

Whereas for the second one, it should say: [Help others on the](https://github.com/nextcloud/android/blob/53a870b5a5dc252c2b04c33eb1bd75be5561ce7b/src/main/res/values/strings.xml#L561)

The same is true for other languages: (German de_DE shown here)
![germancontribute](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/13802408/29949210-747068e6-8eb3-11e7-89cb-05e2449f1429.png)
(which also happens to have a translation for the second [readily available](https://github.com/nextcloud/android/blob/53a870b5a5dc252c2b04c33eb1bd75be5561ce7b/src/main/res/values-de-rDE/strings.xml#L560))

The former: "participate_contribute_irc_text" is found [here](https://github.com/nextcloud/android/blob/fc6dee08e917d74942008ca9a5a61dacea7203a3/src/main/java/com/owncloud/android/ui/activity/ParticipateActivity.java#L77) in android/src/main/java/com/owncloud/android/ui/activity/ParticipateActivity.java

and the latter: "participate_contribute_forum_forum" is found [here](https://github.com/nextcloud/android/blob/53a870b5a5dc252c2b04c33eb1bd75be5561ce7b/src/main/java/com/owncloud/android/ui/activity/ParticipateActivity.java#L84) also in android/src/main/java/com/owncloud/android/ui/activity/ParticipateActivity.java

Edit: Fix here https://github.com/nextcloud/android/pull/1476

title: Themeing NOT apllied
body:
Hi to all,

currently I do run 2 NC instances: one on a local server one on the web. (both version12.0.29). As client I use version 1.4.3 on ANDROID 6.0.1.

I do run two different themes in the server instances: one blue and one red and changed the names from Standard "Nexctcloud" to "Blue " and "Red".

The client does **NOT** show the different themes and also **NOT** the different titles on each server 
 It only shows the standard blue color with the standard title NextCloud!


regards, hitam4450

reference: https://github.com/nextcloud/android/pull/1031

title: don't reset approvals on push
body:
...since rebase/master merge happen right before merging to master and that resets the approval so nearly all the time we merge with admin permission. This way all checks will be green (most of the time).

This way we rely on trust that nobody introduces new changes (except merge/rebase) after a PR has been approved.

What do you think @mario @tobiasKaminsky

title: User account corrupts - 2.0.0-RC[2345]
label: [Label(name="bug"), Label(name="needs info/discussion")]
body:
### Actual behaviour
- Set up new installation of Nextcloud client on phone
- Connect to nextcloud server with username and password
- User account as shown in app changes from full name & username, to GUID & GUID
- App crashes

### Expected behaviour
- User account remains as showing username, instead of GUID
- No app crashes
 
### Steps to reproduce

This has been totally reproducible for me, with every 2.0.0 RC so far.

1.4.2 from F-Droid works fine.

1. Fresh install of application (RC4) after uninstalling previous in order to clear data
2. First-run wizard comes up; I successfully provide hostname, username and password and log in to my Nextcloud server (version 10.0 if that makes a difference)
3. Look at list of accounts, it shows up with two lines (top line: Firstname Lastname, bottom line: username@owncloudhostname) and my photo, as I’d expect - so far, all good. Clicking the drop-down here, and choosing "Manage Accounts" shows me the same detail at this point.
5. I go and do something else on my phone. Could be anything -I even tried just clicking on a different activity in the NextCloud client (e.g. "Activities")
6. When I come back into nextcloud (I have literally not done anything else in the nextcloud app yet) I look at the list of accounts in the app. Both my full name and my username have been replaced with my GUID and my photo is gone
6. I go to “manage accounts”, and do not click on any accounts.
7. In the list, my one account (with GUID now) is shown
8. I wait a short while. Nextcloud then crashes (“Nextcloud has stopped / Open App Again / Send Feedback”


### Environment data
Android version: 7.0

Device model: Samsung S7 Edge

Stock or customized system: Stock

Nextcloud app version: 2.0.0RC[2345]

Nextcloud server version: 10.0

### Logs
#### Web server error log
```
Insert your webserver log here
```

#### Nextcloud log (data/nextcloud.log)
```
Insert your Nextcloud log here
```
**NOTE:** Be super sure to remove sensitive data like passwords, note that everybody can look here! You can use the Issue Template application to prefill some of the required information: https://apps.nextcloud.com/apps/issuetemplate

title: AutoUpload improvements
body:
This should fix two issues:

* resolves #1295
* And one where uploads are not started on boot (still strange, but this is a workaround which might help).

Wasn't tested since I can't reproduce, but I know @tobiasKaminsky can on his phone, so please do.

title: Use same String for Intent
body:
While I am unsure if this solves the problem, I had some similar problem a while ago:
Even though the string content is the same android did not found the stored intent data.

Though it works fine on my emulator and real devices, even without the fix ... :/

fix #1464 hopefully
