title: Fix NPE in virtuals
body:
fix #1442

- use nullable
- only add non-null object to list

I do not understand why there can be a null while reading from database, but as createFileInstanceFromVirtual() can return null, it is always safer to handle this properly.

title: What would be involved in supporting SAML login?
body:
The user_saml app for nextcloud is extremely useful for my implementation since our group has an SSO system set up to provide our users with only a single username/password for pretty much all the apps they use in our organization. 

However, many of them are using the nextcloud app on their phones and have to set up a separate password, which is a minor security concern for us as well as an inconvenience for the users. 

What would it take to allow SAML login to work like it does in the browser?

title: Update libs to latest versions to satisfy lint
body:
@mario @tobiasKaminsky Google released new versions of their libs we use for push notifications and that are referenced for testing so lint added some warnings.

This PR updates to the new lib versions and resolves the lint matter.

title: Resume uploading: what if file is modified inbetween
label: [Label(name="bug"), Label(name="needs info/discussion")]
body:
This came up during conf and should be investigated:
- upload a file with chunking
- interrupt upload
- modify file
- "resume" upload

-> will it be a resume (appending only the newest chunks) or will it begin new (as the filesum changed)

title: Feature request: work auto upload settings into wizard
label: [Label(name="AutoUpload"), Label(name="design"), Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
Currently setting up the NC app doesn't prompt the user to setup auto upload by default, leaving them to find it once they've finished signing in.

It'd likely require some rejigging, but having a prompt after sign-in to setup auto-upload would prompt users immediately to start backing up their photos/documents. Turning this into a post-login mini-wizard with how it works et al would be potentially useful too.

A rough example of a call to action: 

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3178412/29748847-b40c3e50-8b1e-11e7-90bd-feebfcd80857.png)

title: Feature request: "Would you like to auto upload this new folder"
label: [Label(name="enhancement"), Label(name="pr exists")]
body:
A feature of Google Photos I like, because I'm lazy mostly, is the notification that alerts me Photos has found a new folder on disk, and if I'd like to start backing it up.

This would be a _great_ addition in promoting continued use of the NC app whenever new media is found.

title: Update SETUP.md
body: typo

title: Autoupload moves/deletes files too early
label: [Label(name="AutoUpload"), Label(name="bug"), Label(name="high"), Label(name="needs info/discussion")]
body:
### Actual behaviour
- Auto-upload, configured to move files to the app folder, sometimes deletes files taken by the camera app before the application that has triggered the intent got a chance to do something with them (e.g., share with contact).

### Expected behaviour
- Auto-upload is triggered after the intent-calling app is finished with the file. 
 
### Steps to reproduce
1. Use, e.g., https://github.com/siacs/conversations, choose `Attach file`/`Take picture`
2. Take a picture and accept; Conversations offers the file to the recipient
3. Meanwhile, Nextcloud starts auto-uploading the file
4. If the file has finished uploading before the contact has accepted the file, the file will get moved by Nextcloud, and the transfer in Conversations will fail, saying that the file is missing.


### Environment data
Android version: 7.1.2

Device model: Hammerhead

Stock or customized system: LineageOS

Nextcloud app version: 1.4.2

Nextcloud server version: 12.0.0 (but it's a client-side issue)

title: Autoupload configuration: allow to upload all files in selected folder now
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
### Actual behaviour
- When configuring an auto-upload directory which already contains files, all those files need to be uploaded to the specified location manually

### Expected behaviour
- Adding some way (e.g., a button) in the auto-upload configuration page to process all existing files as if they had just appeared (i.e., auto-upload, or queue if network requirements are not satisfied, then copy/delete if appropriate)

title: app lags under higher workload
label: [Label(name="AutoUpload"), Label(name="bug"), Label(name="medium")]
body:
### Actual behaviour
- when updating large folders (uploading 1000 pictures, deleted pictures on PC, so needs update on app), controls lag
- cannot go back in folder hierarchy, settings, etc.
- app sometimes shows black screen for a while

### Expected behaviour
- interaction with controls always possible
- changing folders, previews etc always possible
- no waiting when changing between views

### Steps to reproduce
1. open SofortUpload/Camera
2. choose to upload all pictures (1500) from the DCIM/Camera to SofortUpload/Camera
3. no interaction possible for a while

or

1. delete 1000 pictures from a nexcloud folder via PC
2. open app, let it sync this folder
3. no interaction possible for a while


### Environment data
Android version: Android 7.1.1

Device model: OnePlus 5

Stock or customized system: Stock

Nextcloud app version: 2.0.0RC4

Nextcloud server version: 11.0.4

title: Updated icons are not ok
body:
### Actual behaviour
I applaud the time spent in developing this application and I know is easy to just complain, but the new icons to me are still not ok.
1. just a check mark does not identify which application is that
2. the icon is HUGE! in fact is so big that the top and bottom has 0px in Ubuntu top bar, is just huge, something you would expect to see in a UI that is optimised for your grandparents.
While I do understand in the past was too small, I would say too big is also not that good... A compromise has to be taken to have a good design and a pleasing application to use.

This is how it is showing up, to me it is completely non professional and not appealing:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3273985/29659215-cfbe05ce-88bd-11e7-986c-40a754bea1fa.png)


### Expected behaviour
To address the 2 points above I would suggest to have a compromise where first the icons have to be scaled down a bit.
Second, why don't take the idea of what the green icon I have in above screen shot does and use a variation of that with what we had before, the original logo image where we could use a cropped version of before and after circles but in a horizontal line instead of 45 degrees the green icon has them. Yes it will make the icon smaller but I guess it will still be acceptable?
 
### Environment data
Ubuntu 17.04

Nextcloud app version:
Version 2.3.2

title: Can't login to nextcloud with ldap backend
label: [Label(name="bug"), Label(name="needs info/discussion")]
body:
### Actual behaviour
NC app replaces login username with ldap id.

### Expected behaviour
App should use the username as I entered it.
 
### Steps to reproduce
1. (I have accounts on two OC instances, one with a regular database backend and one which authenticates against Active Directory.)
2. Add AD account as second account to NC app. Login works. Files are displayed.
3. Switch to normal account.
4. In the side drawer the name of the other account changes to the ldap id (screenshot 1).
5. Switching back does lead to a password prompt, the incorrect username cannot be changed (screenshot 2). Login is no longer possible.

### Environment data
Android version: 6.0.1

Device model: Moto X Play

Stock or customized system: Stock

Nextcloud app version: 2.0.0RC4

Nextcloud server version: Database backend: 12.0.2 , AD backend: 10.0.6

![1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/719105/29652889-e30596da-88a7-11e7-9289-199db9e7bc24.png)
![2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/719105/29652892-e45deae6-88a7-11e7-8b33-79fd5aff8b10.png)

title: How to set a default PDF viewer with Android / Nextcloud
label: [Label(name="enhancement"), Label(name="hacktoberfest"), Label(name="pr exists")]
body:
### Actual behaviour
-Tell us what happens

When I open a pdf document in the Android Nextcloud app it opens a "window" where I can choose between 8 different apps to open the PDF document with.

### Expected behaviour
-Tell us what should happen

It should offer me a way to set one of the readers as my default choice so that another time I skips the choice and opens PDF documents directly in the chosen viewer.

For comparison, opening a PDF document in Dropbox defaults to open the document in the embedded Dropbox PDF viewer.  Similarly with Google Drive and the Drive PDF viewer, so somehow it must be possible for an app to pick a default viewer.
 
### Steps to reproduce
1. navigate to a folder with pdf documents
2. open one
3. observe the choices of apps and lack of option to pick a default

### Environment data
Android version:
7.0

Device model: 
Samsung Tab A

Stock or customized system:
Stock

Nextcloud app version:
1.4.3

Nextcloud server version:
Irrelevant

Resolves #1373

As discussed with @AndyScherzinger on the train ;-)

title: GPlay: NPE com.owncloud.android.MainApp.getAuthority
label: [Label(name="bug"), Label(name="pr exists")]
body:
```
java.lang.ExceptionInInitializerError: 
  at com.owncloud.android.services.observer.FileObserverService.startObservation (FileObserverService.java:197)
  at com.owncloud.android.services.observer.FileObserverService.onStartCommand (FileObserverService.java:167)
  at android.app.ActivityThread.handleServiceArgs (ActivityThread.java:3351)
  at android.app.ActivityThread.-wrap21 (ActivityThread.java)
  at android.app.ActivityThread$H.handleMessage (ActivityThread.java:1601)
  at android.os.Handler.dispatchMessage (Handler.java:102)
  at android.os.Looper.loop (Looper.java:154)
  at android.app.ActivityThread.main (ActivityThread.java:6186)
  at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke (Native Method)
  at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit$MethodAndArgsCaller.run (ZygoteInit.java:889)
  at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit.main (ZygoteInit.java:779)
Caused by: java.lang.NullPointerException: 
  at com.owncloud.android.MainApp.getAuthority (MainApp.java:236)
  at com.owncloud.android.db.ProviderMeta$ProviderTableMeta.<clinit> (ProviderMeta.java:54)
```

happens since a while (e.g. 1.4.x).
causing line:
```
return getAppContext().getResources().getString(R.string.authority);
```

My guess is that ```getAppContext()``` returns null since the underlying variable hasn't been initialized yet. A quick fix would be to add a try catch and return the default value which will cause problems for custom/branded clients who run into the NPE fallback then...

Any ideas @tobiasKaminsky @mario ? This is the number 1 crash reported in the actual RC and for all app versions has been reported nearly 3000 times...

title: Beta app: Upload on charger-only not honored
label: [Label(name="AutoUpload"), Label(name="bug")]
body:
When using the latest beta app (2.0.0rc3) the setting of auto upload only when charger connected is not honored, when also connecting to wifi

Steps to reproduce:

Environment: same as #1370

1. Install app
2. Add your cloud
3. Add auto upload for Camera folder. Set it to wifi only
4. Connect to wifi, take a picture, see it upload
5. Disconnect wifi
6. Set folder to charger upload and wifi upload only
7. Take picture
8. Connect to wifi
9. See upload happening

I would have expected it to start uploading only when wifi and charger are connected

(submitted via github app for android, so template was missing)

title: DB upgrade testing
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
To test that our upgrade process is working fine, I tried to upgrade from every old version directly to the newest one.

stable-1.0.0    
Caused by: android.database.sqlite.SQLiteException: duplicate column name: external_links (code 1): , while compiling: ALTER TABLE capabilities ADD COLUMN external_links INTEGER  DEFAULT -1

stable-1.1.0
Caused by: android.database.sqlite.SQLiteException: duplicate column name: external_links (code 1): , while compiling: ALTER TABLE capabilities ADD COLUMN external_links INTEGER  DEFAULT -1

stable-1.2.0
Caused by: android.database.sqlite.SQLiteException: duplicate column name: external_links (code 1): , while compiling: ALTER TABLE capabilities ADD COLUMN external_links INTEGER  DEFAULT -1
                                                  
stable-1.3.0 works
stable-1.3.1 works
stable-1.4.0 works
stable-1.4.1 works
stable-1.4.2 works
stable-1.4.3 works
2.0.0-rc3

After that I installed every stable version directly on top of the oldest:
1.0.0 -> 1.1.0 -> 2.0.0RC3

I assume that we can ignore a fix for 1.0.0 -> 2.0.0 or 1.1.0 -> 2.0.0, or?

title: Autoupload uploads on 4G as well, instead of Wifi only
label: [Label(name="AutoUpload"), Label(name="bug"), Label(name="pr exists")]
body:
### Actual behaviour
After testing a few days with the NC beta app from the Play store, there is one annoying bug:

I have my auto-upload set to function on wifi only, with no charger limitations.
Whenever you connect to a wifi network that is captive-portaled, the app doesn't wait until internet connectivity is made via wifi, but just starts uploading via 4G, pending the [OK] on the captive portal.

### Expected behaviour
Autoupload should only send data over Wifi, like configured
 
### Steps to reproduce
1. Download beta app from Play Store and configure basic settings
2. Enable auto-upload, Enable 'Only upload on Wi-Fi' in preferences for auto uploading
3, Add new content tot the selected folder (in my case: Take a picture)
4. Connect phone to a captive-portal enabled network (in my case: Railway transport public network in NL)
5. Upload seems to start upon association to Wi-Fi, but Wi-Fi is then still a limited network (little exclamation mark next to the Wi-Fi symbol)


### Environment data
Android version: 7.1.1

Device model: OnePlus 3

Stock or customized system: Stock

Nextcloud app version: 2.0.0RC2

Nextcloud server version: 
www-data@cumulus:~/nextcloud$ ./occ status
  - installed: true
  - version: 11.0.4.1
  - versionstring: 11.0.4
  - edition:

title: Correctly uncomment for android lint
body: Same as in line 6

title: Handle foreign broadcast
body:
Steps to reproduce
- install oc client
- install nc client
- start sync on oc client
- open nc client 
--> crash as nc client is listening to broadcast by oc client. Cause: oc client is not using internal broadcast / app specific broadcasts.

Related stacktraces:
`
java.lang.RuntimeException: Parcelable encountered IOException reading a Serializable object (name = com.owncloud.android.lib.common.operations.RemoteOperationResult)
`

`
java.lang.RuntimeException: Parcel android.os.Parcel@849613f: Unmarshalling unknown type code 3014765 at offset 4192
`

Login screen appears for input of credentials.

This behavior occurs with my Nextcloud server at the web address where the Startcom SSL certificate is issued to. title: Sharee list
label: [Label(name="needs info/discussion")]

title: Codacy: fix further issues
body:
* fixing further issues reported by codacy: https://www.codacy.com/app/Nextcloud/android/issues
* move helper functions to a separate utils class and clean up dependencies between the classes
* cleanup upload list adapter

local tests on my phone where successful 😺

title: CookieManager.getInstance() can throw an Exception without saying so
body:
Ref: #1340 

If cookies cannot removed maybe the same credentials are used if an user tries to use the new weblogin flow for the same server.

title: Prevent NPE on absolutePath
body:
Ref: #1336 

NPE in 
`
if (!mediaFolder.absolutePath.startsWith(dataPath))
`

maybe it is also in dataPath, but this would be way more critical:
`
String dataPath = MainApp.getStoragePath() + File.separator + MainApp.getDataFolder();
`
and then many other things would also crash.

title: Update to latest status icon design and fix syncronizing/failed icons
body:
incorporating https://github.com/nextcloud/client_theming/issues/196 / https://github.com/nextcloud/client_theming/pull/200 for the Android client which adds the newly designed icons and also fixes the display of failed and synchronizing states.

cc for review @mario @tobiasKaminsky

title: Check if background string is empty
body:
Background string is by default empty, so if capability is not parsed correctly it leads to a crashing user info activity.
Fallback is the default image.

Ref: https://github.com/nextcloud/android/issues/1339

`I have been having an issue with my photos using this app. Whenever I take a photo the next cloud app creates a grey burst mode photo that is corrupt. I have to delete this photo everytime as it won't backup or open.

`The corrupted photo is created on my Android device every time I take a photo. I have a Nexus 6p running Android 7.1.2 with August 2017 patches.  I am running the beta version of the next cloud app to test a battery issue that I reported. This issue was also happening before that and with the help of Google we were able to narrow the issue down to this app.

title: Instant picture upload subfolder naming
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
### Actual behaviour
-Tell us what happens

Naming convention:
yyyy = Year in digit
mm = Month in digit
dd = Day of the month in digit
Condition: 
Settings - Use subfolders - yes

With uploading pictures to the choosen upload folder a subfolder yyyy is generated and a subfolder thereof  mm and the picture file is put into this folder. Which results in
InstantUpload/yyyy/mm/filename (= InstantUpload/2019/08/20180801-140303.jpg)
This does create multiple mm folders (same name) with different content in different years. 

### Expected behaviour
-Tell us what should happen

 The naming of the subfolder(s) should be configurable with a selectable given pattern.
Then according to the need of the user a pattern like
InstantUpload/yyyy/yyyymm/ (= InstantUpload/2018/201808/)
or
InstantUpload/yyyy/yyyymm/yyyymmdd/ (=InstantUpload/2018/201808/20180801/)
would be possible.

This would integrate with other picture management software.

### Steps to reproduce
1. Setting - subfolders - yes
2. Take a picture
3. Verify the folder structure in InstantUpload


### Environment data
Android version: 4.4.2

Device model: SM-G900FD

Stock or customized system: Samsung stock

Nextcloud app version: 1.4.3

Nextcloud server version: 12.0.1

### Logs
#### Web server error log
```
Insert your webserver log here
```

#### Nextcloud log (data/nextcloud.log)
```
Insert your Nextcloud log here
```
**NOTE:** Be super sure to remove sensitive data like passwords, note that everybody can look here! You can use the Issue Template application to prefill some of the required information: https://apps.nextcloud.com/apps/issuetemplate

title: Force new scan of not permitted files
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
### Actual behaviour
Checks recently changes on the folders which be autouploaded.

### Expected behaviour
It works fine, I think it´s there to save some battery life, and if you want to instantly upload you can force there a new scan. I´m right? That the reason, why it isn´t added intanlty to the upload tasker, is it?
With the new version I deleted accidentally some upload task. Now I don´t know the deleted filename and it would be nice, that you can press a button in the section of the Autouploadssettings that not only forces the recently data to be synced, rather the whole autoupload folder. So old files can be detected, that wasn´t be uploaded.
So you have a battery life save button in the upload tasks (to upoad recent files) and a sync checker in the autouploadssettings, that takes not permitted files to the upload tasker.

EDIT: Another Idea, you can suggest this only at the start for new user with the whats new screen ;)

title: Auto uploads UI feedback (Beta version) - empty camera directory not shown, separate media types confusing
label: [Label(name="AutoUpload"), Label(name="enhancement"), Label(name="needs info/discussion")]
body:
Just some feedback re. the UI for auto uploads in the beta version (ping @mario). I'm referring to the part of the auto-upload interface that features:

- An icon that can be a picture or a camera
- An outline cloud with a line through it that becomes a filled in blue cloud icon
- A preview of the media in the folder

For the most part this was a pretty intuitive interface for me, but the big "gotcha" was that it only shows up for already-populated directories and it's not obvious that it's only for one media type. So for example

- If you're setting it up on a new phone, it won't show the camera directory at all. It's only after you take a picture or video that you can enable auto-uploads, and then the existing files (that are *required* to make the UI visible!) won't be part of the auto-uploads. In an ideal world ( 🙄 ) there'd be a permanent setting that's just labelled "Your Camera Media" that always tracks the configured camera directory, even if it changes. There'd also be an option to "prime" the uploads with existing media. Again, I don't know if that's possible given Android permissions.

- This was the most confusing thing for me: at first I had pictures in my camera directory but no videos. In this situation, it's not at all clear that the little "photo" icon *only means photos will be synced!* Because there's nothing to compare it to! In other places in Android, the same icon can mean all camera media (eg. the gallery icon is usually just a stylised picture in a frame). So I enabled auto-uploads, but then videos didn't upload, and when I went back to the settings I realised what had happened. ...And then I had to sync the existing videos manually.

On the plus side, I *really* like the automatic sorting by year/month, and the automatic deletion, and I'll just reiterate that I've been using it pretty heavily for the last couple of weeks and I've never had a photo or video fail to upload eventually 👍 

Vital stats: Nextcloud version 2.0.0RC2
Android: 7.1.2
OS: LineageOS 14.1
Phone: HTC One M9 (often called "himaul")

Camera storage dir is external SD card.

title: NC Dev 20170810: Auto uploads issue while recording.
label: [Label(name="AutoUpload"), Label(name="bug"), Label(name="needs info/discussion")]
body:
### Actual behaviour
-Tell us what happens
I was trying the newer "Auto upload" feature while recording a video ion excess of 20minutes.
At the end of the recording, the video file .mp4 in the Upload folder was believed to be only 17MB in size, but the true file is actually 3BG.
I started the recording from home so I had direct access to the server over Wifi.
I have noticed so performance issues related to the upload process.
For instance, NC would say that upload is in progress but there was no activity on the network side. ( I am using Network Monitor Mini to check the throughput.
There was no activity for a solid few minutes. Phone was getting hot and at times would become unresponsive.
Then later during the day ( being at work) , the file got finally uploaded. The upload summary still indicates the files as being only 17MB, but the files on the server seems to be there in it's full content.
While the file seems to have been uploaded properly, It seems to have been initiated too many times after a few failed attempts.
It seems the auto upload process is not resilient enough and cause NC Dev to become too responsive.

### Expected behaviour
-Tell us what should happen
 
### Steps to reproduce
1. 
2. 
3.

Android version:

Device model: 

Stock or customized system:

Nextcloud app version:

Nextcloud server version:

title: Connection Problems with uploads
label: [Label(name="AutoUpload"), Label(name="bug")]
body:
### Actual behaviour
I got a Huawei Y6 2017 (MYA-L41, Android 6.0) and it gets errors while uploading .mp4 files or image files.
I took a little trick to get uploaded all old pictures with my new smartphone. I set up the sync for Camera, unmounted my SD-Card and remounted it, so that my device needs to upload all old pictures from my old smartphone.  I know there will be duplicated uploads, but i decided  to upload all files, to delete later the duplications to be sure that all files are in the cloud. Now after hundreds of fileuploads, some files won´t be uploaded and I haven´t yet restartet the raspberry pi. But i got some hints in the logs. My old device has got the same hints, but he hasn´t got many problems like my new Huawei smartphone.
### Expected behaviour
-Should just upload my shit!
 
### Steps to reproduce
1. Anyway if I renew my upload task list with a umount/mount command from the synced folder or if I manually add old pictures to the upload task list, there should be no different.
2. Using Pi with Pihole, idk if the actual destination is within his own subnets and doesn’t route the requests into the Internet.
3. A friend flooded the table oc_bruteforce_attempts, becaus he has got revoked his old App of his old Smartphone. The old Smartphone was also in the Wlan like mine. So it blocked my uploads, too. I empty the table with phpmyadmin, but I get these error sometimes. Sometime I think it´s overheating of the Pi, but when I connect with mobile connection the upload works great.

Android version:
6.0

title: Allow to delete notifications
label: [Label(name="enhancement"), Label(name="hacktoberfest")]
body:
In the browser you can delete notifications on hover:
> ![bildschirmfoto vom 2017-08-11 10-36-10](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/213943/29206166-fc90369a-7e80-11e7-8b5e-3ec3692f2bed.png)

In the android app that option should also be available (maybe by swiping the entry to a side)

To create a notification:
1. Install https://apps.nextcloud.com/apps/admin_notifications
2. `occ notification:generate <username> <message>`

title: Default upload folder modification
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body: The default folder location for all instant upload (which as a separate issue should probably be renamed to auto upload for fresh installs perhaps? Consistency... ) Is instant upload. title: Can't open files with 3rd party apps
label: [Label(name="bug"), Label(name="pr exists")]
body:
### Actual behaviour
I'm not sure if this is related to issue #751. I'm unable to open files at all, not just read-only, so I think this is a different issue. I've tried PDFs (I have Google Drive pdf viewer app), jpg files, and my KeePass database. jpg files work, but appear to be using a jpg viewer built into Nextcloud app. PDFs and my KeePass database don't open, with different errors. I don't have any problems opening these file types from the Dropbox app, but I'd like to get away from using that service.

### Expected behaviour
-I expect Nextcloud app should launch the appropriate 3rd party app to view/edit the file (and then if there's changes to the file, synchronize those, but I'd be happy if they just open).
 
### Steps to reproduce
1. Find a PDF file. Click on it.
2. Wait for it to download. 
3. "Can't open file" is displayed. Click close.
4. Check the box "Set as available offline. A sprite shows "File contents already synchronized"
5. Press back. Notice the file has a green checkmark.
6. Click the file again.
7. "Can't open file." is displayed.

I can use a 3rd party file manager and browse to /storage/SD-CARD-NAME/Android/data/com.nextcloud.client/files/...../FILENAME.pdf and it opens just fine.

1. Find a *.kdb file (keepass 1.x database)
2. Click on it.
3. After it downloads a sprite displays "KeePassDroid cannot handle this uri".
3. Check the box "Set as available offline". A sprite shows "File contents already synchronized".
4. Press back. Notice the file has a green checkmark.
5. Click the file again.
6. A sprite displays "KeePassDroid cannot handle this uri".

I can manually open KeePassDroid and then browse to /storage/SD-CARD-NAME/Android/data/com.nextcloud.client/files/...../FILENAME.kdb and it opens read-only.


### Environment data
Android version: AICP 12.1 (Android 7.1.2)

Device model: Moto X Pure Edition (XT1575)

Stock or customized system: Customized

Nextcloud app version: 1.4.3

Nextcloud server version: 12.0.0.1

### Logs
#### Web server error log
Will find and post if you think it's relevant.

#### Nextcloud log (data/nextcloud.log)
This file doesn't exist on my device.

title: Update user name with correct id found by user ocs call
body:
Ref: #1257 

There already was an existing function that updated accounts, so I extended this one.

So now there is no distinction between any NC version or old/new accounts, all are handled by the same:
- every existing/new account currently will have version 1
- an update is performed one time, correct id, set version to 2

We can discuss if and how we handle this once EOL of <NC12.

title: Remove unintuitive "clear finished uploads"
label: [Label(name="approved"), Label(name="enhancement"), Label(name="pr exists")]
body:
@jospoortvliet pointed out that the last entry is misleading as it can be understood as
- finished = successfully finished
- finished = successful & failed

It someone assumes the first all non-pending uploads will be removed and one has to find the failed uploads manually.
So the idea is to remove this entry. 
:+1:  it is more clear what the entries do
:-1: one click more needed if successful & failed shall be removed

![2017-08-04-074540](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5836855/28955871-bce58bfe-78e9-11e7-9c68-a77547422ca8.png)

title: AutoUpload: retry button in the notification drawer
label: [Label(name="AutoUpload"), Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
### Actual behaviour
When auto upload fails e.g. when Nextcloud server is only available on the LAN there is a sync error message in the notification drawer. 

### Expected behaviour
As mentioned by @mario here https://github.com/nextcloud/android/pull/797#issuecomment-319997004 it could be an idea for future releases to offer the user (maybe in expert mode only) a retry button in the notification drawer. In that case a resync can be started immediately without waiting for next sync interval and without opening the app and trigger resync in expert mode. 
 
### Steps to reproduce
1. Use a Nextcloud sever that is available only on the LAN.  
2. Enable Auto upload for camera folder
3. Leave WiFi
4. Take a picture with the phones camera.
5. Sync will fail. 
6. Imagine you are in a hurry and need to leave home/office immediately to catch the bus. You have to open the app, enable expert mode in settings, then got to Uploads Menu, click the three dots and trigger a forced sync. 

### Environment data
Nextcloud app version: tested with dev 20170730

title: Grey-out auto upload options until enabled
label: [Label(name="approved"), Label(name="enhancement"), Label(name="pr exists")]
body:
As suggested by @gahujipo here: https://github.com/nextcloud/android/pull/797#issuecomment-319973580

> The preferences window for auto upload shows a switch next to "Preferences for auto uploading". At the first sight it was not clear to me that that switch is uses to enable the auto upload feature for that folder pair. My idea was to grey out the options in the window unless the switch is set to true.

title: NC Dev 20170802: Trying to change server address fails
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
### Actual behaviour
-Tell us what happens
I am experimenting with a server located on my LAN. I had it setup not to support https so I was logging only with http://.
I now have setup a SSL certificate and I need to update the server address on my phone.
Upon reconnecting to the server NC Dev prompted me with a certificate request approval. I accepted it, but to make sure I got the proper "App Password" I decided to delete it from the server.
Because the "App Password" no longer exist, NC Dev is crashing, but then I am able to regain control of NC Dev,
Trying to change the password, I am presented with the server address which is based on http://.
I cannot edit the address and change http:// into https://.
The only way to go by is to delete the account and start fresh.

One nasty side effect, is that unless Data and Wifi are disabled, NC Dev will force a switch to the server configuration page, which prevent user account switch, deletion or creation.


### Expected behaviour
-Tell us what should happen
I should be able to edit the server address to make proper correction.
Alos, the switch to edit server correction should not be forced upon. Instead it should allow for account managemenrt capability.

### Steps to reproduce
1. 
2. 
3. 


### Environment data
Android version:
6.0
Device model: 
LG 3
Stock or customized system:
Stock
Nextcloud app version:
NC Dev 20170802
Nextcloud server version:
NC 12

```

```

title: Lint:  Invalid package reference in library; not included in Android: java.rmi.server. Referenced from freemarker.debug.impl.RmiDebugModelImpl.
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
Lint gives this errors 10 times:
```
../../../../../../../../../../root/.gradle/caches/modules-2/files-2.1/org.freemarker/freemarker/2.3.23/cd143cd8c02a9f838e3cb75a6dfe133750437f6d/freemarker-2.3.23.jar: Invalid package reference in library; not included in Android: java.rmi.server. Referenced from freemarker.debug.impl.RmiDebugModelImpl.


../../../../../../../../../../root/.gradle/caches/modules-2/files-2.1/org.freemarker/freemarker/2.3.23/cd143cd8c02a9f838e3cb75a6dfe133750437f6d/freemarker-2.3.23.jar: Invalid package reference in library; not included in Android: javax.servlet.jsp.tagext. Referenced from freemarker.ext.jsp.FreeMarkerPageContext.
```
Which makes sense as javax is not compatible to android ;-)

According to `./gradlew dependencies`:

```
com.googlecode.ez-vcard:ez-vcard:0.10.2
|    +--- com.github.mangstadt:vinnie:2.0.0
|    +--- org.jsoup:jsoup:1.8.3
|    +--- org.freemarker:freemarker:2.3.23
|    \--- com.fasterxml.jackson.core:jackson-core:2.6.1
```

How can we get rid of this?

title: Enabling dom storage api
body:
Needed for some HTML5 parts
Maybe fixes problem with new login flow: no starting spinner, no login

title: Reduce lint errors
body: Side note: our transifex-bot is only commit languages with >50% strings translated, all others are now removed to get rid of lint errors.

title: (Dev version) Uploads not resumed after aeroplane mode or reboot
label: [Label(name="AutoUpload")]
body:
### Actual behaviour
- After queuing up some uploads and toggling aeroplane mode, the upload queue is not resumed.

### Expected behaviour
- Uploads should resume when a connection is available.
 
### Steps to reproduce
1. Manually upload a large amount of files comprising a large amount of data (in my case about 50 files, photos and videos, 4.5GB in total).
2. Wait for a few files to upload (screenshot 01).
3. Enable aeroplane mode. The uploads will stop.
4. Disable aeroplane mode. The uploads will remain stopped (screenshot 02).
5. Wait a few minutes. Soft-reboot the phone.
6. Wait a few more minutes. Launch Nextcloud app. Uploads list show queued uploads with "app terminated" status (screenshot 03).
7. Open the "recent apps" list, swipe to close Nextcloud. Re-launch Nextcloud. *Now* the uploads resume (screenshot 04).

### Environment data
Android version: 7.1.2

Device model: HTC One M9

Stock or customized system: Customised (LineageOS `14.1-20170725-NIGHTLY-himaul`)

Nextcloud app version: `20170727`

Nextcloud server version: 12.0

### Logs

#### Web server error log

Not attached because it didn't seem necessary. Tell me if you want me to attach it.

#### Nextcloud log (data/nextcloud.log)

Exported from app settings. Attached: [`NC Log 01.txt`](https://github.com/nextcloud/android/files/1188976/NC.Log.01.txt)

Screenshots:

![screenshot 01](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/311239/28800925-7f617512-7692-11e7-92f9-5fe50638f4d3.png)
![screenshot 02](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/311239/28800926-7f8b3456-7692-11e7-81c4-75146519e04b.png)
![screenshot 03](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/311239/28800927-7fb69ea2-7692-11e7-8ad1-fbefeb043cba.png)
![screenshot 04](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/311239/28800928-7fe75a38-7692-11e7-94e0-32dd3ad901d1.png)

title: Show/Hide hidden files option not updated till restart
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
### Actual behaviour
-No change in file browser after changing the option 'Show hidden files' in Settings. Only after restarting the app the settings get updated and the files and folders are correctly hidden or shown, depending on the setting.

### Expected behaviour
-Settings should have immediate effect on the view in file browser

### Steps to reproduce
1. Go to Settings
2. turn on or off option "Show hidden files"
3. Navigate to a folder containing hidden files or folders


### Environment data
Android version: 6.0

Device model: H60-L04

Stock or customized system: EMUI 4.0

Nextcloud app version: 1.4.3

Nextcloud server version: 12.0.0

### Logs 
Not Applicable

title: Upload works - Auto-Upload does not
label: [Label(name="AutoUpload"), Label(name="bug")]
body:
### Actual behaviour
I can manually upload pictures to my Nextcloud instance. However, Auto-Upload does not work. Pictures get queued and the app tries to upload them, but in the Queue view it is shown as "failed".

It does work for other phones, so this seems to be a problem with this specific device.

### Expected behaviour
Auto Upload should work.
 
### Environment data
Android version: 7.0

Device model: Moto G4

Stock or customized system: Stock

Nextcloud app version: 1.4.3

Nextcloud server version: 12.0.0

Looking at the logcat output of the device, this seems wrong:

Nextcloud app version: dev 20170727

Nextcloud server version: 11.0.3

title: External page (Movim) does not allow login through app
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
### Actual behaviour
I have Movim (movim.eu) installed as a external website in my Nextcloud 12 and it works fine both on a desktop browser and a mobile browser. However in the Nextcloud app the login button stays greyed out and it is not possible to log in.

### Expected behaviour
It should work just like in the normal mobile browser.
 
### Steps to reproduce

label: [Label(name="AutoUpload"), Label(name="enhancement")]

### Actual behaviour
Autoupload uploads images/video files to nextcloud server keeping the same name.
So if delete after upload option is selected android will reset DSC_XXXX file seq from the most recent.
Example files in DCIM folder. DSC_0001, DSC_0002.
I take a photo, filename is DSC_0003.
Nextcloud detects it, uploads, deletes.
Next time i take the photo again and file name again is DSC_0003 => clash at autoupload.

### Expected behaviour
It would be nice to name files at upload like it is done in iOS version or in previous version like 1.4.0-something
Photo date time taken DSC seq number.
Or give option to the user to choose how to name it.

title: NC Dev 20170723: App password improvement during account setup.
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
### Actual behaviour
-Tell us what happens
Upon adding an account multiple time on the same phone (following reinstall).
When using the normal login process, NC Dev will generate an App password based on the phone model or name.
If an App password was previously generated from the same devices (or less likely having more than one of the same device using the same account), NC Dev seems to always create the app password with the same description. 
It would be good to have extra info added to the description so as to manage the correct app password for the corresponding device.

### Expected behaviour
-Tell us what should happen
If an app password is created by NC12 server without a name or description, the server will take care of that by entering some date and time info.
NC Dev creates the app password based only on the phone name and/or model number even with an app password already exist with that name.
NC Dev should be able to create a different App password with a name or description which doesn't already exist.

### Steps to reproduce
1. Reinstall NC Dev 20170723 or remove account on devices
2. Add account using normal login.
3. Upon account creation, app password would have been created on server.
4. Go to App password section of the server. Multiple instance of the same app password name exist.


### Environment data
Android version:
6.0
Device model: 
LG3
Stock or customized system:
Stock
Nextcloud app version:
NC Dev 20170723
Nextcloud server version:
NC 12

```
Insert your webserver log here
```

Insert your Nextcloud log here

title: Request: Folder and file share classification improvement
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
### Actual behaviour
-Tell us what happens
When folders or files have the same name across accounts, and one or more of those files and folders are shared, the name of the folder of file will be have a "(N)" N being a number chosen by NC (incremental value it seems).
If I have a Document on one account and share it with another account, the name on the second account would be "Document (2)".
From the user who was given access to the share, it is not evident to say the share is from another account, nor from whom the share came from. 
Under NC Dev 20170721, it doesn't even seem possible to know who provided the share.
For security and privacy reasons, and to prevent saving files in the wrong account, it would be really nice if the name of the file or folder containing the name of the person or group the share originated from. Instead of using the "(N)" designation, maybe "(username)" or for a group, the "Groupname".
To prevent such confusion with "Autoupload" default folder name, I usually add "_username" at the folder so I would get "Instantupload_username".
I find this approach makes sharing and receiving shares clearer to read and process.


### Expected behaviour
-Tell us what should happen
 Receiving a file or folder share, the name of the user or group should appear on the shared file or folder.
### Steps to reproduce
1. 
2. 
3.

Device model:

title: Split up play services to avoid support version conflict

Found by lint:
> All com.android.support libraries must use the exact same version specification (mixing versions can lead to runtime crashes). Found versions 25.0.0, 24.0.0.

This also decreases the size of the generated apk:
new version 7,2mb
current one: 11mb

Built is working fine locally, but did not tested push. I assume that gradle resolves deps correctly and thus no problem occurs, but @mario is the pro on this one.

title: Trust user added CAs on Android7+
body:
See https://android-developers.googleblog.com/2016/07/changes-to-trusted-certificate.html for further details.

With Android 7 Google changed the handling of CAs:
> Apps that target API Level 24 and above no longer trust user or admin-added CAs for secure connections, by default. 

This change would basically lead to trusting used added CAs. Please have a look @tobiasKaminsky @mario and especially @LukasReschke if this is something we want. If not, feel free to close the PR and delete the branch.

title: OSSEC: Multiple web server 400 error codes
label: [Label(name="needs info/discussion")]
body:
### Actual behaviour
I've installed OSSEC to protect the public server. If a user would like to rename a file, he get an error message and I get an email from OSSEC with "multiple web server 400 error codes from same source ip". Rename a file in the browser is working fine without error codes.

### Expected behaviour
without any error codes
 
### Steps to reproduce
1. install NC Server
2. install and start OSSEC
3. rename files with the app


### Environment data
Android version:
7.0 (SW-Nr: 2.41.401.4)

Device model: 
HTC 10

Stock or customized system:
stock

Nextcloud app version:
1.4.3

Nextcloud server version:
12.0.0

### Logs
#### Web server error log
```
2017/07/15 07:28:51 [error] 652#652: *9967 open() "/usr/share/nginx/html/robots.txt" failed (2: No such file or directory), client: xxx.xxx.xxx.xxx, server: localhost, request: "GET /robots.txt HTTP/1.1", host: "www.mydomain.com"
```

#### Nextcloud log (data/nextcloud.log)
```
today no entries
```
#### OSSEC error message
```

title: Auto upload does not sync
body:
### Actual behaviour
- the auto upload only sync new files (photos in my case)  if the app is working. But it doesn't sync new photos if the app haven't been launched before and "old" files aren't synced when enabling auto-uplaod. 

### Expected behaviour
- new files should be synced and old ones too
 
### Steps to reproduce
1. Install the app
2. Launch the app and enable auto uplaod
3. Turn off the app 
4. Take pictures or add files 
5. Relaunch the app


### Environment data
Android version: 7.1.1

Device model: axon 7 

Stock or customized system: stock 

Nextcloud app version: 1.4.3

Nextcloud server version:

### Logs

#### Nextcloud log (data/nextcloud.log)

title: download to phone
body:
### Actual behaviour
A simple action is at the moment not possible.
The app "bitcoinwallet" need the backup under the path /download
So i want so save the backupfile from my nextcloud... to my phone.


### Expected behaviour
A menu option: save file to phone location.

title: Remember path when sharing to nextcloud
label: [Label(name="enhancement"), Label(name="hacktoberfest")]
body:
### Actual behaviour
- Path is set to an (unknown) other state

### Expected behaviour
- Path should remember the latest location
 
### Steps to reproduce
1. open an app e.g. gallery
2. share a file to nc
3. select any folder
4. repeat step 1-3


### Environment data
Android version:

Device model: 

Stock or customized system:

Nextcloud app version:

Nextcloud server version:

### Logs
#### Web server error log
```
Insert your webserver log here
```

#### Nextcloud log (data/nextcloud.log)
```
Insert your Nextcloud log here
```
**NOTE:** Be super sure to remove sensitive data like passwords, note that everybody can look here! You can use the Issue Template application to prefill some of the required information: https://apps.nextcloud.com/apps/issuetemplate

title: fix removing of local only folder
body:
Ref: https://github.com/nextcloud/android/issues/1189

Previous change was introduced so that if ocFile == null --> return false, so added this explicitly.

title: Local removal of folder is not working
label: [Label(name="bug"), Label(name="high"), Label(name="pr exists")]
body:
### Steps to reproduce
1. Select folder
2. delete folder -> local only

--> Removal failed
https://github.com/nextcloud/android/blob/master/src/main/java/com/owncloud/android/datamodel/FileDataStorageManager.java#L521

title: fix missing / in contributing link
body: Ref: https://github.com/nextcloud/android/issues/1186

title: Fix drone yml escaping
body:
cc @tobiasKaminsky 

due to the update of drone from 0.5 to 0.7

title: Fix Contributing link in participation screen
label: [Label(name="bug"), Label(name="pr exists")]
body:
At the moment the link tag isn't closed properly, see
```
...$s\"><a href=\"%2$s\">CONTRIBUTING.md<a></font>...
```
in https://github.com/nextcloud/android/blob/master/src/main/res/values/strings.xml#L570

it should be 
```
...$s\"><a href=\"%2$s\">CONTRIBUTING.md</a></font>...
```

PR: #1188

title: Empty folder info not shown anymore
label: [Label(name="bug"), Label(name="high")]
body:
on the actual master when you open an empty folder the message and icon (folder) aren't shown anymore but the loading message and round progress bar stays on the view.

@tobiasKaminsky can you have a look at this since @mario in going to be on vaca? :)

title: Crash when opening remote image in nextcloud-dev
label: [Label(name="bug"), Label(name="dev version")]
body:
### Actual behaviour
-Tell us what happens
App crashes when opening an remote image

### Expected behaviour
-Tell us what should happen
dont crash
 
### Steps to reproduce
1. click on remote image

title: Enhancement: add check if enough ressources available before upload
label: [Label(name="needs info/discussion")]
body:
I've experienced that some users tend to copy local files within the synced nextcloud-folder, which 'overflows' the servers capacity and force the mysql-server to shut down.

So in a few steps this might be a problem from the past:
- crosscheck what is new on local system and what is already on server
- calculate total size of new local files
- comparison with available space on server
- upload/don't upload (with message why)

does this sound like something worth to implement in a future release?

best regards

title: Bruteforce timeout via public capabilities
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
As proposed here https://github.com/nextcloud/server/issues/4510#issuecomment-297694495 
and implemented here https://github.com/nextcloud/server/pull/5567 we will get the possibility to ask for the current bruteforce timeout.
As we are switching to weblogin flow for >= nc12 and I enhanced the bruteforce support for all version (cookie is now sent with every request, so only first request ever will take long) I doubt if we need this.

With the timeout we could show a little warning if the login is delayed by bruteforce.

title: delayed removal of auto-uploaded files after certain time #enhancement
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
### Actual behaviour
- Images should get automatically uploaded (they are not im my case, but that's a different story ;))
- There is only an option to remove the images right after successful upload

### Expected behaviour
- Allow specifying a duration for wich successfully auto-uploaded files (images/videos) are kept, before they will get automatically removed. The idea is to provide a "delayed removal" option instead of the existing "instantly remove after successful upload" option.
- The delay should be customizable (probably best in days (and/or maybe hours for some folks)).
- If set to 0, this means instant removal (like the current setting allows)
- So you once setup this delay, which will then applied to all newly auto-uploaded files. With this option set, this will allow to automatically remove and cleanup all successfully auto-uploaded files after a certain time-span
(eg like count-down for each uploaded file (or batch of files) and once the count-down expires (counted down to 0), the file(s) get automatically (and silently) removed from the smartphones storage space.

### Why?
* Cleanup, regain disk-space.
* At the same time allow to still /use/ recent photos eg. by sharing them without having to re-download them from the nextcloud server :/
* Also privacy to some extend: Because like this I can assure that someone grabbing my phone only gets direct access to x days of personal photos.

### Environment data
Nextcloud app version: v.1.4.3

### Related issues
See also #1146 which also has the goal of cleanup of storage-space, but with a not time-based approach and rather on-demand and/or storage space related triggers.

Add app links to Nextcloud Android Dev similar to external pages
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
Hello,

additional apps installed into Nextcloud should be shown as items in the menu of the mobile app just like the external pages it shows now. As it already shows web pages, this would be handy to show additional Nextcloud apps that are already shown in the browser on mobile/desktop.

This would remove the requirement to switch to a browser from the Nextcloud app instead of listing and displaying them directly inside the official Nextcloud app.

Additionally, a new handler could be created that allows dedicated companion apps for Android that interface directly with certain Nextcloud apps (like for example a Bookmarks app or Notes app) so an Android menu shows up which app to use/start (either the web app inside the Nextcloud app or the dedicated one).

title: Need new button for complete re-scan-re-upload of folders selected for synchronization
label: [Label(name="AutoUpload"), Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
<!--
Please report only issues corresponding to the calendar for Nextcloud 9 or later.
The old calendar 0.x is discontinued!

Migration and CalDAV issues belong in the server repo!
https://github.com/nextcloud/server/issues
-->
### Steps to reproduce
1. While having folders checked for synchronization - unknown problems arise, and for some odd reason synchronization stops (as i have seen a number of times) then normal troubleshooting starts - are there blocked files on the server - delete them on server - these files are not re-uploaded once back to normal and next time the android client syncs the folder from where the picture or file came from.
You may even chose to delete the account on the device, and recreate it - then no more files older that the date of the creation of the account are uploaded - no matter if the files are on the server or not
2. Normally synchronization picks up again if you manually tags a file for upload to server, but all new files arrived since the stop of sync until manual upload will not never synced.
3.i am sure there are other scenarios, where files on the device are left un-uploaded

### Expected behaviour
At next scan the non-uploaded files should be detected, and uploaded, but for the case where a file was purposely deleted via the web interface on the server, it creates a conflict - should this file be re-uploaded or not - rather not i would say. But sometimes you just wish to make sure, that the complete folder marked for sync on the phone IS on the %é_è-'çàçe(bloody) server.
Therefore the need for a "redo complete deep dive sync of folders marked for sync" "with/without overwrite" of existing files (the overwrite could be interesting in case of corruption on the server (sd card about to hang up, cryptolock etc)

### Actual behaviour
not possible to get missing files onto the server once sync has decided to omit them, unless finding out yourself which files are missing, and manually tagging them for upload

title: Autoupload of video in wrong folder (v1.4.3 on Lollipop v5.0.1)
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
### Actual behaviour
-Autoupload of PICTURES is configured in /some/folder with use of subfolder based on date, so a picture taken today is uploaded on /some/folder/2017/06
-Autoupload of VIDEOS is configured exactly the same way, **BUT** a video taken today is uploaded on /some/folder/201706 <= The "/" between year and month is missing

### Expected behaviour
-In this case video and files must be uploaded on the **same folder** /some/folder/2017/06
 
### Steps to reproduce
1. Configure autoupload of pictures in  /some/folder with use of subfolder based on date

title: New autoupload feature uploads taken pictures to different location than old feature, breaks user experience
label: [Label(name="needs info/discussion")]
body:
When I'm unable to login on nextcloud using 'old' app, and I used '-dev' from fdroid I added and setup autoupload for picture from `DCIM/`, previously I could set 'autoupload taken images'. New system instead uploading images, it watches for new files in a folder and uploads them [folders] to `InstantUpload/.` When I use subfolders, the new system uploads pictures to:

* /InstantUpload/DCIM/2017/06 or:
* /InstantUpload/Pictures/2017/06 when the old system was uploading everything to:
* /InstantUpload/2017/06

the behaviour is inconsistent and breaks user experience. Personally I much preferred upload taken pictures feature, as it was camera-app agnostic. I was able to upload pictures from OpenCamera and LG Camera (great burst-photo functionality) independently. Pictures and videos from both app were uploaded to the same directory. With the new system I had to configure two different folders to observe and I still ended up with two different directories with **new** pictures, which I have to manually merge with my old folders.

Previous system was much better organised and required less user actions to successfully organise images.

### Expected behaviour
- upload should stop
 
### Steps to reproduce
1. enable auto upload with "only on wifi"
2. take some pictures, wait for upload to start
3. leave wifi area

Idea to solve:
Manually check if the requirements are met, although this should be the job of evernote.

I could not reproduce this with my onePlus3 and 7.1.2, but reported via mail:

title: AutoUploadJob does not remember restrictions after failure
label: [Label(name="AutoUpload"), Label(name="approved"), Label(name="bug")]
body:
### Actual behaviour
- Upload starts while not connected to wlan

### Expected behaviour
- Remember "upload only on wlan"
 
### Steps to reproduce
1. set auto upload to "upload only with wlan"
2. let auto upload start
3. disable wlan -> all jobs will fail
4. click on a job

We can debate if this is a desired behaviour as the user "enforces" this by clicking on the upload item and thus wants to have it uploaded now, or if it is a bug as the restriction is not remembered.
I would for the second one.
If an user wants to have an item of the upload queue "forced" uploaded (by omitting the requirements) we can add a long press click with "instant upload".

https://stackoverflow.com/questions/10797551/incompatibleclasschangeerror-interface-not-implemented

They say that you need to add android-support-v4.jar to libs. I did not test it yet because of it need application build from sources as I understand

title: Sharing with "password rule" enabled is not working
label: [Label(name="bug"), Label(name="pr exists")]
body:
### Actual behaviour
if you enter a password for a link share and this password is too short, you will be redirected to the login windows and a message appears "a error appears during the sharing of a folder or file".

### Expected behaviour
if you enter a password for a link share and this password is too short, e message should notify you about this.
 
### Steps to reproduce
1. enforce password protection is enabled on nextcloud
2. password rule is set (for example 8 characters) on nextcloud
3. in the android app share a file or folder
4. enable "share link"
5. you have to set a password
6. if you set a password with less then 8 characters you will be redirected to the login page

If you did not enforce the password protection and follow this steps, the warning about the password lenght is displayed:
1. disable enforce password protection on nextcloud
2. password rule is set (for example 8 characters) on nextcloud
3. in the android app share a file or folder
4. enable "share link"
5. enable "password protection"
6. if you set a password with less then 8 characters you get a notification that you have to enter 8 characters for the password



### Environment data
Android version: 7.0

Device model: Samsung Galaxy 7 Edge

Stock or customized system: stock

Nextcloud app version: 1.4.3

Nextcloud server version: 12.0

Every time I upload files, I get this notification:
![img_20170610_162503](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/925062/27003590-f06da92c-4df9-11e7-8e79-39c6eee9e6b1.jpg)

Can we remove that notification? It’s an additional one which is not really needed, plus the icon is not properly shown.

title: Quicker and more pleasant picture download/view flow
label: [Label(name="design"), Label(name="enhancement"), Label(name="medium")]
body:
Opening an image, every time it shows the Loading view + bar, then flashes to this:
![screenshot_2017-06-10-16-14-19](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/925062/27003567-87eb4940-4df9-11e7-8d37-2665ed6e4d40.png)
And only then shows the actual image.


Instead for a much smoother flow:
1. As the downloading view, show the thumbnail (which is already there) in big, and a loading spinner overlayed.
2. Directly change it to the actual image as soon as it’s downloaded.

title: Empty content screen icon colors
label: [Label(name="bug"), Label(name="design"), Label(name="good first issue"), Label(name="pr exists")]
body:
The empty content screen icons are partly a bit off, for example the icon for favorites as well as uploads is blue, which both looks a bit strange.

- Every empty content icon should be 50% grey
- Except favorites which should be the yellow star
- And Folders/files which should be Nextcloud blue

Just like on the server. :)

title: Strange animations when switching sections
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
When switching sections like Notifications, Activity, Files etc, the main content slides in from down including the header – it doesn’t really make a lot of sense. :)

Let’s have no animation there, just directly change the main content when tapping a different navigation entry.

title: Sending log issue
label: [Label(name="enhancement"), Label(name="help wanted")]
body:
### Actual behaviour
-Tell us what happens
Under Nextcloud Dev 20160609, after requesting the log to be sent and pressing the "Upload" button, upon returning to the log page and pressing the "elete history", if the app is still in the process of seting up transfer, then the content of the log will be cleared.

### Expected behaviour
-Tell us what should happen
I think there should be a mechanism that would prevent the log being transmitted to be erased.
 
### Steps to reproduce
1. Access Settings.
2. Press "Logs"
3. Press "SEND HISTORY"
4. Select how to send it (ie. Nextcloud Dev), and select relevant account.
5. Select location and press "UPLOAD"
6. Without waiting, press "DELETE HISTORY"

Check content of logs before and after deletion on server. The file should be empty.

### Environment data
Android version:

Device model: 
LG 3 LG852

Stock or customized system:
Stock

Nextcloud app version:
Nextcloud  Dev 20170609

Nextcloud server version:
NC 12

### Logs
#### Web server error log
```
Insert your webserver log here
```

#### Nextcloud log (data/nextcloud.log)
```
Insert your Nextcloud log here
```
**NOTE:** Be super sure to remove sensitive data like passwords, note that everybody can look here! You can use the Issue Template application to prefill some of the required information: https://apps.nextcloud.com/apps/issuetemplate

in folder /Uploads you should see subfolders per Year and month

title: Uploading pictures with "Google Photos" via share doesn't work.
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
### Actual behaviour
-Tell us what happens
I just installed "Google Photos" app on my cellphone to debug issues my friend is having.
This new issue targets both Nextcloud 1.4.3 and Nextcloud Dev 20170602, but the Dev version doesn't work at all.

Issue with Nextcloud 1.4.3:

With a few pictures available in "Google Photos", I select a few of them, then click the "Share" logo.
I am given a choice of application. I choose "Nexctloud".
I select the format to be either "LArge size" or "Actual size".
A progress bar will appear indicating how many files are being downloaded.
If the files are not on the device, they will be downloaded (I believe the folder they are going to be stored at is the "Download" folder). When all the files have been downloaded, Nextloud app will appear asking for the folder to upload to. I use the pin to access Nextcloud.
I select my folder then press Upload. Upon pressing the button, "Google Photos" appears.
Background uploading of the pictures by Nextcloud starts.
The problem is that not all pictures are being uploaded.
At a minimum, it seems consitstent at uploading one pictures per share request.
However, when selecting more than one pictures, I could only get at most 3 pictures uploaded by Nextcloud.
My friend was able to upload a larger number of files, but was always missing a few.



### Expected behaviour
-Tell us what should happen
Nextcloud should be able to upload the entire selection provided by "Google Photos" and not skip a few files. 

### Steps to reproduce
1. Have "Google Photos" app installed.
2. Have a few pictures available in "Google Photos"
3. Select a few pictures (max of 200) 
4. Click the "Share" icon
5. Select "Nextcloud" within the list of apps.
6. Enter PIN number, select relevant Nextcloud account if more than one installed within app.
7. Select where to upload the files.
8. Press "Upload" and wait for transfer to complete.
9. Check files are properly uploaded on Nextcloud server. They will not.


### Environment data
Android version:
6.0

Device model: 
LG 3 D852
Samsung Note 5

Stock or customized system:
Stock on both phones

Nextcloud app version:
1.4.3

Nextcloud server version:
NC 12. (Just upgraded to NC12 a few days ago. Issue was first observed under NC 10 and NC 11)

### Logs
#### Web server error log
```
Insert your webserver log here
```

#### Nextcloud log (data/nextcloud.log)
```
Insert your Nextcloud log here
```
**NOTE:** Be super sure to remove sensitive data like passwords, note that everybody can look here! You can use the Issue Template application to prefill some of the required information: https://apps.nextcloud.com/apps/issuetemplate

title: Will only sync offline file when navigating to folder when no internet connection after edit
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
### Actual behaviour
Offline file will not synchronise until you navigate to the folder in the nextcloud app containing that file with the network connected (even if the accounts > nextcloud > files is set to on)

### Expected behaviour
Updated files should synchronise as soon as network connection is established, rather than requiring navigation to the folder.
 
### Steps to reproduce
1. Mark a file as offline with wifi enabled
2. turn off wifi
3. edit file and save it
4. close nextcloud client
5. enable wifi
6. wait - sync will not occur
7. navigate to folder containing offline file and it will upload


### Environment data
Android version:
6.0.1

Device model: 
Blackberry priv

Stock or customized system:
Stock

Nextcloud app version:
1.4.3

Nextcloud server version:
12.0.0

(No apparent log errors)

title: FR: Notification of pending uploads ala dropbox
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
Feature request:
Would it be possible to get a notification of pending uploads in the android notification area, similar to the way in which dropbox handles it?
eg. with dropbox, if a file is modified it shows at the top with a notification to say that an upload is pending.

The only reason I suggest this is because when files are changed on android it's not always obvious that anything is going to be uploaded. This stopped me from using the old owncloud app a long time ago because I'd end up forgetting about it and not connecting to wifi, then later getting conflicts without realising and losing work.

title: Cannot use SSLCipherSuite HIGH with Apache
body:
Using Nextcloud 12 (issue was present in Nextcloud 11 as well) the Android client ( 1.4.3 ) will not connect when using OpenSSL cipher suite HIGH on Apache. MEDIUM or LOW must be specified in order for the Android client to connect. Device used for test is Samsung Galaxy Tab 3. 

Can someone test with ciphers in HIGH list on another device to ascertain if it is the device (Samsung Galaxy Tab 3) device or Nextcloud client that is forcing use of one of the MEDIUM ciphers?

Apache setting: SSLCipherSuite HIGH
Nginx setting: ssl_ciphers HIGH

Ciphers used by the HIGH setting are:
ECDHE-RSA-AES256-GCM-SHA384:ECDHE-ECDSA-AES256-GCM-SHA384:ECDHE-RSA-AES256-SHA384:ECDHE-ECDSA-AES256-SHA384:ECDHE-RSA-AES256-SHA:ECDHE-ECDSA-AES256-SHA:SRP-DSS-AES-256-CBC-SHA:SRP-RSA-AES-256-CBC-SHA:SRP-AES-256-CBC-SHA:DH-DSS-AES256-GCM-SHA384:DHE-DSS-AES256-GCM-SHA384:DH-RSA-AES256-GCM-SHA384:DHE-RSA-AES256-GCM-SHA384:DHE-RSA-AES256-SHA256:DHE-DSS-AES256-SHA256:DH-RSA-AES256-SHA256:DH-DSS-AES256-SHA256:DHE-RSA-AES256-SHA:DHE-DSS-AES256-SHA:DH-RSA-AES256-SHA:DH-DSS-AES256-SHA:DHE-RSA-CAMELLIA256-SHA:DHE-DSS-CAMELLIA256-SHA:DH-RSA-CAMELLIA256-SHA:DH-DSS-CAMELLIA256-SHA:AECDH-AES256-SHA:ADH-AES256-GCM-SHA384:ADH-AES256-SHA256:ADH-AES256-SHA:ADH-CAMELLIA256-SHA:ECDH-RSA-AES256-GCM-SHA384:ECDH-ECDSA-AES256-GCM-SHA384:ECDH-RSA-AES256-SHA384:ECDH-ECDSA-AES256-SHA384:ECDH-RSA-AES256-SHA:ECDH-ECDSA-AES256-SHA:AES256-GCM-SHA384:AES256-SHA256:AES256-SHA:CAMELLIA256-SHA:PSK-AES256-CBC-SHA:ECDHE-RSA-AES128-GCM-SHA256:ECDHE-ECDSA-AES128-GCM-SHA256:ECDHE-RSA-AES128-SHA256:ECDHE-ECDSA-AES128-SHA256:ECDHE-RSA-AES128-SHA:ECDHE-ECDSA-AES128-SHA:SRP-DSS-AES-128-CBC-SHA:SRP-RSA-AES-128-CBC-SHA:SRP-AES-128-CBC-SHA:DH-DSS-AES128-GCM-SHA256:DHE-DSS-AES128-GCM-SHA256:DH-RSA-AES128-GCM-SHA256:DHE-RSA-AES128-GCM-SHA256:DHE-RSA-AES128-SHA256:DHE-DSS-AES128-SHA256:DH-RSA-AES128-SHA256:DH-DSS-AES128-SHA256:DHE-RSA-AES128-SHA:DHE-DSS-AES128-SHA:DH-RSA-AES128-SHA:DH-DSS-AES128-SHA:DHE-RSA-CAMELLIA128-SHA:DHE-DSS-CAMELLIA128-SHA:DH-RSA-CAMELLIA128-SHA:DH-DSS-CAMELLIA128-SHA:AECDH-AES128-SHA:ADH-AES128-GCM-SHA256:ADH-AES128-SHA256:ADH-AES128-SHA:ADH-CAMELLIA128-SHA:ECDH-RSA-AES128-GCM-SHA256:ECDH-ECDSA-AES128-GCM-SHA256:ECDH-RSA-AES128-SHA256:ECDH-ECDSA-AES128-SHA256:ECDH-RSA-AES128-SHA:ECDH-ECDSA-AES128-SHA:AES128-GCM-SHA256:AES128-SHA256:AES128-SHA:CAMELLIA128-SHA:PSK-AES128-CBC-SHA

Ciphers used by the MEDIUM setting are:
DHE-RSA-SEED-SHA:DHE-DSS-SEED-SHA:DH-RSA-SEED-SHA:DH-DSS-SEED-SHA:ADH-SEED-SHA:SEED-SHA:ECDHE-RSA-RC4-SHA:ECDHE-ECDSA-RC4-SHA:AECDH-RC4-SHA:ADH-RC4-MD5:ECDH-RSA-RC4-SHA:ECDH-ECDSA-RC4-SHA:RC4-SHA:RC4-MD5:PSK-RC4-SHA:ECDHE-RSA-DES-CBC3-SHA:ECDHE-ECDSA-DES-CBC3-SHA:SRP-DSS-3DES-EDE-CBC-SHA:SRP-RSA-3DES-EDE-CBC-SHA:SRP-3DES-EDE-CBC-SHA:EDH-RSA-DES-CBC3-SHA:EDH-DSS-DES-CBC3-SHA:DH-RSA-DES-CBC3-SHA:DH-DSS-DES-CBC3-SHA:AECDH-DES-CBC3-SHA:ADH-DES-CBC3-SHA:ECDH-RSA-DES-CBC3-SHA:ECDH-ECDSA-DES-CBC3-SHA:DES-CBC3-SHA:PSK-3DES-EDE-CBC-SHA

title: "On device" content display behavior should be improved.
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
### Actual behaviour
-Tell us what happens
Under both version of Nextcloud 1.4.3 and Nextcloud Dev 20170529, I find the "On device" feature to be pretty much useless.
The reason is that the folders are always displayed, even though their content may have not been downloaded yet.
I think it would be more informative to only show folders which have been synchronized and containing files. If the folder is not synchronized, ie. not containing downloaded files, then the folder should not be made visible.
To an extent, it would be nice to have the ability to visualize all the files either broken down per folder or as a single diaporama or catalog where the app would decend into each folder and create a list such as every files present on the storage media are browseable with a swipe. This can be define as an option similar to list view and "Grid view".

title: Nextcloud Dev 20170529: "Favorites" and "Shared" menu not working.
body:
### Actual behaviour
-Tell us what happens
I don't know if the following status are still work i progress or simply not working due to bugs:

- "Favorites"
- "Shared"

Right now, when I access the "Favorites" menu, I get a short message that looks like:
"Nothing Favorited yet" (improper English I believe) then follows the spinning "Loading" semi-circle, and ends with "No files here- Upload some content or sync with your devices"

Same drill with the "shared" menu.

PS: As I was breaking down the steps to report this issue, I left my phone in the "Shared" menu. After a while I saw some activity and the display went from "No files fere" to showing a list of the files and folders being shared.
Investigating the issue further, it will take at least a minute before the content gets updated. In the meantime, "No files here" remains. If I swiped the screen down, it refreshes with "Nothing shared yet".
As I am waiting, there seem to be chunks of data being downloaded, at around 10KB/s.
I suspect each burst of data is a portion of the list being downloaded.
As I was performing the test, Nextcloud Dev, crashed a few times.

Pressing the "..." on the right top corner of the display, and switch between "Grid view" and "List view" a few times will populate the list incrementally.
The content doesn't seem to exist in the cache as soon as the screen is being refreshed, the content will instantly disappear.
The feature is not very stable to be useful, I think.
According to the Web interface, I have about 100 folders and 100 files shared for my account.

It seems "Favorites" never gets updated, though, I have 2 folders and 8 files set as favorites.

### Expected behaviour
-Tell us what should happen
Accessing the relevant menu should show some kind of list relevant to the feature.

### Steps to reproduce
1. Accessing "Shared"
2. Waiting until "Loading" stops.
3. 


### Environment data
Android version:
6.0
Device model: 
LG 3
Stock or customized system:
Stock
Nextcloud app version:
Nextcloud Dev 20170529

11.0.3

title: Nextcloud 1.5 vs Nextcloud Dev
body:
### Actual behaviour
-Tell us what happens

This is just a query for information.
It seems Nextcloud 1.5 is in the work and I am wondering about the following:
- Is Nextcloud Dev going to become Nextcloud 1.5? As far as I understand, Nextcloud Dev is a different beast altogether and may not have the same features as 1.5, right?

- Nextcloud Dev is currently being tested but is not a Release Candidate nor a final product.
- Will Nextcloud 1.5 be released under RC or will it go directly to Release? It seems 1.5 is currently being tested.

- Will Nextcloud 1.5 be available to beta tester at some point or will it go as a Release for everybody?

If the former, how to get access to the beta or RC if any?

Thanks

title: Nextcloud Dev: Is there a way to export account settings in order to make a clean install and reload those settings back.
body:
### Actual behaviour
-Tell us what happens
I am using Nextcloud Dev app on a daily basis and I try to report bugs I find.
The last bug I found may have been caused by the introduction of one or more updates, or simply have occurred during normal usage.
It seems performing a clean install, rather than an update has solve that particular issue, maybe something to do with the Thumbnail cache.
I am usually reluctant to perform a clean install for several reasons:

- I need to go through account setup.
- I need to generate a new App password.
- I need to enable Autouploads to point to non-default folder and enable each of the options.

Repeat the above process for my other accounts.


### Expected behaviour
-Tell us what should happen
Is there a way to backup or save the App configuration so it can be reused after the App has been removed and installed again?

title: Spelling: "Login" is not a verb. + ": Uppercase"
German translation (just German descreption inside)
Nextcloud android app does not move or delete original files
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
### Actual behaviour
I setup Nextcloud android app to auto upload my photos to server and the original files to be moved to app folder. Instead, the original files are kept in the original folder.
The exact same behaviour happens with the setting "Original file will be..." - deleted.
Also, the same behaviour happens when I manually upload a file to the server and select Move or Delete.

### Expected behaviour
I take a photo, nextcloud app uploads it to the server then it moves it to the application folder.
or
I take a photo, nextcloud app uploads it to the server then it deletes the original photo.

### Steps to reproduce
1. Setup Nextcloud android app to auto upload files from DCIM/Camera folder;
2. Setup Nextcloud android app "Original file will be..." - "moved to app folder";
3. Take a photo;
4. Wait for Nextcloud to upload the photo on the server;
5. Go to Nextcloud app and browse the InstantUpload folder to confirm the photo is uploaded;
6. Using a file browser, got to DCIM/Camera folder and verify if the original photo is still there.

### Environment data
Android version: 6.0.1

Device model: Samsung Galaxy J5 (2016) [SM-J510FN]

Stock or customized system: Stock

Nextcloud app version: 1.4.3

Nextcloud server version: 11.0.3 (stable)

![screenshot_20170529-104638](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/21157928/26544679/ef26bd10-4462-11e7-90a5-04395310c9bc.png)
![screenshot_20170529-110956](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/21157928/26544680/ef2bbcac-4462-11e7-89cd-f0231cbd3e27.png)
