title: unnecessary and confusing content-descriptions in file activity
label: [Label(name="accessibility"), Label(name="design"), Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
### Actual behaviour
In the main file and folder activity, every file or folder name has a contend description set which prepends the layout type to the file name. For example if you have a file named testfile.txt in your Nextcloud, the contend-description for this entry is "LinearLayout-testfile..txt".

The purpose of content-descriptions is to add text descriptions for graphical UI elements such as image buttons. This information is then used e.g. by screen readers such as Talkback which enables blind or visually impaired users to work with the app by utilizing text-to-speech or braille displays.

When using the Nextcloud app together with Talkback, talkback reads the content description instead of the visible file name as described above, which is quite annoying and confusing. 

Since file and folder names consist of text, there is no need for them to have content-descriptions at all. Funny enough, there are also graphical buttons in the same activity i.e. to create a new folder, which are graphical only and would need contend-descriptions to be announced in a meaningful way, but don't have them set. I will however open a separate issue for this.

I am not a Java coder, but by looking into the code it seems to me the content-descriptions have been set mainly to use them in automation testing, not considering end users also see this information in some cases.

### Expected behaviour
Content-descriptions should only be set where needed to add textual descriptions for graphical elements. Furthermore the contained information must be valuable and informative to the end user.

### Steps to reproduce
Either use debugging tools to view the content-descriptions or enable Talkback from the assistive technologies screen in the global android settings and try to navigate the Nextcloud app. Be warned however talkback changes the touchscreen behaviour, which is confusing for sighted persons. When touching an element, no action is performed, instead the touched element is beeing read via text-to-speech. To actually trigger the focussed element, you need to double-tab it.

### Environment data
Android version: all supported versions

Device model: BQ Aquaris X5 Plus

Stock or customized system: stock Android 7.1.1

Nextcloud app version: 1.4.3

Nextcloud server version: 12.0

title: New login in NC12
label: [Label(name="bug"), Label(name="high")]
body:
Server is now sending both auth methodes:
`< WWW-Authenticate: Basic realm="Nextcloud"
< WWW-Authenticate: Bearer realm="Nextcloud"`

Currently android only uses only the latest string.
Oauth/Bearer is not working on android client.
To have a real fix, the client needs to parse both methodes and check if any says "basic".

Another way @nickvergessen just found out is to use /dav instead of /webdav.
With this approach we only get "basic realm":
- contra:  we do not get "bearer"/oauth
- pro: we have not to handle two auths

@mario @AndyScherzinger

title: HOTFIX: Ignore oauth for now and use always basic auth
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body: Otherwise new users cannot login into nc12 for the very first time.

title: Switch to new dav / enhance chunked uploading
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
Currently we are storing successful uploaded chunks client side.
This can now be enhanced to reduce client code:

- use new dav:  /dav/uploads/userx/<YOURRANDOMID>/
- list shows already uploaded chunks
  - iterate over them and check file size, if chunk is completely uploaded
- upload (remaining) chunks
- move from /dav/uploads/userx/<YOURRANDOMID>/.file to /dav/files/userx/<PATH>

title: [WIP] Use colors from setup.xml for folder icons
body:
Just a current WIP with using different colors from setup.xml
Useful for automatic branding.

Sometimes later this can also be enhanced to (hopefully) change colors dynamically if set on theming app on server, for all users.

Icons that are now changed:
- folder (shared, linked, regular)
- empty list icon
- auto upload cloud icon (only on checked state)
- checkbox (only on checked state)
- primary action buttons

title: Sort contact list
body:
This PR sort the contact list
If the contact doesn't have Name or LastName is send it to the end of the list

title: disable search related navigation entries in sidebar/bottombar
body: if server version is <12

title: Speed up up drone by disabling emulator as no tests are run
label: [Label(name="enhancement"), Label(name="pr exists")]
body:
Currently we do not run any test on the emulator or did I overlooked something?
Therefore we now could disable the whole emulator stuff and "just" build?

title: Drawer branding
body:
if you right now try to change the drawer icon for e.g. "backup contacts" it will also change all user icons across the app.

-if an icon is only used in drawer, I have renamed it to be more consistent
-if an icon is also used somewhere else, I have copied the icon so that you can have in independent change of drawer only

(this is needed for custom branding)

title: Contacts backup folder after new install
body:
- always update contacts backup folder
- if file is not downloaded, download it then show content

Ref: #1018

title: Contacts restore option in newer phone not available
label: [Label(name="bug"), Label(name="pr exists")]
body:
### Actual behaviour
-The user with device "X" select the option backup contacts, then the same user with the same account opens the app in device 'Y', the restore option is not showing

### Expected behaviour
-When a user moves from device X to Y expects to restore contacts.
*Maybe the option `Last backup` its ok to see it as `never` because this configuration belongs to the current device. 
**Edit: It works if i browse in the `/.Contacts-Backup/` folder  

### Steps to reproduce
1. From device X select the option backup contacts
2. From device Y open the backup activity, restore option is not available



### Environment data
Android version: 7.0 | 6.0

Device model:  Huawei P10 | LG-H542 

Stock or customized system:

Nextcloud app version:1.4.2 both

Nextcloud server version:

### Logs
#### Web server error log
```
Insert your webserver log here
```

#### Nextcloud log (data/nextcloud.log)
```
Insert your Nextcloud log here
```
**NOTE:** Be super sure to remove sensitive data like passwords, note that everybody can look here! You can use the Issue Template application to prefill some of the required information: https://apps.nextcloud.com/apps/issuetemplate

title: Contact backup first time crashes
label: [Label(name="approved"), Label(name="bug"), Label(name="pr exists")]
body:
### Actual behaviour
- Select backup contacts for the _first time_ ( press button back up now ) application crashes

### Expected behaviour
- Contact backup file uploads to server. 

If it helps the problem is that the method `expireFiles` tries to get the folder `/.Contacts-Backup/` before it´s creation in the `CreateFolderOperation`
 
### Steps to reproduce
1. Open app
2. Select back up contacts menu
3. Press the button backup now
4. Wait until the service starts


### Environment data
Android version: 7.0

Device model: Huawei P10

Stock or customized system:

Nextcloud app version:1.4.2

Nextcloud server version:

### Logs
#### Web server error log
```
Insert your webserver log here
```

title: Store lint output in nextcloud
body: This one stores the master and the current lint html files in my cloud, so we can easily review what errors/warnings have increased.

title: Add possibility to move quota to navigation header
body:
This is needed as we cannot directly access the views in header.
(this is mainly for customized builds)

title: Improve push
body: This fixes push magic for various use-cases.

title: Auto-Upload does not work
label: [Label(name="AutoUpload"), Label(name="bug")]
body:
### Actual behaviour
-Tell us what happens
Autoupload hangs

### Expected behaviour
-Tell us what should happen
Upload files after w-lan is on 

### Steps to reproduce
1. Take a picture
2. Connect to W-LAN
3. In the upload list, images are listen, but nothing happens. 
On each item is a message: "Warten auf das Hochladen"

But sometimes after several minutes, some pictures was successfully uploaded and than uploading stops again.

Android version: 7.0

Device model: Symung Galaxy S7, SM-G930F, no branding

Nextcloud server version: 11.0.3

title: Contact list improvement
body: fix some lint errors/warnings

title: Further codacy fixes
body: work in progress

title: Send not working
label: [Label(name="approved"), Label(name="bug")]
body:
### Actual behaviour
- When trying to share an image (*.JPG) via the "send" function to a WhatsApp contact then the error "unsupported file format" gets thrown within WhatsApp. Also other messaging applications are failing to send the image.
- If I direct access the nextcloud data folder with some other file browser app I can successfully send the image so the image itself is ok.

### Expected behaviour
- Image should have been shared with WhatsApp so that it can be send to one of the WhatsApp contacts.
 
### Steps to reproduce
1. Open image
2. Select "send" in the options
3. Select WhatsApp (or some other app)

### Environment data
Android version:
7.1.2
Device model: 
Nexus 5X
Stock or customized system:
Stock
Nextcloud app version:
1.4.2
Nextcloud server version:
11.0.3

title: Improve offline support
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
### Actual behaviour
- NextCloud server is not reachable (offline) and mobile is connected to WIFI. Now when trying to use the app to open an image that has been marked as "offline available" and that has this green check mark it takes quite some time (several seconds) to open the image. Overall the app becomes very unresponsive especially if you're in the image preview mode.

### Expected behaviour
- If an image has been downloaded onto the mobile and if the server is not reachable it should immediately show the image that has been stored on the mobile and don't wait that long for the server to respond
- Also the app's responsiveness shouldn't drop when the server is not reachable
 
### Steps to reproduce
1. Mark via the folder view an image (in my case 4.5 MB) as "offline available" and wait until the green check mark appears (do not yet open the image)
2. Close the app
3. Take the server offline
4. Re-open the app and try opening the previous downloaded image (takes very long / much longer than usual)
5. Try opening the image info options (very unresponsive)

### Environment data
Android version:
7.1.2
Device model: 
Nexus 5X
Stock or customized system:
Stock
Nextcloud app version:
1.4.2
Nextcloud server version:
11.0.3

title: How to refresh the list without synchronising? Or how to do it with syncing? Full manual needed also!
label: [Label(name="enhancement"), Label(name="needs info/discussion")]
body:
Hi

In a folder after clicking refresh account nothing happens. The list of files and folders stays the same. What to do?

Where is the main manual online to explain all the colors and behavior? Who can explain to me? I am quite disappointed not to find this online?

Sincere,
Klaus

title: Use network constraint "connected" as default
body:
ANY: Network must not be connected.
CONNECTED: Network must be connected.
Ref: #1005

- take some photos
- wait > 30s
- auto upload tries to upload pictures and fails with "connection error"

There was a PR for the "old" auto upload.
This issue remains open to check this if it is working after rewite by mario.

Thank you Community, you rock :tada:!

title: Transifex: 'quote' character should be escaped for Android String resource
label: [Label(name="approved"), Label(name="enhancement"), Label(name="pr exists")]
body:
```
Review, amend and write code, see 
<a href="https://github.com/nextcloud/android/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md">CONTRIBUTING.md</a> 
for details
```
can't be translated on transifex with the error:
```
'quote' character should be escaped for Android String resource
```

any idea @tobiasKaminsky , since you made the last config changes to transifex :)
Alternatively we could go for 
```
Review, amend and write code, see %1$s for details
```
and add the hyperlink via string formatting in code...

title: Use app specific log folder
body:
Use app specific log folder. This is always writeable by the app.
Now the log file can be written on the very early beginning as no permission is needed.
Also the cause of storage migration problems can now be logged.

Needs: https://github.com/nextcloud/android-library/pull/60
Should fix: https://github.com/nextcloud/android/issues/297

title: Support direct rendering from server to Chromecast
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
Let me tell you a story 😊 

Mrs. Peabody wants to display pictures to her parents. She currently uses Google Photos. Opens the app, turns on the TV+Chromecast, presses the cast button, and pictures & videos show on the TV as she swipes on them in her phone. She has some 60fps videos from her last snowboarding holidays and the video renders perfectly smooth in TV (a little low-res at the beginning until buffer catches up, but nobody notices).

Mr. Peabody wants to move from Google to Nextcloud - for obvious reasons -, but cannot do that until his wife is able to show pictures to her parents in the TV comfortably. This includes:

- 1 button press to cast.
- Direct nextcloud-to-chromecast streaming, or the video will not display smoothly.
- Pics & videos should be correctly sorted.
- Swiping to next media should cast it automatically.

Right now only screen mirroring works, but it's clunky.

Can we help Mr. Peabody?

### Actual behaviour
- No Chromecast icon.
- Video is downloaded instead of played (https://github.com/nextcloud/android/issues/379).

### Expected behaviour
- Chromecast icon on screen when casting is possible.
- When casting is on, media streamed directly from nextcloud server.

title: Crash due to non-existing empty string
body: Ref: #946,  https://help.nextcloud.com/t/nextcloud-dev-doesnt-start/12389

title: Opening a folder on an external share shows "no data available"
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
### Actual behaviour
If I open a folder which resides on an external WebDAV share, its content is not displayed but "no data available". Surprisingly this behavior does not happen on all folders but most of them. I've not yet found a template which justifies the different handling of the folders. 
The content itself is viewable using the normal Web-GUI or using an alternative app like e.g. ES File Explorer.

### Expected behaviour
The content of a folder should instantly been shown.
 
### Steps to reproduce
1. Open the Nextcloud app.
2. Access a folder which contains several files and folders.
3. The message "no data available" is shown.


### Environment data
Android version: 7.1.1

Device model: Jiayu S3 Adv.

Stock or customized system: MadOS ROM

Nextcloud app version: v1.4.2 beta

Nextcloud server version: 11.0.3 

### Logs
#### Web server error log

Nothing special has been logged related to this problem.

title: remove old reference to onClick, this is now handled via ButterKnife
body: use "end" instead of "right" for RTL support

title: Handling bugs
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
To have a better overview about our outstanding bugs, I would like to enhance our bug processing like this:
- new bug is reported 
- at least one other needs to be able to reproduce it -> "approved"
- if not, then ask for steps -> "needs info"
- if bug is fixed -> "pr exists"

Bugs that have "needs info" and no response after 1 month can be closed.

title: Auto Upload: add month name
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
If you have multiple months, you will see "02" , "05" in gallery app.
To distinguish this from other random/temporary folder names I suggest to add " - monthname" to it:
"01 - january"
"02 - february"
...
To avoid more options this should be "just" changed.

title: Enhance maintenance recognition
label: [Label(name="approved"), Label(name="enhancement"), Label(name="pr exists")]
body:
With #502 we have a recognition of maintenance mode for
- create, rename, move, delete of files/folders
- upload new files

But you can still browse the file list and refresh the folder listing without any knowledge that the server is currently in maintenance mode.

@jancborchardt @eppfel please give us an hint how to show it to the user.

title: Use lint checker
body:
This basically runs "android lint" and compares the error/warnings counts against a threshold in scripts/lint/lint-results.txt.
It will fail if the count increases and success if it is unchanged or decreased. 
If it decreases the new value will be pushed to the current source branch, triggering a new build.
(If we skip drone, then github would remain in "waiting state" and thus not allow us to merge it, so we have to start drone once again).

Main goal is to reduce the error/warning count to 0 or at least not introduce new issues.

@mario @AndyScherzinger

title: App stuck in Loading spinner while thumbnails are being generated
label: [Label(name="approved"), Label(name="bug"), Label(name="pr exists")]
body:
### Actual behaviour
When the android app is generating/loading thumbnails, I click on an image (even one with a thumbnail already generated).  When the download progress bar completes, the app shows a Loading spinner and gets stuck loading.

If I Force Close and restart the app and navigate to the same folder and stay in a section where all the thumbnails are already generated, pictures load just fine.

### Expected behaviour
Pictures should download, loading screen should show (I assume) and the picture should become visible when the app is finished loading
 
### Steps to reproduce incorrect behavior
1. Enter Photos folder
2. Scroll to section with missing thumbnails and wait for the app to start generating thumbnails.
3. Click on a picture to start loading (this can be a picture that's already cached on the phone.  It doesn't matter which picture)
4. Wait for the picture to finish downloading and the white Loading spinner screen appears.  That's where it gets stuck!

### Steps to reproduce expected behavior
1. Enter Photos folder
2. Keep grid scrolling position in an area where all thumbnails are already generated.  (None need to be generated)
3. Click on a picture to start loading (this can be a picture that's already cached on the phone.  It doesn't matter which picture)
4. Picture loads just fine!  Almost instantly after the download process.

### Environment data
Android version:
6.0.1
Device model: 
Galaxy S6 Phone and Galaxy Tab S2
Stock or customized system:
Stock
Nextcloud app version:
Tested with current stable version 4.4.2 in Play store and dev version:  20170430
Nextcloud server version:
11.0.3
### Logs
#### Web server error log
N/A - None since mid April.  I was able to reproduce the error today and no web server log entries were made.

#### Nextcloud log (data/nextcloud.log)
See attached file from April - May
[nextcloud.txt](https://github.com/nextcloud/android/files/976711/nextcloud.txt)

title: Update app to take advantage of the larger aspect ratio on latest Android devices
label: [Label(name="design"), Label(name="enhancement"), Label(name="needs info/discussion")]
body:
see https://android-developers.googleblog.com/2017/03/update-your-app-to-take-advantage-of.html

The recommendation is to add
```
<meta-data android:name="android.max_aspect" android:value="2.1" />
```
to support aspect ratios of 2.1 or higher. Else if we don't set a value, and ```android:resizeableActivity``` is not ```true```, then the maximum aspect ratio defaults to 1.86 (roughly 16:9) and the app will not take advantage of the extra screen space. This would be the case for a Samsung Galaxy S8 for example.

title: Android lint
body:
Run target "android lint" and fix issues.

This is a nice way to do it:
https://medium.com/yplan-eng/stop-ignoring-android-lint-use-it-8a8ee2ca6af8

It consists of multiple steps:
- enable lint to break on any lint errors
- configure lint.xml to treat warnings step by step as errors
  - fix one warning category
  - treat them as error in lint.xml
  - repeat with remaining categories

So if you are fine with this, I will start soon to fix all lint errors and enable lint on drone.

title: Stop music when bluetooth headset disconnects
label: [Label(name="enhancement"), Label(name="hacktoberfest")]
body:
### Actual behaviour
- Playing music straight out of the app is awesome!  There is just one minor nitpick: When a bluetooth headset is turned off, the playback does not stop, but it continues over the internal speaker of the mobile phone. 

### Expected behaviour
- When disconnecting the BT device, stop/pause playback.
 
### Steps to reproduce
1. Upload a sound file via nextcloud sync
2. Pair a BT headset with the phone
3. Start playback by clicking on the file in nextcloud app
4. enjoy playback
5. turn off BT headset
6. Experience mobile phone speakers blaring at you


### Environment data
Android version: 7.1

title: What happened to Auto Backup?
body:
Hello, I have Nextcloud 1.4.2 from Fdroid and I have an auto backup feature for dirs with images (not only camera taken, but also screenshots, downloads etc).

See https://m.imgur.com/6xwDGNh

I have installed Nextcloud 1.4.2 from Google Play on my wife's phone and the feature is missing.

I am very much interested on the feature as we want all images saved to nextcloud, not only camera snaps.

thanks!

title: Search view wrong files
body:
Ref: #857 

The main clue is that the current system does not allow to have "any" ocfile, instead there must always be a parentId/parentFolder. Without that things like downloading files do not work.
As the favorites/photos can show any files (even if they have never been synced) we need to download the parentOCFile, maybe even recursive until "/".
Of course this is only done once for each folder.

Sidenote: I tried it with ~3500 and it took quite a long time to display the images. Fetching the files recursively was not the problem as on the second time all files were fetched already, but it still took ~20s.

title: propose instant image/video upload make use of file's last modified time
body:
Propose instant image/video upload make use of file's last modified time rather than datetime as of upload trigger

Summary:
the changes is to respect and retain an image/video file's last modified time (i.e. mtime) of itself.

Description:
Uses of System.currentTimeMillis() as of upload triggered are not guaranteeing the truth of last modification datetime about users' uploaded data.

Uses of Media.DATE_MODIFIED are seemingly more appropriate for the usage.

==========
For example:
Consider that 
1. USER_A captured a screenshot at 2017-04-25 1800HKT, a photo at 2017-04-25 1900HKT, a video at 2017-04-25 2000HKT
2. USER_A then connected the android phone to a stable WiFi network at 2017-04-26 1200HKT, which enables Nextcloud android app to trigger those pending auto-upload/backup jobs

==========
Currently unexpected result:
USER_A will be told by Nextcloud that the uploaded files are all last modified on/at 2017-04-26 1200HKT

==========
Expected result:
Nextcloud should tell users an exact truth about last modification time of an uploaded file.

e.g.:
USER_A should be told by Nextcloud that the uploaded screenshot is last modified on/at 2017-04-25 1800HKT, the uploaded photo is last modified on/at 2017-04-25 1900HKT, the uploaded video is last modified on/at 2017-04-25 2000HKT.

==========
Other discussions:
1. comments are polluting the clean code but I temporarily write down comments to explain my changes for sack of facilitating others to review my changes. pls remove it after reviews if feeling uncomfortable.
2. File Upload Datetime Timestamp is also considerably important information for users to get an understanding about their uploaded file when users revisit their files. For file_upload_datetime_timestamp, uses of System.currentTimeMillis() (as of file upload trigger/completion at client/server) would be suitable to the usage. Should it be considered to be implemented in a planned future? Besides, considered that, file upload is async task, where a progress of file upload could be taking a lengthly upload duration, say probably an hour long for big video file over a slow network, take file upload completion timestamp at server as reference for file_upload_datetime_timestamp may be considerably more logical to usage? I think that could be discussed.


Thanks for your attentions!

title: Can't pause pinned-offline audio when server is unavailable
label: [Label(name="bug"), Label(name="dev version")]
body:
STR:

1. Upload some audio to a Nextcloud server
2. Pin the audio offline in the app'
3. Make the server unavailable (in my case it's down; not sure what the behavior is when you just take the device offline)
4. Tap the audio file to play it
5. Notice how you now get a screen that says "Loading" which prevents you from using the audio controls and which will never load because the server's down

I'm on Nextcloud dev 20170419 installed via F-Droid. This is definitely a regression but I'm not 100% sure what version I was on before - presumably it was 20170415, the previous version, but again I'm not sure.

title: Enhance contacts backup
label: [Label(name="design"), Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
To enable contacts backup in public version some points needs to be discussed
(this was a customer feature and we want to have it also in regular version)

- [x] support multiple accounts
- [x] where to put it
  - settings is not the best place (as @mario pointed out) as it is an account specific setting (same for davdroid)
  - navigation drawer is somehow a too prominent place
- more explanation / config
  - [x] change target folder
  - [x] show current target folder
  - [x] explain that backup is done once a day
  - [x] custom deletion of old backups (currently disabled, should be adjustable?)
  
![filezskujf](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5836855/25325359/7e9da1ba-28cb-11e7-8478-9995b1d95a27.png)

title: Create new text file from within NC
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
Hi everybody and thank your for this app!

What I am missing is a simple way to create a new text file from within the NC app.

If you want to do it today, there are severals steps necessary:
- open your favorite text editor, write text and save it to a new local file
- open NC app, navigate to the destination folder
- click on "add" buttton ("+") at the bottom right
- click on the first upload button
- navigate through your local files and select the desired text file
- choose "move to next cloud" and click on "upload"

What I would suggest is to add a "add text file" button to this small menu (sorry for my bad gimp skills):
![image1563907354-445](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3306424/25313696/f2ae1780-2833-11e7-957e-0870f46bf9d1.jpg)
Thanks! Spectas

title: Add app title to webview welcome pages
label: [Label(name="approved"), Label(name="design"), Label(name="enhancement"), Label(name="pr exists")]
body:
In the header of the webview welcome pages (see https://github.com/nextcloud/android/pull/827) the app name should be in the header, centered, to give context.

In the usual case simply "Nextcloud", or the relevant name if branded.

title: Re-design icons in add button/menu ("+")
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
Hello everybody,

first of all, thank you for this great software suite!

Right now the add-button opens a menu with icons, which is imho not self explaining. The upper two symbols (upload file and upload from external app) would also fit the other way around. You have to do try and error to know, which one is what for:
![image1563907354](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3306424/25313532/9d04bf94-2830-11e7-9ab3-542495447c01.jpg)
What I would suggest is to take the same icon twice, only with a small difference. I am not a designer, so sorry for the quality of this small gimp project. But perhaps something like this:
![image1563907354-edit](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3306424/25313563/09e8b39a-2831-11e7-9b6e-ad84dc857f44.jpg)
Imho it would be clearer, as it is something people know from the differentiation between "open" and "open with" buttons.

Thanks and greetings,
Spectas

title: change all namings of beta/nightly to new "dev"
Enhance fingerprint support
label: [Label(name="enhancement"), Label(name="hacktoberfest")]
body:
#624 adds support for fingerprint as an alternative for PIN protection for accessing the app.

some (minor) enhancements should be implemented:

- deactivating PIN (in the preferences) if you activated fingerprinting
- deactivating fingerprint (in the preferences) if you have activated PIN
- ask for fingerprint if you deactivate fingerprint
- some "next 5 tries" mechanism/reset (incorrect finger(print), e.g. 5 times wrong fingerprint and the app is locked and to get another chance at fingerprinting your way into the app you need to wait for e.g. 10 seconds (should be enough imho)

cc @mario @tobiasKaminsky @Flole998

title: Favorites/photos: clicking on images result in wrong image
label: [Label(name="bug"), Label(name="pr exists")]
body:
- open favorites
- click on one image
-> wrong image

Caused by PreviewImagePagerAdapter uses "parentFolder", which is the parent folder of the image to show and not the file list of favorites/images

According to that:
if FileDisplayActivity, startImagePreview(OCFile file) intents are set, but never used.
Instead this is handled by getFile() and setFile()

title: Nextcloud Dev 20170415: clicking on a thumbnail downloads the file.
body:
### Actual behaviour
-Tell us what happens
On Nextcloud Beta, there was the ability of clicking on a thumbnail of a photo and be able to display the thumbnail in full screen. At the same time, it was also possible to scroll through the photos without downloading the files themselves. This was a nice feature to have as the downloading the picture was done in the background and when download was complete, the thumbanil in the scroll mode would show the full size image.

Should we expect Nextcloud Dev to have the same behavior found in Beta?

title: Nextcloud Dev 20170415: Autouploads of video breaks files.
label: [Label(name="AutoUpload"), Label(name="bug"), Label(name="needs info/discussion")]
body:
### Actual behaviour
-Tell us what happens
When Autoupload is enabled for Camera folder,  video file being recorded will become corrupted.
Behavior is identical to the previous ticket, however, there is still corruption even though the file remains in its original forlder:
Beta 20170221: Autoupload of video corrupts files #673

### Expected behaviour
-Tell us what should happen
 Nextcloud app should detect when the file has been finalized before moving ahead with the autoupload.

### Steps to reproduce
1. Have Autoupload for Camera to be enabled.
2. Open Camera app and take a video. I was running the test for the maximum length of recording which is 5 minutes on my phone.
3. Transfer is probably underway while video is in progress
4. File sent to server is truncated and damaged because it is incomplete. 107MB out of 600MB file would only be uploaded.

### Environment data
Android version:
6.0
Device model: 
LG-3

Stock or customized system:
Stock

Nextcloud app version:
Nextcloud Dev 20170415

Nextcloud server version:
11.0.2

```

```

title: Nextcloud Dev 20170415:  Phone is becoming warmer than usual.
label: [Label(name="AutoUpload"), Label(name="bug"), Label(name="needs info/discussion")]
body:
### Actual behaviour
-Tell us what happens
After installing "Nexctloud Dev: 20170415" the phone as been running warmer than usual.
While taking a video to test "Autoupload", I let the video being recorded for the full 5mintues, then on the second video being recorded, the camera app terminated the recording complaining the phone was getting too hot.
I don't know if Nextcloud Dev is doing some intensive work in the background trying to sync up with the server or there is bug  causing excessive CPU usage.

### Expected behaviour
-Tell us what should happen
 
### Steps to reproduce
1. "Autoupload" must be enabled and target the camera folder.
2. Taking more than one video.
3. During upload of the video and recording the phone will get warmer and cause the camera app to cancel recording.


### Environment data
Android version:
6.0

LG3

title: Auto upload on 1.4.2 and Android 7.1.2 still broken
label: [Label(name="AutoUpload"), Label(name="bug")]
body:
### Actual behaviour
-Tell us what happens
Auto upload doesn't work-
If an image or video is added to a watched folder while not connected to wifi, it will never upload when reconnected.
If the upload fails due to a connection issue, it will never retry.
Photos taken with the camera don't even show up in the uploads list.
The app drains my battery

### Expected behaviour
-Tell us what should happen
Auto upload should work-
If the connection fails, it should retry at a later time
If its waiting for wifi, it should at some point in the future check for a wifi connection rather than waiting indefinitely
All photos taken with the camera should show up in the uploads list (interestingly, thumbnails show on the "Auto upload" page)

### Steps to reproduce
1. Take a photo or video while not connected to wifi
2. Some photos are never detected for upload, it almost seems random which ones. 
3. Sometimes app will cause rapid battery drain
-or-
1. Take a photo or video while on wifi, turn wifi off mid transfer to simulate a connection error
2. Upload never retries.
3. Sometimes app will cause rapid battery drain

### Environment data
Android version: 7.1.2

Device model: Nexus 5x

Stock or customized system: Stock

Nextcloud app version: 1.4.2

Nextcloud server version: Owncloud 9.1.4 RC2 (cannot migrate to NextCloud due to outstanding issues with the NC server)

### Logs
#### Web server error log
```
Insert your webserver log here
```

#### Nextcloud log (data/nextcloud.log)
```
Insert your Nextcloud log here
```
I understand the devs are working hard on this app, and its free, however, its been incredibly frustrating.  I'm not an Android developer, but I'll do what I can try to troubleshoot this issue.  I'd really like for it to work reliably.

title: java.lang.RuntimeException: android.os.TransactionTooLargeException: data parcel size 1245708 bytes
label: [Label(name="bug"), Label(name="pr exists")]

Happens when sending a very large (> 1Mb) log while.

Workaround: if file is > 1 mb truncate it so that it fits. 
AFAIK the newest entries are on top, therefore truncate from the end.

title: Remove play services
body: This change removes play services and fixes a number of regressions for the Auto Upload. Special thanks to the Android job maintainer for his fixes, for accepting my fixes, and all the people who tested stuff.

title: [Enhancement] Upload waiting queued items on click
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body: Especially due to #486 I regularly have e.g. images in my upload queue waiting for a wifi to autoupload. there doesn't seem to be a way to manually start the upload, e.g. to share it. I suggest that clicking on a waiting file should start the upload, regardless if it was queued as a wifi-only upload or not.

title: Auto Upload "Original file will be deleted" setting not working with external sdcard
label: [Label(name="bug"), Label(name="needs info/discussion")]
body:
### Actual behaviour
"Original file will be..." set to 
- "moved to app folder": file is **copied** to the app folder and if I delete the file in the original folder manually the picture won't show up in Gallery ( #769 & #807  )
- "deleted": the file is kept in the original folder

### Expected behaviour
"Original file will be..." set to 
- "moved to app folder": file is **moved** to app folder and visible in Gallery
- "deleted": file is deleted from device
 
### Steps to reproduce
- "Original file will be..." set to "moved to app folder":
1. Take a picture
2. Wait for upload
3. Find file stored in the original folder as well as in the app folder
4. Picture is shown in Gallery
5. Delete file from original folder
6. Picture isn't shown in Gallery any more

- "Original file will be..." set to "deleted":
1. Take a picture
2. Wait for upload
3. Find file still stored in the original folder

### Environment data
Android version: 7.0

Device model: Samsung Galaxy S7 & S7 Edge

Stock or customized system: Stock

Nextcloud app version: 1.4.2

Nextcloud server version: 11.0.2 (stable)

Nextcloud Folder: /storage/9C33-6BBD/Android/data/com.nextcloud.client/files (= SD-Card)

Auto Upload Settings:
![screenshot_20170406-175351 1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/25515660/24764027/5f941730-1af3-11e7-9b83-770518df7318.jpg)

title: Add further media types to auto upload
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
as discussed in #285 and numerous other issues, this PR adds further media types to the auto upload screen, starting with videos. For now video and images are split and shown twice for folders contain both e.g. the camera folder. We could also merge them into one (if we want that which is subject to discussion).

Audio is also on the agenda but I would leave it out for now until it is clear how to implement this. The reason for that is that we are querying the media store and then display all folders that contain images (and are visible to the media store, as-in indexed). So for music in case each album has it's won folder we would display all those folders which might be a lot while it does makes sense do handle it this way for video and images...

here is a screenshot of the work in progress and btw thumbnail generation and caching has been extended for video. If a format can't be read or the file is somehow corrupt we just show the standard icon:
![device-2017-06-09-172344](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1315170/26982729-9944cc40-4d39-11e7-968f-cd22a1ca0d58.png)



**OPEN ISSUES**
- [x] add delete capability for custom folders (delete button on the bottom left in the folder preference dialog)
- [x] hide delete for non custom folders
- [x] hide delete for unpersisted custom folders
- [x] block save button in preference screen as long as not all necessary data has been set (grey out "save" text until set)
- [x] fix filter for local folder picker (upload activity re-use) to only show folders but no files
- [x] make Jobs aware of the folder type and only upload all file types for custom folders, video-only for video folders and image-only for image folders
- [x] make sure a job gets removed/terminated when a custom folder setup gets deactivated or deleted
- [x] rewrite auto upload
- [x] adapt to customer-hack-flag which hides the per-folder setting, which is needed for custom folders and also the flag needs to be ignored for custom folders since the user (IMHO) will like to have full control over this type of auto upload folder!
- [ ] add check to prevent several custom folder definitions which define syncs on different levels of one file tree since this will either lead to duplicate uploads or even errors (in case delete after upload)
- [x] check why successful uploads disappear from uploads view after visiting that screen a few times
- [x] lock files while uploading
- [x] show only current user uploads
- [x] automatically retry manual uploads
- [x] remove uploads screen menu
- [x] show "Setup custom folder" even if no media folders are detected
- [x] Make it "Set up a custom folder" where it says "Setup a custom folder" on the work in progress screen

title: Latest nightly Android client upload issues with MP4 and jpg images
label: [Label(name="AutoUpload"), Label(name="bug"), Label(name="needs info/discussion")]
body:
### Actual behaviour
-Using the instantupload feature, and also, using the manual upload of JPG pictures and MP4 movies to my private NextCloud server I am not able to view the iconized listed inividual file preview of JPG files in the Android nightly client nor am i able to play the MP4 movies uploaded by the nightly android nextcloud client. Onscreen Message when opening the files using the Nextcloud nightly android client: large black exclamation icon with the message "Picture could not be displayed" or with the MP4 movies i can open the MP4 file using the android nightly client but after 5 seconds it presents the following message: "Media could not be displayed using the default mediaplayer". The messages could be slightly different  because they are presented in an other language then English, being Dutch, which is the default language on my phone.
What is also strange is that other content (both pictures and Movies) uploaded using the stable android Nextcloud client are displayed correct by the Nextcloud nightly android client, listed individual iconized preview is displayed, and content uploaded bij the nextloud android stable client can be opened and played. The issue here is that I am not able to open or play Content uploaded by the Android nightly client using the nextloud android nightly client.  All Pictures which I am not able to open with the nightly Android client also have the same file icon: a grey icon with gray mountain tops and grey circle (sun?) for pictures. 

Also i noticed that, when I close the nightly Nextcloud android client en open the latest stable NextCloud android client, I can see the all the pictures being displayed correctly (listed miniatures preview icons) and i can also view and play both the pictures and the MP4 movies which i was not able to see and play using the, and uploaded by, the nightly Nextcloud android client. 

### Expected behaviour

### Steps to reproduce
1. Open Nightly Nextcloud android client

title: Improvement: arbitrary synced folders
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
### Actual behaviour
- The defined folders sync fine. However, there doesn't seem to be a way to define a custom folder to autoupload (or sync) to the server.

### Expected behaviour
- I would like the ability to define a folder that is not just images or videos but other files to be automatically uploaded to the server.
- The client should monitor that folder (or even check every couple of minutes) if files have changed or have been added.
- When a file has been stable for a configurable time span, it gets uploaded to the associated folder on the server.
### Rationale
I'm running the GpxPod plugin on the server, my devices record GPX tracks when I'm using OSMAnd. I'd like to upload the generated tracks automatically. 

I can imagine there are other applications that generate data files that someone might want to upload, e.g. backup files from some application that isn't in the cloud.

### Environment data
Nextcloud app version:
1.4.1
Nextcloud server version:
11.0.2

title: Remove Auto upload
body:
I posted this on Nextcloud site, but this is probably more appropriate.

I have recently updated my Samsung S7 to Android 7.0 and with it the Nextcloud app somehow also "updated".

The recent 1.4.2 update added the Auto upload feature, which I dislike very much. I do not want my Videos and Photo files to be going to the same directory. I cannot now separate the upload of video to wifi only. I want the pics to be uploaded at all times, while video only on wifi. 1.4.2 broke that. Before android 7.0 came out, I downgraded the nextcloud to 1.4.1 and restored the ability to upload separately. However, now that the system updated I "gained" the auto upload, no matter what I do. I even tried to downgrade to 1.4.0, and still see that retched auto upload feature.

So, my question is, how do I re-enable the ability to select separate folders for video and photo, AND the ability to upload different files over cellular or wifi?

Thank you,

Lev

title: Camera auto upload has a significant delay before actually uploading ("Waiting to upload")
body:
### Actual behaviour
I just migrated from ownCloud to Nextcloud. I enabled the automatic upload feature for camera photos, which I was also using previously in the ownCloud Android app. When I take photos with the camera, the new photos are placed in Nextcloud's uploads list and labeled "Waiting to upload" where they sit for some time before actually uploading.

I frequently used the automatic upload feature in ownCloud to take a photo with my phone and quickly have it available on my computer. The upload delay in the Nextcloud app is frustrating.

### Expected behaviour
New photos taken with the camera app should begin uploading immediately, as they did in the ownCloud app.
 
### Steps to reproduce
1. Enable auto upload for Camera photos
2. Take a photo
3. Observe the newly taken photo(s) are stuck in the Nextcloud app Uploads queue, labeled "Waiting to upload"

### Environment data
Android version: 6.0.1

Device model: Moto G4 Plus

Stock or customized system: Stock

Nextcloud app version: 1.4.2

Nextcloud server version: 11.0.2

Hi, 
this is not a bug report, but a feature proposal. When using the nextcloud app on android, I can press the plus button in the right lower corner. After that, I have the possibility to create a folder and two different options to upload a file. 
This is absolutely fine, but I am missing a functionality to create a file. Creating a file is specially useful in the Notes folder when using the Notes App. Having an option to create a file will also allow to paste simple text you received via WhatsApp etc. to your cloud.

Mischa

title: 1.4.2 Video upload folder destination incorrect
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
see https://help.nextcloud.com/t/1-4-2-video-upload-folder-destination-incorrect/10432

There is an option to have it upload to ```<folder>/<year>/<month>``` (folder being user selected) this is broken in 1.4.2

In this case my destination folder for my videos is "video".

In 1.4.2. it creates a folder called ```<folder>+<year>/<Month>```  i.e.  ```video2017/03```  when the path should have been ```video/2017/03```

-----

I haven't tested this personally but know that we fixed this issue pre-1.4.2 final for images, but am not sure if this is then also automatically fixed for video uploads (but would think so).

title: Target folder after auto upload
body:
I really like the feature to move auto uploaded files after successful upload. It is very helpful to keep track of what is uploaded and what failed. Right now, I only have upload failures due to the net breaking away and tgat sort of jazz, but it happens and I still don't fully trust that feature.
It also helps not reloading images that are actually still on the device when browsing in the Nextcloud app.

The issue is where the images are moved. /storage/emulated/0/Android/data/com.nextcloud.android.beta/files/nextcloud/myaccount@myserver/SofortUpload/Camera2017/03 is just ridiculous. There even seems to be a .nomedia somewhere, I cannot see the images in the Photo app anymore. I can only properly use them with the Nextcloud app.

I am not sure what the best solution would be. Perhaps not put the synced folders into Android/data? I don't really see a reason for that. I would like to see it in [configurable path, mostly /sdcard]/nextcloud.

title: API for other apps
label: [Label(name="enhancement"), Label(name="pr exists")]
body:
User story: I as a NextCloud user, want to use all NextCloud features on Android.

So downloading multiple apps is fine (and you got many: OCReader; Notes, NextCloud itself, …), installing them is fine, but afterwards we get some problems…

### The problems
1. User experience: Currently in all apps I saw have to re-enter my credentials. If I want to make it in a secure way I even have to recreate device passwords for each app (see 2.1 below)… That's cumbersome.
2. Security:
2.1. Each apps stores passwords. The fact that you can (and should) use separate device/app passwords for all these apps mitigates the risk, but nevertheless the password storage may get a problem.
2.2. Another thing is the connection to the NextCloud server: Do all these apps verify HTTPS certs correctly? Do these apps honor HSTS? What about HPKP? What about SSLv3? What about insecure ciphers? Do all these apps have the option to distrust system certificates?
SSL (implementations) are a well-known and common issue on Android…

What I want to show is: Using multiple apps, which may be more or less maintained, which may be better in a security aspect or not, which may accidentally delete all your data and where each of them needs a login is (potentially) bad.
Even when all apps are open-source (which is not guaranteed as users might also use non-FLOSS apps) open-source does not equal to security. NextCloud should provide a secure platform, where third-parties can securely integrate their apps.

### Possibly solutions
* As for the first issue, something [is proposed](https://github.com/stefan-niedermann/nextcloud-notes/issues/43) thanks to @David-Development [lib](https://github.com/David-Development/ownCloud-Account-Importer): Basically getting the user account from the saved one in Android accounts. However: This means the same password is used creating a potential security risk.
* or integrate all these third-party apps into the main NextCloud app. However: This requires much work, additional app permissions and will likely make the maintainers of the other apps sad.

### My proposed solution
…is therefore to create an API as the title indicates. Allow apps to connect to the main NextCloud app, where they can request permissions etc. All traffic (and therefore the SSL/TLS things) would be handled by one app - NextCloud - where you can include all security features etc. You can more easily expand/change the NextCloud system, especially the authentication.

### Examples
So how exactly could it be done? I've got two examples of other open source apps here:

* the way [K9 mail](https://github.com/k9mail/k-9/) integrates the OpenPGP provider. They show an authentication screen.
* the way DAVDroid integrates with Open Tasks (via custom Android permissions).

----

Related: https://github.com/nextcloud/android/issues/626 (DavDroid)
CCing other app devs: @schaal (ocreader), @stefan-niedermann (nextcloud-notes), @bitfireAT @devvv4ever (DAVDroid), @nerzhul (Nextcloud SMS App), @David-Development (News-Android-App)
Others, who might be interested: @jancborchardt

*Any app I forgot? Please comment and I'll add the maintainer here.*

title: Possibility to set storage path
label: [Label(name="bug"), Label(name="needs info/discussion")]
body:
In storage path settings, I can choose only from predefined paths and in my case, it's limited to default which means only one path is possible. But I would like to download my files for example to SD card and not main memory. This is probably partially issue caused by Android emulation, but even so, it would be nice to allow experienced users to set their own path manually.

### Actual behaviour
- I can choose only Default location for storing files

### Expected behaviour
- I would be able to enter any path I like
 
### Steps to reproduce
1. Run Nextcloud client on Jolla C
2. Try to set storage path


### Environment data
Android version:
Sailfish OS 2.1.0.9

Device model: 
Jolla C

Stock or customized system:
Stock

Nextcloud app version:
1.4.1

Nextcloud server version:
10.0.0.3

title: [Feature Request]: Ability To Stream
body: Ability to stream on Android app.

title: Auto-uploaded files that are moved to app folder are deleted from local storage the next time the folder is viewed in the app
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
### Actual behaviour
After images are taken and auto-uploaded, they are moved to the app folder as expected. However, the next time the folder containing those images are viewed in the Nextcloud app, the images are deleted.

### Expected behaviour
The images should not be deleted and should appear with a green checkmark as with all other locally-available files.
 
### Steps to reproduce
1. Enable auto upload for e.g. the camera
2. Change "Original file will be..." to "moved to app folder"
3. Take a picture
4. View the upload subfolder of the app folder in a file explorer and notice that the image has been moved there
5. Open the upload folder in the app and notice that the newly-uploaded image has no green checkmark
6. View the upload subfolder of the app folder in a file explorer again and notice that the image is gone

### Environment data
Android version: 7.1.1

Device model: Pixel XL

Stock or customized system: Stock

Nextcloud app version: 1.4.2 RC4

Nextcloud server version: 11.0.1

title: Blinking Thumbnails when refreshing
label: [Label(name="dev version")]
body:
Hi,

I'm running nightly since 2 weeks (with regular updates), currently I run version : 20170308.

I have noticed, in folders containing images, that refresh leads the thumbnails to blink wether I'm online or offline because the default image icon (with montains) is shortly displayed ... look at the attached zip screen video:
[ScreenRecord - Blinking Thumbnails.zip](https://github.com/nextcloud/android/files/835908/ScreenRecord.-.Blinking.Thumbnails.zip)

title: Remove tabs and line breaks from string source
body:
They were shown in Transifex and appeared to be just artefacts of word wrap and indentation of the XML source, so this commit removes them.

I noticed while translating that the source messages on Transifex are not exactly the same as those in the file I edited. Should the messages be edited in `en-rGB` or `en-rUS` as well perhaps?

title: Nightly 20170301: AutoUpload issue (other folder)
body:
### Actual behaviour
Files stored in snapchat folder won't auto-upload at all.

As many others, I have been struggling with the auto upload for a while. Testing with the nightly build of 20170301 with Android 7 (same result with android 6); I am concluding that auto upload for screenshots works fine, auto upload from camera work doubtfully fine (have not been able to reproduce faults systematically, but I have a hunch that it have failed). Auto-upload from other folder (i.e) snapchat is broken (hence this report).

### Expected behaviour
Auto upload from all defined folders should work, including snapchat folder.
 
### Steps to reproduce
1. Open/install Snapchat
2. Configure it to save "memory" pictures locally as aswell
3. Configure NC to auto upload from local snapchat folder (the folder with is latest pictures is visible in the NC setting)
4. Save a memory in snapchat (which stores the poto locally)
5. No auto-upload :(

### Environment data
Android version: 7.0 
Device model: Samsung Galaxy S7
Nextcloud app version: Nightly 20170301
Nextcloud server version:  11.0.2

title: App forces logout after sharing a file with the same user twice
label: [Label(name="approved"), Label(name="bug"), Label(name="pr exists")]
body:
### Actual behaviour
-App forces logout after sharing a file (intern) with a user twice

### Expected behaviour
-The user should not be shown in the search list after you have added them in shared.
 
### Steps to reproduce
1. Open App
2. Long press on a file -> share 
3. Add user or Group
4. Search for a user (Let's say user "example")
5. Add the user "example" as a person which you want to share the file with
6. Search again for the user
7. Try to add him again
8. App logs out


### Environment data
Android version: 6.0.1

Device model: Moto G3

Stock or customized system: customized

Nextcloud app version: 1.4.2 RC4

Nextcloud server version: 11.0.1.2

title: Different internal and login username cause JSONException for fetching user information
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
### Actual behaviour
- It uses the username that was entered during login (but this is not for sure the internal username - LDAP allows to use CN, email and a nickname together with the same password to login and maps internally to a UUID as username)

In the test we used the current master of the android app and logged in via `abc@example.com` but the internal username is `abc.def` - `abc@example.com` is only allowed to be used as username for the login form.

```
03-06 16:50:43.620 20551-25186/com.nextcloud.client D/ExistenceCheckRemoteOperation: Existence check for https://www.example.com/remote.php/webdav/ targeting for  existence finished with HTTP status 200
03-06 16:50:43.621 20551-25186/com.nextcloud.client D/OwnCloudClient #3: REQUEST GET /ocs/v1.php/cloud/users/abc@example.com
03-06 16:50:45.561 20551-25186/com.nextcloud.client W/HttpMethodBase: Going to buffer response body of large or unknown size. Using getResponseBodyAsStream instead is recommended.
03-06 16:50:45.563 20551-25186/com.nextcloud.client D/GetRemoteUserInfoOperation: Successful response: {"ocs":{"meta":{"status":"failure","statuscode":998,"message":"The requested user could not be found"},"data":[]}}
03-06 16:50:45.564 20551-25186/com.nextcloud.client E/GetRemoteUserInfoOperation: Exception while getting OC user information
   org.json.JSONException: Value [] at data of type org.json.JSONArray cannot be converted to JSONObject
      at org.json.JSON.typeMismatch(JSON.java:100)
      at org.json.JSONObject.getJSONObject(JSONObject.java:613)
      at com.owncloud.android.lib.resources.users.GetRemoteUserInfoOperation.run(GetRemoteUserInfoOperation.java:137)
      at com.owncloud.android.lib.common.operations.RemoteOperation.execute(RemoteOperation.java:136)
      at com.owncloud.android.authentication.AuthenticatorAsyncTask.doInBackground(AuthenticatorAsyncTask.java:84)
      at com.owncloud.android.authentication.AuthenticatorAsyncTask.doInBackground(AuthenticatorAsyncTask.java:41)
      at android.os.AsyncTask$2.call(AsyncTask.java:305)
      at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:237)
      at android.os.AsyncTask$SerialExecutor$1.run(AsyncTask.java:243)
      at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1133)
      at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:607)
      at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:761)
```

### Expected behaviour
- It should use the correct user name and fetch the user information for that username


Sadly I have no real access to the server and can't provide better steps. But maybe @mario @AndyScherzinger  or @tobiasKaminsky have an idea about this.

title: [Feature Request] Use notifcation bar to show upload status
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
Would be nice to see upload status in notification bar.

Infos could be:
- startime
- endtime
- upload rate in mb/s
- erros during upload

With this also drop support for 4.0 and use "new" API 16. So it is possible to pause and restart upload over notification bar. You wont lose much devices and about 97,4% still compatible with API 16

title: Can't share files deftly to other apps
body:
### Actual behaviour
-Apps can't open files if prompted to do so from within Nextcloud app. I need to manually download the file, then browse to it from a file explorer app, and then use that to open the file with another app.

### Expected behaviour
-When I tap "open with" in Nextcloud and select Word, for example, Word should be able to open the document. Currently it just opens word or gives the error "download file first" despite making the file available offline. Sharing to Solid Explorer should allow me to save the file to another directory, right now nothing happens.
 
### Steps to reproduce
1. Tap "Open with" after downloading a document
2. Select any word processor or printer app
3. Attempt to view the document. Apps will either just open or automatically close.


### Environment data
Android version: 7.1.1

Device model: Moto X Pure 2015

Stock or customized system: Mokee (cyanogen mod based)

Nextcloud app version: 1.4.2RC4

Nextcloud server version: 10.0.1

### Logs
#### Web server error log
```
Insert your webserver log here
```

#### Nextcloud log (data/nextcloud.log)
```
Insert your Nextcloud log here
```
I can't find any log files, the one I found did not log anything beyond Jan 16th.

title: Various search fixes
body:
If you approve, please merge and tag and let me know so I can release.

Thanks!

title: Bump Jackrabbit to the latest 2.14 release
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
At the moment we are using 2.12.x which is still using http client 3.1 while the new release 2.14 bumped the version to 4.1, see http://jackrabbit.510166.n4.nabble.com/ANNOUNCE-Apache-Jackrabbit-2-14-0-released-td4666058.html

> The main changes in this release are:
> - Switch WebDAV client components to HttpClient 4.5.x (summary in JCR-2406)
> - Introduction of Commons-VFS Datastore implementation (JCR-3975)
> - Allow use of JDK7 features (JCR-4030) 

cc @mario @tobiasKaminsky

title: [Feature Request] Enable debug logging in beta/nightlies
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body: At the moment u can just send a crash report. Would be nice if u can see that reports also. F.e create a new menu point in the settings for enabling(reading and coping logs in smartphone)/disabling(normal sending as it is) logging

title: [Feature Request] Auto-Update should sync also old files(pics)
body:
At the moment old files won't sync if u enable Auto-Upload for one or more folders.
I think it would be better to sync also old files. Either first time autoupdate is enable for a folder or every time autoupload for a folder is disabled/enabled. The second one is also a manual one

One question could be is "old file upload"optional or not

title: Falied SSL Initialization
body:
### Actual behaviour
- When test a server address before logon, I get a warn about failed SSL initialization

### Expected behaviour
- Expected to accept connection
 
### Steps to reproduce
1. Configure server with Let's encrypt with secp384r1 as pubkey algorithm
2. Configure nginx as following ssl options:

```
ssl_protocols TLSv1.2;
ssl_ciphers 'ECDHE-ECDSA-AES256-GCM-SHA384:ECDHE-RSA-AES256-GCM-SHA384:ECDHE-ECDSA-CHACHA20-POLY1305:ECDHE-RSA-CHACHA20-POLY1305:ECDHE-ECDSA-AES128-GCM-SHA256:ECDHE-RSA-AES128-GCM-SHA256';
ssl_prefer_server_ciphers on;
```
3. Check the Android app.


### Environment data
Android version: 7.0

Device model: Asus ZenFone3 - Beta Tester

Stock or customized system: Official Asus Beta Tester

title: Fix quota crash
body: Andy, Tobias, please approve as soon as you can.

title: Nightly: Fresh start
body:
- create a "source" branch which can be used for starting a fresh nightly
  - correct app namin
  - proper provider names
  - nightly link, check for new apks
- merge this in a new branch
- rename everything to nightly
- re-add all "ready for nightly" PRs
- make this as a script that it can be done, in theory, everyday.

title: Upload a big file manually or via auto upload with "move to nc folder"
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
When uploading a big file manually or via auto upload and with the option "move to nc folder" the file is being uploaded and moved correctly to the nc folder. But the app does not show the green downloaded arrow and thus tries to download the file again.

Yesterday I did some research and it seems that the mLocalPath is still set to the source path. But while debugging it the move function in UploadFileOperation.java is used and there mLocalPath is being set correctly. 
But on browsing the files, the value is still wrong in the database...

This was reported by @AndyScherzinger for rewriteAutoUpload branch by @mario 
I tested it against master and there everything is working.
Currently I am out of clue, therefore opening this issue...

title: Difference between Nextcloud Nightly and Nextcloud 1.4.2 RC1
body:
### Actual behaviour
I am at loss when it comes to understanding the roadmap and bug fixes between both version of Nextcloud app Nightly (Old Beta designation) and 1.4.2 RC1.
I have seen issues related to Autoupload under Nightly that were fixed under 1.4.2 RC1 but remains broken under Nightly.
Also not everything that has been improved, added or fixed in Nightly finds its way into 1.4.2 RC1.

I was under the impression Nightly was the next major release and would replace 1.4.2 after most bugs where fixed.

Can we get some lights to what is happening?
Is Nextcloud Nightly supposed to be incremental update for 1.4.2 RC1 or is it supposed to be targetting the next release.

I am just confused.

title: Update Build for Android Studio 2.3
label: [Label(name="medium")]
body:
At the moment the build is based on Android Studio 2.2 capabilities and with Android Studio 2.3 just been released (https://android-developers.googleblog.com/2017/03/android-studio-2-3.html), we got a mayor upgrade for gradle which should speed up the build process.

A branch has already been created here: https://github.com/nextcloud/android/tree/androidStudio23 for the "code change" while in order for this to work properly we also need to update the corresponding docker image which would also be part of the PR. The PR should then be for Release 1.5 or later leaving the build process of 1.4.2 untouched for stability reasons to not further slow down its release.

cc @tobiasKaminsky @mario

title: Taaem fix
body:
This fixes an issue with really really big folders, and has been tested by @taaem.

Ideally in the future, we'll use persistent storage (sqlite) for this instead of the Data Holder I just wrote, but this works.

IMHO, important enough to be in 1.4.2.

title: How to correct reviewed translations on Transifex?
body:
I found some translations (German) where the spelling is not accurate. I'm already translator on Transifex but I can only change strings which are not reviewed yet.

How to proceed for incorrect reviewed strings?
I can add a new suggestion for the string, but will this have any effect (i.e. will somebody ever check and apply this)?

Example: `Kalender & Kontakte Sychronisierung erfolgreich konfiguriert` is not correct German (hyphen missing) and could be improved to `Kalender- & Kontakte-Sychronisierung erfolgreich konfiguriert` or `Synchronisierung der Kalender und Kontakte erfolgreich konfiguriert`. But there are many others, where I would like to improve spelling.

title: App crashes when loading an huge directory
body:
### Actual behaviour
I have a directory on my Nextcloud instance with ~3000 pictures (all in the same dir), when I open that folder from the app it takes ages and nothing happens. After a while I tried to refresh via pull down, I don't think that is actually related to the crash. Then the app crashes and when trying to open the app again it straight crashes again until I reboot.

Load the images.
 
### Steps to reproduce
1. Have a folder with many images
2. Open from the Nextcloud app

title: Custom delete delay after Instant-Upload
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
### Actual behaviour
I checked the option to delete pictures after upload. After upload files get immediately deleted

### Expected behaviour
Please add an option to specify a amount of time to wait before deleting the files after upload.
This doesn't have to be specific to a folder, can be a global option. The problem is, the deletion happens sometimes too fast, before I can preview the file. Such a option would be very nice.

Specific use case scenario: I create a screenshot of something, or download some pictures. Want it to be archived on my NextCloud, and don't need them on my device. Mostly I also want to share the stuff with a contact, or want to look at it. Because the auto delete happens mostly very fast, I often cannot view/open/share the file anymore.
As said above, I really like the feature of auto-deletion, and don't want to deactivate it. Adding a short delay for deleting - configurable if possible - would be really handsome.


### Environment data
Android version: 7.0.1

Device model: N5

Stock or customized system: LOS

Nextcloud app version: beta 20170222

Nextcloud server version: 11

title: Only uploads of current account will be shown in upload
label: [Label(name="design"), Label(name="needs info/discussion")]
body:
With the really great bugfix of autoUpload @mario has changed the scope of the pending/successful/failed uploads in the upload pane.
The previous behaviour was to show all uploads, independent of the current used account. For each upload the targeted account is shown in the remote folder path.
Now (aka in the next version) the user would only see the uploads for the current account.

Two problems:
If an upload will fail the user sees a notification is shown in the top bar. After clicking on it the upload pane is shown, which might (or might not) show the failing upload, depending on the current account.

If a user wants to see if auto upload is working and he is using the "wrong" account he might think that the auto upload never works.

For me this is a real problem as we did not discussed this properly and it can lead to confusing users.

So my idea is to keep the UI behaviour the same as it is now (showing all uploads) and if we agree to do an account separation we should discuss how it can be done.

@AndyScherzinger 
@jancborchardt @eppfel

title: Beta 20170221: Improving "Autoupload" event.
body:
### Actual behaviour
-Tell us what happens
Having "Autoupload" enabled for one or more folders will actually not take place until the"autoupload" feature is being triggered.
There should be an option that can force "Autoupload" on any folder selected for Autouploads.
As a simple example, if we enable "Autoupload" on Camera folder, which already contains photos and videos, enabling "Autoupload" will not trigger the autoupload mechanism. Instead, it is waiting for a trigger event from camera. Only then will the folder be uploaded.

### Expected behaviour
-Tell us what should happen
There should be an option to force Autopload to process a folder even in the absence of the triggering event.

title: Beta 20170221: Autoupload of video corrupts files
body:
### Actual behaviour
-Tell us what happens
When Autoupload is enabled for Camera folder, and option is set to Original files will be... "Moved to app folder" will cause any new video file being recorded to become corrupted.


### Expected behaviour
-Tell us what should happen
Nextcloud app should detect when the file has been finalized before moving ahead with the autoupload.


### Steps to reproduce
1. Have Autoupload for Camera to be enabled.
2. Set Original files will be... "Moved to app folder"
3. Open Camera app and take a video. 10-20seconds should be enough.
4. Transfer is probably underway while video is in progress (I suspect start of video file has been moved) but recording is still in progress.
5. File is successfully sent to server, or so it seems, but file is only 30-70MB in size and trying to play it returns error from player.

### Environment data
Android version:
6.0

Device model: 
LG G3

Stock or customized system:
Stock

Nextcloud app version:
Beta 201702221

Nextcloud server version:
NC 11.01

### Logs

Insert your webserver log here
```

Insert your Nextcloud log here
```

title: Implement Policies
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
In the fingerprint PR we had a little discussion about security. I mentioned safetynet and even though it was meant as a joke, now when i think about it it's actually not that stupid. In order to give admins more control about what users are allowed and have to do, I request to introduce policies that can be set by the admin. Those policies can be things like:
- require passcode or fingerprint authentication
- disable passcode fallback if fingerprint is is configured
- require safetynet to pass in order to use the app
- disable webdav (so safetynet actually makes sense)
- require device to have a pincode/unlock pattern etc. set
- disable access for old app versions

I think that would be a great benefit, especially when looking at how nextcloud is used in enterprises. Also when the password manager will finally be introduced, even in smaller setups such policies would be useful to force users to comply to company policies or just to make the own system safer.
However this would require a lot of changes and so I am asking for comments here if that feature is wanted and if there are any other options that should be added.

title: Label for PR
label: [Label(name="pr exists")]
body:
https://github.com/nextcloud/android/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#pull-request says:
-   1 to develop
-    2 developing
-    3 to review
-    4 to release

@jancborchardt correctly says in https://github.com/nextcloud/android/issues/623#issuecomment-279707231 that "1. to develop" for a PR is double.
So I would just remove "1. to develop" and rename the remaining starting by 1.

For issues we will still have
-    nothing/no tag
-    approved
-    PR exists (and then the PR# should be shown in first post)


@mario @AndyScherzinger

title: Rename "remove" to "delete"
label: [Label(name="approved"), Label(name="design"), Label(name="enhancement"), Label(name="good first issue"), Label(name="hacktoberfest"), Label(name="pr exists")]
body:
"Delete" is a standard word to describe this action and I know what it does already. "Remove" is something new that I have to think about what it does. 

I suspect this wording was used so that "remove from server" and "remove from device" can be options in the dialog, but I think "Delete from device" is just as clear. 

As an added benefit, "Delete" is a lot more visually recognizable in the menu compared to "Remove", which is easy to mix up with "Rename".

Tangentially related: #109

title: App was terminated error
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
I see this on both the beta and production versions of the NC app, 

This is not reproducible by myself, it happens randomly despite the apps being excluded from Android's battery optimisations. 

Typically it'll look something like this: 

- Take lots of photos, or upload lots of files in one go
- Leave the app (home/app switch buttons, not back usually - so the app is "open" still)
- The notification bar shows the files uploading
- Suddenly it stops. You'd assume it's finished, but when opening the uploads screen again:

![screenshot_20170213-184603](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3178412/22897802/fd1fd6e2-f21c-11e6-8039-a0e6a227cb12.png)

At the point of opening the uploads screen I'd expect the "failed" uploads to resume as the app is no longer terminated, however they have to be manually restarted.

Android 6.0.1, though I've seen it on prior versions too (though not nougat, as I don't have a test device)

title: Fix for #448. Rotation change in FolderPicker caused app crash.
body: The <tt>onSaveInstanceState</tt> method may be called right after <tt>onCreate</tt>, before <tt>onCreateView</tt> is called. This caused a npe, since the <tt>mMultiChoiceModeListener</tt> was not yet initialized.

title: PR reject by one should lead to a complete rejection
label: [Label(name="approved"), Label(name="enhancement"), Label(name="pr exists")]
body:
If any of our devs reject one PR via PullAprove it should not be possible that this is being overriden by two other 👍 .
This can be done with: http://docs.pullapprove.com/groups/reject_value/
"A single rejection rejects the PR".

This way we make sure that all participating devs are fine with the PR.

@mario @AndyScherzinger

title: Autoupload does not work
body:
### Actual behaviour
- Autoupload doesn't work at all

### Expected behaviour
- Autoupload should work
 
### Steps to reproduce
1. Enable autoupload for any picture folder
2. Create / add photos to folder
3. See that app didn't upload anything

I enabled the settings below for pretty much every picture directory, e.g. Screenshots, Camera/DCIM, 9GAG. But neither of them are working. Doesn't matter if I take photo with camera, or make an screenshot. Nothing gets uploaded. I also don't get any notification for an upload try, and don't get an message in the upload view. The nextcloud app also definitely has (M-)Permissions granted to access those files.
Note that manual upload of files, and sharing files into the app works. At least for camera directory OwnCloud Instant Upload worked, with this one not even camera.
I tried it on 3 devices now and instant upload doesn't work on any of those devices.

I tried to get an logcat (`adb logcat -s com.nextcloud.client`) but there seems to be no logcat output, and no option to share error logs from the app (maybe another suggestion/feature).

![screenshot_20170210-171631](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6735650/22834466/80d466de-efb5-11e6-8c66-237f725fb6c7.png)
![screenshot_20170210-171655](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6735650/22834479/8d6640f2-efb5-11e6-8b9e-e18a3ede2611.png)




### Environment data
Android version: Nougat 7.1.1, Marshmallow

Device model: Nexus 5, Moto G2

Stock or customized system: LOS 14.1, CM13

Nextcloud app version: 1.4.1 - F-Droid

Nextcloud server version: 11.0.1

### Logs
#### Web server error log
No server error, because app didn't even try to upload.

#### Nextcloud log (data/nextcloud.log)
No server error, because app didn't even try to upload.
