title: Extremely slow upload speed when using Android app (1.4.1), with latest Nextcloud (11.0.1) release
label: [Label(name="approved"), Label(name="enhancement"), Label(name="high")]
body:
### Actual behaviour
All uploads performed from within the Android app are insanely slow when compared to doing the exact same operation from within a browser (also on Android, from the same network and using the same file)

Typically it takes around 10 minutes to upload a 5Gb file from our company network into the recently-established Nextcloud instance. From the Android app, however, this was left running for approx. 30 minutes, resulting in numerous chunks of files, consisting of 1Mb each, being left in the ../cache directory for the user and only made it to around 340Mb during this time before the upload was terminated. The files had to be manually removed on the server-side after cancelling the upload in the App. It appears that the connection is re-initiated for every 1Mb chunk, causing the slowdown.

This flaw makes the Android app completely unusable for this purpose; and the users are forced to use the regular web frontend instead.

### Expected behaviour
Uploads from within the app should perform the same as when done from within a browser (on the same device, and on the same WiFi network)

I would really like to see an option to remove this chunk-upload behaviour, as this does not occur when uploading from a browser, which places the uploaded file(s) into temporary files suffixed with ocTransferId<$transferid>.part on the correct location and bypasses the ../cache dir altogether.

From looking at previous tickets (last activity on Oct 2016) it appears that a temporary workaround was done to increase the chunk-size from 1 to 8-10Mb, but this does not seem to have made it into the release/stable branch yet. Nevertheless it should not need to chunk the files unless under very special circumstances, as we've not experienced issues when testing various hot-spots and uploading large(ish) files without issues.

### Steps to reproduce
1. Open Nextcloud Android app 
2. Select a file of 2Gb or larger size
3. Perform an upload and watch the uploading user's cache directory being flooded with "-chunking-nnnnnnnnn-nn" files of 1000Kb each while enjoying the upload speed of a 28.8kbps modem. ;)


### Environment data
Android version: 6.0.1 Multiple Android versions also tested.

Device model:  Sony Z3C (D5803). Multiple devices also tested.

Stock or customized system: n/a

Nextcloud app version: 1.4.1

Nextcloud server version: 11.0.1

### Logs

Apache error log is empty. 

#### Nextcloud log (data/nextcloud.log)
```
Insert your Nextcloud log here
```
No logfile is produced in data/nextcloud.log

title: AutoUpload Fails due to too many jobs
body:
### Actual behaviour
Activated Camara Autoupload after it finally works since 1.4.1. But then App throws exception:

```
java.lang.IllegalStateException: Apps may not schedule more than 100 
distinct jobs
	at android.os.Parcel.readException(Parcel.java:1692)
	at android.os.Parcel.readException(Parcel.java:1637)
	at android.app.job.IJobScheduler$Stub$Proxy.schedule(IJobScheduler.java:158)
	at android.app.JobSchedulerImpl.schedule(JobSchedulerImpl.java:42)
	at com.owncloud.android.services.FileAlterationMagicListener.onFileCreate(FileAlterationMagicListener.java:103)
	at org.apache.commons.io.monitor.FileAlterationObserver.doCreate(FileAlterationObserver.java:379)
	at org.apache.commons.io.monitor.FileAlterationObserver.checkAndNotify(FileAlterationObserver.java:345)
	at org.apache.commons.io.monitor.FileAlterationObserver.checkAndNotify(FileAlterationObserver.java:304)
	at org.apache.commons.io.monitor.FileAlterationMonitor.run(FileAlterationMonitor.java:182)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:761)
```

### Expected behaviour
(new) Photos gets uploaded.
 
### Steps to reproduce
0. have more then 100 photos in camara folder (me has 374)
1. open autoupload settings
2. don't change anything
3. press save
4. Exception shown

App is restarting then and uploads the first 100 Images, but then stops until new image is added or steps above are done. While repeating that process the most images fails but some are uploaded twice or more with "(2)" attached to filename.

Id: N4F26I
Product: bullhead

************ FIRMWARE ************
SDK: 25
Release: 7.1.1
Incremental: 3532671

Stock or customized system: Stock

Nextcloud app version: 20170206 Beta

Nextcloud server version: 11.0.1

title: Improve web dav URL calculation
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
### Actual behaviour
-  #401 fixed the web dav URL to be calculated as: ```/remote.php/dav``` but in a hard coded way

### Expected behaviour
- we should  use ```AccountUtils.getWebdavPath(AccountUtils.getServerVersion(account)``` while this one should then return ```/remote.php/dav``` instead of ```/remote.php/webdav``` for server versions >= 9
- This way the path works of Nc but still supports older versions of oC for app users that are running oC < 9 as their backend.

title: Autoupload account not pin'able
label: [Label(name="approved"), Label(name="bug")]
body:
### Actual behaviour
-Tell us what happens
I have two NextCloud servers and configured two NextCloud accounts.
I have AutoUpload enabled and have it pointed to photos/upload.
I want the pictures to be uploaded to server 1.
When I take a picture, the auto-upload process uploads the picture to the server that was last accessed in the NextCloud app.
Then, trying to manually upload the same picture to upload path on server 1 fails with unknown error.

### Expected behaviour
-Tell us what should happen
I want the picture allways to be uploaded to server 1, independent of last server accessed in app.
I want to be able to manually correct the wrong upload afterwards.
 
### Steps to reproduce
1. Have two NextCloud servers
2. Setup two NextCloud accounts
3. Enable auto-upload, select destination folder on server 1
4. Access server 2 in app.
5. Take picture
6. Picture is uploaded to upload path on server 2, if it didn't exist, it is created.
7. Manually upload picture to upload path on server 1 fails (unknown error).

### Environment data
Android version: 6
Device model: Alcatel 6036Y
Stock or customized system: Stock.
Nextcloud app version:1.4.1

title: Feature request: try app passwords in uppercase
body:
### Actual behaviour
- user creates app password: ABCDE-FGHIJ-KLMNO-PQRST (which is good, because uppercase is easier to read)
- user attempts to log in with abcde-fghij-klmop-pqrst
- login attempt fails

### Expected behaviour
- The client should detect the provided password matches /[a-z]{5}-[a-z]{5}-[a-z]{5}-[a-z]{5}/ , retry to login with strtoupper($password), and (on success) remember the uppercase password.

 
### Steps to reproduce
1. create app password, which is in UPPERCASE
2. enter the app password into the app, but without turning CAPSLOCK on
3. fail to log in

title: Autoupload "Remote folder" setup improvement
label: [Label(name="enhancement"), Label(name="needs info/discussion")]
body:
### Actual behaviour
-Tell us what happens
Under Nexctloud app beta (20170204 and prior), setting up individual Autoupload "Remote folder" is a great idea.
However, I am not happy with the default "InstantUpload" as the primary folder. The reason is that I do share this folder with other people and it does appear under "InstantUpload(2)" and so forth. Thus is not very personal. So to alleviate this shortcoming, I have created a ""InstantUpload_my_account_name" folder on my server.
Where it becomes messy is when I have to change the default "remote folder" location to my own. This is not so much the process that bothers me, but rather the inability to preserve the subfolder structure.
For instance, the default folder for the Camera folder would be set to "InstantUpload/Camera". Will trying to remap the "Remote Folder" to my own, I loose the "/Camera" subfolder.
For now it is not a problem as I do not mind having videos and picture from the camera into the same folder.
I might find some issues is with the other apps.
I use Whatsapp and if I remap the "Remote Folder" to mine, then I loose the "/Whatsapp" subfolder. If I want to retain it's hierarchy, I must enter the name manually.
I wish there was an option to relocate to a different top level folder and still preserve the child folder.
This should be done with a user prompt.

### Expected behaviour
-Tell us what should happen
 Upon remapping "Remote Folder" the app should request by providing a prompt to the user whether the child subfolder should be preserved and applied to the new folder.

1: Default folder location under "Remote Folder is "InstantUpload/Camera".
2: I want to remap the location to "InstantUpload_Olivier"
3: I should be asked if I want to preserve the folder structure and have instead "InstantUpload_Olivier/Camera"
4-A: If YES, then "InstantUpload_Olivier/Camera" should be created
4-B: If NO, then "InstantUpload_Olivier" should be used.

This of course is a case by case procedue for every Autoupload source folder.

title: Sharing files: request for improvement
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
### Actual behaviour
-Tell us what happens
When selecting a file for sharing, the application will present a popup window where user can be entered.
Once the user has been selected, there is an option to clear the keyword used in the search bar, so that another user can be added. This is fine.
However, the only way around to exiting this popup window is to press the back key on my phone. 
This requires like 4 or 5 key press before getting back to the file list.
It would be great to have an extra button available that will allow the window to be cleared once pressed.


### Expected behaviour
-Tell us what should happen
Once the user has been selected, the popup window should present another button giving the option to terminate the sharing process and return to the list of files.
 
### Steps to reproduce
1. Select one files only.
2. Select to share the one file.
3. Enter the user name to share with.
4. Accept the selection of the user.
5. "Exit" or "Return to list" button should be presented. It could also be presented at step 4 to save one keypad press.
6. The popup window should close and present the list of files as it was before.
7. Since only one file can be selected for sharing, and because the list of share is not relevant anymore as it was already presented, it would make sense to unselect the file automatically. This way the next file can be selected and shared if needed.

title: Rewrite auto upload
label: [Label(name="bug"), Label(name="enhancement"), Label(name="high")]
body:
Due to design flaws of FileObserver on Google side, and lacking implementations on the side of various vendors, the approach Auto Upload was using would never work - at least not in the way we were using it.

Unfortunately, some vendors decided to hide certain inotify events, and you could also never know when the file was finished writing to (CLOSE_WRITE isn't a 100% bulletproof solution).

To remedy the situation, I have rewritten a significant part of Auto Upload, and in the process made it available to Android 5+. In the future, I expect to adapt it to 4+ as well so nobody has to live with pain that is Instant Upload.

As such, this should fix 95% of our troubles with uploads we've had in the past.

I have tested this to the extent possible, and it seems to work quite good.

I appreciate any and all comments, reviews and constructive criticism on both the code and the functionality.

title: Support for client certificates
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
### Actual behaviour
In order to secure Nextcloud on TLS level, it would be good if the app could support client certificates. If the client certificate is not sent on handshake, the server prevents access to Nextcloud logon page. This would provide a second line of defense.

### Expected behaviour
Nextcloud app should support client certificates as other apps like caldav sync and carddav sync already do.

title: Integration of pullapprove
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
This is the PR for integration https://pullapprove.com

It demands:
* Any PR to be reviewed by at least 2 devs
* Any PR labeled with design to be reviewed by at least 1 designer (Jan, Felix)
* Approval can be approved via commenting: :shipit:, 👍, Approved or LGTM
* Pushes to the PR resets the review process for the code review
* Reopening of a PR resets the review process
* Authors can't approve their own PR

title: Timeout too short
body:
### Actual behaviour
- I can't connect to my Nextcloud server with the Android app because of a timeout

### Expected behaviour
- I should be able to connect, my instance is slow for unknown reasons (investigations in progress), but I can connect to it using either the desktop or the web client because the timeout is longer.

### Steps to reproduce
1. Have a Nextcloud instance with a user with 30G of data + APCu + plugins: calendar, tasks, contacts and mail
2. Try to connect
3. Doesn't work

**Edit:** Sometimes, with a bit of luck, it's possible to connect (1 out of 20 tries)

### Environment data
Android version: 6.0.1

Device model: Nexus 5

Stock or customized system: stock

Nextcloud app version: 1.4.1 (F-Droid)

Nextcloud server version: 11.0.1

### Logs
#### Web server error log
```
Nothing is added to the nginx log when I try to connect.
```

#### Nextcloud log (data/nextcloud.log)
```

title: Cache size
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
The current cache size is 10Mb which is way to small for any larger photo collection.
There is a PR (#144) which allows to manually resize the cache. I think this is not the best idea as the user has to do it manually, so this might be there as a fallback.

In https://github.com/nextcloud/android/issues/177#issuecomment-236945762 this was proposed:
-  \>=40% of the internal storage available: set cache size to 5% of internal storage size of the device (cache is always in internal storage)
- < 40% of the internal storage available: set cache size to 10% of the remaining space available but at least 100MByte (which still gives you enough space for thumbnails and resized images)

Every time the apps starts the cache size will be checked and adjusted.

title: [Feature Request / Support] Distinction between video and photo in photo upload?
body:
I recently hit the auto-upload overhaul in the F-Droid Nextcloud app beta. While it looks pretty nice and more general than the old camera upload feature, I seem to miss an important feature, the distinction between video and photo upload on mobile and wifi connection.
While I can afford uploading photos immediately, even my pretty generous 6GB LTE volume does not allow to push 4k videos without wifi.
If this is really not possible right now - e.g. because the upload feature is supposed to be general and not limited to photos and videos - I suggest a file size threshold for immediate mobile-connection upload vs. wifi-only upload.

This is not just a backup issue. I would really like to get my photos to my server immediately, for emergency cases where my phone may be taken away or destroyed afterwards, be it a criminal attacker or e.g. documentation of police violence.

title: Make file actions the same in all views
label: [Label(name="design"), Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
Currently when you are in the list and act on a file through multiselect, there are more actions than when you for example view that image and use the 3-dot-menu from the detail view.

- This list should clearly be the same.
- Also we should decide if there’s anything we don’t really need or should consolidate.
- We need to think about the sorting, for example »Delete« (should be called that, not »Remove«) should always be at the bottom
- We should think about introducing icons for the important actions (not for all) so they are even easier to find.

cc @mario @eppfel @AndyScherzinger @tobiasKaminsky

title: File actions in the list
label: [Label(name="approved"), Label(name="design"), Label(name="enhancement"), Label(name="good first issue"), Label(name="hacktoberfest"), Label(name="high"), Label(name="pr exists")]
body:
Currently it’s very cumbersome to do any action on a file. You have to go through long-press, then the multiselect menu, and then choose the action.

Instead we should do it obviously, like in the mobile web interface:
![capture du 2017-01-24 12-06-42](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/925062/22244940/d4a10924-e22d-11e6-958d-4be6e8d91043.png)
- A 3-dot-menu for every folder/file. Very obviously clickable
- The share icon should also be clickable, because people expect that. Playing around with making it appear un-clickable is just beating around the problem. ;) If there’s too little space then we could even only show the share icon when a file _has_ been shared (like we do now) but when tapped it should be interactive and open the share options.
- If there’s enough space, even have a column or some more space for the favorite icon on the left.

Already talked about this with @mario, what do you think @tobiasKaminsky @eppfel @AndyScherzinger?

title: Process Update
label: [Label(name="needs info/discussion")]
body:
Hi everyone,

@tobiasKaminsky and I had a short discussion today how we could further fine tune the development process we have and came up with the following changes.

* If a PR is considered done (reviewed, tested and labeled to release) it shall be merged
* No upfront release planing (anymore), if a considerable amount of PRs has made it to master (5+) consider doing a release 
* Issues and PRs will be assigned to the next milestone right after merging (if no milestone is available, create one: (X.X.?)
* Issues and PRs are only prioritized via the labels (low, medium, high) to give a indication what is important at the moment
* As soon as a RC tag is done we freeze the master and done PRs are forbidden to be merged except for bugfixes introduced in the upcoming release's RCs 

If we realize that we did quite some larger PRs as in features then a already created milestone X.X.? can be renamed to X.?.0 to make it a feature release.

Hope I didn't explain it too complicated (it should be a simpler process than we already have today).

What do you think?
@mario @przybylski

title: Improvements search
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
Re-opening the original PR.

Before I start explaining what I've done, I'm aware that there is an ongoing work on the search api on the server side. This PR implements local search/filtering and adds a bunch of fixes to the overall user experience.

* search across files (either all or only On Device)
* search results are limited to 100 results, and you get a message stating that
(if you need more, your query probably isn't concise enough anyway)
* search is now nicely restored across orientation changes
* footer and FAB are hidden while searching
* FAB is closed after you close search, even if it was previously open
* search the entire local filesystem
* search results are limited to 100 results, and you get a message stating that
(if you need more, your query probably isn't concise enough anyway)
* search is now nicely restored across orientation changes

Both operations are really quick, but just in case - there's a loading/refresh thing
rotating while searching.

There are a few bugs with the local files screen that I've discovered in the process, so I'll make sure to open issues for them in the near future.

Thank you for considering this PR and don't be too harsh!

title: Add filter functionality and UI
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
As discussed in the sidebar menu redesign: #556 and the search #558 , we need to implement a powerful filter into the Android App.
The following filters came up, so far:

- [ ] "on your device" (to get rid of the menu item/view and integrate as a filter)
- [ ] By Media / file format
  - [ ] photos for a starter

We have to come up with a plan how to integrate filters in the UI.

title: Notifications
label: [Label(name="approved"), Label(name="design"), Label(name="enhancement"), Label(name="green"), Label(name="high")]
body:
Notifications are an important part of a workflow, so I want to implementation notifications screen. 
Pulling would be every 5 minutes if there are apps that can generate notifications otherwise we can pull every 2 hours or so. This can, of course, be tweaked later on.

Since we want the user to receive notifications even when app is inactive, I assume we need a service implementation, but @tobiasKaminsky and @AndyScherzinger can probably clarify that.

Clicking on a notification while the app is inactive would open the app and the notifications screen for the user that got the notification. This would also trigger some kind of message that "User Mario Danic logged in" or something similar coming up at the top of the screen. 

Involving @nextcloud/designers so they can tell me how wrong I am on the overall workflow and so they can deliver mockups/workflows I'd work against.

Involving @karlitschek to tell me more about the vision behind the functionality, and involving @nickvergessen because he seems to be the chief of all things API.

Feel free to suggest whoever you think can clarify more on the API (endpoints, data to send, returned data) and the requirements of this task.

@nextcloud/designers - I'd appreciate your input and mockups on how this should work.

title: Sidebar menu redesign
label: [Label(name="design"), Label(name="enhancement"), Label(name="green")]
body:
I am aware of the ongoing discussion regarding the menu redesign, and I'm opening this issue to both get an understanding of the current state of things, as well as clarify the new features I need to implement so we can all see how it'd work together.

My suggestion:
- Remove All files and On device from the sidebar menu
- Add a footer on the page with a filter icon in the left corner which would open a filter page (and contain "All files" and "On device" (among others). Since filter is whole other issue, we'll discuss this elsewhere.
- The top menu items would be:

- Home (webdav root)
- Favorites 
- [Photos](https://github.com/nextcloud/android/issues/556#issuecomment-273897162)

- Activities
- [Notifications](https://github.com/nextcloud/android/issues/559)
- Uploads

- Settings
- Participate

I will open an issue for both activities and notifications separately, but maybe @karlitschek or @MorrisJobke can clarify the Photos - would it simply open a "Photos" directory (should the item be removed then if the user removes the dir) or will it show all photos on your instance? (in that case, I assume search API will be useful here - just need to know which extensions to use for searching).

@nextcloud/designers - your input is more than appreciated.

Also involving @AndyScherzinger and @tobiasKaminsky

title: Dynamic menu items
label: [Label(name="approved"), Label(name="enhancement"), Label(name="green"), Label(name="pr exists")]
body:
Capabilities API would expose menu items to be added to the sidebar. The menu items would simply open a web page, and the API would expose title and the URL - but @MorrisJobke probably knows a bit more about this than I do.

While I will have an issue regarding sidebar menu redesign, in the current design the links would probably go between uploads and settings.

Involving @nextcloud/designers team just in case they have any issue with the suggested approach.

@AndyScherzinger @tobiasKaminsky 

PR: #806

title: User information screen
label: [Label(name="design"), Label(name="enhancement"), Label(name="green"), Label(name="pr exists")]
body:
I would like to implement the read-only user information (phone, email, etc) screen. (as far as I understand, there's no way to update most of the data via API, but please let me know if I'm wrong).

My suggestion for changes:

- Under Manage account remove "Reconnect" (or the key icon, this option is not straightforward btw) and the trash icon 
- Once you click the name of the account, you get a user information screen and both options should be put in the options menu top right for consistency with the rest of the app

The reason for this change is that you can switch accounts already from the sidebar, so there's no point in having two places to do the same operation.

I appreciate all the suggestions and comments on this approach and also welcome the mockup for the user information screen. 

cc @nextcloud/designers @AndyScherzinger @tobiasKaminsky

title: Going forward with instant upload
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
When we look at iOS with iPhoto and iCloud for example, it becomes very clear that instant upload is basically a hack to one-way push the photos from your mobile phone onto your computer.

But what happens if you modify them on the computer?

What you really want is simple two-way-sync. Hook up the pictures once and then it’s just all synced. How can we achieve that @nextcloud/android? Anything with the new instant upload implementation which helps us on that front?

(cc @xMartin cause we talked about that)

title: In the welcome screen "multi account" is overkill for a new user
label: [Label(name="design"), Label(name="enhancement"), Label(name="low")]
body:
### Actual behaviour
-In the welcome screen (the screen that shows up the first time user runs Nextcloud client) there is a slide for "Multi account: Connect all your clouds", here:
![934e1d90-b1cc-11e6-8d56-df271352b9c3](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3006332/22083118/f2b48fe2-ddca-11e6-82a7-78808da0ee0f.png)

### Expected behaviour
- This is supposed to be an introduction for someone who is new to Nextcloud. I think setting up a *second* account when the user still hasn't set up the first one is overkill. The multi account feature, while being really nice, is an advanced feature. The average Nextcloud user needs only one account, and should not be presented in the welcome screen.
  
### Steps to reproduce
1. Run a fresh copy of Nextcloud Android client (or delete the app storage from Application manager to reset the app)
2. Look at the second slide in the welcome screen.

label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
Native tagging system could be much more useful if tags could be searched and edited from the phone app. It would be great especially for managing photos as currently gallery cannot use tags and the previews in list view are really small. Even more so, one could use spare idle times like riding on a bus to organize all photos (especially with beta app and it's great previews)

It could also be the only way of tagging several files at once (currently not possible).

I'm aware that I posted this idea on the old ownCloud forum already :smile: but it came back to me when I read [the issue about search behavior](https://github.com/nextcloud/android/issues/543)

Unfortunately I cannot help with coding, I just wanted to ask your opinion on the matter..

title: Enhancement: View images thumbnail instead of full download
body:
### Actual behaviour
-When opening image, full size image is being downloaded. 

### Expected behaviour
-For saving data and enhance performance, we request to be delivered smaller thumbnail of image for temporary view. Option to download full size image should be available then.
 
### Environment data
Android version: 6

If this is already available, please, provide us a guideline. Thank you.

title: Feature request: Adding server monitoring as part of Nextcloud app.
body:
### Actual behaviour
-Tell us what happens
With NC11, there is an app that can be added to Nextcloud server which allow Nextcloud performance and usage monitoring by collecting some statistics.
While there are tools to do just that (I am personally not aware of which tool to use) I would like to know if there is a plan to integrate this functionality within Nextcloud app to monitor the server.


### Expected behaviour
-Tell us what should happen
 If possible, I would like to be able to see Nextcloud Server statistics, such as CPU statistics, user activity, quota, from withing Nextloud app itself.
Only specific users should be able to see entire server statistics, but each user could have the ability to monitor their own account statistics.

title: Feature request: Slider to browse quickly through folder.
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
### Actual behaviour
-Tell us what happens
This is a feature request to add a slider on the side on the side of the display to be able to scroll through document quiclky.
Currently, sweeping the finger downward on the display seem to be the only solution to scroll down documents under the active folder.
There is on the right side of the display a small slider, which is just to display relative position within the folder. There is no way to interact with it.
So, when a folder contains hundreds or thousands of photos, it requires many, many sweep to reach the intended files.

### Expected behaviour
-Tell us what should happen
A slider, should be added on the side of the display to be able to scroll up or down the slider in a single motion.

title: Avoid toggling favourite for all selected files
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
We don't want to toggle favorite for files we know are already favorited. 
This simple change avoids this for both singular and multiple favorite
changes.

(And yes, there's some redundancy because toggleFavorite will do the required
check even if called  from toggleFavorites - but at least there are no redundant method
calls)

There are other problems in the way toggling a favorite is presented in the UI, but I'll leave
that to one of my future PRs.

title: "Upload failed" message should be removed when uploads are succesful
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
### Actual behaviour
-Tell us what happens
This is more of an improvement, but can also be considered a bug.
Let's say Auto Upload or manual uploads are in progress. Then something wrong happens and the file being uploaded is stopped in it's track. Nextcloud app then output a "Failed updload" message, and it is the way it is supposed to happen. However, with the new retry mechanism, upload will eventually resume and all standing by uploads should complete. 
Upon completion, if all the files have been uploaded, then the "Failed upload" should be removed from the list, when the user log back on the phone.
I think the result should be transparent.

### Expected behaviour
-Tell us what should happen
When an upload fails and user is not logged-in the phone, then the message "Failed upload" is added to the status messages for the user to review during login.
However, if the transfer finally complete and everything is is order, then this "Failed upload" message should be removed from the status task. Maybe the message should update the status message saying maybe "There were some failed uploads, but everything has been uploaded" This is a mouthful, but something more concise should work too. If we go this route, then I could possibly think about when the uploads last took place, but I think this is too much information.

 
### Steps to reproduce
1. 
2. 
3. 


### Environment data
Android version:

Device model: 

Stock or customized system:

Nextcloud app version:

Nextcloud server version:

### Logs
#### Web server error log
```
Insert your webserver log here
```

#### Nextcloud log (data/nextcloud.log)
```
Insert your Nextcloud log here
```

title: Enhance thumbnails
label: [Label(name="enhancement"), Label(name="help wanted")]
body:
Scenario:
4 years with ~200 folders and ~50 images per folder.
After a fresh installation I want to quickly show an image.
But after navigate to the desired folder it took long to get all thumbnails (in list/grid view).

Research how 
- other do that
- store the newest (now) 1000 (or more) thumbnails
- add "download thumbnail" button
- how to deal with limited cache?

I am open for any discussion :-)

title: enhance folder listing
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
Enhance the way the folder/file list are stored.
Currently it can happen that you descend into a subfolder and have to wait for the content (file name, size) to show.
The new idea is to:
- store all informations of all folders on an initial run
- sync periodical all data
 - compare folder by etag
 - if etag is the same => do nothing, else update its content

with this one would "always" have an up to date folder system.
If the mobile is not using wifi the user still can pull to refresh a folder.

title: round thumbnail size to power of 2: 384 => 256
body:
NC11 only supports thumbnails with power of 2: 128, 256, 512.
So if a mobile wants to have 384 this will result in 512px.
This PR rounds it down to power of 2: 384 => 256 instead of 512.

title: Android automatic refactor - ObsoleteLayoutParam
label: [Label(name="1. developing"), Label(name="needs info/discussion")]
body:
Hi (again),

I am developing a tool to automatically refactor Android applications with the goal of improving energy efficiency.
This pull request has the changes generated while applying the rule "ObsoleteLayoutParam".

While developing your application's views you might be specifying attributes in a view's artefact that are not necessary due to the nature of its parent. In this PR, those attributes were replaced by a comment.

I have made a previous validation of the changes and they seem correct.
Unfortunately the tool is not yet ready to change the file in a specific line and file comparison might be confusing when whitespace is not ignored.
Please consider the changes and let me know if you agree with them.

Best,
Luis

title: Android automatic refactor - Viewholder
body:
Hi (again),

I am developing a tool to automatically refactor Android applications with the goal of improving energy efficiency.
This pull request has the changes generated while applying the rule "ViewHolder".

When developing list views, it is very common to repeat work in every item. Something very common is retrieving a field with the API method ```findViewById```. There is a ViewHolder pattern that lets you reuse the work made in the previous computed item.

I have made a previous validation of the changes and they seem correct.
Please consider them and let me know if you agree with them.

Best,
Luis

title: Android automatic refactor - Recycle
label: [Label(name="needs info/discussion")]
body:
Hi,

I am developing a tool to automatically refactor Android applications with the goal of improving energy efficiency.
This pull request has the changes generated while applying the rule "Recycle".

Some resources (e.g., ```Cursor``` instances) should be closed when they are no longer necessary. 

I have made a previous validation of the changes and they seem correct.
Please consider them and let me know if you agree with them.

Best,
Luis

title: Nextcloud Beta 20170105: Auto upload preview doesn't shows content when Wifi enabled
label: [Label(name="dev version")]
body:
### Actual behaviour
-Tell us what happens
When accessing the Auto upload settings, if Wifi is enabled and connection to server is valid, the pictures will not be displayed. Instead, an icon used as a place holder will be shown.
Disabling Wifi while application is running will force Nextloud app in displaying the previews.
It seems the pictures will eventually render after a long while.

### Expected behaviour
-Tell us what should happen
Pictures should be rendered fairly quickly no matter the state of Wifi.
 
### Steps to reproduce
1. Start with WiFi enabled.
2. Access Auto upload menu.
3. Pictures should be populated with photos, but only icons are present.
3 A. If photo showing, close app and restart it following above steps.
4. To have icons replaced with actual pictures, disable Wifi.
5. Back in Auto Upload menu, photo should now be visible.


### Environment data
Android version:
6.0

Device model: 
LG-G3 LG-D852

Stock or customized system:
Stock

Nextcloud app version:
Beta 20170105

Nextcloud server version:
OC 9.1

title: Properly encode the share link password
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
cherry pick of oC 1869 for reported issue oC 1842
______
### Actual behaviour
Example
When I put _Hello%20World_ as password the client doesn't encode the value and sends it without any change to the server.
So, when I navigate to the url returned by the server and introduce _Hello%20World_ as password I get password authentication error... The password that I should introduce to get access is _Hello World_

Other example
If I choose _Hello&World_ as password -> The server takes _Hello_ as password 

### Expected behaviour
The password should be exactly what I typed
 
### Steps to reproduce
The password parameter in https://doc.owncloud.org/server/9.1/developer_manual/core/ocs-share-api.html#update-share is sent by the android client to the Server without x-www-form-encoding 
The windows desktop client is sending the password in the right way , so the server doesn't get messed up

title: Add numeric buttons on PassCodeActivity
body:
- Implimenting new numeric buttons for input passcode.
  - Soft Keyboard is need for passcode.
    But Soft Keyboard disappear sometimes.
	Then I tried add buttons.
  - But I think now Soft Keyboard always appear.
  - New button's design is not cool.
	('2 abc','3 def',...,Clear icon,Back icon and ...)
  - Do you think that the numeric buttons are necessary?
  - You can switch Soft Keyboard when Back is longClicked

- I add guard time when passcode is not match
  - against Brute-force attack :)
  - and add small animation :)
  - Do you think that time is increase(3sec->6sec->12sec->...)?

- I tried implimenting snackbar instead of mPassCodeHdrExplanation.
  - It is simple. But too simple notification?
  - If snackbar is enought, We can delete mPassCodeHdrExplanation.
  - If snackbar is not enought, I Will delete snackbar.

- Replace four EditTexts to TextInputLayout.
  - TextInputLayout is easy to handle KEYCODE_DEL and Soft Keyboard.
  - I think Soft Keyboard is normal Soft Keyboard (like built-in soft keyboard)
    or Password input keyboard (like Keepass2Android)
  - Use TextInputLayout#setError() instead of toast()

- I add goHome() when ACTION_CHECK.equals(getIntent().getAction())

title: Nextcloud app doens't close
body:
Today I installed tne Nextcloud app 1.4.0 on a LG Nexus 5 with Android 6.0.1 and got it to connect with a Nextcloud on Linux Debian 8.6 'Jessie' with Apache 2.4.0, MariaDB 10.1 and PHP 5.6.29 on an old Dell XPS420 desktop PC. 

So far so good. 

But when I tried to exit the app in Adroid, I could not find any way to do so. No close button, no way to log out or anything. Even when I rebooted my phone Nextcloud would start logged in with the account I have on the Dell PC.This remains so, even when I shut down the Dell PC. The app keeps trying to synchronize with Nextcloud server even when it is unreachable.

This is not what I would expect. I would expect to be able to normally and a connection to the Nextcloud server and open a new connection, possibly logging on with a different account.

I know I'm new to all of this, but I think this is a bug in the Nextcloud app for Android.

Cheers,

Daniel.

title: Auto upload: wifi/charging only for specific filetypes
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
Back on old instant upload we distinguished between upload on type and "situation"
- video / wifi only
- video / charging only
- images /wifi only
- images / charging only
all settings could be changed interdependently.

Now with auto upload it is "folder based" and only options are
- Upload pictures via wifi only (which is misleading as it applies for all file types)
- charging only

So my idea is to extend this to have a selectable pre-defined "mime-type" list:
- pictures
- videos
- other
The menu setting would then be 
- Upload via wifi only
- Upload when charging only
Each setting has a second option line where the selected items are be shown:
- Upload via wifi only: videos
- Upload when charging only: videos, other

@AndyScherzinger @eppfel

title: Storage path "unkown" by default, cannot be changed to a custom value. Selecting the only available option "/storage/emulated/0/Android/data/com.nextcloud.client/files" breaks gallery functionality. Pictures made are not moved to the storage location.
body:
Probably related to:
#452 
#453 

### Actual behaviour
In settings, storage path says "unkown" by default. It can only be set to "/storage/emulated/0/Android/data/com.nextcloud.client/files". No further options are available. This is unexpected behaviour.

Pictures synced with the nextcloud server are stored in the "nextcloud" folder, as long as this option is **not** changed from "unknown". The *are* visible in the stock Gallery App. This is the expected 
behaviour.

When "Instant picture uploads" is selected and "Original file will be...moved to the app folder", the picture is uploaded but **not** moved to the nextcloud folder on the device. This is unexpected behaviour.

Once the storage path is changed to the only available option "/storage/emulated/0/Android/data/com.nextcloud.client/files", synced/downloaded pictures are **not displayed in the stock Gallery App** any more. This is unexpected behaviour.

Pictures made are still uploaded to the server but not moved to the storage path on the device.

### Expected behaviour
Default storage path should be displayed instead of "unknown". Be able to select a custom storage path. After selecting the storage path, picture files synced with nextcloud should still be visible via the stock Gallery App. Picture made should be moved to the app folder after successful upload.
 
### Steps to reproduce
1. Take picture
2. Wait for successful upload
3. Check picture location with any file manager on device - it still is in DCIM/Camera
4. Select "/storage/emulated/0/Android/data/com.nextcloud.client/files" as storage path
5. Display of media content (e.g. pictures) synced with nextcloud is broken, pictures are not displayed any more in the stock Gallery app.
6. Redo step 1-3, pictures made are still not moved to the storage location.

### Environment data
Android version: 6.0.1
Device model: Samsung Galaxy S4 Mini (GT-I9195)
Stock or customized system: Cyanogenmod 13.0 (Android 6.0.1)
Nextcloud app version: 1.4.0 
Nextcloud server version: 11.0.0

body:
### Actual behaviour
The Nextcloud app doesn't show all available files and directories of a user, if these have been mounted in via a WebDAV share (the problem may exist for other external storages too). In the Nextcloud app some of the external storage links are shown as empty and a request to upload files is displayed.

Root of nextcloud user:
![20161222_nc_root_directory_content](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2572764/21429167/ed3039ae-c85d-11e6-9948-bc6c3a4d3afd.jpg)
Sub-directory doesn't show any content:
![20161222_nc_empty_sub-directory](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2572764/21429175/f33b49f6-c85d-11e6-8b6a-d5c41d46bf45.jpg)

All files and directories can be seen and accessed using the Nextcloud Web GUI.
![20161222_oc_webgui_content](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2572764/21429249/4e787258-c85e-11e6-9305-066c9e9ebaac.jpg)

I did a cross-check with the iOS ownCloud app v3.5.2 and all files and directories are instantly shown in the app so that it seems to be a problem of the Nextcloud app itself.
![20161222_oc_ios_content](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2572764/21429276/65c88682-c85e-11e6-95cd-c077f2df244d.jpg)

### Expected behaviour
The Nextcloud app should show all available files and directories of a user, including files which are mounted in via a WebDAV share.
 
### Log files

Android version: 5.1.1
Stock or customized system: stock

Nextcloud app version: 1.4.0
Nextcloud: 10.0.2


PR: https://github.com/nextcloud/android-library/pull/70

title: Distinction between emblems and some options is not clear
label: [Label(name="design"), Label(name="enhancement"), Label(name="needs info/discussion")]
body:
Device: Samsung Galaxy S4 Mini
OS: Cyanogenmod 13 (Android 6.0.1)
Server: OwnCloud 9.1.2
App: 1.4.0

I find the interface for the NextCloud app extremely confusing. I'll walk you through how I used it and where I tripped up.

I install the app, log in to my server, and open the settings to change local storage to be on my SD card. I go to "All files", navigate to a folder with pictures in it, and open a couple of pictures. When I go back to the folder, I see a green check mark on these photos. The [Android app manual](https://docs.nextcloud.com/android/android_app.html#managing-files) says:

> Downloaded files are marked with a green arrow.

So far so good. I don't want them clogging up my storage though, so... what do I do now? I try long pressing on them, and this allows me to select it (and the other photo). There's an option to "set available as offline", but that seems redundant... they're already available offline. I try setting it and unsetting it anyway. Solid Explorer shows that they're still on my device. 

Question: Is there a way to get them off my device?

Question: Are they being kept in sync? One-way? Two-way? Just locally cached?

I also try going to the "On device" section of the app. It shows me *all* the root level folders on the server, even the ones where I haven't looked at anything! The manual has nothing on this topic.

Question: How can I just see the files that are on my device? How can I clear them?

So now I browse to a document I want to maintain on both my phone and the server... keep it in sync, you might say. I long press it. There are two options: "set available offline" and "sync". I have no idea what the difference is. Don't these words usually mean the same thing? Is one a one-way and one a two-way sync? If so, which one? These options aren't even mentioned in the manual.

Question: What is the difference between these options?

I select "set available offline". A yellow emblem appears (an arrow pointing down to a line). Doesn't this sort of emblem usually mean "downloaded"? Like the green check mark?

Comment: I can see why you might use the green check mark the way you do — on desktop cloud storage apps it usually means "file is now synced locally". But on desktop apps there's usually no distinction between a one-off download and files that are kept in two-way sync. In this app, it gets confusing. If I saw the yellow emblem by itself, I'd actually assume that it meant what the green emblem means. I don't even know why you bother with the green one by itself... why does a user need to know what files are in a local cache, if they're not actually being synced?

Personally I'd suggest: green emblem for anything that's kept in sync that's fully downloaded, a blue circling arrow icon for anything that's currently syncing, and nothing at all for locally cached but not-synced files. A local unsynced cache seems like an implementation detail. The real feature I want is synced locally vs. access from cloud on demand, not downloaded once and possibly out of date vs. synced locally.

----

I realise this is an amalgam of a bunch of different issues. I tried to split it up a bit, but I realised I don't know enough about what your intent is with these features, options and emblems to be able to say "rename X to Y" or "this emblem should be this other thing". Some might be documentation issues, or they might be UX improvements. Feel free to tell me how they could be separated and I'll post them as separate issues.

- installed nextcloud with the php installer
- created admin user
- created standard user
- Installed apps: mail, contacts, calendar, notes
- Successfully set up nextcloud desktop client
- Removed android dav-droid account
- Attempted to re-add dav-droid account.

title: Android Permissions
label: [Label(name="high"), Label(name="pr exists")]

### Expected behaviour

### Steps to reproduce
1. Install Nextcloud App 1.4.0 from f-droid store


### Environment data
Android version: 4.2.2

Stock or customized system: custom

Nextcloud app version: 1.4.0

READ_PHONE_STATE, which I believe should not needed for the correct function of the App. I think this permission is quite sensitive as it allows access to information uniquely identifying the user. I would like to request removal of this permission or at the very least an explanation why it is needed and how it is used.

title: Rate limiting from brute force protection prevents login with the Android client
label: [Label(name="approved"), Label(name="bug"), Label(name="pr exists")]
body:
### Actual behaviour
If you enter the wrong password too many times, brute force protection makes it impossible to log in with the Android client because the client seems to time out after 10 seconds while the brute force protection enforces a 30 second delay.

### Expected behaviour
The Android client's timeout should be long enough to handle the delay from brute force protection. Perhaps after waiting 10 seconds the client could display a message saying that login is slow and the current IP address might be blacklisted.
 
### Steps to reproduce
1. Enter the wrong password enough times to get your IP address rate limited by brute force protection.
2. Try to log in with the Android client
3. Receive a "Server took too long to respond" message after 10 seconds.

I hope I have diagnosed this situation correctly. I changed my password on the server and then tried to connect a few times from the Android client with the old password before remembering that it had changed. After that, I could not log in again even after ensuring the password was correct until I had cleared my ip address from the brute force blacklist as described here: https://help.nextcloud.com/t/how-can-i-unblock-an-ip-blocked-through-brute-force-detection/5731


### Environment data
Android version: 6.0.1

Device model: Motorola Moto E

Stock or customized system: CyanogenMod

Nextcloud app version: 1.4.0 rc2 (latest version on F-Droid at this time)

Nextcloud server version: 10.0.2

PR: https://github.com/nextcloud/android/pull/1099

1.4.x - currently latest release

10.0.2 (stable)

title: Minor Usability improvements
label: [Label(name="approved"), Label(name="bug"), Label(name="design"), Label(name="enhancement"), Label(name="good first issue"), Label(name="pr exists")]
body:
I looked closely to the current app and spotted some things we could improve for usability:

# Missing space between avatar and filename :white_check_mark: 
`papercut` - see #449

![screenshot_20161124-194840](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1899308/21112965/13410e06-c0a8-11e6-8d94-2d72c02acb93.png)

# Add icon to make state more recognize :white_check_mark: 
Reading the text takes time, an icon is easily remembered and then you would spot on first glimpse, that this is an empty folder. see #449

![screenshot_20161124-195142](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1899308/21112456/216f2744-c0a6-11e6-8e88-eb580a74e939.png)

## Some folders have opaque white background in multiselect
![screenshot_20161124-195506](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1899308/21112623/c214f89a-c0a6-11e6-9bd4-5fb6108b72d5.png)

## Wrong top-left icon after menu swipe :white_check_mark: 
When you are in an folder and swipe from the left edge of the screen the menu opens. After closing the menu again, the icon has changed from `back` to `menu`, but the action is still `back`. see #449

![screenshot_20161212-195635](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1899308/21112835/93afcbf0-c0a7-11e6-81cd-86d3c1c6541b.png)

#  Trim filenames in respect to each other
In this view you can not distinguish the files, because they follow the same pattern `P3_[Date]_[Content]_[Owner].[extesnion]`. Not so easy to fix, I guess and not a use-case that happens often: Therefore Low priority

![screenshot_20161124-195114](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1899308/21112234/4ebc597a-c0a5-11e6-89ae-8d76418a1df8.png)

### Environment data
Android version: 6.0.1

Device model: Sony E5823

Nextcloud app version: Latest Beta (30.11.16)

title: Pause Synchronisation on network change (especially WiFi to mobile)
label: [Label(name="AutoUpload"), Label(name="bug"), Label(name="needs info/discussion")]
body:
### Actual behaviour
If you synchronize a folder (or upload files), the fulfillment of the upload/download/synchronization continues even after the internet interface changes.

Practical example: You start synchronizing a 10GB folder while being connected to you WiFi at home. After a while you have to go to work. After leaving the WiFi zone Nextcloud continues synchronizing over LTE (or whatever). After a while you monthly mobile high speed volume is exhausted.

### Expected behaviour
When changing the network connection, Nextcloud should automatically stop the upload/download/synchronization. The user should be asked, when to continue the process.

Additionally there should be an option (opt-in?) to "do not pause synchronization on WiFi connection" - or vice verca (opt-out!) to "pause synchronization on mobile connection".
 
### Steps to reproduce
1. select a folder
2. choose 'synchronize' in the burger menu


### Environment data

Nextcloud app version:

1.4.0

### Additional Information

This issue would probably solve #193 but going further (beeing more smart).

title: Enhancement request: allow to select the name of dedicated WIFI networks for picture/video uploads
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
### Actual behaviour
If the options "Instant picture/video upload" and "Upload pictures/video on Wifi only" are selected, the app tries to upload the pictures independently if a connection to the `right` Wifi network has been established. Not every Nextcloud server is reachable via the Internet but over the local Wifi network at home.

### Expected behaviour
If the options "Instant picture/video upload" and "Upload pictures/video on Wifi only" are selected it should be possible to additionally select a specific Wifi network which should be used for the upload of the pictures and videos. If a different Wifi network is active any upload attempt should be stopped.
 
### Environment data
Android version: 5.1.1
Stock or customized system: stock

Nextcloud app version: 1.4.0

title: scope of "available offline" in ... is incorrect
label: [Label(name="approved"), Label(name="bug"), Label(name="pr exists")]
body:
### Actual behaviour
I already described the behavior in #416, but it is a different problem than the one 416's title discusses.

After setting "available offline" for one file in folder, newly downloaded and modified files in the same folder are automatically uploaded to the server - without "available offline" defined. Files which where already in the folder before the other file was marked with "available offline" will not be automatically uploaded after modification.

This behavior continues for all additional downloaded and modified files until the android device is rebootet (or the app was restarted - suggestion, not tested). After Reboot, the behavior is as expected.

### Expected behaviour
regardless the result of #416, files created after "available offline" setting of a different file should be handled in the same way as files also not marked with "ao" before "ao" of this one file was changed. This is a bug in my oppinion.
 
### Steps to reproduce

All file create/modification happened on a Linux box with LibreOffice and on an android using AndrOpenOffice.

1. file 1.ods is created on Linux - ownClould client uploads it to the Nextcloud Server - some seconds later it becomes visible in nextcloud App
2. file 1.ods is clicked in ncApp, opened in AndrOpenOffice, modified and safed back to ncAPP directory. No upload is happening to ncServer
3. file 2.ods is created on Linux - ocClient, uploads to ncServer, some seconds later visible in ncApp on Android
4. file 2.ods is modified on Android - no Upload 
5. file 2.ods on ncApp is marked as "availabe offline" and get's immediately uploaded to the server (this was part of the discussion in #416)
6. file 3.ods was created on ocClient (Linux), syncs to ncServer, and is visible on ncApp (Android)
7. file 3.ods is modified in Android. It is immediately uploaded to the ncServer without being flagged "available offline".
8. you can repeat 6 and 7 for additional files, they behave the same.
9. modify 1.ods and save it - it will not been uploaded to ncServer
10. creating a folder in this directory and repeat 6. and 7. showed, that the problem is not being inherited to the subfolder.



### Environment data
Android version:
7.0
Device model: 
Nexus 9

Stock or customized system:
Stock

Nextcloud app version:
1.4.0

Nextcloud server version:
10.0.1

title: Insta Upload stopped working properly
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
### Actual behaviour
- When connecting wifi, Insta-Upload starts uploading taken photos
- Usually the first 2-3 work fine and then most of the file uploads show some progress (usually until ~70%, but sometimes also less) and then fail
- Retrying of the failed uploads leads to failed uploads again
- also: when entering the InstaUpload directory (in "All Data"), the nextcloud app failed a lot of times until I was able to enter it (now not happening anymore) -> might have something to do with my insta upload directory containing 4,6gb of files - it's now still slow when I open the directory

### Expected behaviour
-Photos should be uploaded
-If an upload fails, the retry should work
-If a use "remove failed uploads", there should be a way how I can synchronize the instant upload directory later. How am I supposed to do this now? I have some pictures that failed to upload and I can't event retry anymore because I accidentally used the remove functionality (now they are still in my phone gallery but not in the instant upload folder in the nextcloud app)
=> It would be nice to have a "upload all not synchronized/previously failed photos from the gallery" option or so

### Environment data
Android version: Cyanogenmod 13.0

title: strange behavior on Updating a file
label: [Label(name="enhancement"), Label(name="needs info/discussion")]
body:
### Actual behaviour
I opened a file stored on the server (**not** marked to be offline available in the Details... of the APP). It was a OpenOffice Spreadsheet. The file get's downloaded and is opened with AndrOpenOffice. 

After changing and saving the spreadsheet. The file does **not** get uploaded by nextcloud-APP.
There was no information in the Upload-activity-log.

After that I checked the box **_offline available_**. In the same moment the file get's uploaded to the server.

### Expected behaviour
depends on the design spec:
I assume that a file not to be stored locally (offline available = false) is copied to the tmp folder and opened from there. If this file is updated and the server file is to be updated by specification I expect the file to be immediately updated on the server (or at least within seconds). If an update of the file in the tmp folder will not be updated on the server by design then I would not expect the file to be uploaded after marking the file **_offline available_** 
 
### Steps to reproduce
1. Create a spreadsheet file with openoffice on the PC and wait until it is uploaded to the server
2. open the file by tipping it in nextcloudAPP
3. change it and save it 
4. wait some minutes to check whether the file is going to be uploaded (in my case it is not uploaded)
5. now long-tip on the file in nextCloudApp, select ... Menu - Details, check the **_offline available_** checkbox - the modified file immediately get's uploaded to the server


### Environment data
Android version:
6.0.1

Device model: 
Google Nexus 5

Stock or customized system:
stock

Nextcloud app version:
20161129-beta

Nextcloud server version:
10.0.1

regards

Peter

title: Already downloaded file is not updated
label: [Label(name="enhancement"), Label(name="needs info/discussion"), Label(name="pr exists")]
body:
1. In the app, open a text document (or any file), it gets downloaded and you can view it
2. Update it on your computer or server
3. Refresh the file list on Android to get the new state, changed date on the document updates

Expected behavior: The new file is simply shown, especially if there have been no local changes.

What actually happens: The old downloaded file is shown with no indication it’s outdated. Even makes me think there’s a sync error. PR #1655

title: Feature request: Android Enterprise support
label: [Label(name="approved"), Label(name="enhancement"), Label(name="help wanted")]
body:
I may have touched on enterprise use in the past @AndyScherzinger, but this is slightly different.

Rather than uploading a config payload into an MDM platform alongside the NC app to automatically setup the NC client on a per-user basis, Android Enterprise APIs can be used within the app to provide these configuration fields to administrators as soon as the app is uploaded.

For example, an email client:

![](https://help.nextcloud.com/uploads/default/original/2X/5/52cc788db1c3e30ecaeb1323b2f7ca6cf45f3f1a.png)

Let's me set the user, server and even password, making deployments to endpoints so easy it's hardly even believable.

If the NC app can hook into the Android Enterprise platform I think you'd have a pretty attractive offering for businesses running 10's of hundreds (/thousands) of android endpoints.

https://developer.android.com/work/managed-configurations.html

And the beauty is, users can have NC installed for both work and personal, meaning the business controls (and can remove) the data in the NC AE installed app (identified by a small briefcase icon on the app icon) meanwhile the normally installed NC app connects to the user's own NC and can't be tampered with by the business at all.

I can both provide access to my EMM lab environment for testing and/or document the setup and deployment of the app under Android Enterprise.

(This is particularly nice because even if it's more convenient for the user to start at the root, it's much easier for them to press back a couple times than it is for a user in the current situation to navigate through a bunch of folders.)

Alternately, we could start in the last used folder.

title: Auto upload: support USB mounted storage
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
The new auto upload utilizes the Media Scan implementation of Android. This works fine for internal memory and also SD cards mounted as internal storage. If the SD card is mounted as a USB storage the media scan doesn't seem to get triggered by the camera app but for some reason the Google Photos app will show the media folders on the storage point. 
In order to be able to "just" query the USB storage folders a workaround might be that we simply trigger media scans of USB mounts from time to time which will add the media folders to the media database and thus makes them discoverable for us.

cc @tobiasKaminsky 

This is an open issue for now and need some research on how this can be solved.

body:
Update federated sharing options checking if re-sharing is allowed.

Depends on https://github.com/nextcloud/android-library/pull/25 and feedback from @schiessle in which server version this is available (to be set in the library)

title: [Enhancement] Delete local files after confirmed sync after period of time
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
### Desired behaviour
-Setting to sync folder is active
-Files sync to nextcloud for PERIOD OF TIME (say 12 months)
-Toggle for local storage max size or period after which local files are deleted from phone once confirmed synced to server.

First step: Toggle switch to delete synced photos manually that are older than X months. I understand that during sync there is the ability to delete local files on the phone, but I don't want to do that as I prefer to keep them on my phone for a period of time to share and as a second source of backup. It would be great to manually delete synced files older than X months as a starter.

Further enhancement 1: Show how much space can be saved by deleting synced files live as user is toggling smaller time frame.

Further Enhancement 2 (and original goal): Automatically perform above tasks

Use Case 1:
A cellphone has been active since 2012. At the end of each calendar year, User manually deletes the prior year's photos (so delete 2015 backed up photos on Dec 31, 2016) from his phone to give more local space for new 2017 pictures. It would be great to see this automatically delete CONFIRMED SYNCED photos and videos that are over PERIOD OF TIME old. Could be in months with a default 12, min 1 and max 48, with a toggle for on/off?

Use Case 2:
A cellphone has been active since 2012. User phone memory is 8gb stock, and his camera is using up majority of that space and is getting "low memory" warning on the phone. User is able to define a max local space for new pictures to use, such that once exceeded the oldest CONFIRMED SYNCED photos or videos are deleted until that maximum space defined is honored again.


Both cases release some of the local resources being taken up by photos that are already on the server and can be downloaded again as required, but a backup for more recent files is kept on the phone. I find that after a calendar year I rarely use photos that are taking storage on my phone. Google has a manual toggle to delete synced photos, I would like to take that one step further.

title: 1.4RC2 NC tries to upload HDR dir after taking a picture
label: [Label(name="bug"), Label(name="needs info/discussion")]
body:
### Actual behaviour
NC tries to upload temporary HDR folder after taking a picture, and fails.

### Expected behaviour
Upload pictures only.
 
### Steps to reproduce
1. Open google camera app and make sure HDR is on
2. Take a picture
3. Review uploads in NC, notice there are two attempts to upload each picture. One IMG_date_time.jpg and one IMG_date_time (which corresponds to HDR temp folder)


### Environment data
Android version: 7.0

Device model: Nexus 6P

Stock or customized system: stock,latest ota, Google Camera app

Nextcloud app version:1.4RC4

title: 140rc2
body: Hotfix @AndyScherzinger

title: Auto upload missing on Android < 7
label: [Label(name="bug"), Label(name="high"), Label(name="release candidate")]
body:
### Actual behaviour

- No new auto upload
- No legacy auto upload

### Expected behaviour

There should be at least one of the auto upload options available.
 
### Steps to reproduce
 - Install 1.4.0 RC1
- Auto upload info popup shows up
- Configure autoupload
- Go back to files
- No autoupload in drawer 
- No autoupload in settings

### Environment data
Android version: 6.0.1

Device model: Nexus 5

Stock or customized system: Cyanogenmod 13

Nextcloud app version: 1.4.0 RC1

Nextcloud server version: 10.0.1

title: Share resized image via whatsapp
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
This is currently not working.
I doubt it is "our" problem as sharing to k9, sms is working.

(as this is currently only in beta it is not that big problem, but needs to be investigated further...)

title: Auto upload: pause pending uploads
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
A user takes 100 photos and right after the device connects to wlan, all uploads are started (one by one). The user wants to pause the upload as the (slow, not metered) wlan traffic needs to be used somewhere else.

I would put it in the upload pane in the overflow menu as as checkbox "enabled/disabled".

cc: @AndyScherzinger @eppfel @jancborchardt

title: Auto upload: manual sync shared folder
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
Imagine that you just found nextcloud and start using auto upload for DCIM/Camera with option "move to nextcloud folder". 
Then it would be very cool to manually trigger an initial sync. Same holds for e.g. WhatsApp Images with "only upload" (here the system needs to check for the existence of the remote file instead of just plain upload).

title: Auto Upload: add pending jobs to "uploads"
body:
Back in the old instant upload the user can see the pending uploads.
This should also be possible in the new "auto upload" way...and it is, I am implementing it currently ;-)

My question is regarding the UI/UX:
As these uploads are triggered by android the user cannot start them manually.
But it is possible to stop/kill one -> is this necessary?
What else should be displayed:
- Name
- thumbnail
- status: (waiting for wifi connection/waiting for device charging)

@jancborchardt @eppfel 
@AndyScherzinger

title: IllegalStateException
label: [Label(name="bug"), Label(name="needs info/discussion")]
body:
### Actual behaviour
nextCloud Beta crashes in the background or with the app open. The app appears to be updating the files but never stops. This does not occur in the non-beta app.

### Expected behaviour
Files update and the app goes into a passive state.
 
### Steps to reproduce
Not positive of steps but believe this to be it.
1. Share a folder with content with another owncloud user.
2. This folder is synced with a desktop client.
3. Delete the folder from the desktop client without unsharing first.
4. Open the Beta app and go to the directory where the deleted folder is.
5. Wait 3-5 minutes and crash.


### Environment data
Android version: 7.0

Device model: Nexus 6P Angler

Stock or customized system: Customized CopperheadOS

Nextcloud app version: F-Droid Beta 20161111

Nextcloud server version: 10.0.1 (stable)

title: [Feature request] Enable video streaming
label: [Label(name="approved"), Label(name="enhancement"), Label(name="help wanted"), Label(name="pr exists")]
body:
### Actual behaviour
When I click on a video that has not been downloaded so far the app starts downloading the video file instead of playing it directly.

### Expected behaviour
When I click on a video that has not been downloaded so far the video should played as video stream, i.e. playing should start immediately and the video should not be downloaded to the internal memory.

There is already a pull request for this feature: https://github.com/nextcloud/android/pull/183

Moreover the feature is already included in the Beta app and works for me (at least when playing the video in an external player).  For some reason the internal player has some issues with several or all video formats.

### Steps to reproduce
1. Navigate to a folder with videos that have not been downloaded.
2. Click on a video.

title: [Improvement] Add option to always open video files in external players
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
### Short description

Please add an option to always open video files in an external player.

### Long description

At the moment, when I click on a video in the Beta app the app starts streaming the video in the internal player.  This is OK for people that don't have any good external video players.  However, there are a lot of people that have very advanced external video players (with brightness control, swipe navigation, etc.), which support much more formats than the internal video player.  For those people it would be nice to open the videos by default in the external player, since the current solution by long pressing the video, going to the context menu, and choosing "Stream video file in external player", is really time consuming and unnecessary.

title: Enhance davdroid integration to integration of all possible nextcloud apps
body:
Currently it is hardcoded to davdroid.
We should serve also as an authenticator (of course without password) to all apps that are searching for nextcloud. This then would be the other way around, but the user then, depending of the app, does not have to type username and address.

title: Enable users to activate logging, provide access to log file
label: [Label(name="approved"), Label(name="enhancement"), Label(name="medium")]
body:
### Actual behaviour
-stable releases have logging disabled

### Expected behaviour
-user can choose to activate logging
 
### Steps to reproduce
At the moment logging is deactivated in stable releases via a programmatic switch. 
Suggestion: Add a on/off switch in the settings at the bottom where the "Log" entry resides so that users of the stable version have the chance to activate the logging to provide logs to development. 
Con: Logging is a rather technical thing and should be hidden from the user
Pro: We get bug reports from stable users but have nearly no chance to gather any information if it is a non-trivial bug that can be reproduced but is rather related to the context (server setup, connection, navigation flow, etc.). So by giving the user the chance to activate logging, send us the log, deactivate logging again we would have better chance to help users and tackle issues

pinging @tobiasKaminsky and @nextcloud/designers for feedback if this is something worth discussing/implementing.

title: Make file operations cancellable and/or non-blocking
label: [Label(name="design"), Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
Problem: some file operations cannot be cancelled. This is unfortunate if you tap on the wrong one, enter an incorrect file name (rename), find the wrong folder (copy, move), etc.

Items that are currently blocking and (maybe) shouldn't be:
- [ ] Deletion
- [ ] Copying
- [ ] Renames
- [ ] Moves
- [ ] Folder creations

Not sure if these should be non-blocking. That'd be the ideal, but only if we can find a way to make the operations cancellable, IMHO.

Items that should stay blocking, but should be cancellable by hitting "back" (and _maybe_ by tapping outside of the "wait a moment" dialog? Not sure):
- [ ] Share

@jancborchardt what do you think of the above? It's pretty clear to me that the current design isn't quite optimal, but I'm not sure exactly what the best replacement would be.

title: Auto Upload (Android 7+)
label: [Label(name="design"), Label(name="enhancement"), Label(name="high")]
body:
New instant upload implementation for any device running Android 5 or later - called **Auto upload**

This new implementation supports "V1" of the specified feature set, which focuses on 
- bringing the instant upload feature to Android 7+
- supporting Android Doze
- supporting instant upload for any kind of media folder (at the moment this means Images/Videos)

for any future increments, please see #285

_This is a collaboration between @AndyScherzinger and @tobiasKaminsky coding-wise._

@nextcloud/designers please have a look at the actual screenshots (below), hereby requesting feedback/discussion. In short we mimic Google Photos to some extend.

display media folder in a sectioned grid (--> headers). Each folder shows its name, up to 8 thumbnails, remaining images of the folder for >8 files in the respective folder, on/off toggle icon, three dot for custom preferences (per folder, beware though that we have a defaulting so you don't need to configure anything).
![device-2016-10-26-144206](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1315170/19726387/058a5566-9b8b-11e6-86c5-0dd1b9fe6d80.png)
_The sorting is weighted and alphabetical, meaning they are sorted alphabetically (while a folder named "Camera" wins...) and weighted by active/inactive. Thus active one will be at the top and the Camera folder will always be at the top of the active or the inactive cluster.
The thumbnails shown per folder are always the latest ones (as in date taken, modification-date) and they get cached_

Preferences are adopted from the actual/known instant upload capabilities as is choose the upload folder, wifi only, charging only, created sub-folders, upload behavior, enable/disable.
![device-2016-10-26-144227](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1315170/19726390/0af6d68c-9b8b-11e6-9f98-225ac63c3b4c.png)

The new instant upload is so cool it got it's own main menu item :yum: 
![device-2016-10-26-144449](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1315170/19726413/1e19cb66-9b8b-11e6-83d7-db7cabf91c89.png)
_Also due to the fact that this feature has at least for evolutionary increments to be possibly implemented see #285 and will transform into a general folder sync feature in the future_

---

**Tasks Tobi**
- [x] Use DB for hardcoded DCIM folder to implement FolderObserver, JobScheduler
- [x] Use DB to start/stop/resume all DB entries for FolderObserver
- [x] Adapt UploadPane to new system
- [x] Fallback system for android versions that do to support JobScheduler (< 5)
- [x] "null bug" see https://github.com/nextcloud/android/pull/358#issuecomment-256663141
- [x] Using subfolders when uploading screenshots doesn't work. see https://github.com/nextcloud/android/pull/358#issuecomment-256665297
- [x] Depending on the upload behavior (like "just upload") the instant upload should not copy the uploaded files into the app (at least they should be removed after they have been uploaded, else instant upload is not respecting its own preferences)

**Tasks Andy**
- [x] Folder sync overview recycler view with header implementation
  - [x] Performance tuning, async setting of the image
- [x] Folder sync custom settings UI
- [x] Media query implementation for standard options for media folders (sync deactivated by default)
- [x] Smart sorting for sync folder list (weighted, mostly alpha-numerical, active/disabled)
- [x] Show message if no (really no) media folder is available (e.g. fresh created emulator)
- [x] Fix state (enabled/disabled) persistence bug
- [x] Always display the latest media (add order by clause to media queries)
- [x] Hide menu item below Android 5
- [x] Hide (legacy) instant upload preferences on Android 5+
- [x] Feature pop-up with a hint to the new folder sync functionality and deactivation of the legacy instant upload
- [x] Remove legacy shared preferences for Android 5+
- [x] Further UI tweaking of the settings screen
- [x] Ability to disable a folder in its settings
- [x] Camera uploads lead to "new" Camera folder in the instant upload screen, hiding the original one (suspicion: wrong distinct in the media query + filter needed for Nc internal folders containing media)
  - [x] Filter Nextcloud app folders from being displayed

title: Android app tries to connect to wrong OCS endpoint
label: [Label(name="bug"), Label(name="high")]
body:
See: https://github.com/nextcloud/server/pull/1861

Basically when setting up a new account in the app it connects to `/index.php/ocs/cloud/user?format=json`

This might have worked for dark hackery reasons in the past. But this is not the valid OCS endpoint.

It should be ``/ocs/v2.php/cloud/user?format=json` (note that you need to send the `OCS-APIREQUEST: true` header.

Basically this does no longer work in NC11 because we moved OCS to the appframework.
