title: Unable to download files
label: [Label(name="needs info/discussion")]
body:
### Actual behaviour

I recently migrated my owncloud installation to nextcloud (via [the instructions here](https://help.nextcloud.com/t/migrating-from-owncloud-to-nextcloud/551)) and although behavior on the desktop client and web client is functional, I am unable to download files from the android client. 
### Steps to reproduce

I'm not sure how to reproduce this issue. 
### Environment data

Stock or customized system: Customized (migrated from Owncloud) 
Nextcloud app version: 1.3.1 
Nextcloud server version: 10.0.1 
### Logs
#### Nextcloud log (data/nextcloud.log)

```
{"reqId":"tVmyl+e7RmNqunzmd1SX","remoteAddr":"10.0.8.4","app":"webdav","message":"Exception: {\"Message\":\"Can not decrypt this file, probably this is a shared file. Please ask the file owner to reshare the file with you.\",\"Exception\":\"OC\\\\Encryption\\\\Exceptions\\\\DecryptionFailedException\",\"Code\":0,\"Trace\":\"#0 \\\/var\\\/www\\\/owncloud\\\/lib\\\/private\\\/Files\\\/Stream\\\/Encryption.php(460): OCA\\\\Encryption\\\\Crypto\\\\Encryption->decrypt('PK\\\\x03\\\\x04\\\\n\\\\x00\\\\x00\\\\x00\\\\x00\\\\x00\\\\xF7iRI\\\\x1E...', 0)\\n#1 \\\/var\\\/www\\\/owncloud\\\/lib\\\/private\\\/Files\\\/Stream\\\/Encryption.php(291): OC\\\\Files\\\\Stream\\\\Encryption->readCache()\\n#2 [internal function]: OC\\\\Files\\\\Stream\\\\Encryption->stream_read(8192)\\n#3 \\\/var\\\/www\\\/owncloud\\\/3rdparty\\\/icewind\\\/streams\\\/src\\\/Wrapper.php(83): fread(Resource id #143, 8192)\\n#4 \\\/var\\\/www\\\/owncloud\\\/3rdparty\\\/icewind\\\/streams\\\/src\\\/CallbackWrapper.php(91): Icewind\\\\Streams\\\\Wrapper->stream_read(8192)\\n#5 [internal function]: Icewind\\\\Streams\\\\CallbackWrapper->stream_read(8192)\\n#6 \\\/var\\\/www\\\/owncloud\\\/3rdparty\\\/sabre\\\/http\\\/lib\\\/Sapi.php(78): stream_copy_to_stream(Resource id #146, Resource id #148, '392210')\\n#7 \\\/var\\\/www\\\/owncloud\\\/3rdparty\\\/sabre\\\/dav\\\/lib\\\/DAV\\\/Server.php(470): Sabre\\\\HTTP\\\\Sapi::sendResponse(Object(Sabre\\\\HTTP\\\\Response))\\n#8 \\\/var\\\/www\\\/owncloud\\\/3rdparty\\\/sabre\\\/dav\\\/lib\\\/DAV\\\/Server.php(248): Sabre\\\\DAV\\\\Server->invokeMethod(Object(Sabre\\\\HTTP\\\\Request), Object(Sabre\\\\HTTP\\\\Response))\\n#9 \\\/var\\\/www\\\/owncloud\\\/apps\\\/dav\\\/appinfo\\\/v1\\\/webdav.php(60): Sabre\\\\DAV\\\\Server->exec()\\n#10 \\\/var\\\/www\\\/owncloud\\\/remote.php(165): require_once('\\\/var\\\/www\\\/ownclo...')\\n#11 {main}\",\"File\":\"\\\/var\\\/www\\\/owncloud\\\/apps\\\/encryption\\\/lib\\\/Crypto\\\/Encryption.php\",\"Line\":361,\"User\":\"adi\"}","level":4,"time":"2016-10-18T18:44:31+00:00","method":"GET","url":"\/remote.php\/webdav\/laverna-backup.zip","user":"adi"}
```

The file is not a shared file and like I mentioned before, there seems to be no problem using the webui. After looking through the thread [here](https://github.com/owncloud/ios/issues/701), where users faced a similar issue there seemed to be an issue with email fields in LDAP. However, I have not enabled LDAP on my installation.

title: Use correct array of options
label: [Label(name="bug"), Label(name="hacktoberfest")]
body:
Resolves: #336

> android app crashes when trying to sort a directory of photos to upload

@tobiasKaminsky please review - This is a work in progress since imho the implementation is broken for a simply reason. OCFIleList and LocalFileList both use the same preference for the sorting choice. So if you choose BySize in the main screen and then open upload via the FAB it'll load "by Size" and will try to sort this way. Unfortunately the local file sorting by size also sorts folders, by recursively calculating their size which takes around one minute on my phone... So imho we either need to 
- remove folders from the local file sorting as in sort by size with folders on top sorted alphabetically or
- split the sorting choice into two preferences and don't offer sorting by size at all.

What do you think @tobiasKaminsky - I vote for ignore folders during size sorting (locally)

title: Files appear as conflicting with the server even though they were not modified on server
label: [Label(name="bug"), Label(name="needs info/discussion")]
body:
Hello,

I have posted this as an ownclient client issue but migrated to nextcloud since, and I also have the issue.  I am not sure whether cross-posting it a good idea, and I am sorry if it is not.
### Actual behaviour

When a file is modified twice on the client within a few seconds and the first upload to the server didn't finish, I get a popup telling me the local version is in conflict with the distant version.
Expected behaviour

A file should not be in conflict with the server version if the file hasn't been modified on the server…
### Steps to reproduce
1. Make a file available offline
2. Make a few quick changes and saves to that file, making sure that your saves happen before the previous version was uploaded to the server (I personally always trigger the error with a todo.txt file modified via an app called Simpletask)
3. The "conflict resolution" popup opens within nextcloud client.
### Environment data

Android version: 6.0.1

Device model: Zuk Z1

Stock or customized system: CyanogenMod, official nightly build

nextCloud app version: Nextcloud 1.3.1 (f-droid)

nextCloud server version: 10.0.1 (current stable)

title: An unknown error occured when logging in

App successfully connects to the server upon entering the address. But after inputting the right login credentials and clicking on Login an unknown error occurs.

Only happens on this device. Other devices (like Nexus 5, Jolla, BlackBerry Z30) connect successfully.
The client on the phone does work with an older ownCloud instance though.

Login succeeds.

2. Input username & password

title: Choose sorting order
label: [Label(name="approved"), Label(name="design"), Label(name="enhancement"), Label(name="pr exists")]
body:
Currently files can be sorted by 
- A -> Z
- Biggest -> Smallest
- Newest -> Oldest

This issue is about discussing if (and how) we can allow to change the sorting order.

Ideas:
- Add 3 options with reversed order: Z -> A 
  - ugly as hell -> NO
- Second click on same order reverts sorting order
  - not understandable/visible for user
- use fast scroll instead of reversing order
  - user can easily and fast scroll down 

Option 3 is maybe independent and should be implemented anyway (#47) 

@Spacefish

title: Automatic synchronization of modified file
body:
### Actual behaviour

After opening a text file in an external editor and making changes, the text file shows the changes only on the Android device.  The changes are not pushed to the nextcloud server until the file is manually synchronized.

1. create a text file in nextcloud from the browser

title: Move all file type (as in mime type) checks to MimeTypeUtil
label: [Label(name="hacktoberfest")]

title: Fix pmd and findbugs error to be able to activate checks in CI
label: [Label(name="approved"), Label(name="good first issue"), Label(name="hacktoberfest")]
body:
#321 will introduce code quality metrics for checkstyle, pmd, findbugs and lint. The checks would actually be turned of for the nightly builds since they report several issues so the builds would fail.

For the build to successfully run with these checks activated (`gradle check`) the pmd and findbugs issues need to be resolved. 
To do so simply checkout the branch of the PR #321, compile, run `gradle check` and have a look at the reports in `build\reports` for pmd and checkstyle.

title: Incorporated Checkstyle, findbugs, pmd and lint
label: [Label(name="hacktoberfest")]
body: Incorporated checkstyle, findbugs, pmd and lint for code quality. Most rules are not set yet as that would be needing a lot of changes in the code base so the rules can be added bit by bit and corresponding changes effected in codebase.  @AndyScherzinger

title: Generalize FileListAdapter parts
label: [Label(name="approved"), Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
At the moment The FileListListAdapter and the LocalFileListAdapter offer to render the file listing as a list or grid (with a special threatment of images/videos). Right now the code to pick and configure the list and grid item are code duplicates. 

This issue is for discussion and solution finding. The "problem" here is that at the moment the local adapter works with a collection of File, while the FileListList adapter works with a collection of OCFile, so some calls differ, most do not.

title: [Refactoring] Utilize MimetypeIconUtil implementation
label: [Label(name="hacktoberfest"), Label(name="pr exists")]
body:
With #316 `MimetypeIconUtil` got extended to also provide mimeType checks for isAudio, isVideo, etc.

These checks have been implemented multiple times throughout the application and should be replaced with using the MimeTypeIconUtil, users are for example:
- BitmapUtils
- OCFile
- FileDataStorageManager
- UriUtils

title: Support Intent.ACTION_OPEN_DOCUMENT_TREE
label: [Label(name="approved"), Label(name="enhancement"), Label(name="help wanted"), Label(name="needs info/discussion")]
body:
### Actual behaviour

In an App requesting access to a directory via the Storage Access Framework and Intent.ACTION_OPEN_DOCUMENT_TREE, the Nextcloud DocumentsProvider is not shown, since it does not support subtree selection.
### Desired behaviour

The DocumentsProvider should be shown, and you should be able to select Nextcloud directories.
### Android Dev Reference:

If you're implementing a DocumentsProvider and want to support subtree selection, implement isChildDocument() and include FLAG_SUPPORTS_IS_CHILD in your COLUMN_FLAGS.

I could maybe implement that, but it would need a lot of time (which I don't have until around christmas probably), since I know nearly nothing about the Storage Access Framework and how it works, and completely nothing about the internals of the Nextcloud App, so someone else would probably be able to do this faster (and better).

title: Block server communication on metred networks
label: [Label(name="enhancement"), Label(name="needs info/discussion")]
body:
issue raised in #158 

The client with 1.3.0 made a first step in honoring metered connections by not triggering instant uploads on metred wifi connections. This should be extended to any kind of server communication while to not render the app useless on metered networks by asking the user if the communication should be blocked or not (and then saving this to the apps preferences to revert the decision).

What do you think @tobiasKaminsky @nextcloud/designers ?

title: Data on sd-card only readable for other android apps under android 6.0x
body:
### Actual behaviour

If you use the storagepath on sd, other apps, p.e. keepass2Android or Gallery can only access to the files readonly. Only Nextcloud itself can write to its directories.

Path to sd is /storage/9016-XXXX/Android/data/com.nextcloud.android.beta/files
Path to memory is /storage/emulated/0/Android/data/com.nextcloud.android.beta/files

I think this issue is by security design of android 6.0x, but makes the storing to sd-card nearly useless, because, you can't change or delete files using other apps.
### Expected behaviour

Also other apps should be able to change or delete files in the Nextcloud sd-directory
### Steps to reproduce
1. try to access to a file witch is stored in the Nextcloud Directory on the sd card with gallery or keepass2android
2. you can read but not write or delete the files with other apps
### Environment data

Android version:
6.01
Device model: 
Samsung Galaxy S7
Stock or customized system:
Stock
Nextcloud app version:
beta 20160922
Nextcloud server version:
10.0.16
### Logs
#### Web server error log

no error

title: Intermittent upload failures from Android client (Nexus 5x)
label: [Label(name="bug"), Label(name="needs info/discussion")]
body:
Hi,
### Actual behaviour

-During an upload of selected files, some files fail to upload without an obvious reason. The behaviour is intermittent. The weird thing is, it doesn't matter if I start the upload in any of the following ways:
1) open 'photos' app and use 'share' functionality to upload it to my nextcloud server
2) open the nextcloud app and use its upload functionality to select files from the 'photos' app
3) via the web interface using Chrome Web Browser on my Nexus - it also fails (for instance, after one picture has been uploaded, it just stop uploading the next ones, without any error)

for steps 1) and 2), if I try to re-upload the failing photos, they will fail again.

This problem seems to be unique to my Nexus 5X device. I have a Samsung tablet and a Samsung mobile phone and they upload all files successfully all the time.
My issue looks somehow similar to #287 , however my logs seem to be a bit different.
### Expected behaviour
- All selected files should be upload successfully to the selected forlder.
### Steps to reproduce
1. Select number of photos to upload, either via the 'photos' app or the nextcloud app itself
2. Upload to the selected folder
3. watch it fail intermittently. 
### Environment data

Android version:
7.0
Device model: 
Nexus 5X
Stock or customized system:
stock
Nextcloud app version:
1.3.1
Nextcloud server version:
10.0
The server is running on my home network only, OS Ubuntu 16.04 on Odroid (ARM)

title: Upload from Android app fails
label: [Label(name="bug"), Label(name="pr exists")]
body:
### Actual behaviour

-(Auto)upload from Android app fails ALMOST always after a variable progress
### Expected behaviour

-(Auto)upload from Android app should succeed :)
### Steps to reproduce
1. Configure App to upload new photos (here: in Wifi, without charging)
2. Take photo
3. See upload progress to a variable level, then fail with "connection error" ("Verbindungsfehler")
### Further info

Uploading AND autouploading of certain files fails. The failing seems pretty reproducible for some file, especially most (but not all) camera images. Some other file can be uploaded without problems (including a 400+MB video). Some other videos also fail. I cannot find any pattern. Behavior is observed in 2 generally stable wifis.
I should perhaps note: The file for the logs belowis 4197043 bytes large. The error says it expected 353728 got 101043.
If the last chunk has 101043, this would leave 1024000 bytes for each of the other chunks, with is a number that makes a lot of sense. Why did it expect 353728 bytes?
I am pretty sure this is a very strong pointer to the root of the problem.
### Environment data

Android version: 6 (OxygenOS 3.5.1)

Device model: Oneplus 3

Stock or customized system: Stock (Community release)

Nextcloud app version: 1.3.1-gplay

Nextcloud server version: 10.0
### Logs
#### Web server error log

I know there are a lot of similar bug reports around, with various configuration solutions. I think I have added them all to my configs:

PHP (7.0.8-0ubuntu0.16.04.2, values from phpinfo(), so I know it is active):

```
max_execution_time = 3600
max_input_time = 3600
max_file_uploads = 50
upload_max_filesize = 16G
post_max_size = 16G
upload_tmp_dir = /data/tmp (disk has enough space, tried /tmp on SSD before, too)
memory_limit = 256M
```

Apache (Apache/2.4.18 (Ubuntu)):

```
KeepAlive On
MaxKeepAliveRequests 500
KeepAliveTimeout 500
```

```
<VirtualHost *:443>
    ServerAdmin webmaster@example.net
    ServerName cloud.example.net

    DocumentRoot /var/www/example.net/cloud/current

    <Directory />
        Options +FollowSymLinks -Indexes
        AllowOverride None
    </Directory>
    <Directory /var/www/>
        Options FollowSymLinks MultiViews
        AllowOverride None
        Order allow,deny
        allow from all
    </Directory>
    <Directory /var/www/example.net/cloud>
        SSLRenegBufferSize 10486000

        <Limit GET POST OPTIONS PROPFIND PUT DELETE MKCOL MOVE>
                Order allow,deny
                Allow from all
        </Limit>
        <LimitExcept GET POST OPTIONS PROPFIND PUT DELETE MKCOL MOVE>
                Order deny,allow
                Deny from all
        </LimitExcept>
    </Directory>

    ErrorLog ${APACHE_LOG_DIR}/error.log
    # Possible values include: debug, info, notice, warn, error, crit, alert, emerg.
    LogLevel warn
    CustomLog ${APACHE_LOG_DIR}/ssl_access.log combined

    SSLEngine on
    Header always set Strict-Transport-Security "max-age=15552000; includeSubDomains"

    SSLCertificateFile    /etc/letsencrypt/live/cloud.example.net/fullchain.pem
    SSLCertificateKeyFile /etc/letsencrypt/live/cloud.example.net/privkey.pem

    SSLProtocol All -SSLv2 -SSLv3
    SSLHonorCipherOrder on
    SSLCipherSuite "EECDH+ECDSA+AESGCM EECDH+aRSA+AESGCM EECDH+ECDSA+SHA384 EECDH+ECDSA+SHA256 EECDH+aRSA+SHA384 EECDH+aRSA+SHA256 EECDH EDH+aRSA !RC4 !aNULL !eNULL !LOW !3DES !MD5 !EXP !PSK !SRP !DSS"
</VirtualHost>
```

title: Instant camera upload stopped after installing sd card
label: [Label(name="bug"), Label(name="needs info/discussion")]
body:
## What happens

Been using instant upload to sync camera pictures for about a month, no problem. Installed an sd card (which camera uses as default storage location now) and now every picture says ”local file not found” when attempting to upload.
## What should happen

The files should upload as they did before the sd card was installed.
### Steps to reproduce
1. Configure instant upload, take picture, works fine
2. Install sd card & set camera to use it as storage
3. Take picture & app reports local file not found
### Environment data

Android version: 6.0.1

Device model: Samsung Galaxy S7

Stock or customized system: stock

Nextcloud app version:1.3.1

Nextcloud server version: 10.0.0

title: [TOP] Enhance sync folders
label: [Label(name="design"), Label(name="enhancement"), Label(name="high"), Label(name="pr exists")]
body:
As discussed on conf this is a collaboration between @AndyScherzinger and me.
Purpose: 

Increment 1 - instant upload - #358 - release 1.4.0
- replace current instant upload
- full support for Android 6,7

Increment 2 - enhancement auto upload - #797 - release 2.0.0
- support video folders
- allow any kind of folder pair (custom folders)
- show jobs in upload pane
  - track jobs
  - get job result to update upload pane
  - if job fails: allow user to restart
- automatic retry
- upload updated files

Increment 3 - upload existing files
- add "upload/sync all existing images/videos/files" as an option to the auto upload folder three-dot menu.

Increment 4 - folder upload
- allow folder hierarchies :heavy_check_mark: 
- smart UI to semi-automatically detect and notify about potential new media folders the user can add/active for instant upload #2406

Increment 5 - sync one way
- sync - one way
- free up space

Increment 6 - sync two way
- sync - two way

title: auto retry for failing upload items
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
as reported in #85 we should implement some hardening/auto-healing by simply retrying uploads that failed due to server error.
This issue has also been reported on the Play store, e.g.

> Very good application to save photos. But it would not hurt in case of synchronization failure, retry the app itself by uploading them rather than go through the loading tab. Thank you !

cc @tobiasKaminsky

title: Improve error infos on upload failure
label: [Label(name="enhancement"), Label(name="needs info/discussion")]
body:
As reported by @Bugsbane 

> Oh, something else that I was also running into, but I'm assuming is my Nginx setup - not the Android app - is that files over 1gb seem to fail when uploading. Even so, if possible it would be nice to let the user know why uploads failed.
> 
> Uploads view: Just the filename and then "Upload failed"

I think we should improve in this area, either via displaying a more detailed message or via activating the logging on stable clients (see #247) to give people the change to gain some more information. In general though I think more detailed error message might confuse since non-tech users might get confused but for error reporting and knowing what is going on it might be critical information.
With failed downloads might might anyways have to implement some auto-restart, e.g. on the next wifi connect or else so users wouldn't even have to look into the uploads view and investigate...

what do you think @tobiasKaminsky and also @nextcloud/designers also from the UX/UI perspective since infos might get very technical

title: Show move/copy context in toolbar title
label: [Label(name="design"), Label(name="good first issue"), Label(name="pr exists")]
body:
![device-2016-09-12-101119](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1315170/18429040/a04b3156-78d1-11e6-8c1c-e3fd67e8f1be.png)

See screenshot above, the "folder chooser" for move file and copy file which is launched after single/multi selection of a file from the main file list view always says "Nextcloud" so you don't have a detailed context. So my proposal is to show "Copy to..." and "Move to..." as the title to set the context right. Else the user has to remember the action that has been chosen before.

As for testing we need to make sure that all (other) chooser screens like when sharing with Nextcloud isn't affected by this.

cc @tobiasKaminsky @nextcloud/designers 

PR: https://github.com/nextcloud/android/pull/265

title: Make available offline as default
body:
Hi!
Please add an option to make new files and folders available offline as default.
Why aren't new files copied to the nextcloud folder synced automatically? That would be the same behaviour than the desktop client has. I mean like a normal webdav folder.
I think, that would make things much easier.

title: Provisioning Links to launch and prefill app with login data
label: [Label(name="enhancement"), Label(name="needs info/discussion"), Label(name="pr exists")]
body:
I thought about this feature for a while and saw that @paraqles now also opened a feature request for that on the oC Android client tracker.

My request (which I would implement myself) would be do implement Nextcloud URLs which could do exactly that but would like to do this in a way as it is proposed by Google/Android/Chrome.
https://developer.android.com/guide/components/intents-filters.html#Receiving
https://developer.chrome.com/multidevice/android/intents
https://github.com/zxing/zxing/blob/master/android/AndroidManifest.xml#L99

The exact schema(s) will have to be defined during implementation. The schema should read in a flexible way as in might just contain the server address, might also have the username, might have the password (or not).

Any input @nextcloud/designers @nextcloud/android

title: Option to activate/deactivate debug-logging
label: [Label(name="enhancement"), Label(name="needs info/discussion")]
body:
I would like to propose a feature, Debug Mode. This would allow me to set an email to use (ex. gmail or outlook) which would allow users to have automatic logs sent via email whenever an exception occurs.

Meaning, the Android App encounters an error and it sends automatically an email with the information of this error. I have had some issue saying "error while waiting on server" but beyond that no information and nothing in the server logs.

title: Autoupload fails due to reset of the trusted certificate
label: [Label(name="AutoUpload"), Label(name="approved"), Label(name="bug"), Label(name="medium")]
body:
### Actual behaviour
- Autoupload fails instantly on every photo to upload and every retry 
- No specific error code or error description
- No logs on Nextcloud server
### Expected behaviour
- Working autoupload feature
### Steps to reproduce
1. Take a picture
2. Wait for autoupload
3. See how it fails
### Workaround
1. Enter the Nextcloud app
2. Try to upload a file from within the Nextcloud app
3. Nextcloud app asks you if trust the certificate of your cloud
4. Tap Yes
5. Go to upload queue
6. Select retry all failed uploads
7. It works now flawlessly
8. Profit
### Suggestion

The dialogue if you trust your unsigned certificate should be accessable from within the upload queue
### Environment data

Android version: 6
Device model: LG G3 (D855)
Stock or customized system: Stock

title: Don't show upload failure notification for deleted files
label: [Label(name="design"), Label(name="enhancement"), Label(name="pr exists")]
body:
### Actual behaviour
- setup instant upload of photos and limit it to wifi
- disable wifi
- take a photo
- delete this photo
- enable wifi
- there is a notification about a failed upload (it says: can't find local file)
### Expected behaviour
- there should be no notification about a failed upload

@jancborchardt Does that make sense? I'm always annoyed by this behavior because I think that something is broken even if this isn't the case.

Beside that for real failures they should maybe not say: "failed upload due to connection issues" but something like "3 queued upload - they are retried once the network connection is better" because sometimes you have flaky internet connection but you don't care about the upload, but it should actually do it at some time and not not at all after the first failed try.

title: Fails to upload bigfile when chunk assembly take more than 60 seconds
label: [Label(name="bug"), Label(name="needs info/discussion")]
body:
### Actual behaviour

he Android App upload a bigfile, it fails when upload seem to be complete.
When the last chunk is uploaded, Owncloud Server assemble all chunks and the process can take a long time.
If it takes more than 60 seconds, the Android App abort and notify:
"An error occurred whilst waiting for the server, the operation couldn't be done"

Owncloud Server is served by nginx. A HTTP Code 499 means that the http client closed the socket.
### Expected behaviour

The Android App should wait for the chunk assembly completion.
### Steps to reproduce
1.  With Android App, upload a big file, assembling all chunk must take more than 60 seconds
2.  wait
3.  Android App notify a socket error
### Environment data

Android version: 6.1.0
Device model: Sony Xperia Z5
Stock or customized system: stock
ownCloud app version: 1.2.0
ownCloud server version: 10.0.0

 msec="1472731693.423" request_length="1024430"
 request_time="2.795" "connection_requests=77"

title: Only show empty content message when there really is nothing in there
label: [Label(name="approved"), Label(name="design"), Label(name="enhancement"), Label(name="medium")]
body:
Oftentimes when a folder is loading, the »Nothing in here« message already shows. This gives the impression of files being missing, which is not correct and actually a bit frightening.

We should only ever show the »Nothing in here« message if there absolutely is nothing in there. Until that it’s loading state.

Also, with the »Loading …« state there should also be the spinner shown for more feedback. :) Just like on the web interface. Similarly, the empty content notice should get a folder icon above it so it looks nicer. Again, copy it from the web interface. :)

title: Security Risk: auto downloading file to device and Google's built in file explorer or any file explorer
label: [Label(name="enhancement"), Label(name="needs info/discussion")]
body:
### Actual behaviour

My Nextcloud application is setup to require a password on start before accessing any data, but when I click on a file, the application is caching the file to the device permanently despite not checking "make this file available offline" in the settings menu. The cached data can then be accessed without a password through Google's integrated file browser found in Settings>Storage>Explore. Android will not allow viewing of the file because it's not within the Nextcloud app, but I can email or text the file to anyone and it can be opened like any other file.
### Desired behaviour

The Nextcloud application should have a global setting, "Cache data locally", with each file having their own setting, "make available offline".
1. If the global setting is disabled, any data downloaded via the Nextcloud application should be stored in RAM ONLY and purged once the application is closed. This global setting, if enabled, would also permanently disallow individual file, "make available offline".
2. If the global setting is enabled, any data downloaded via the Nextcloud application should be stored locally on the device, as it is now, but purged once the application is closed unless the user sets "make available offline" and then ONLY those files are retained on the device.
### Steps to reproduce
1. Open Nextcloud
2. Set password required
3. Click on a file: document, picture, video, whatever
4. Open Settings>Storage>Explore
5. Navigate to the Nextcloud folder and find the file previously accessed file
6. Push and hold on the file and select to share
7. E-mail the file to yourself
8. View the file
### Environment data

Android version: 7.0 nougat (NRD90M)

Device model: Nexus 6P

Stock or customized system: Stock Google Android ROM (NRD90M)

Nextcloud app version:1.2.0

Nextcloud server version: 9.0.53

title: [UX] Confusing terminology / icon: "Set as available offline" for files, refresh/sync icon for folders
label: [Label(name="bug"), Label(name="design"), Label(name="good first issue"), Label(name="needs info/discussion")]
body:
As of Nextcloud 1.2.0*, selecting a file makes an option "Set available offline" appear in the "…" menu on the top right. Selecting a folder, however, makes a refresh/sync icon appear on the top right. _(UX remark: I expected to see a "Set available offline" menu entry pop up for the folder as well. It took me a minute of going back and forth between folders and files to realize that there's that icon, instead, and that it doesn't just refresh the current view.)_ As a user, I have absolutely no clue what tapping this icon does. Does it do a one-time download? Does it make the folder permanently available offline (i.e. one-way sync)? A two-way sync? (I know the latter hasn't been implemented yet but still.)

To me it looks like it makes all files contained in the folder available offline one-by-one as I suddenly see green check marks appearing on all my files in that folder (similarly to if I had made them available offline individually). However, I do not see a similar check mark on the folder itself. Does that mean it is a one-time procedure only and new files in the folder won't automatically be made available offline later? Lots of questions here…

**Update:** I just realized that offline availability is now denoted by a yellow download icon, while a green check mark means… that the file is in fact available on the device, i.e. was downloaded, and/or that it is up-to-date? Quite confusing! Anyway, I therefore assume that the sync/refresh icon appearing for folders just downloads all files in the folder once?

**My suggestion:** Make the terminology and the use of icons consistent and their meaning unambiguous. If in doubt, introduce a menu entry "Legend help" to explain the icons.

PS: I hope it doesn't make a difference but I'm still running OwnCloud. According the [announcement of the Android client](https://nextcloud.com/nextcloud-android-client-1-1-0-is-here/), the latter should still be fully compatible to OwnCloud.

(*) I was 100% sure I would be downloading v1.1.0 from the Play Store as this is the version that was last announced (see above). Where can I find information on the v1.2.0 release?

title: IllegalArgumentException: Comparison method violates its general contract!
label: [Label(name="approved"), Label(name="bug"), Label(name="high")]
body:
### Actual behaviour

-Uploads view crashes
### Expected behaviour

-Uploads view shouldn't crash
### Steps to reproduce
1.  Open the Uploads view in the drawer
### Backround

This bug has been reported several times on the Play developer console.
This bug is present in oC and Nc. 
Research shows it is likely related to a wrongly implemented comparator and Android's swicth to JDK 7 which leads to Array.sort using a different algorithm: https://dertompson.com/2012/11/23/sort-algorithm-changes-in-java-7/
### Environment data

Android version: 5,6,etc.

Device model: Nexus5X amoung others

Stock or customized system: stock

Nextcloud app version: 1.2.0
### Logs
#### Nextcloud log (data/nextcloud.log)

```

    at android.app.ActivityThread.handleLaunchActivity(ActivityThread.java:2476)

Caused by: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Comparison method violates its general contract!

title: Allow cancel of pending upload in notification
label: [Label(name="approved"), Label(name="design"), Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
### Actual behaviour
- it is nearly unpossible to interrupt an upload
### Expected behaviour
- upload notification should be rich to get a cancel upload quick action
  -- canceling by 1. open the app, 2. enter the pin, 3. open hamburger menu, 4. tap uploads, 5. cancel upload by tapping (x) which (hopefully) works only on real fast devices, slow devices are busy by uploading and tapping does nothing ... mostly until 99% or 100% of upload is made ;/
- share / upload should get an option to be throttled if not connected with WiFi (there are only some options to handle this for instant uploads of images and videos)

title: Chunked download
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body: Investigate if and how chunked download is possible

title: show/hide toolbar on scroll down/up
label: [Label(name="approved"), Label(name="design"), Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
Since we now have the toolbar in place (which replaced the legacy action bar) we can start implementing further material design thing like show/hide of the toolbar as described here: http://android-developers.blogspot.de/2014/10/material-design-on-android-checklist.html

> App bar
> Where appropriate, upon scrolling down, the app bar can scroll off the screen, leaving more vertical space for content. Upon scrolling back up, the app bar should be shown again.

If this general behavior is approved I would start working on an implementation on the main list which shows the files on server/on device as a first implementation. If that is done we can then think about adopting this also on other screens like file picker for upload I probably wouldn't implemented it on all screens but may on all list or just most lists...not sure though.

any feedback/comments? @tobiasKaminsky @jancborchardt @przybylski ?

You can see this behavior in Chrome on Android for example.

title: Background Syncing for the main account not working
body:
### Actual behaviour

I have two accounts added to the client. The main account (the one I have selected in the app) does not get synchronized. The second "inactive" does. See the pi

![tmp_18117-img_20160803_1800321529362149](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2091312/17360362/3104a4ac-59a6-11e6-8758-0897512fca93.jpg)
### Expected behaviour

Both accounts should be synchronized.
### Steps to reproduce
1. Add 2 accounts.
2. Select one as the primary.
3. Enable File-sync in the Android Accounts Setting
### Environment data

Android version: 6.0.1

Device model:  OnePlus One (bacon)

Stock or customized system: Cyanogenmod 13 nightlies

Nextcloud app version: 1.2.0

Nextcloud server version: ownCloud 9.0.4 & 8.2.7

I know I currently run owncloud, but I think there are not many differences ATM between oC and nC. Insyamd picture upload for example works. Syncing also works when I open the app. Only background syncing for the main account does bit work as expected.

title: Warning about possible incompatibility to ownCloud
label: [Label(name="design"), Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
https://github.com/nextcloud/android/pull/141#issuecomment-236938290 @Spacefish 

> I would display a warning during the initial account adding inside the app, which tells the user, that ownCloud might be incompatible and that he may want to upgrade his server to next cloud.. however we loose all the users which may use the next cloud app but can't control the server installation (cooperate or educational users mainly)

Good idea. 
Should we, for now, mention the one and only thing (file drop) that is not compatible?

@jancborchardt @LukasReschke

title: [WIP] Extend instant upload
body:
This allows to choose any folder on the phone to sync in one direction to owncloud, just like the instant upload does this for images.
This can fix the problem of not using the correct `NEW_PHOTO` Action and it can also help to "backup" important folders (like WhatsApp Images).

---

Original discussion can be found in oC 1650

PR has been created by @tobiasKaminsky

title: Unreliable / disfunctional (auto) sync with PIN code lock
label: [Label(name="bug"), Label(name="needs info/discussion")]
body:
### Actual behavior
- File is not automatically updated if PIN/Code Lock is enabled
- File is not updated when opening app when marked for sync until you open the folder it is in
### Expected behavior
- You you setup Nextcloud/ownCloud without a PIN, all favorite files are downloaded when they change on Server
- File should update ... anyway... Enabling PIN / Code may not decline this function. Even if you say "it's about security": it is not, an old once synced file is still in the filesystem unless you have enabled PIN / Code or not
### Steps to reproduce
1. setup app 
2. mark a file as favorite
3. change this file externally
4. see this file is being updated on phone automatically
5. setup PIN/Code Lock in Nextcloud app
6. change the file again (from your computer)
7. see .. nothing happens.. Until 
   a) you open the app manually and
   b) you change into the folder the favorite file is in
### Environment data

Android version:
4.4 (.0)

Device model: 
Sony Xperia SP

Stock or customized system:
Stock

Nextcloud app version:
1.2.0 

Nextcloud server version:
somewhat 10beta .. called owncloud 9.1

title: Refresh when app starts
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
oC 1729

> ### Actual behaviour
> 
> Sometimes when the application starts the root folder is not refreshed, and a manual refresh is required. This is verified, because execution will not enter the if(hasWindowFocus()) statement in startSyncFolderOperation method in FileDisplayActivity.java. The issue cannot be reproduced every time. Increasing the delay applied to the runnable, for example to DELAY_TO_REQUEST_OPERATIONS_LATER + 350 fixes the problem. 
> ### Expected behaviour
> 
> The application should refresh the root folder when it is started.

> 2. Start the owncloud application a good number of times, at least 10.

title: Massive battery drainage and mobile data use after first usage
label: [Label(name="bug"), Label(name="needs info/discussion")]
body:
I freshly installed the nextcloud app, connected it to my owncloud server and uploaded one small file of about 100 kb. Worked without any problems.
However, after a few hours I noticed that my phone has lost a lot more battery power than usual for the time span. According to the battery statistics the nextcloud app has used over 30% of the battery since I installed it a few hours ago. Furthermore, the app has used 64.65 MB of mobile data in that time (59.82 MB background data, 4.83 MB foreground), which was over 10% of my monthly data plan! There was no interaction with the app after the initial upload of the one file.

Android version: 6.0.1 MOB30P
Device model: Nexus 5
Stock or customized system: Stock
Nextcloud app version: 1.1.0
Nextcloud server version: owncloud 9.1

title: Wrong Federated-Cloud-ID displayed
label: [Label(name="bug"), Label(name="needs info/discussion")]
body:
### Actual behaviour

App displays Federated-Cloud-ID by putting together entered username and host (= <enteredUsername>@<host>).
### Expected behaviour

Because I've set up a login backend based on [user_external](https://github.com/owncloud/apps/tree/master/user_external), my actual username and the entered username, thus the local-part of my Federated-Cloud-ID, differ. The app should request the actual username or Federated-Cloud-ID (as it's displayed on the Personal-tab in the web interface) from the server.
### Environment data

Nextcloud app version: 1.2.0 RC1
Nextcloud server version: 9.0.53.0

title: Release x.y.z - Roadmap
label: [Label(name="overview")]
body:
Planned RC1: ~6 weeks after previous stable release / replace with date

**Create stable-x.y.z branch & use it for release**
- [ ] create branch ```stable-x.y.z```
	- [ ] make it protected
	- [ ] set up Codacy, Drone as required status
- [ ] change ```drone.yml```
- [ ] change ```getBranchName.sh```
- [ ] delete old [stable-x.y.z-1 branch(es)](https://github.com/nextcloud/android/branches/all?utf8=%E2%9C%93&query=stable)

**Bump**
- [ ] release new library version & use this is in app
- [ ] Bump version name and version code in ```build.gradle``` files
- [ ] Update ```CHANGELOG.md``` adding new features
- [ ] check if code is outdated due to last supported server version ```@NextcloudServer``` annotation
- [ ] bump version in MainApp
	- [ ] ```OUTDATED_SERVER_VERSION``` according server (e.g. NC12)
	- [ ] ```MINIMUM_SUPPORTED_SERVER_VERSION```: latest supported version - 2 (e.g. NC12 -2 = NC10)
- [ ] remove support for server older ```MINIMUM_SUPPORTED_SERVER_VERSION```

**Test app with all supported Android version**
- access all activities
- auto upload
- upload / download files/folders
- use external sdcard
- what's new slides correctly shown on first start

All tests on
  - [ ] Android 4
  - [ ] Android 5
  - [ ] Android 6
  - [ ] Android 7
  - [ ] Android 8

**RC1**
- [ ] Verify that the new version number is shown in settings
- [ ] Verify that logging is enabled
- [ ] add $version.txt to /fastlane/metadata/android/en-US/changelogs/ to support GPlay version info
- [ ] Tag new version as ```rc-x.y.z-01``` with private dev key (not on github)
- [ ] Build and release to Play Store as beta release and :shipit: 
- [ ] Publish it on f-droid as optional release: edit metadata and open new merge request on gitlab
- [ ] Verify that it is shown on f-droid (within 24h)

**Final Release, after two weeks time (max) of latest RC release**
- [ ]  replace screenshots (https://github.com/nextcloud/screenshots/tree/master/android/phone)
- [ ] Verify that the new version number is shown in settings
- [ ] Verify that logging is disabled
- [ ] update translations from transifex
- [ ] Test that what's new is shown correctly on upgrade
- [ ] add $version.txt to /fastlane/metadata/android/en-US/changelogs/ to support GPlay version info
- [ ] Tag new version as ```stable-x.y.z``` with private dev key (not on github)
- [ ] Build and release to Play Store as stable release and :shipit: 
- [ ] Publish it on f-droid as release: edit metadata, bump "current version" and open new merge request on gitlab
- [ ] Verify that it is shown on f-droid (within 24h)

title: Provider authorities should be an absolute package name
label: [Label(name="approved"), Label(name="bug"), Label(name="high")]
body:
As already filed in the owncloud issue tracker https://github.com/owncloud/android/issues/1735 forks will have collisions with authorities, e.g. `UsersAndGroupsSearchProvider` as well as the `ManageSpaceActivity`.

The later has been fixed (for us) by using the full qualified name of the class but I think it would be best, if we move these two (and any other that may need to be moved) to a `com.nextcloud.android` package so both apps behave well and let a user run them in parallel - being good citizens.

cc for approval: @nextcloud/android

I would like make some suggestions to change the uploading UI to be more similar as to how it is in Outlook and Dropbox Android apps.

For example, whenever you upload something you get a better display choice:

https://www.dropbox.com/s/t08de241e6b4435/Screenshot_20160711-095124.png?dl=0

Additionally when you select photos (for example) you get to see the various albums or areas where the photos or screenshots might be stored:

https://www.dropbox.com/s/6vcghpgpe68cyve/Screenshot_20160711-095212.png?dl=0

Also what is helpful is to have thumbnail preview (or at least an option for this) when selecting images rather than the list view:

https://www.dropbox.com/s/01hfa0way69tem8/Screenshot_20160711-095314.png?dl=0

title: Instant Upload broken for CyanogenMod 13
label: [Label(name="bug"), Label(name="needs info/discussion")]
body:
### Actual behaviour

Taking a photo with the stock Camera app results in "local file not found" in the Uploads section of the Nextcloud Android App
### Expected behaviour

Photo should be uploaded
### Steps to reproduce
- Install app, configure Instant Upload (if it matters - WiFi only, year/month subdirs, default location)
- Take a photo with Camera
- Nextcloud sees the photo, but upload fails with:

```
IMG_20160711_012340.jpg
3.2Mb, Local file not found
user@my-nextcloud-server/nextcloud
Nextcloud/InstantUpload/2016/07
```
### Environment data

Android version: 6.0.1
Device model: Samsung Galaxy S 2 (i9100)
Stock or customized system: CyanogenMod 13
Nextcloud app version: 1.1.0
Nextcloud server version: 9.0.52 (Debian 8)
### Logs
#### Web server error log

```
172.20.10.116 - gwmngilfen [11/Jul/2016:01:33:32 +0100] "HEAD /nextcloud/remote.php/webdav/InstantUpload/2016/07/ HTTP/1.1" 200 0 "-" "Mozilla/5.0 (Android) nextcloud-android/1.1.0"
172.20.10.116 - gwmngilfen [11/Jul/2016:01:33:33 +0100] "HEAD /nextcloud/remote.php/webdav/InstantUpload/2016/07/IMG_20160711_012340.jpg HTTP/1.1" 404 1307 "-" "Mozilla/5.0 (Android) nextcloud-android/1.1.0"
```
#### Nextcloud log (data/nextcloud.log)

```
Nothing logged (N.B. file appears to be owncloud.log...)
```
### Additional Notes

Manual upload from Gallery also fails, although with nothing logged to the webserver. Can raise a separate issue if required, but it feels related... :)

title: Per Directory Sort Instead of Globally
label: [Label(name="approved"), Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
### Approved idea

Store sort order folder based, with descending the order to subfolder.
(like list vs. grid view is doing it)
### Expected behaviour

If I change the sort option in one directory, it is remebered for that directory.  When I leave, the sort goes back to the default A-Z sort method.
### Environment data

Android version: 6.01

Device model: Nexus 6p

Stock or customized system: Custom

Nextcloud app version: [F-Droid] Nextcloud beta 20160621

Nextcloud server version: Nextcloud 9.0.52 (stable)

Owncloud's sync app has the opposite behavior as nextCloud's.   With owncloud, when you set _Folder A_ to **Newest - Oldest** sorting, upon leaving said folder the sorting reverts to **A-Z** sorting.  When I reenter _Folder A_, it remembers my previous sorting method and displays accordingly.

This is probably an individual preference for each user but I am interested to see if other people feel similarily.  Maybe it should be an option in settings? Thanks for all of your work!

### Actual behaviour

If im connected to my home wlan, setup with IPv4 and IPv6 the Login does not work. "Server took to long to respond" if i connect to my carrier, everything works (Only one private IPv4 from the carrier provided for my phone)
### Expected behaviour

Login should work, even with IPv6 setup.
### Steps to reproduce
1. Connect to some DHCP which gives IPv4 and IPv6
2. Open App, try to add your Account
3. "Server took to long to respond" error apears..
### Environment data

Android version: 6.0.1

Device model: BlackBerry Priv, STV100-4

Stock or customized system: Stock

Nextcloud app version: 1.1.0

Nextcloud server version: 9.0.52 (stable)

Dos anyone can reproduce this too?

Cheers,
Marco

title: Support for "files drop" feature
label: [Label(name="approved"), Label(name="enhancement"), Label(name="pr exists")]
body:
Nextcloud allows you to create public link shares where the users don't see the file listing but can only upload files. This is how it looks like in the web interface:

![filedrop](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1589737/16657742/d103b50e-4463-11e6-8721-294b79818db0.png)

If a public link is created and the "Allow editing" permission was set a additional check box shows up, "Hide file listing". If activated it removes the "read" permissions, so it is a simple permissions change which can already be done by the OCS API. Of course this option only exists for folders.

title: Instant Upload broken on Android N
label: [Label(name="approved"), Label(name="bug")]
body: With the release of Android N the instant upload feature doesn't work anymore. Most likely due to changes for background processing, doze etc. the instant upload simply doesn't get called anymore, see also the forums: https://help.nextcloud.com/t/direct-upload-photos-doesnt-work/1469

title: Confirmation dialog before removing an account
label: [Label(name="approved"), Label(name="enhancement"), Label(name="medium")]
body:
Review from the Google Play store. User wished to have a confirmation dialog before an account is removed. 
If I remember correctly we had this discussion at some point and decided not to. But, yes delete is a tricky one. Any input on this @jancborchardt ?

TASK: Show an undo toast after removing an account.

title: Sort favorite files first in the list
label: [Label(name="design"), Label(name="enhancement"), Label(name="hacktoberfest"), Label(name="medium"), Label(name="pr exists")]
body:
Favoriting is not very integrated at the moment. Only an indicator, we can do better here.

Better integration without needing to switch to a separate view would be to always sort the favorited items of a the current folder up top.

PR is #302

title: Sort by recent should mix files and folders
label: [Label(name="approved"), Label(name="bug"), Label(name="design"), Label(name="pr exists")]
body:
When sorting by recently modified, folders are shown first. It's quite cumbersome to need to scroll down to reach files.

The elements should be sorted by recently modified, files and folders mixed. This is also how we did it before.

PR: #135

title: Beta 20160621 - (Sub)-Option missing
label: [Label(name="dev version")]
body:
Hi to Andy and ALL,

Below  the Option **Immediate Upload**  (SofortUpload).
I miss the Sub-option 

Use Subfolders
_Store in subfolders based on year and month_

as being offered in the published Version 1.1!

I think this is a pretty neat feature to better organize the "sometimes huge number " of Uploads!

regards, hitam4450

title: Feature request: Select "ALL" Files within a folder
label: [Label(name="approved"), Label(name="design"), Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
Feature request:

Select "ALL" files within a folder for file operation e.g. copy, move, delete, etc.

regards, hitam4450

title: Beta  20160621 - Behaviour
label: [Label(name="bug"), Label(name="needs info/discussion")]
body:
Hi Andy,
enclosed you'll find some details about a first, quick testrun!

On ANDROID 4.4.2 I do have the following issues:

  Mixed language (English, German) menu Description
  Does not show ALL Files, not even after refreshing
  Selecting Storage path:    Selecting External SD Card    Error while migrating

regards, hitam4450

PS. After selecting ALL Files in the (left side) menu panel, I could see & access ALL Files!

title: Remembering Last Folder
label: [Label(name="approved"), Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
Another UI Enhancement:

To facilitate repetitive actions e.g. file move or file copy...the last selected folder should be remembered !

regards, hitam4450

title: Multi Select on Files Operation
body:
Hi, I just downloaded Version 1.1 and I like it! 
Especially I like the option to create Sub folders to be able  to organize files by year-month. 
However, currently the option to select "multiple" files prior to take any selected action e.g. moving files "within the server" to a new location, is missing!
This option facilitates files operation considerably !

regards, hitam4450

title: Add Trash Can Delete Option To Top Bar
body:

Android version: 6.0.1
Device model: Nexus 6p
Stock or customized system: customized
Nextcloud app version: fdroid Nextcloud beta version 20160621

I delete stuff fairly frequently and it seems like it would be more convenient (I believe) to have the standard trash can icon appear when files and/or folders are selected.  This is one of the little things that always bothered me with ownCloud's app.  

Thanks either way.  I already enjoy nextCloud's app and software more!

title: Release 1.1.0 stable
body:
Version number bumped accordingly, version name "1.1.0" and updated changelog.

Please review @tobiasKaminsky @przybylski @jancborchardt @LukasReschke 

PS: Please +1 if changes are fine with you, merge will be done prior to releasing 1.1.0 stable which is in the near future since the RCs are very stable and no crashes&ANRs have been reported on Google Play or in the forums that haven't been fixed yet. Btw the changelog now only documents stable releases since I don't think documenting all RCs for eternity doesn't make sense.

title: Grid view > back while folder is loading crashes app
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
### Actual behaviour

If "Show grid view" and then the back arrow in the top left corner are clicked, while a folders contents are still loading, the nextcloud app crashes.
### Expected behaviour

The app should just go back to the previous folder without crashing.
### Steps to reproduce
1. Open a folder with many files (I used my instant upload folder, and tested with others)
2. While it's loading, click the three dot menu in the top right
3. Click "Grid view" (going the opposite direction and choosing "List view" won't crash the app)
4. Click the left/back arrow in the top, left corner of the app

Works every time.
### Environment data

Android version:
5.1.1

Device model: 
Samsung galaxy prime

Stock or customized system:
Stock for Samsung

Nextcloud app version:
1.1.0

Nextcloud server version:
ownCloud 9.0.2

title: RC 1.1.0 preparation
body:
@tobiasKaminsky @przybylski @LukasReschke @jancborchardt feel free to :+1: -> merge -> GH tag/release -> build -> upload to Google Play Beta Channel :)

rc tag would be: `rc-Mayor.Minor.Hotfix-RCIncrement` --> `rc-1.1.0-01`

title: No instant update of folder list when changing active account (Nextcloud beta Android-App 20160621)
label: [Label(name="bug"), Label(name="dev version"), Label(name="needs info/discussion")]
body:
### Actual behaviour

No "instant" update of the files list after choosing a different account from the dropdown. 

One have to wait until the screen gets locked. After unlocking the screen the files list is getting updated (caused by an event ?). Manually updating the account (via '...' menu) works well. In no case there's any visual feedback (except the changing files list) which might be suboptimal.
### Expected behaviour

Choosing a different account should lead to an instant update of the files list so one can see the directory structure of the recently choosen account 
### Steps to reproduce
1. Have two different accounts ready to use with different files/directories
2. have a look on the current files list
3. choose the other account
4. have a look on the current files list and notice it's **NOT** the files list of the current but the previous account
5. wait until the lock screen appears
6. unlock the screen and notice that now you see the proper list
### Environment data

Android version: Android 6.0.1

Device model: Samsung SM-G900F  (S5 klte)

Stock or customized system: customized CM 13.0

Nextcloud app version: Nextcloud beta Android-App 20160621

Nextcloud server version: 9.0.50
### Logs
#### Web server error log

```
Insert your webserver log here
```

```
Insert your Nextcloud log here
```

title: Refactor: Create a ThumbImageView
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
Thumbnails of images are currently shown in 3 different places. The uploadlist, the local file browser and the normal folder view of an nextcloud folder.

The code to generate a thumbnail / kickof the thumbnail generation is present in all of there places.

To unify this, i would like to propose a ThumbImageView class which subclases ImageView. This Class should handle all concern regarding File or OCFile -> Thumbnail, by calling ThumbManager and so on.

The ImageView objects are reused in the list views, all code accesing these Views has to check whether the reference they use, still refer to a View with the initial File, this could be solved by having a Reference to OCFile or File on the ThumbImageView aswell as the unique thumbnail CacheKey!

So we have some new methods like
void setFile(File file);
void setOCFile(OCFile file);
int getCacheKey(); (maybe override .hashCode(), but this could be problematic with OCFiles not existing)

Another possibility would be to introduce two additional classes
FileThumbImageView and OCFileThumbImageView.. As far as i understand it, the Upload Queue and local filebrowser lists use File and the nextcloud folder browser uses OCFile..

This should only a refactor not any addition of new functionality.

title: actual -> current
body:
Longman Dictionary says: Do not use actual to mean 'at the present time'. Use current or present
http://www.ldoceonline.com/dictionary/actual
http://english.stackexchange.com/questions/29654/using-actual-to-signify-current

title: replace f-droid text link with a badge
Cache resized images on local deletion of an image
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
When deleting an image locally on the phone the app should generate an resized image of it prior to deletion.
With that (if the cache is big enough) the images can still be shown by thumbnail/resized image without server interaction.

title: Resized images: zoom behaviour
body:
Idea to download the full sized image:
- Zooming a resized image with at least 2x (which can get blurry)
  - show snackbar "automatically download full image on zoom: yes"
  - Clicking "yes" after second time will offer option "always" to prevent showing the question.
- time out the snackbar the second time by just waiting will show "never download full image" -> "yes".
- after both show second snackbar without action "default behaviour can be changed in settings"
- In setting: new entry "click on image downloads ..."
  - full image to storage
  - resized image to cache

title: Sending resized images
body:
If the image is not downloaded a resized image version is sent.
Should this be clarified by using "send resized image" and use "send original size" when downloaded?

title: Resized images
label: [Label(name="enhancement"), Label(name="pr exists")]
body:
What it does, copied from ownCloud and heavily discussed there, so here just a CR:
- Clicking on an image loads a reduced version to the cache.
- The width and height is determinated by the screen.
- the benefit is a very small, but yet usable preview of the image.
- it can be used to send via whatsapp, or as a file to another app (like k9) with the correct filename.
- resized images are not treated as downloaded files. If the user wants to have the real file, he has to long-click and select download.
- clicking on an image shows first a square thumbnail (if available) until the resized image is loaded

**ToDo**
- [x] test with disabled API (gallery app)
  - test if thumbnails api can be used -> not possible right now
- [x] Unsupported image formats https://github.com/owncloud/android/pull/1599#issuecomment-229400874
  - [x] svg
  - [x] tiff
- [x] Bad preview of landscape images https://github.com/owncloud/android/pull/1599#issuecomment-229406324 [WIP]
- [x] sharing a non-downloaded image on Android N fails (at least with whatsapp)
- [ ] sharing a non-cached resized image fails -> first download resized version
- [ ] a resized image should load immediately (first on queue or dismiss all other current downloads)
- [x] ~~download of a resized image also with a nice download animation on the bottom?~~
- [x] snackbar is sometimes beneath virtual keys
- [ ] ~~if resized version show "sending resized image" otherwise "send" (as it is  now)~~
- [x] test with disabled data
  - [x] show resized image if available
  - [x] show thumbnail if resized image not available
  - [x] show (something smart) if both is not available -> default image icon
- [x] on air plane mode: snackbar is shown all the time as resized download files -> prior check of connection

Assumptions:
- users do not want to download the whole image, instead just like streaming have only a resized version
- if an user wants to have many images in original quality, he can synchronize the folder

This leads us to
- always show a resized version
- if an user zooms in (> 2x) a snackbar "download full image: yes" will be shown (on every time)
- (to have the old behaviour: add setting "click on image downloads full image" (as checkbox))

Update: Talked to Jan @conf:
- behvaviour setting can be removed
- otherwise approved

title: Development guideline
body: @nextcloud/android it is a first draft, please review and comment

title: Feature Request: Prevent duplicate uploads
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
## Wanted behaviour

When I attempt to upload a duplicate file, I'd like it to prompt me before it uploads. Maybe a message that states "x with that name and datestamp already exists. Upload another copy?"

In an ideal world it would be able to do this with several files in one go, rather than 1 by 1 so as to agree or disagree with duplicate uploads all at once, but anything would be acceptable at the moment.
## Actual behaviour

Currently uploading duplicates just appends a number in brackets, meaning I then later have to manually remove duplicates.

Context: 
https://help.nextcloud.com/t/is-there-anything-to-stop-duplicates-being-uploaded/1146

title: App doesn't remember cloud connection
label: [Label(name="bug"), Label(name="needs info/discussion")]
body:
### Actual behaviour

-If mobile is restarted (I use planned switch-off/on during night) app asks for url, username and password
### Expected behaviour

-App should at least pre-fill last cloud URL and username or if it is not security issue save credentials and login automatically.
### Steps to reproduce
1. login into app
2. restart phone
3. start app
### Environment data

Android version: 4.2.1

Device model: evolveo strongphone

Nextcloud app version: 1.0.1

title: HotFix master branch: Set fixed lib version

For some reason jitpack is not refreshing the snapshot build so the branch won't build thus I created a lib release 1.0.1 and set the dependency to 1.0.1 instead of -SNAPSHOT

ATM This is necessary in order to get master to compile again. Sorry for any inconvenience :(

body:
There is the mail_feedback thingy implemented which goes to apps@nextcloud.com, this mail address is not routed at the moment.

I'd advise that we maybe link them to our bug tracker or a new category in our forum instead. Any thoughts?

cc @nextcloud/android

title: Synchronizing big folder problem / Download fails due to Doze

While synchronizing 34GB of PDFs split in varying sizes
When android locks the screen, some time later a synchronization error occurs

synchronization of all files

title: Automated testing
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
To improve the quality of our app we should introduce automated testing.
@przybylski you said on IRC that you have experience with this?
What can you recommend? 
ownCloud started with appium

title: Update welcome url, fixes #16
body: see #16 simply using the top level url for nextcloud

title: Server based theming capabilities
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body: Will the nextcloud app eventually be able to visually look like the mobile web browser version? This way it can be themed just like our own installs are. Or Will its always have it's own design and look?

title: Link to a list of Nextcloud providers on the setup screen
label: [Label(name="pr exists")]
body:
I bet many new users are unfamiliar to the concept of ownCloud/Nextcloud requiring URL/user/pass and not just user/pass.

To improve usability, I suggest that we put a link next to the server address box in the setup screen, saying: "Looking for a server? Get it here." And we link it to "https://nextcloud.com/providers/" or the equivalent Nextcloud page when it is ready.

Apart from making it usable for Dropbox-minded users, this has the extra benefit of pointing more customers to the own/Next-cloud providers in that list, and this in turn increase the licensing fees Nextcloud can negotiate to get from the said providers.

PR: #561

title: Update changelog

title: Two level thumbcache + async I/O
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
Just compare to the normal version, while scrolling in a folder

fixed a bug, which retriggered thumbnail loading, after a thumbnail was loaded and the view was scrolled at the end of the view (beginning and and aswell as backscroll).

All I/O is now done in a AsyncTask, even cache I/O on the flash, as it really introduced stutter, because flash read access aswell as JPEG->Bitmap Decoding is done on the UI Thread.

I added a bitmap in memory cache for thumbnails (LRUCache), this cache is queried in the AsyncTask aswell (should not be).

I think final solution would be

Check Memory Bitmap Cache
  Hit -> Use the bitmap directly on UI Thread
  Miss -> Start AsyncTask and query JPEG DiskCache
     Hit -> Decode and set the save bitmap in memcache aswell as set it on the UI Thread
     Miss -> generate the thumbnail, save in both caches and update bitmap in UI Thread

Otherwise scrolling large folders with a lot of Thumbs is a pain / looks stuttery.

title: Modern Toolbar / Drawer / Account Switcher
body:
Use the new toolbar and support lib drawer implementation - Google's new, to be used implementation of the top bar instead of the action bar which can be considered legacy. Besides that the new implementation also sports an account switcher and avatars (images and default generated server-alike color circles).

**Motivation**
The actionbar is simply a bar which can have a menu, search widget and in newer AppCompat versions also a drawer implementation but isn't as flexible as the toolbar.

**Reasons and benefits**
The toolbar can be customized on many ways like but not limited to:
- adding any kind of views to it, like the progressbar which would be nice especially when 
  - we integrate the multi select branch (no dark blue line below the then grey bar)
  - no dark blue line below the bar when the drawer is opened
- animate it, like scrolling it away on a list/recycler view which seems nice on the file browsing views
- the material drawer can be full height, like mentioned in #1210 because this is only possible for the toolbar not the action bar (it can be done with hacks though)

Material Design spec for side nav drawer: 
http://www.google.com/design/spec/layout/structure.html#structure-side-nav

title: Move vs Copy are both disruptive - can it work like other apps?
label: [Label(name="approved"), Label(name="enhancement"), Label(name="pr exists")]
body:
### Actual behaviour

When uploading, the options provided are to either move the file from it's location to the NC directory or make a copy of it. 

For the former and especially in the case of photos traditionally kept in DCIM this leads to fragmentation of files in other places on the filesystem (and therefore harder to manage)

For the latter, copying doubles storage usage per file, with many photos taken the disk usage can get into the gigabytes before the day is over.
### Expected behaviour

Like other apps, uploading shouldn't disrupt the location of files nor duplicate everything on storage. 
Perhaps investigating and replicating the functionality of dropbox, onedrive or Google photos would be a good place to start. 
### Steps to reproduce
1. Tap to upload 
2. Choose whether to move or copy
3. Instantly regret either decision

Context: https://help.nextcloud.com/t/android-copy-vs-move-on-upload-there-has-to-be-a-better-way/631

body:
The problem: I need three diffrent apps to sync all my data

owncloud, CalDav Sync Adapter and DAVDroid.

DAVdroid has the problem is you need two accounts, one for calendar, the other for contacts. It also chokes on my calendar.(a little large). It also needs a long not-obvious string that is mentioned nowhere in documentation except third party sites.

So, I would like calender and contact support in the official app, so one account will sync everything. Also makes it somewhat easier for novices.(non-technical friends/customers/employees), who merely use someone elses owncloud install.

title: GPLv2 vs Apache2 license
body: This app is GPLv2 licensed but uses Apache2 style dependencies like Google's Android support libraries.  This might be problematic, e.g. see https://www.apache.org/licenses/GPL-compatibility.html . So iirc switching to GPLv2+ ( adding the "version 2 and later"option) or GPLv3 solves this, but I am not a lawyer...

title: Allow arbitrary folders to be synchronized
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
Currently the nextCloud app will create a one to one folder representation of the remote server when synchronizing a directory. However it would be really helpful on a mobile device to map a device directory to a remote server directory.

A use case would be syncronizing a workspace directory of an app on the mobile device with a dedicated directory path on the remote server. For instance a directory with pictures often edited by a mobile app synchronized with a subpath of 'Photos' on the remote server. Or you want to synchronize a shared folder with music into you music library directory on you mobile device...

This would assume issue #19 to be working, such that changes on the mobile device are propagated to the remote server.

title: Store files on SD card
label: [Label(name="enhancement"), Label(name="pr exists")]
body:
Currently all files synchronized by the app become stored on the internaml device memory. However it should be able to store files to the SD card instead.

A typically use case would be synchronizing a music library, which could exceed the internal storage by far and is ideally stored on a modern SD card.

PR: #92

title: Allow 2-way-sync
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
When 'syncronizing' a folder in the nextCloud app, actually changes from the remote server become propagated on the mobile device. However changes on the mobile device aren't uploaded back to the remote server.

How the nextCloud app should behave:
- files added to a synchronized folder should be scanned/recognized
- changes to files (create, update, delete) of a synchronized folder should be propagated back to the server
- conflicting changes should open a dialog (overwrite on device/server, rename)

rebased original PR done by @tobiasKaminsky so all kudos belongs to him.
Please review @tobiasKaminsky @przybylski

title: Development Guide discussion
body:
Hi everybody,

I just created a wiki page for a short development guide which should help new contributors to understand how develop and release new versions of the app.

https://github.com/nextcloud/android/wiki/Development-Guide

It is just a draft. I thought it is easier if we have some stuff written down to kick off the discussion. For now I focused on versioning and the code review process.

Feel free to challenge anything I have written down ;)

cc @jancborchardt @LukasReschke @tobiasKaminsky @przybylski

title: Optimizing the uploader layout & taking user configured sorting into account
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
NC version of @jancborchardt's original oC request 1193:

> When uploading content from another app (like the Gallery), the uploader view looks strangely different from the normal file list.
> 
> It should have the same layout, with file/folder info below the folder names, and also the same sort order if one chose to sort by modified date.

pinging @tobiasKaminsky @przybylski for the 2-thumbs-up code review

could be put into a post 1.0.0 release since it is a rather small change and easy to test (already tested by me)

title: Improve automatic synchronization process
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body: Currently time between synchronization is constant and is equal to 3h. Let's give users freedom to specify the time between synchronizations.

title: first pass of changing to Nextcloud
